title: Data Analyst
role-description:
As we embark on an exciting period of change throughout our business we need a new Data Analyst to join our thriving inventory function. Through your excellent analytical skills you will be able to identify trends and patterns hidden within the data. You are excited when you are faced with large datasets you will enjoy the challenge of working through it and recommending actions from the data. The Data Analysis function within Cromwell is growing and this is an excellent opportunity to be a key contributor to the future of Cromwell.

The Role Will Be Responsible For
Review and analyse significant amounts of planning data
Build and maintain relationships with supply chain and cross-functional partners
Identifies, recommends and leads continuous improvement projects
Supporting inventory planning strategies across a large portfolio of products, locations, and customers.
Creating relevant reports for management and cross functional partner review.
Skills Required
Advanced Excel Skills essential
Experience of data analysis using large consumer databases preferred including experience using VBA and SQL.
Demonstrated ability to find creative solutions to problems and means of improvement and collaborate with partners to drive results.
Knowledge of inventory management practices and methods
Detail oriented, high proficiency
Highly motivated and results oriented
Ability to collaborate with people
About Us

We are Cromwell – a subsidiary of US Fortune 500 company, W.W. Grainger. Established for over 50 years, we supply maintenance, repair and operations type products as well as technical and specialist support to industry. We offer next day delivery or collection from our nationwide stock centres, supported by an overnight UK logistics network.
With ambitious growth plans and a real focus on our people, this is an exciting time to be joining our organisation. As well as offering a highly competitive salary and benefits package, we’re serious about your professional development and your ability to influence the way our business grows. Think you’ve got what we’re looking for? Apply now.

title: Data Analyst Intern
role-description:
Are you a bit mad, very driven, and excited about building new things? Look no further! The Shortcut is seeking a talented Data Analyst Intern to join our team! The Shortcut is a talent accelerator, helping people to enter the tech world by either creating a startup or joining one. We're a community-driven non-profit and a sister organization to Slush, Maria01 and Junction. We empower our community through events, workshops and trainings to explore ideas and develop skills needed in startups.

The General Scope Of Your Responsibility Will Consist Of
Assisting in coordinating & instructing trainings on Python for data analysis
In-depth event analysis (using a BI tool)
Analyzing & visualizing key metrics for internal and external reporting
Supporting the efforts of the team in KPI measurement

You Are
Energized and driven by subjects such as talent development, diversity in tech and the Shortcut mission
Ambitious, willing to grow as a data analyst, and seeking to demonstrate your abilities
An aspiring Data Analyst, if not Data Scientist
Experienced in analyzing & summarizing in-depth data with Excel or R
Comfortable giving lectures or presentations to an audience with excellent oral and written communication skills
Self-motivated & proactive
Possibly experienced in teaching or coaching
Preferably skilled in Python, and SQL
Passionate about business & research analytics
Able to respond to challenges by generating results, getting feedback, and improving based on that feedback

We Offer
Platform to showcase your ability and increase your employability
Hands-on experience developing yourself as a Data Analyst working on in-house projects and training aspiring Data Analysts
Access to networking opportunities
Working with a diverse community of driven, like-minded doers
Please send us a letter of motivation describing what interests you about the position and The Shortcut, as well as your CV via The Hub so we can get to know you better by November 17th, 2019. In the meanwhile, should you have any questions, contact Mojjammil on our Tech team.

title: Data Insight Analyst - London
role-description:
**The Company**
A leading provider of research, data and strategic advice, their customers
include every one of the world's biggest 20 consulting firms. Their
ambitious mind-set matched with continuous growth means it would be a
fantastic opportunity for the right candidate to develop alongside the
company in the coming years.
**The Role**
The purpose of this role is to uncover hidden stories in data-sets, derive
insights and structure the results into a format easily understood by all
stakeholders.
Analytics is seen as the driving force behind the success of the business
thus far. As a result, freedom is given for the personal development of
employees and the improvement of the data analytics function, which in turn
will escalate the company that next level.
There is a high dependence placed on having the statistical capabilities to
solve business problems through the application of a variety of techniques,
for example cross-tabulation and linear regression analysis. The team are
willing to allow this analyst the opportunity to develop their programming
skills and be upskilled with Python, which is used on projects.

The Successful Candidate Will Have
Strong quantitative academic background.
An excellent proficiency in Excel and ideally a visualisation tool
such as Tableau, Qlikview or PowerBI
The technical prowess to learn programming languages, including
Python
The ability to communicate and present findings in layman's terms.
Pro-active and inquisitive nature in learning new skills and
understanding developments in the world of data.
The capability to flourish in an innovative and fast paced
environment.

title: Data Analytics Associate
role-description:
Overview

The firm is looking to recruit a Data Analytics Delivery Associate to join the Data Analytics Hub based in central Liverpool. This team is one of several Hubs within rapidly growing Shared Service Centre (SSC). SSC team members work internally within the business providing support to the client facing members of the firm.

Advantage is the data analytics tool used to analyze a client’s entire dataset. It runs using Qlikview and provides powerful visualisations which help auditors to understand client transactions and identify outliers. Audit of journals is the first area for which the tool is being widely used.

Responsibilities

This will be a challenging and rewarding role where you will:
Work extensively with Advantage software to support regional client facing audit teams to analyse client data and produce digital dashboards for the audit teams to use
Liaise with and support audit teams and clients during the data extraction process
Supervise a team of Data Analytics Assistants. Allocate and review work within the team
Provide technical oversight and query resolution for team members and internal clients
Contribute feedback and recommendations on process and tools used
Deliver team outputs to agreed timescale, quality and volume
Provide support to other colleague teams dependent upon seasonality of core work
Requirements
Highly developed IT skills – Expert knowledge of MS products (Excel, Access) and some exposure to data analytics tools is highly desirable. Willingness to learn new systems is essential
Intermediate knowledge of coding/scripting advantageous
Staff supervisory experience or a strong desire to develop these skills
Experience in either audit or finance would be useful
Well presented with a professional level of communication – both verbal and written
Good time management, organisation skills and the ability to prioritise and complete tasks with limited supervision
Ability to work well in a team environment
Ability to use own initiative and take a flexible approach
#3698243

title: Data Analyst - Bradford
role-description:
Job Title: Data Analyst Location; Bradford Salary: Competitive, dependent on experience Contracted hours: 37.5 Contract type: Permanent About Us Anchor Hanover Group is the largest provider of specialist housing and care for people in later life in England, employing more than 9,000 people throughout England. We provide more than 60,000 homes for older people and are a trusted care provider with more than 100 care homes. We know that quality services start with quality people. We work hard to be recognised as a leading employer and are committed to retaining and attracting the best in our industry. At Anchor Hanover Group we believe in values. We are Accountable, Respectful, Courageous and Honest. We believe our people should be proud of the work they do making a difference to society and our customers. About the role: You will be a Data Analyst (or Information analyst), working within the property management team. You will be responsible for maintaining, extracting and analysing data on a variety of platforms and creating insightful, accurate and actionable reports to various aspects of the business and key partners. You will work with key partners to ensure data collection methods are robust, user-friendly and reportable. You will be using a wide range of systems on a daily basis, generally in Cognos, future Analytics tools and Excel. You will have:
Strong I.T and analytical skills (with experience of various systems)
Have previous experience working with a variety of data bases
Experiences of extracting information from multiple systems
Experience of working with System suppliers
Experience of working with highly complex data and have the ability to present information in an audience friendly way. Recruitment Agencies please note that we do not recognise speculative CVs, should you submit a speculative CV we will assume the candidate as our own. Please note the application closing date may change if we receive a high volume of applications As England’s largest not-for-profit provider of care and housing for older people, we’re able to negotiate great deals and benefits for our people. Here are just a few of the things you’ll get when you work with Anchor Hanover Group:
25 days holiday plus bank holidays
Buy and sell annual leave
Exclusive discounts on high-street shopping
20% off mobile phone contracts
25% off Private Healthcare
Contributory pension, 4% from you and 4% from us

title: Data Analyst

• Good organizational skills

• Fluent in English

title: BI Specialist m/f/d Data Analysis Europe - Hamburg

title: Data Analyst, Adobe XD
role-description:
Our Company

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. 
 
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join the Adobe XD team as we embark on the exciting journey to deliver an industry leading software solution for the design community. As a Data Analyst, you will develop and maintain a modern data architecture to further our reporting, analytics, and experimentation capabilities, and – on a longer term - you will leverage predictive modeling and machine learning to help the XD team understand, manage, and optimize the experience throughout the customer journey. Ideal candidates will have a strong academic background as well as technical skills such as applied statistics and data engineering. Our team prides itself on being customer focused, agile, and data driven. If you are looking for a chance to be a part of a industry-game-changing opportunity, this one is for you!
  What You'll Do:
Partner with product managers and software engineers to gather and define data requirements, and build the necessary tooling required to ensure timely delivery of high-quality data
Build and maintain various product and engineering dashboards to inform the team about the state of the business, as well as to alert stakeholders when issues occur
Optimize scheduled jobs and explore new solutions to increase operational efficiency
Develop predictive models to address various business problems by leveraging statistical modeling or machine learning
Collaborate with product management and engineering groups to develop new products and features
  What You'll Need to Succeed:
MS degree in Computer Science, Applied Math, Finance or other related fields
5+ years of meaningful data engineering experience
Proficient in querying languages such as SQL
Proficient in one or more programming languages such as Python, R, Java
Some experience with one or more of Hive, Hadoop, Spark, Splunk.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau is a plus
Good understanding of statistical modeling and machine learning concepts is a plus
Proven business acumen, previous experience with product analytics
Possess natural curiosity, creativity, and technical acumen, being capable of asking critical questions about data and always ready to solve any challenges
Excellent communication, relationship skills, and a strong team player

title: BI / Data Analyst
role-description:
Overview

The Business of Fashion is seeking a talented Data Analyst to drive our fast growing B2B and B2C subscription business as a founder member of our new, centralised Data Team.

Our teams know that data is crucial to growing our BoF Professional community of readers, and to the success of BoF. With your ability to collaborate across the business, you will understand how data can help inform decisions and which insights are important. Combined with your technical ability, you will help us leverage data to derive the crucial learning required to build value for our community and build our business.

Who Are We?

The Business of Fashion (BoF) is a next generation fashion media company conceived for today's global and hyper-connected world. Founded in 2007 by Imran Amed, BoF is known for its authoritative, agenda-setting point of view on the global fashion industry, described as "The Economist of Fashion," "A Daily Destination for Fashion's Power Players" and "The Industry Bible."

Providing tools and services to support the journey through the fashion and beauty industries, including News & Analysis, Careers, and Education, BoF has grown to be an indispensable resource for fashion executives, creatives, students and entrepreneurs in over 200 countries.

What We Need You To Do

As a founder member of our Data Team, alongside Data Engineers and a Product Manager, you will be responsible for supporting the evolution of our data platform and for arming the business teams with new data and more sophisticated ways to interrogate it in order to learn and apply insight effectively.

By supporting us in establishing repeatable and sustainable analytics processes, you will ensure the business is efficient in their use of data, and compliant to all relevant data regulation.

In Being Successful In This Role, You Will

Get data in shape
Prepare, clean and analyse large sets of digital data to uncover audience trends and behaviours and business performance insights
Collaborate with a Product Manager to pipeline new or evolution of current data sets
Champion accuracy and ensure solutions meet the required level of quality alongside our QA team
Enable all business teams to leverage data
Be the go-to person for new data requests, coordinating delivery to meet need
Collaborate with teams across the business to identify need
Continuously prioritise reporting which will deliver the most impact
Structure, create and maintain a suite of reporting / visualisation
Pipeline requests requiring new data or changes to current data sets via a Product Manager and engineers
Onboard BoF team members to our data capabilities and procedures
Manage communication to ensure stakeholders are well informed about your projects
Use data strategically
Identify questions we should be asking to harvest important insight
Build stories from data that provide crucial insight to inform business decisions and present in an engaging way
Be our data guardian
Ensure the integrity and cleanliness of our data
Data models are established and maintained
Metrics are defined and used consistently across the business
Ensure the security of our data
Support establishment of our BoF Data function
Ensure repeatable, sustainable processes
Manage the proliferation of reports & dashboards
Support the definition of the BoF data analytics approach and process


Who You Are

You are a strategic Data Analyst, ideally with experience working with a digital subscription / media business, who enjoys proactively finding opportunities for the business to consider. You have refined your own views on the optimum approach and process to best establish a Data Function, and are looking forward to helping unveil the power of data to transform a business.

You are naturally collaborative and relish working alongside colleagues from multiple business functions (Marketing, Product, Editorial, Senior Leadership etc) to drive the full potential from our data.

The Specifics
You understand the different dimensions of data required to inform business decisions (from KPI reporting, to funnels, to user segmentation, to attribution and so on)
You have experience working with Looker, creating Models, Looks and Dashboards; or similar experience with a BI tool like Tableau, PowerBI, Qlikview, Chartio, etc.
High SQL proficiency, and good knowledge of RDB and data structures
Ability to explain analysis clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences
Independently manage projects end to end - ensuring stakeholders are kept informed

It won't be necessary that you have a working knowledge of Python or R, or experience using DBT (Data Build Tool), but if you do have either this will be a bonus.

You'll Know You're Successful When...

You and your colleagues, Product Managers and Data Engineers, are working well as the newest team at The Business of Fashion

The Business of Fashion business teams are gleaning actionable insights every day from our data

You are the person in the business teams come to if they need insight. You can help them answer the question that starts with, "Do we have data that can tell me…." - and then you suggest a better question to ask

title: Data Analyst - Paris (Internship)
role-description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is looking for a Data Analyst Intern to join our analytics and growth team in Paris. As a member of the internal analytics team, you will play a central role to deliver data driven insights and data products to various teams at the company. You will also support the full organization to self leverage data and capitalize on it. The ideal candidate is naturally curious, has good verbal and written communication skills, a strong interest in data and related technologies, a sharp analytical mind and a positive attitude towards work.

What you'll do
Work closely with all Dataiku teams to help them identify business problems and solve them thanks to ad-hoc data analysis or long-term data-driven solutions you’ll create and implement.
Work on defining and implementing a long-term analytics strategy for the company with the objective of improving autonomy and overall efficiency of the teams.
Support the organization in the development, deployment and maintenance strategy of rolled-out internal data projects.

The scope of the job represents a unique opportunity to understand the company as a whole, develop your technical skills (Python, SQL) and discover or deepen knowledge on a wide range of software (Dataiku DSS, Salesforce, Tableau, Gainsight…).

Requirements
Bachelor/Master degree or equivalent practical experience
Excellent analytical, critical thinking, and creative problem-solving skills
Good communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate and present complex situations and concepts
Resourceful mindset towards technologies, willingness to explore and proactivity
Curiosity and ability to quickly learn and understand the vocabulary, concepts and key stakes of various fields of activity
Track record of successful project management, execution, multi-tasking and collaboration with cross-functional teams
Basic understanding of data analysis and related tools and techniques such as SQL, Python, Dataiku DSS, Tableau…
Benefits
Enjoy our brand-new office in Paris and the startup life (Breakfast, Snacks, Game Room, Yoga, Football and more…)
Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and fun team
Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness
To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast (having just closed a $101 million Series C round in December 2018 and looking to double in 2019), but still maintains a startup spirit. Dataiku serves its global customer base from its headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Singapore, and Sydney. Each of our offices has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
As we embark on an exciting period of change throughout our business we need a new Data Analyst to join our thriving inventory function. Through your excellent analytical skills you will be able to identify trends and patterns hidden within the data. You are excited when you are faced with large datasets you will enjoy the challenge of working through it and recommending actions from the data. The Data Analysis function within Cromwell is growing and this is an excellent opportunity to be a key contributor to the future of Cromwell.

The Role Will Be Responsible For

Identifies, recommends and leads continuous improvement projects

Demonstrated ability to find creative solutions to problems and means of improvement and collaborate with partners to drive results.

Detail oriented, high proficiency

About Us

We are Cromwell – a subsidiary of US Fortune 500 company, W.W. Grainger. Established for over 50 years, we supply maintenance, repair and operations type products as well as technical and specialist support to industry. We offer next day delivery or collection from our nationwide stock centres, supported by an overnight UK logistics network.

Think you’ve got what we’re looking for? Apply now.

title: Data Insight Analyst - London
role-description:
**The Company**
A leading provider of research, data and strategic advice, their customers
include every one of the world's biggest 20 consulting firms. Their
ambitious mind-set matched with continuous growth means it would be a
fantastic opportunity for the right candidate to develop alongside the
company in the coming years.
**The Role**
The purpose of this role is to uncover hidden stories in data-sets, derive
insights and structure the results into a format easily understood by all
stakeholders.
Analytics is seen as the driving force behind the success of the business
thus far. As a result, freedom is given for the personal development of
employees and the improvement of the data analytics function, which in turn
will escalate the company that next level.
There is a high dependence placed on having the statistical capabilities to
solve business problems through the application of a variety of techniques,
for example cross-tabulation and linear regression analysis. The team are
willing to allow this analyst the opportunity to develop their programming
skills and be upskilled with Python, which is used on projects.

The Successful Candidate Will Have
Strong quantitative academic background.
An excellent proficiency in Excel and ideally a visualisation tool
such as Tableau, Qlikview or PowerBI
The technical prowess to learn programming languages, including
Python
The ability to communicate and present findings in layman's terms.
Pro-active and inquisitive nature in learning new skills and
understanding developments in the world of data.
The capability to flourish in an innovative and fast paced
environment.

title: Data Analytics Associate
role-description:
Overview

The firm is looking to recruit a Data Analytics Delivery Associate to join the Data Analytics Hub based in central Liverpool. This team is one of several Hubs within rapidly growing Shared Service Centre (SSC). SSC team members work internally within the business providing support to the client facing members of the firm.

Advantage is the data analytics tool used to analyze a client’s entire dataset. It runs using Qlikview and provides powerful visualisations which help auditors to understand client transactions and identify outliers. Audit of journals is the first area for which the tool is being widely used.

Responsibilities

This will be a challenging and rewarding role where you will:
Work extensively with Advantage software to support regional client facing audit teams to analyse client data and produce digital dashboards for the audit teams to use
Liaise with and support audit teams and clients during the data extraction process
Supervise a team of Data Analytics Assistants. Allocate and review work within the team
Provide technical oversight and query resolution for team members and internal clients
Contribute feedback and recommendations on process and tools used
Deliver team outputs to agreed timescale, quality and volume
Provide support to other colleague teams dependent upon seasonality of core work
Requirements
Highly developed IT skills – Expert knowledge of MS products (Excel, Access) and some exposure to data analytics tools is highly desirable. Willingness to learn new systems is essential
Intermediate knowledge of coding/scripting advantageous
Staff supervisory experience or a strong desire to develop these skills
Experience in either audit or finance would be useful
Well presented with a professional level of communication – both verbal and written
Good time management, organisation skills and the ability to prioritise and complete tasks with limited supervision
Ability to work well in a team environment
Ability to use own initiative and take a flexible approach

title: BI / Data Analyst
role-description:
Overview

The Business of Fashion is seeking a talented Data Analyst to drive our fast growing B2B and B2C subscription business as a founder member of our new, centralised Data Team.

Our teams know that data is crucial to growing our BoF Professional community of readers, and to the success of BoF. With your ability to collaborate across the business, you will understand how data can help inform decisions and which insights are important. Combined with your technical ability, you will help us leverage data to derive the crucial learning required to build value for our community and build our business.

Who Are We?

The Business of Fashion (BoF) is a next generation fashion media company conceived for today's global and hyper-connected world. Founded in 2007 by Imran Amed, BoF is known for its authoritative, agenda-setting point of view on the global fashion industry, described as "The Economist of Fashion," "A Daily Destination for Fashion's Power Players" and "The Industry Bible."

Providing tools and services to support the journey through the fashion and beauty industries, including News & Analysis, Careers, and Education, BoF has grown to be an indispensable resource for fashion executives, creatives, students and entrepreneurs in over 200 countries.

What We Need You To Do

As a founder member of our Data Team, alongside Data Engineers and a Product Manager, you will be responsible for supporting the evolution of our data platform and for arming the business teams with new data and more sophisticated ways to interrogate it in order to learn and apply insight effectively.

By supporting us in establishing repeatable and sustainable analytics processes, you will ensure the business is efficient in their use of data, and compliant to all relevant data regulation.

In Being Successful In This Role, You Will

Get data in shape
Prepare, clean and analyse large sets of digital data to uncover audience trends and behaviours and business performance insights
Collaborate with a Product Manager to pipeline new or evolution of current data sets
Champion accuracy and ensure solutions meet the required level of quality alongside our QA team
Enable all business teams to leverage data
Be the go-to person for new data requests, coordinating delivery to meet need
Collaborate with teams across the business to identify need
Continuously prioritise reporting which will deliver the most impact
Structure, create and maintain a suite of reporting / visualisation
Pipeline requests requiring new data or changes to current data sets via a Product Manager and engineers
Onboard BoF team members to our data capabilities and procedures
Manage communication to ensure stakeholders are well informed about your projects
Use data strategically
Identify questions we should be asking to harvest important insight
Build stories from data that provide crucial insight to inform business decisions and present in an engaging way
Be our data guardian
Ensure the integrity and cleanliness of our data
Data models are established and maintained
Metrics are defined and used consistently across the business
Ensure the security of our data
Support establishment of our BoF Data function
Ensure repeatable, sustainable processes
Manage the proliferation of reports & dashboards
Support the definition of the BoF data analytics approach and process


Who You Are

You are a strategic Data Analyst, ideally with experience working with a digital subscription / media business, who enjoys proactively finding opportunities for the business to consider. You have refined your own views on the optimum approach and process to best establish a Data Function, and are looking forward to helping unveil the power of data to transform a business.

You are naturally collaborative and relish working alongside colleagues from multiple business functions (Marketing, Product, Editorial, Senior Leadership etc) to drive the full potential from our data.

The Specifics
You understand the different dimensions of data required to inform business decisions (from KPI reporting, to funnels, to user segmentation, to attribution and so on)
You have experience working with Looker, creating Models, Looks and Dashboards; or similar experience with a BI tool like Tableau, PowerBI, Qlikview, Chartio, etc.
High SQL proficiency, and good knowledge of RDB and data structures
Ability to explain analysis clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences
Independently manage projects end to end - ensuring stakeholders are kept informed

It won't be necessary that you have a working knowledge of Python or R, or experience using DBT (Data Build Tool), but if you do have either this will be a bonus.

You'll Know You're Successful When...

You and your colleagues, Product Managers and Data Engineers, are working well as the newest team at The Business of Fashion

The Business of Fashion business teams are gleaning actionable insights every day from our data

You are the person in the business teams come to if they need insight. You can help them answer the question that starts with, "Do we have data that can tell me…." - and then you suggest a better question to ask

title: Data Analyst - Paris (Internship)
role-description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is looking for a Data Analyst Intern to join our analytics and growth team in Paris. As a member of the internal analytics team, you will play a central role to deliver data driven insights and data products to various teams at the company. You will also support the full organization to self leverage data and capitalize on it. The ideal candidate is naturally curious, has good verbal and written communication skills, a strong interest in data and related technologies, a sharp analytical mind and a positive attitude towards work.

What you'll do
Work closely with all Dataiku teams to help them identify business problems and solve them thanks to ad-hoc data analysis or long-term data-driven solutions you’ll create and implement.
Work on defining and implementing a long-term analytics strategy for the company with the objective of improving autonomy and overall efficiency of the teams.
Support the organization in the development, deployment and maintenance strategy of rolled-out internal data projects.

The scope of the job represents a unique opportunity to understand the company as a whole, develop your technical skills (Python, SQL) and discover or deepen knowledge on a wide range of software (Dataiku DSS, Salesforce, Tableau, Gainsight…).

Requirements
Bachelor/Master degree or equivalent practical experience
Excellent analytical, critical thinking, and creative problem-solving skills
Good communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate and present complex situations and concepts
Resourceful mindset towards technologies, willingness to explore and proactivity
Curiosity and ability to quickly learn and understand the vocabulary, concepts and key stakes of various fields of activity
Track record of successful project management, execution, multi-tasking and collaboration with cross-functional teams
Basic understanding of data analysis and related tools and techniques such as SQL, Python, Dataiku DSS, Tableau…
Benefits
Enjoy our brand-new office in Paris and the startup life (Breakfast, Snacks, Game Room, Yoga, Football and more…)
Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and fun team
Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness
To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast (having just closed a $101 million Series C round in December 2018 and looking to double in 2019), but still maintains a startup spirit. Dataiku serves its global customer base from its headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Singapore, and Sydney. Each of our offices has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes.

title: Data Analyst (x/f/m)
role-description:
MYCS means creating furniture you love - exactly the way you want it!

All our products are customisable via a photorealistic, real-time 3D customisation tool. With this tool, MYCS is not only revolutionising e-commerce but is also turning the furniture market upside-down. MYCS has been expanding rapidly since its launch in 2015. To further advance our mission "make customisation the new normal," we are looking for enthusiastic and passionate talents who are happy to take on responsibility. At MYCS everyone has the opportunity to realise their own ideas and really make an impact.

Join our international team to shape the future of the furniture market!

These will be your tasks
Working in our BI team to produce actionable analytics
Evaluating and reporting of business, product, and marketing decisions
Driving a data-first mindset across the organisation
Being an effective teacher on how to interpret and take action on results
Providing ongoing support and optimising BI services
Ensuring data consistency and reconciling different data sources
Conducting deep-dive analyses for various departments across the company


You're Offering These Qualifications
Effective communicator with the ability to explain complex concepts in plain language; good presentation skills are a plus
Background in analytics, statistics, econometrics or machine learning
Experience understanding business needs and requirements from perspectives across the organisation
Experience in SQL and R or Python; data visualisation skills and Javascript are a plus
Experience with statistical modelling, regression analysis or equivalent techniques
Prior experience working programmatically with data
Experience with Excel or business reporting is a plus
Excellent English language skills, German is a plus


We're Offering These Benefits
Be part of a technically outstanding and dedicated international team
Work in Holacracy, a set-up where power is distributed throughout the origanisation, giving independence and freedom to self-manage
Benefit from many opportunities to evolve and learn new tools
Participate regular events with an individual budget at each team’s disposal
Get your own customised furniture through generous employee discounts
Enjoy free snacks, drinks and a full fridge
Benefit from subsidy for occupational pension
Shape your own day of work through a commitment to work-life balance with flexible working hours and models
To enhance your application, please, feel free to add your GitHub link.

We're looking forward to receiving your application!

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
En Iwantic, primera agencia española especializada en selección de perfiles digitales, reclutamos a los candidatos más brillantes para los empleos que están cambiando el mundo.

En este momento, estamos buscando unData Analystpara una gran multinacionalcon al menos tres años de experiencia en analíticay minería de datos en un entorno comercial, para Barcelona.

Funciones
Identificar oportunidades para explotar los datos, demostrando el valor de estos nuevos enfoques, en consonancia con los objetivos de negocio.
Diseño y puesta en marcha de modelos analíticos avanzados
Establecimiento de estrategias y metodologías comunes a las distintas divisiones, implantando mejores prácticas y asegurando la consistencia en el uso de datos.
Trabajar estrechamente con los analistas de las distintas áreas de negocio, con el fin de garantizar la evolución y mejora continua de nuestros activos de datos.
Colaboración conTI para desarrollar una hoja de ruta, identificar nuevas fuentes de información y apoyar acciones relacionadas con la visualización de los datos.
Mantener estrechos vínculos con los propietarios de los datos, tanto internos como externos, y dar respuesta a las consultas e incidencias de los usuarios.
Comunicación, sensibilización y formación permanente a todos los niveles de la compañía para impulsar una cultura basada en los datos.

Requisitos
Experiencia en el desarrollo e implementación de modelos analíticos avanzados.
Experiencia trabajando con una amplia variedad de conjuntos de datos, incluyendo datos transaccionales, de comportamiento e investigación, y en su utilización para responder a las diversas necesidades de negocio.
Comodidad a la hora de trabajar en un ambiente de negocio, en contacto directo con los clientes internos, así como en la gestión de tareas diarias del proyecto.
Visión empresarial, con capacidad de identificar nuevas oportunidades y pensar de forma innovadora.
Habilidad para planificar y gestionar múltiples tareas, trabajar con plazos acordados, y gestionar y responder a prioridades cambiantes.
Excelentes habilidades interpersonales, capacidad de comunicación y competencia para presentar análisis complejos de forma clara y sencilla a equipos multidisciplinares y con distintos niveles de seniority.
Competencia profesional de inglés, hablado y escrito.

Conocimientos
SQL Python, ROctave, JMatLab, Scavis, Microstrategy
herramientas estadísticas como R, SAS o SPSS
VBA y Excel o herramientas de visualización de datos, preferentemente tales como BO y/o Tableau u otros
La persona seleccionada gozará de grandes beneficios sociales( tickets restaurante, seguros...), contrato indefinido y plan de carrera desde un primer momento, además de un interesante paquete retributivo.

title: Senior Business/ Data Analyst
role-description:
We Are

The Wix Business Analysis (BA) group. We are 60+ business analysts and data scientists and strongly believe in using analytics to understand how users interact with our products. With over 140 million users, we collect over a billion events a day–that’s 1TB of data added daily! We do it all using cutting edge technology to process, store, & query our data, including tools we develop ourselves as well as tools like Hadoop and Presto.

We’re looking for an experienced analyst to help build the understanding, growth, and success of our business.

You Are

A Senior Business or Data Analyst with a high level of analytical and problem solving skills. You have excellent business judgment and strategic thinking, and always pay close attention to detail. You have a strong sense of curiosity and a desire to learn and be part of a high-tech, internet-based industry.

You have 2+ years’ experience in quantitative analysis, preferably for an internet or online company. You’re fully proficient in SQL.

Bonus Points If You Have
Experience working with Tableau.
Programming experience in Python/R.
BSc/BA in a highly quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics or engineering.

As a Senior Business/Data Analyst, You Will
Optimize the core business model of Wix.
Analyze and optimize products and activities, take part in design and implementation, and be a key part of strategic product decisions.
Explore, analyze and process massive amounts of data, turning it into actionable business insights.
Conduct customer analysis – churn, behavior, segmentation, trends, customer value and much more.
Plan, conduct and interpret the results of A/B tests in order to optimize existing and implement new product features.
Build automated dashboards and reports to facilitate company-wide awareness and understanding of key metrics.
Be the data and analytical lead on various projects and work closely with different teams across the company.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Do you love data and its ability to help make the world a better place? Is your curiosity piqued given the chance to tap into a rich vein of high quality data? Do you enjoy delivering business insights and supporting data-driven decision making? Interested in energy and Big Data? Want to reduce carbon emissions in the UK and beyond?

Guru Systems is a fast growing company on a mission to radically reduce carbon emissions by creating and applying great technology.

We provide smart payment and data analytics systems to energy companies, housing associations and private developers. We manufacture our own embedded devices and manage our onsite Internet-of-Things networks, and are proud of our award-winning team and products.

Right now we need you on our team!

Your Mission

Guru’s Data Analyst role sits at the intersection of our Product and Technology teams.

Working with Technology, your mission is to take responsibility for the collection, organisation and interrogation of data sets from a variety of sources. You will take stewardship of Guru’s data (including metadata) and support our developers in their work to create robust and appropriate data storage solutions.

You’ll work closely with our Product team to identify opportunities for analysis that supports improvements in our client’s operations, in particular, the performance efficiency of heat networks throughout the UK. To achieve this, you’ll engage with domain experts in order to understand specific technical problems and construct appropriate analysis that allows our clients to take positive actions to improve their performance.

In doing so, you’ll be saving carbon emissions and reducing the overall cost to deliver heat. In short, you will be a key part of creating a platform that people love and want to use on a regular, continuous basis to make their world a better place.

You Will Have
A BSc in a quantitative field
Experience with math / quantitative reasoning
Experience delivering and presenting data analysis to a range of stakeholders
Ability to use some kind of programming interface (e.g. R, Python, Tableau) to perform data collation, cleanup, and manipulation for analysis purposes. (Note: you are not expected to be a developer, just to be able to use programming languages to manipulate data)
Ability to undertake ad-hoc analysis for Guru or our stakeholders as required (diversity analysis, distribution loss factors, etc) in accordance with good statistical and quantitative practices.
Strong empathy and the capacity to react calmly and efficiently, even when others are stressed
Excellent interpersonal and presentational skills, with the ability to communicate clearly in written and spoken English

Nice To Have
Good understanding of web technologies and the Internet of Things
Experience working in an SME / startup environment
Experience of undertaking data analysis in the energy or built environment industries
Characteristics:

You’ll have a solid track record of collection, organisation and interrogation of data sets from a variety of sources, the use of programming languages to manipulate data, and the design and presentation of data analysis to a range of stakeholders.

Naturally inquisitive, you’ll be comfortable recommending and implementing relevant tools and new processes. You’ll have a common sense approach to technology, allowing you to quickly understand the fundamentals and communicate them to non-technical stakeholders.

Confident and self-motivated, comfortable within an SME, you’ll have an excellent interpersonal style, able to operate effectively as part of a dynamic team. You’ll feel comfortable speaking to clients at all levels of seniority.

Salary, Benefits And Other Information
Be part of a growing innovative business and help shape the future of energy
Collaborative, flexible and friendly environment
Bespoke personal development budget
Normal working hours are 9 am to 5:30 pm
Guru Systems will match 5% pension contributions
25 days holiday
2 Volunteer / Social Engagement Days
Quarterly and annual social events, from bowling to a whole company getaway
We offer great perks and discounts with free access to health and wellness support and more.
Free coffee, teas and fruit every day, and a variety of beverages on a Friday!
A bit more about Guru:

We have brought together a fantastic team of extremely bright people from fields that don’t usually overlap: energy, engineering, IoT, software development and Big Data analytics. Proud of our award-winning team and products, we maintain high standards, certified to ISO9001, ISO14001, ISO27001 and Cyber Essentials Plus.

We care about our culture – a lot. While Guru’s people are highly effective, we are also open-minded, curious and always willing to own and learn from our mistakes. We are tolerant but we won’t knowingly hire jerks, no matter how skilled they are. We also prefer team players to lone heroes.

We also care a lot about our clients and other stakeholders, because we can only fulfil our mission if they are delighted with our output.

title: Insights Data Analyst
role-description:
We are a team on a mission, to put accessible and affordable healthcare in the hands of every person on earth. Our mission is bold and ambitious, and it’s one that’s shared by our team who shares our values, to dream big, build fast and be brilliant.

To achieve this, we’ve brought together one of the largest teams of scientists, clinicians, mathematicians and engineers to focus on combining the ever-growing computing power of machines, with the best medical expertise of humans, to create a comprehensive, immediate and personalized health service and make it universally available.

At Babylon our people aren’t just part of a team, they’re part of something bigger. We’re a vibrant community of creative thinkers and doers, forging the way for a new generation of healthcare. We’re only as good as our people. So, finding the best people is everything to us.

We serve millions, but we choose our people one at a time…

A Operations Insights Analyst who will build the analytical and reporting infrastructure to enable us to understand and predict trends across our clinical operations business as we scale. This is not your typical Analyst role; dashboards, reports and analytical products will be required to be delivered on tight operational timelines.

You will develop a deep understanding of Babylon’s operations to help drive your analytical solutions, and you must also be able to communicate the value of your work to different disciplines in order to embed your solutions in day-to-day operations.

You will work intimately with the clinical operations team and across multiple product and technical teams in order to help us build the first digital general practice that can support millions of patients.

Your Role Is To
Build a reporting and analytical infrastructure in Tableau
Build a gold-standard suite of reports and dashboards that will be used to power the Clinical Operations business
Mentor power business users on the use of Tableau Explorer to support self service
Help build and define the operations reporting and insights processes
Create the optimal reporting structure by working closely with business leads and clinicians
Develop strong understanding of Babylon’s operations in order to define appropriate metrics and key success indicators
Build clear and effective feedback loops to key areas of the business (including product, engineering, commercial, marketing etc.) to provide valuable operations insights
Communicate insights and metrics to senior stakeholders and business partners on a regular basis
Be the analytical powerhouse behind core operations projects (from origination to implementation) and create the required models and analysis to drive initiatives
Analyse and identify existing priority processes that need transforming or improvement, and then implement on your findings.
Help build the foundational data infrastructure and analytics platform to assist data-driven teams within operations and across the company

Who Fits This Role
Someone with 1-2 years business experience using SQL
Minimum 1-2 years experience using Tableau to build reporting dashboards and analyse data
Experience building models and dashboards to tight timelines and embedding these in operations to inform real-time business decisions
Experience working with data engineering to build databases
Previous experience working on short turn-around, analytical problems
Strong statistical understanding
Worked in multi-disciplinary teams
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a non-hierarchical manner across multiple teams

What’s nice to have?

Fundamentals in Python and R
Experience working in a startup culture

Benefits
Competitive salary package including share scheme
Free babylon for you and your family
One of the nicest offices you’ll ever see, located in the heart of Chelsea
Free healthy breakfast, and snacks
On site table tennis and video game competitions
Regular social gatherings and an intimate, collaborative environment
A real entrepreneurial spirit and drive to make a tangible difference in the world
Free weekly yoga or football sessions
Pension scheme
Childcare vouchers
BUPA health and life insurance

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
DATA ANALYST

Il Gruppo Ligabue sviluppa servizi di approvvigionamento, di catering e di facility management (che comprende diverse soluzioni integrate - come housekeeping o maintenance), principalmente per attività marittime come Navi da Crociera, Traghetti, Navi da carico, ed attività operanti nell’Oil & Gas, Mining e Construction come Piattaforme Off Shore e campi On Shore in zone remote. L’azienda è stata fondata nel 1919 ed è attiva in 14 paesi del mondo, con un fatturato consolidato di oltre 350 milioni di euro.
 Per il nostro HQ di Marghera – Venezia stiamo cercando un/a Data Analyst.

Descrizione del ruolo

Le funzioni AFC & ICT del Gruppo Ligabue hanno iniziato un importante programma di potenziamento dei sistemi e processi di pianificazione e reporting di gruppo per soddisfare l’accresciuto fabbisogno informativo del Management in una fase di forte crescita in mercati diversificati e complessi.
La figura ricercata, con riporto diretto al Group ICT Manager e collaborando con le principali funzioni di staff e di linee di business, sarà parte del processo di evoluzione in atto, con ampia visibilità su tutto il progetto.
La persona prescelta ha forti competenze tecniche in ambito di modellizzazione dei dati, della verifica della loro integrità e consistenza, ma anche la capacità di interloquire con i diversi responsabili delle aree di business, comprendendo le necessità e specificità di ognuna, ponendosi come referente per i sistemi di business intelligence.
 Compiti e principali responsabilità

progetta, sviluppa e mantiene KPI, metriche, reports e dashboard funzionali all’analisi dell’andamento del business in ottica consuntiva e predittiva
collabora con i team operativi e le funzioni di staff per sviluppare soluzioni automatizzate di reporting, ottimizzazione dei processi di produzione e raccolta dati
crea le strutture per estrarre dati da molteplici applicativi, assicurandone l’affidabilità, la qualità e la precisione
supporta l’ufficio del Controllo di Gestione nella creazione e manutenzione della reportistica per il management
promuove l’adozione di nuove soluzioni tecnologiche che possano migliorare l’esecuzione dei processi aziendali (AI, machine learning)

Requisiti
 laurea magistrale in scienze informatiche o statistica
esperienza in data modelling e statistica per creare strutture dati adeguate
esperienza di 3-5 anni in posizione similare
consolidata conoscenza di strumenti di BI; è un plus la conoscenza dei prodotti SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Business Object, Qlik, Tableau ed eventualmente prodotti di EPM/CPM
è un considerato un plus aver partecipato al roll out di soluzioni di business intelligence
ottime doti di comunicazione e competenza nel fare presentazioni
inglese fluente

Sede di lavoro: Marghera (VE)

title: Data Analyst
Junior Data Analyst
role-description:
Requirements

If you want to develop your strengths and be the best in your area of expertise, BDO is your choice, because here, the exceptional client service can be achieved with the support of a good team and hard work. Job domain: AUDIT & ASSURANCE Assignment: Full time job/ Part time could be possible for students!Requirements: Economic University, Accounting or Finance are preferred;o Microsoft Excel knowledge is a big plus;o Good command of English;o Analytical thinking and result-oriented attitude;o Initiative, accountability, team spirit;o An enthusiasm for data and how it may be analyzed and interpreted;o Tenacious problem solving ability and critical thinking;o Organized and capable of planning to manage resources required.

Responsibilities

Short description:As a Junior Data analyst at BDO you will develop the appropriate skills and knowledge for performing the following activities:o Liaise with and support audit teams during the data extraction process;o Assist in the cleaning and correcting of data;o Perform data loads into data analytics solutions;o Ensure that the audit teams and management are informed of progress or issues;o Manage a constant flow of deliverables and monitor progress against deadlines;o Perform reviews and quality checks after data has been loaded;o Liaise with audit teams to resolve data quality or reconciliation issues;o Provide feedback and recommendations on processes and tools used.

title: BI Specialist m/f/d Data Analysis Europe
role-description:
The future of life sciences is too complex to be viewed from only a single perspective. Thatis why Eppendorf views the world from many perspectives - including those of natural scientists, engineers, IT specialists, economists and specialists from other disciplines. As a premium manufacturer of innovative products and consumables, we are a global community of more than 3,000 employees.

Discover and shape your future with Eppendorf - as a

BI Specialist m/f/d Data Analysis Europe



Your tasks

Developing databases and/or a data warehouse that are/is automatically curated to capture all relevant information for Global Business Intelligence and Development at Eppendorf
Supporting the Business Units in developing their product portfolio strategies by mining, analyzing, presenting and storing relevant data
Delivering qualitative insights of publications and markets through analytics, web crawlers, text miners, and data-parsing tools
Designing dashboards
Developing key relationships within the Europe Market Region to enable Business Unit personnel to engage with the market
Gathering market and competitive intelligence to enable decisions made by the Business Units and the European Market Region
Participating in customer visits to key clients with Sales Managers and in tradeshows both to understand customer needs and competitive positioning
Contributing to market share analysis for key products, to add further insights into the work done by Sales and Operational Marketing
Gathering competitive intelligence regarding product offers, positioning and pricing, product developments, and share of wallet of key customers across all Eppendorf products
Traveling in the field to gather market intelligence, including meeting with customers, attending conferences and tradeshows, interacting with key opinion leaders
Providing customer and market feedback to Business Portfolio
Business trips up to 30% of the time


Your background

Masters in economic computer sciences or mathematics
MBA with several years of professional experience preferred
Highly networked and proven business acumen
Experienced in Python, SQL, R, Tableau, HTML, web crawling, data & text mining, predictive modeling and database design
Good understanding of life science research labs and of the industry
Working knowledge in Illustrator, Animate, InDesign or similar preferred
Experience in a matrix based organization preferred


Your perspectives at Eppendorf

Structured induction and rapid team integration through the employee introduction program
Company culture that encourages our employees to exercise their creative freedom to introduce his or her own ideas and set things into motion
Robust total rewards program including competitive pay and benefits package
Independent organization of the daily work as well as various tasks and projects
Diverse benefits, such as a canteen, company pension scheme, sports groups or daycare

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Data Analyst

£30 - £39.90/hour

London

16/10/2019 (18:27)

Huntress

Data Analyst

A global powerhouse within the social media industry is looking for a Data Analyst to join their team in London for an initial 11 month contract and support data queries from the business. They're seeking someone who can work in a fast-paced environment to quickly answer ad hoc questions related to their workforce.

Contractor requirements

3+ years of experience with SQL (or similar language aimed at querying relational databases)
Experience working with data visualization tools like Tableau
