title: Manager Data & Analytics Office
role-description:
About This Vacancy

Location: Zoeterwoude
Discipline: Finance
Working Experience: 5 - 10 Years
Type of Contract: Permanent

Apply Before

Manager Data & Analytics Office

As Manager Data & Analytics Office you are responsible for Data Governance, Reference & Master Data, Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics. A team of around 10 data & analytics professionals. Deploying Data & Analytics as core capability for HEINEKEN Netherlands Commerce or HEINEKEN Netherlands Supply. You are responsible for executing the Data Strategy. Continue to build up the strong data foundation through pragmatic Data Governance enhancing Data Management and derive value out of data through Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics.

What are your responsibilities as Manager Data & Analytics Office?

Data & Analytics is seen as core capability within HEINEKEN. Your goal is to build and further mature this capability. The Data & Analytics Office acts as an enabler. We believe that every business becomes a Data business. You are not going to solve all data and analytics challenges, you going to help the business lines to solve their data & analytics challenges by supporting them with knowledge, policies, processes, tools etc. with a clear ‘add business value’ mindset.

Your Main Responsibilities Are
Develop, maintain, adapt and execute the Data & Analytics Strategy. Aligned with the Global Data & Analytics Strategy and the Strategy of HEINEKEN Netherlands Supply or HEINEKEN Netherlands Commerce
Manage and develop your team of Data & Analytics Professionals
As Business Process Owner of the Data & Strategy, Data Management and Insights processes you will continues improve these processes
As Business Owner of the Data & Analytics Platform/Technology stack you are, together with the IT Solution Owner, responsible for the development of this platform and set the priorities
You act as a trusted advisor for the MT of HEINEKEN Netherlands and the MT’s of the Business Lines
Building up and mature the data & analytics capability throughout HEINEKEN Netherlands across all Business Lines
Promote, maintain and develop Data Ownership throughout the organization
Show the ‘art of the possible’ and explain, in business language, complex Data & Analytics concepts (e.g. Data Governance, Master Data, Machine Learning etc etc.)

As Manager Data & Analytics Office you will be based in Zoeterwoude (HEINEKEN Netherlands Supply) or Leiden (HEINEKEN Netherlands Commerce; as from April 2020) and you will be reporting to the Finance Director/Manager.

Your working environment

Within Heineken NL you will be part of the MT Finance. Finance acts across business lines and acts as the guardian of Heineken’s assets. And yes… we view Data as a critical business Asset. The Data & Analytics Office consists of 4 teams: Data Governance, Reference & Master Data, Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics. The purpose is to “Enable employees and their customers to make informed decisions based on easy accessible and trusted insights” .

Our message is that you have to be in control of your data if you want to accelerate with Advanced Analytics and digital innovation.

Are you the Manager Data & Analytics Office we are looking for?

Deep Experience In One Of The Disciplines But Also Knowledge (able To Apply) Of The Other Disciplines

To be successful we’re looking for individuals who has a strong t-shaped profile.
A Master Degree in Information Management, Business Administration, Business Information or equivalent;
At least 8-10 years’ work experience in Data Governance, Reference & Master Data, Business Intelligence and/or Advanced Analytics;
At least 5 years’ work experience in leadership roles, managing high value specialists
Relevant knowledge of (industry) standards like the Data Management Body of Knowledge, CMMI, architectural frameworks, reference models is a must;
Fluent written and verbal communication skills in English;
Strong persuasion skills; key skill is that you can communicate with and enthuse stakeholders on different levels;
Please kindly note that you need to have an EU Working Permit (Orientation Year Visa not included) in order to proceed for this position.


What To Expect From Us

Working at HEINEKEN means looking beyond the boundaries of your own job title. Your opinion and talents are important for every change and improvement. This means that you may be involved in a project that falls outside of your specialization.

The salary differs per position within the company. It will be based upon the intensity of the job, the relevant work experience, and your education. Having fun in your work and a good balance between work and private life is equally important. The more you enjoy your job, the better your contribution to our products will be. A career with HEINEKEN offers great challenges combined with exciting opportunities to own and grow your career in line with your aspirations.

About HEINEKEN

HEINEKEN is the leading international brewer, with more than 250 international and local beer and cider brands in more than 190 countries. Our colleagues come to work every day with pleasure to ensure our consumers can enjoy numerous beer and cider brands, such as HEINEKEN, Amstel, Brand, Desperados, Affligem, and Apple Bandit.

In the Netherlands, HEINEKEN has three breweries in Den Bosch, Wijlre, and Zoeterwoude, the latter being the largest brewery in Europe. Furthermore, soft drinks are bottled at Vrumona in Bunnik, one of HEINEKEN Nederland’s subsidiary companies. Vrumona has a varied portfolio, including brands such as Royal Club, Crystal Clear, SiSi, Sourcy, and Sourcy Vitaminwater. In addition, in the Netherlands, Vrumona is the license-holder and supplier of Pepsi, Rivella, 7UP, and Mountain Dew.

Interested?
Are you interested in this job and would you like to apply? Then please click on the application button. For additional information about this job or the application process, please contact Bart de Geus - Manager Data & Analytics Office. We are looking forward to receiving your application.

HEINEKEN Netherlands is working with preferred suppliers. Acquisitionwillnotbeappreciated.

At HEINEKEN, we brew great beers and we build great brands. We are committed to surprising and exciting our consumers and employees everywhere. We have a proud history and heritage in brewing and in our communities. With operations in over 70 markets globally, we are the world's most international brewer.

title: Data Analysis Trainee
role-description:
We're looking for a talented Data Analysis Trainee to help us change the world of digital advertising together. Please note that this is a Product Data Analysis position, not a Data Science/ML/AI Traineeship.

About Us

At seedtag our mission is to create the best in-image advertising on earth. We are the leading company in in-image advertising and we believe in high-quality and non-intrusive advertising content. The seedtag platform allows some of the largest online publishers to get the most out of their images.

Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, today we proudly count over 100 employees in 7 countries. At seedtag we are committed to maintaining a culture where everyone can thrive and find meaning in their work. Our team is composed of eager self-starters who cultivate innovation and constantly bring fresh ideas.

About You

As a Data Analysis Trainee you will work on extracting information from multiple sources and extracting insights to improve the business. You will form the bridge between product development and our operational teams. Your tasks will include:
Leverage data to perform analysis across all areas of our business to improve operational efficiency and streamline process.
Design and build dashboards and reports to help optimize the business.
Monitor, analyse and contribute to improve performance of seedtag solutions.
YOU
Graduating with a degree in engineering, mathematics or a related technical area is a MUST.
Are proficient in Excel/Google Sheets and have previous experience with Python and SQL. Additionally, some experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Microsoft PowerBI or Google Data Studio is a plus.
Have fluent proficiency in Spanish and a good level of English.
Enjoy understanding how things work, why things may go wrong and how to improve business processes.
Are a real team player with really good communication skills.

What We Offer
A fun and international work environment in a young AdTech company
The opportunity to gain relevant work experience in the field of Data Analysis in the growing AdTech market
A great work location in the heart of Madrid with great coffee, free snacks and even an arcade games machine. Also, we recycle everything we can!
The option to follow company paid English and/or Spanish courses weekly
Open meditation classes in the office fully sponsored by seedtag
Real flexible working hours. We start work between 9 and 11
Many fun offsite activities with your colleagues!

Would you like to join the team? Send us your application via the "apply" button!

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
We are TravelPerk: a fast-growing, well-funded startup that has raised $134m since our creation in early 2015. Backed by world-class investors from some of tech’s most disruptive companies, including Slack, Trello, Twitter, Farfetch, Deliveroo and Delivery Hero, our team is made up of A-players from the online travel industry - Booking.com and Skyscanner, among others.

Our mission is to revolutionize the B2B corporate travel market, worth over $1.3 trillion, by simplifying the process for everyone involved. In doing so, we’ve been named the fastest growing SaaS startup in Europe (#5 in the world) by SaaS1000 and have been featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired.

If you’re ready to take off with us, keep reading!

What You Will Do

Reporting to the CFO, you will be managing and analyzing all data being processed at TravelPerk in order to create useful insights for strategic purposes. This is an instrumental position to bring the business to the next level, as you will support Product owners, Marketing, and Management with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in data-driven decision making.

The Data Analyst Has The Following Responsibilities
Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
Query datasets from different sources, turn data into information, information into insight and insight into product and business decisions.
Use data to investigate and help resolve issues in our product or processes
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports
Data modelling, design and implementation of ETL processes. Acquire data, consolidate and maintain it in a central database.
Apply visualization techniques to facilitate conversations and assist in decision making.
Support Product owners, Marketing, and Management with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in decision making.


Requirements To Apply
Data engineering or Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or similar.
3+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in a business intelligence, analytics, or data science/data scientist role, including relevant tools, techniques, and technology.
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in English.
Excellent analytical skills.


You Will Need To Prove The Following
You are a Master in data analysis tools (SQL, Google Analytics, and excel)
Experience with statistical packages (Python, R)
Comfortable querying different type of databases (ie PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch)
Experience preparing, consolidating and normalizing data: ETL processes (i.e. Pentaho Data Integration).
Experience with different data visualization and BI tools (ie Tableau, Looker).
The desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction, and with highly engaged individuals.

What do we offer?
Competitive compensation including equity in the company.
24 vacation days per year and flexible working hours.
Health perks: Choose between a private health scheme or a gym allowance.
"Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salary.
Free Spanish classes.
Yoga and meditation.
Possibility to choose your hardware and tools.
Free coffee and beverages, fresh fruit and other breakfast stuff.


The Data Analyst position requires full-time, in-house work in Barcelona, Spain. We can help with relocation from anywhere in the world. English is the official language at the office. No prior knowledge of Spanish is required.

TravelPerk is an equal opportunity employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, or age.

title: Data & Analytics Consultant
role-description:
Who We Are

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean, AI, agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

Role & Responsibilities

As a Data and Analytics Consultant you will be conducting projects in the transformation of our clients’ businesses through the effective collection, processing and activation of data. We expect you to ensure quality and continuity of the full range of Data & Analytics services meanwhile actively contributing to the expertise level and competencies of the team. Your work will be done in close collaboration with the other divisions (Media & Activation, Creation, Consultancy, Data Science and Technology) to provide comprehensive services to our clients. Among your responsibilities will be the execution of our Data & Analytics projects ensuring delivery including:

Analytics and Media Implementation
Tag management setup, data layering, media tagging and custom scripting
Performing audits, reviews and creating best-practice analytics setups
Media tagging and conversion support
Solution design, documentation and creating developer guidelines

Data Collection & Enrichment
Setting up and improving data collection (web, apps, offline, pos)
Best practice Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics and Firebase implementations
Lighter coding (JavaScript, Python, SQL, R)
Data aggregation and channel attribution

Data Visualisation and Storytelling
Dashboarding (Data Studio, PowerBi, Tableau)
Basic and advanced reporting
Presentations and consulting work

We expect you to stay up to date on developments within the industry, to share best practices and contribute to Artefact’s institutional knowledge.

Your Profile
Academic level of education (Bachelor or Master)
A minimum of 1 year of work experience in a data-driven working environment
Verifiable knowledge and experience of web analytics platforms like Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics etc.
Familiarity with tag management systems like Google Tag Manager, Tealium iQ Ensighten etc.
Familiarity with website optimization tools like Optimizely, Google Optimize, Convert, AB Tasty etc
Optionally, familiarity with Data Management Platforms like BlueKai, Adobe Audience Manager, Tealium Audience Stream, etc.
Basic knowledge of web-related technologies (JavaScript, CSS and HTML) and database techniques (REST-APIs, SQL, No-SQL)
Knowledge of data processing and data modeling algorithms and techniques would be an advantage
Fluency in English is a must, preferably also Dutch


What We Offer You
A team that values professionalism. We are driven entrepreneurs that are eager to make a dent in the industry.
Personal development. Every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn. This is a chance for you to take your career to the next level!
A social working environment. We enjoy each other’s company both on and off the clock.
Great office location in central Utrecht.
A competitive salary package.

title: Data Analytics Lead Teacher (Full time)
role-description:
Data Analytics Lead Teacher (Full time)

Job Description

#About the Gig

We’re looking for a Lead Instructor for our Data Analytics Bootcamp with a passion for data and for sharing their knowledge in order to have an IMPACT in the Tech Talent Community. The Lead Instructor is someone who has a deep understanding of data analysis gathered from his/her educational journey and real-world experience. You need to be a strong communicator and very patient -- you will find yourself explaining many abstract and complex concepts in math and technology to the first-time data squads.

The role includes free time to do your own projects every afternoon. You will be only teaching during the morning getting paid as a full-time job.

The Lead Instructor Will Be Responsible For
Overseeing the whole academic experience of an Ironhack bootcamp (from student selection to graduation).
Teaching at our Madrid Campus - Near to Madrid Rio
Managing Teaching Assistants RockStars (TAs)
Creating engaging content for our Data Analytics course that may include lessons, exercises and/or mini-projects
Lead instructor won't be needed to produce the curriculum. The curriculum is pre-made by our Global Education Team

Requirements

#Is this You?
3-5+ years of experience in Data Analytics, Data Science, and/or Data Engineering, preferably with leadership roles
Solid understanding of and strong technical skills in Python, SQL, and R
Proficiency in building end-to-end data pipeline:
Writing Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) jobs to calculate business metrics
Understanding of APIs and Datawarehousing concepts
Familiarity with contemporary industry software and tools (e.g. Linux, git, AWS, Google Analytics, Jupyter)
A big plus if you have experience with one or more of the following:
Experience in Big Data architecture (e.g. Hadoop, Hive)
Experience in Analytics and business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlikview, MicroStrategy)
Experience in Dataviz (e.g. D3)
Experience in AI and machine learning
Passion for teaching: although we don’t require previous formal teaching experiences, we’re looking for people who will enjoy teaching, mentoring, and giving feedback for students.
Experience managing and keeping a team motivated. Can-do attitude and a good sense of humor.
Great communication skills and an ability to capture people’s attention :)
#Perks
Be part of an Amazing Team. We embrace a constant learning, can-do attitude and 100% positivism!!
Flexible work environment
Possibility of doing any of our part-time bootcamps
Macbook Pro
500€ annually for education budget
Annual company offsite
Ironbeers every Friday
Fresh Fruit
Ping Pong Tournaments
and much more!
#About Ironhack

Ironhack is an education startup that was founded to disrupt the way we learn about technology. It sucks that we’ve been learning the same way since the Industrial Revolution, so we empower students to find meaningful careers in software development or product design by offering immersive learning experiences to extremely motivated people.

Our higher purpose is to transform the education space by making it customer-centric and outcomes-driven. Students finish our program with a new way of thinking and approaching problems, resulting in new jobs, promotions at their current jobs, or companies they’ve built.

Quick Facts
Founded in 2013 by Wharton and Harvard grads
Operations in Barcelona, Madrid, Miami, Paris, Mexico City, Berlin, Amsterdam, Sao Paulo and Lisbon
100% YoY Growth (help us to keep it going!)
Graduated over 3,300 students
100+ global team members & venture capital backed

title: Compliance Data Analyst
role-description:
This is Us.

A team of more than one thousand people sharing an idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.
In today’s world, we know this happens because we are a fully online bank. We were born out of that idea and 20 years on, technology, simplicity and transparency continue to be the ingredients of the recipe that leaves the best taste in our mouths: being more than just a bank, someone useful in the lives of the millions of clients who have chosen us.
The way we do things also mirrors our eagerness to innovate. We are proud to be one of the very first banks to work with agile methodologies. It doesn’t ring a bell yet? No worries, we will be delighted to tell you all about it. You will find it’s one of those things you’ll want to repeat over and over.
And although we are based in Spain, we like to cross borders. We are lucky to work with international teams every day across 44 countries, composed of women and men as equal as they are diverse. Because here you are completely free to be who you want to be, love whomever you choose, and even go for pineapple as your pizza topping.
Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead—that’s our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working…we are looking forward to meeting you!

Compliance

We support ING Bank in Spain in being compliant with applicable laws, regulations and reasonable expectations of society at large as well as being the preferred bank for its clients by ensuring that it does the right things, the right way with integrity. This entails that every employee within ING Bank respect the letter and spirit of applicable laws, regulations, as well as policies, standards and the internal values and behaviors defined by the Orange Code.
We work with key internal stakeholders and offer an environment which provides a global overview on how the regulatory requirements and controls are embedded within the business, and provides an opportunity to support relationships with external stakeholders, regulators and supervisory institutions as well as the global functions at Head office.

What are we looking for?

As a Compliance Data Analyst you will participate in Analyzing both in force and new regulation.
Identifying, defining and implementing in collaboration with the rest of the team initiatives to improve control management across the organization for Non-Financial Risk, focusing on the regulatory ambit, customer protection and ING integrity and reputation.
Leading the development and application of data analysis techniques in regulatory control activities, adding value to the identification and management of relevant risks for Compliance ambit.
Coordinating the information requests from the regulators received by ING Spain.
Coordinating and analyzing initiatives with regulatory impact in the organization to identify risks and measures to implement, along with the follow up of measures already implemented.
Participating in the preparation of Compliance Manuals: summary of applicable and relevant laws and regulations; and internal policies and procedures and their periodical review.
Participating in the Compliance continuous training program for all members of the organization.
Advising in compliance matters to the rest of the organization.
Liaison between regulatory entities and ING Spain.



Knows About

For us, a Compliance Data Analyst is someone who:

Compliance or Risk and Control Management, being required a Bachelor Degree
Data Analysis, being able to gather information for key risks identification and developing effective control techniques
Products, processes and regulation related to retail and wholesale banking.

Is a Master Of

ACL and SQL, SAS, R, Python or similar languages
Working with large datasets and automation, machine learning and / or artificial intelligence



Is An Ace In

Team playing, being capable of working in international teams, but also independently if needed
Delivering within a fast-paced, high demand environment while balancing multiple priorities.
Communication and presentation skills
Written and spoken english
Being proactive and creative

Has Worked In

A comparable role in a Compliance and/or a Risk and Control Management function within the financial sector or a consultancy firm, with at least 6 years of experience.

Whose Day At ING Looks Very Much Like This

7.00 - 10.00 h / Arrives at the office (Flexible start time)
At 10.00 h / Daily planning
At 11.00 h Meets with TWIP team to advice in PSD2 implementation
At 12.00 h Develops and applies data analysis to improve AML/FT or FATCA-CRS control activities
At 13.00 h takes a break and goes down to the canteen.
At 14.00 h Validates information to be submitted to the Bank of Spain in response to a request of information
At 16.00 h Follows up action plans with regulatory impact identified to solve an Internal Audit finding.

16.00 - 19.00 h (Flexible end time). Goes to the paddle tennis court for a game.
Win or lose, a shower and off to home.

What do we offer?

Flexible schedule.
What goes on at ING matters much to us.
But we know that the most important things are outside the office.

Free meals.
So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn’t take up your time or your cravings.

Life and health insurance.
For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).
Free company shuttle.
We take you from Madrid city center to our offices at Las Rozas (and back!)

Banking benefits.
Special loan or mortgage terms after 6 months working at the bank.
And benefit from our pension plan after 2 years with us.

More health, more sports.
Paddle tennis court and lessons available to you
Runners club with your own trainer
Clinics with professional, world-class athletes
Physiotherapy service on site

title: Data Analyst/ETL Developer
role-description:
Vinted is the world’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace. Our mission is green: we want to make second-hand the first choice globally.

Currently, 22 million people use our platform, which is developed and supported by a team of more than 300 people from our offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Warsaw. We have a unique work culture that’s based on trust, honesty, and attention to self-improvement.

We’re looking for a technically-minded Data Analyst/ETL Developer to join our Analytics team. You’ll be using cutting-edge technologies to work with big data. Sounds interesting? Read on.

In this position, you will:
Build solutions for third-party data integration into our data warehouse
Support the product teams and management with ad hoc data analysis
Maintain existing product and third-party ETL solutions
Extend our financial reporting solutions

About you:
You have a degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a similar field
Familiar with at least one of the following programming languages: Python, R, Java, Scala
Strong analytical skills
Acquainted with SQL (MySQL, Impala)
Comfortable working with various data structures (JSON, CSV, XML, HTML)
Exceptionally attentive to detail
Fluent in spoken and written English

Bonus skills:
Knowledge of Apache Spark
Experience with ETL development
Experience with data visualisation tools (Looker, Qlik, Tableau)
Basic understanding of web development
Interest in and knowledge of accounting

Work perks:
Opportunity to join our stock options programme
Learning budget (13.2% from net yearly salary)
25 working days of holiday
Daily breakfast and lunch at Vinted Noise restaurant
Monthly team-building events
In-house gym
A personal “Shop @ Vinted” budget

The salary range for this position is 1600-3300 Eur GROSS / month.

If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need.

title: DIGITAL DATA ANALYST (M/F/D)
role-description:
DIGITAL DATA ANALYST (M/F/D) Berlin, München TD Reply What really sets us apart is our imagination, ability to quickly implement innovative solutions, and willingness to inspire our customers with groundbreaking technological solutions. We’re always on the lookout for enthusiastic people who can challenge conventional thought, explore new ideas and achieve exciting goals together. Are you ready? TASKS:
Identify KPIs around data usage and different sources.
Elaborate meaningful presentations for multiple internal and external stakeholders who are not just interested in crunching numbers.
Give recommendations in meaningful presentations beyond numbers.
Work with social listening and publishing tools as well as with web-analytics tools.
Leverage your skills in the creation of qualitative and quantitative analyses.
Create insightful reports and interactive dashboards based on an array of digital data sources.
Collaborate with our software development and design teams in the creation of engaging user experiences and in the definition of functional specs meant to improve our product. QUALIFICATIONS:
You hold an advanced degree in business, economics, engineering, informatics, behavioral or social science, psychology or a related field.
You have 2+ years of relevant working experience and rejoice in the name of all things digital and data-driven marketing.
You have a good understanding of business analytics techniques , you are perceptive and have a strong sense of responsibility.
You are fluent in English.
You are an open minded inspiring individual and a team player.
You have experience working in a digital agency, consultancy or major company (Automotive OEM, FMCG).
You have a solid understanding of the Automotive industry (optional). In addition to an attractive salary, we promote your professional development through regularand systematic further training opportunities. As an innovative, diverse, and dynamicinternational team, we share our knowledge and work together. This helps you to develop yourself, gain new knowledge and skills, and show what you are made of. If you share our passion for perfection and are looking for an exciting professional challenge, join Reply! About TD Reply: TD Reply is an innovation and marketing consultancy and part of the Reply Group. We take a data-driven and execution-oriented approach to drive organizational change through meaningful insights. Our Berlin, Munich and Beijing offices count 90+ consultants, analysts, designers, thinkers, developers, visualizers, futurologists, data scientists and organizers. We are working on international data science projects for clients such as Adidas, BMW, Coca-Cola, Miele and Telefonica. We look foward to receiving your application.

title: Data Analyst - Product Insights
Data Analyst - Lisboa
role-description:
Com mais de 10 anos de existência, somos uma Equipa especializada em Projetos de Consultoria em diversas áreas dentro do mundo das TI (Business Analytics, Development, Governance).

Investimos diariamente para sermos uma das melhores empresas para trabalhar, tendo sido distinguidos no ranking do Great Place to Work com o 1º lugar na categoria das empresas com 100 a 500 colaboradores e melhor empresa na categoria de Liderança. Visita a nossa homepage e junta-te aos nossos Talentos!

Experiência na implementação e definição de modelos analíticos tabulares complexos (usando DAX) (fator preferencial);
Experiência em ferramentas de reporting (por exemplo, Power BI) (fator preferencial);
Conhecimentos em R e Python (fator preferencial);
Capacidade analítica e de problem solving;
Dinamismo e audácia na procura de soluções para os desafios;
Vontade de aprender e evoluir;

Quem Somos
Consultora de Tecnologias de Informação e Processos de Negócio
Atuamos nas áreas de Business Analytics, Development e Governance
12 anos experiência
200 Talentos

title: Data Analyst (M/F)
Associate BI & Product Data Analyst
role-description:
We’re Sky, Europe’s biggest entertainment brand. Think top-quality shows. Breaking news. Innovative tech. Must-have products. Careers here mean the freedom and support you need to make an impact – pushing boundaries, creating solutions, hitting targets. And as part of our close-knit team, you’ll enjoy plenty of benefits. Plus, experiences you’ll only find at Sky.

This role is an exciting opportunity to join us and work within our Data Technology and Analytics (DTA) Team.

What You'll Get

Sky Q, a generous pension and private health care. Access to over 12,000 LinkedIn Learning courses to support your development. And if that’s not enough, our award-winning Osterley campus boasts six subsidised restaurants, a cinema, gym, and much more.

To find out more about working with us, search #LifeatSky on LinkedIn, Twitter or Instagram.

You Will

As an Associate BI & Product Data Analyst, you will be focusing on delivering Core Reporting, Self-serve and Data Products to the business. You will be involved in the use of data and Insights to drive value for the business. You are responsible for delivering against the project approach.
Suggest and design innovative solutions for data insight utilising tools such as Business Objects, Tableau, SQL and GCP.
Gather, manipulate, analyse and document raw, complex data and share data stories that make sense to business and technical audiences.
Partner with data product management teams to provide the most accurate and relevant information to help drive meaningful business decisions and feature definition.
Continually design, test, and deploy new reports and self-serve solutions - all with the goal of providing a state-of-the-art reporting environment.
Respond to ad-hoc analysis needs while ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Develop and define self-serve products.
Understand and abide by data protection rules.
You’ll Have
A degree showing an ability to use and display data in meaningful ways.
Be a self-starter who can use their initiative to solve business problems.
Be a good team player and have the ability to work with others to achieve a common goal.
Excellent commercial skills – be able to understand requirements and be able to deliver solutions to time, cost and quality.
Have an interest in BI and commercial tools to allow the business to extract, manipulate and display data.
Experience working in a dynamic environment in an innovative and creative area. Be able to deliver big picture benefits and make careful and swift prioritisation calls.
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written. both verbal and written.
High levels of logical thinking & problem-solving skills. Able to deal with complex problems using innovative and industry leading techniques.
An understanding of the Media and Broadcasting world.
So, what are you waiting for? Apply now for a chance to forge your own career path and be brilliant as part of a bright, talented team.

Just so you know: if your application is successful, we’ll ask you to complete a criminal record check. And depending on the role you have applied for and the nature of any convictions, we might withdraw the offer.

We’re happy to discuss flexible working.

It’s our people that make Sky Europe’s leading entertainment company. That’s why we work hard to be an inclusive employer, so everyone at Sky can be their best.

title: Data Analyst, Paris
role-description:
Who We Are

At Criteo, we are building the advertising platform of choice for the open Internet, an ecosystem that favors neutrality, transparency and inclusiveness. With more than 1.4 billion active shoppers and $600 billion in annual commerce sales, we deliver performance at scale. Founded in a Paris start-up incubator, Criteo now carries out our entrepreneurial spirit across 30+ global offices. Do you want to have an impact on more than half of the world’s internet users? Join us and be part of something big.

In the Analytics team our mission is to inform decision making through data-driven insights that drive the business.

The Analytics team covers the full extension of Criteo products for the most important clients in each region.

You will face challenging problems that require data-driven solutions, in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.

As an analyst in the team, you will have access to a vast amount of data from multiple sources that you will explore and analyze to find solutions to business questions.

What You'll Do
You extract truthful insights from data to support the client strategy, with analysis and testing, in close collaboration with other functional teams.
Develop internal tools and reports to give everyone access to relevant data in order to improve autonomy and overall efficiency of the teams
Use your excellent analytical skills and business sense to nurture innovation and find new opportunities for growth, with analyses that will inform the development of Criteo products
You will work on business problems providing the analytical expertise, partnering with other teams and functions such as technical, commercial and creative aspects
You present results and analyses to key clients and to internal leadership to make sure your solutions are put in practice!

Who You Are
You have a strong academic background in an analytical field such as Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics or Economics
You have strong problem solving and critical thinking skills
You have experience in data analysis and related tools such as SQL, Tableau, Python and R
You display versatility, attention to detail and generally a hands-on attitude
You can translate business questions into analytical problems and clearly communicate the results
You have experience in autonomously solving problems
You are fluent in English and French
You are interested in the tech ecosystem and show an understanding of business dynamics.

Why you'll love us
Fun and passionate work environment
35+ annual holidays days
Health insurance
Discounted transport and sports activities
Private nursery
Maternity and paternity leave
Competitive compensation package
Central location in Paris and amazing rooftop!

Join us to contribute to one of the fastest growing, leading edge technologies in online industry. We work hard, play hard and we share the same passion for e-Commerce, Advertising and Technology. We value team work, openness, technical innovation, and results-orientated thinking.

At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard and feel a sense of belonging.

Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

title: Analyst - Business Intelligence - London
role-description:
Our client is a social enterprise in the financial services sector disrupting the pay-day loan market. They are passionate about providing customers with a financial product to meet their short-term needs that is both ethical and affordable. This start up business has the financial backing, the passion about their product and the drive to succeed and as a result, their business is growing rapidly. As the Business Intelligence Analyst for this fintech start-up organisation, you will enjoy a diverse role touching on all aspects of being a top Analyst - data collection, data production, data insights and presentation. Reporting into the CEO you will lead and deliver on all things Data and Analysis. This is a great opportunity to use your Analyst skills and have significant impact in a dynamic environment, playing a key role in the organisation’s development! The day to day……
First point of contact for all data queries
Reporting on customer metrics
Assisting other parts of the business (Sales, Marketing etc) by servicing requests for data or statistics
Analysis of data
Drawing conclusions from data and providing Insights to inform business decisions
Finding other relevant data from other sources, for example the ONS or published studies
Compile presentations in power point to tell the story behind the numbers
Giving presentations outlining the analysis performed and key findings to stakeholders
Automation of processes Technical Skills……
SQL; specifically, T-SQL, but good knowledge of any flavour of SQL will be transferrable
Programming ability is not strictly required but would be very helpful
Advanced Excel Other important stuff....
Must believe in the social purpose of the business
Thrives in a fast-paced and evolving environment
Must be analytically minded and bring ideas to the table
Can-do attitude, solutions-finder, commercially focused, likes to input into a business
Wants to play a key role in driving a business forward

title: Data Analyst - Express Booking
role-description:
Do you want to join a team of entrepreneurs from over 50 different nationalities? To work in an environment powered by passion where no two days are the same?

At trivago we use the latest innovative technologies to empower our users to find their ideal hotel 100 times a second, across 55 different locales world-wide and in 33 different languages.


Do you want to have a major impact on the product performance of a leading global hotel search engine? Are you passionate about data-driven decision making?

Our team works on bringing the right message in front of the right user at the right time. We're looking for a critical mind who has a passion for uncovering untapped business opportunities in the massive amount of data we generate every day.

If data driven product development excites you, we want to hear from you!

Get an inside look at data science at trivago:

https://youtu.be/pNuW3gnrUcQ

What you’ll do:

Work in a cross functional team of data analysts, product owners and data engineers.
Manage end-to-end responsibilities for our Key Performance Indicators: definition, data processing, reporting and visualization.
Stay on top of regular monitoring of data to spot trends, find anomalies and analyse active A/B tests.
Support, consult and challenge colleagues on data-driven decisions, testing and predictive algorithms.
Proactively communicate and share your conclusions as well as explain complex topics tailored to the audience.
Collaborate closely with our Data Engineers to ensure quality and usability of data.
Help foster a data-driven culture throughout the team and apply best practices.

What you’ll definitely need:

3-5 years previous professional experience in data analysis.
Expertise using SQL and either R or Python.
Experience with Business Intelligence tools for visualization/reporting.
Strong critical thinking skills; ability to see the "big picture" while also diving into the details where necessary.
Clear and structured communication skills, an analytical mindset, a ‘can-do’ attitude and capable of using data to tell stories.
To speak fluent English (our company language).
  What we’d love you to have:

A degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics or another quantitative discipline.
Experience with Hadoop
Strong knowledge in statistics and data exploration.

What to expect from life at trivago:

Growth: We help you grow as trivago grows through support for personal and professional development, constant new challenges, regular peer-feedback, mentorship and world-class training.
Autonomy: Every talent has the ability to make an impact independently by driving topics thanks to our strong entrepreneurial mindset, our horizontal workflow and self-determined working hours.
International environment: Our agile, international culture and environment with talents from 50+ nations encourages mutual trust and creates a safe space to discuss openly and act freely.
Collaborative spaces: Our office in the heart of Leipzig offers interactive spaces where we can easily collaborate, exchange ideas, take a break and workout together.
Relocation: We offer our international talents support with relocation costs, work permit and visa questions, free language classes, flat search and insurance.

Additional information:

trivago N.V. is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users.
To find out more about life at trivago follow us on social media @lifeattrivago.
To learn more about tech at trivago, check out our blog: https://tech.trivago.com/
Want to learn more about trivago’s business model to prepare for your interview? Visit https://company.trivago.com/our-product/

title: Data Analyst - Business Systems
role-description:
The Role

Are you seeking a Data Analyst role? Here at our Matchworks office in Liverpool, we are seeking a talented Analyst to join our Fleet and Plant division. You will effectively analyse complex data and information using the relevant tools available - SFN, Minitab and Lean Six Sigma methodology to define, measure, analyse, improve and control performance. And you will be able to communicate effectively in writing and orally, having the ability to translate complex information.

What will this role involve?

The Data Analyst is responsible for providing relevant data, conducting detailed analysis to monitor and improve performance.

Specific Responsibilities Will Include
Liaising with local data owners to ensure that all systems support data capture and reporting requirements
Ensuring the timely submission of complete and accurate data in the prescribed format
Validating data and populate performance reporting systems at the prescribed frequency
Producing daily / weekly/ monthly / periodic reports showing performance against targets
Helping to design and implement appropriate KPI's for each business unit / contract / function
Analysing KPI data to identify issues. Trends and improvement opportunities
Assisting in the development and production of web-based report
Assisting and in translating performance improvement opportunities into coherent, prioritised business improvement strategy
Benchmarking performance data across similar contracts / industries
Management of Power BI issues, modifications, liaison with users and Business MI

What are we looking for?

As Data Analyst You Will Have
Relevant degree in Analytical, Mathematical or Statistics (or similar)
Previous experience of management of systems or databases
Highly analytical with proven data analysis and reporting skills
A passion for working with data and finding data insights: highly experienced in data, analytics, metrics and statistics.
Ability to manage own time and prioritise and effectively work to deadlines
Exceptional attention to detail
Highly developed communication skills

Salary and Benefits

As a Data Analyst at Amey you will be rewarded with a very competitive salary, 24 days holiday, contributory pension, life assurance and access to a range of Amey savings

title: Product Data Analyst
location: Sant Cugat del Valles, Cataluña, España
role-description:
Bodas.net es el portal web líder del sector nupcial a nivel nacional e internacional.

Formamos parte de The Knot Worldwide y juntos nos hemos convertido en el referente mundial del sector, con un equipo global de más de 1700 personas. Entre todos, ayudamos a organizar más de 5 millones de bodas en Estados Unidos,  España, Italia, Francia, Portugal, Reino Unido, Canadá, Brasil, México, Chile, Argentina, Colombia, Perú, Uruguay y la India.

Estamos buscando a un/a Product Data Analyst para actuar como puente entre los aspectos operativos y de producto de Bodas.net, utilizando una mentalidad estratégica, un pensamiento analítico, un enfoque basado en datos y un poder operativo para generar valor empresarial.


¿Qué estarás haciendo?

Trabajarás con los stakeholders, principalmente en el departamento de Producto y Marketing de bodas.net y ayudarás al cliente interno a comprender el rendimiento de nuestros canales de adquisición y los funnels de conversión.
Analizarás el comportamiento de los usuarios de nuestros websites e identificarás oportunidades de crecimiento para impulsar la adquisición y el engagement
Colaborarás con los Product Managers, los equipos de Ingeniería y Marketing para identificar e impulsar mejoras estratégicas y operativas que proporcionen un impulso sostenible en las métricas clave del negocio.
Revisarás el rendimiento del producto, asesorarás sobre las áreas de oportunidad y analizarás las pruebas A/B y otros datos experimentales para medir el impacto de las nuevas características.
Crearás y gestionarás informes y cuadros de mando en herramientas de dashboarding como Qlik Sense, Google Sheets, Excel y desarrollarás presentaciones para mantener al equipo informado de las tendencias clave.
Comunicarás, colaborarás y presentarás los resultados a los clientes de Bodas.net y The Knot Worldwide.
Explorarás nuevas formas de visualizar nuestros datos


¿Qué buscamos en ti?

Has trabajado dentro de un equipo de producto - marketing y en un entorno orientado a los datos.
Tienes experiencia en SQL y bases de datos.
Experiencia con Google Analytics y BigQuery.
2-3 años de experiencia en analítica web o Business Intelligence
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y gestión de proyectos.
Dominio programando en R o Python será un plus.
Valoraremos que tengas experiencia en el desarrollo de dashboard en el Frontend de Qlik Sense.
Que te puedas comunicar en Inglés con nuestros compañeros de USA.


Nos enamorarás si...

Entiendes en profundidad a nuestros usuarios y los pones en el centro de todo lo que haces.
Eres respetuoso y actúas con una gran integridad. Si ves algo que no está bien, no tienes problema en decirlo.
Planteas preguntas para entender diferentes perspectiva y te sientes cómodo desafiando respetuosamente las suposiciones de otras personas.
Te fijas objetivos claros y ambiciosos. Anticipas los obstáculos, perseveras y eres responsable de los compromisos que asumes.



¿Qué te podemos ofrecer?

Seguro médico gratuito al año de tu incorporación
Si no te gusta cocinar, te invitamos a comer todos los lunes. Y el resto de semana puedes seguir comiendo por un precio muy bajo.
Café. te y fruta gratis, para que estés sano y despierto
Descuentos en gimnasios
Regalo por matrimonio y nacimiento de hijos e hijas. Nos gusta aportar nuestro granito de arena ☺
¡Nos gusta mucho celebrar! Hacemos varias actividades y una gran fiesta al final del año para terminarlo como se merece
Retribución flexible (Ticket Restaurant, Ticket Transporte, Ticket Guardería, Formación

role-description: VX Company is op zoek naar Junior Microsoft Data Analytics Consultants voor in het BI & Advanced Analytics team van ervaren data analisten en BI-experts. title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
role-description:
BNP Paribas is a leading European bank with an international reach. It has a presence in 72 countries, with more than 202,000 Employees – including more than 154,000 in Europe and over 5,000 in Portugal alone.

BNP Paribas is present in Portugal since 1985, having been one of the first foreign banks to operate in the country. Today, BNP Paribas has several entities operating directly in this territory, offering a wide range of integrated financial solutions to support its clients and their businesses.

Worldwide, the Group has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. The Group helps all its clients (individuals, community associations, entrepreneurs, SMEs, corporate and institutional clients) to realize their projects through solutions spanning financing, investment, savings and protection insurance.

BNP Paribas Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB) is a leading European investment bank with global leadership in many of our businesses. We are part of the BNP Paribas Group, a financial institution with solid foundations and a proven ability to adapt to change. BNP Paribas CIB, with nearly 28,000 employees in over 50 countries, can offer you an exciting and truly global start to your career, a career where you, your ideas and your development matter.

The Global Markets Client Analytics (GCA) team is responsible for providing data, insights and analysis to Global Markets front office on client activity. The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner. The team in Lisbon is comprised of 6 members. The consumers of this data and analysis are over 1000 global Front Office users including Sales, Trading, Research and Senior Management. We are a global team, with presence in Europe, America, and Asia.

Responsibilities
Production of interactive dashboards primarily using Tableau as a tool
Understand data handling, modelling and reporting techniques along with a strong understanding of the business
Leverage large volumes of data from internal sources
Help global markets to achieve digital transformations
Proof of concept data projects with innovative methods or tools
Relationship with other departments – IT, Management, Sales and Trading teams
PROFILE
Bachelor or Master in Computer Science, Engineering, Maths, Business Management, Economics or Information Management
Interest in Data Science
Knowledge of visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI)
Experience with programming languages (Python is a plus)
Knowledge of SQL.
Understanding of code versioning tools such as Git is a plus.
Strong communication and presentation skills both verbal and written.
Effective problem solver and consensus builder.
Team work and collaborative mind-set.
Fluency in English is mandatory
BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.

In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Primary Location

PT-11-Lisbon

Job Type

Standard / Permanent

Job

INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY

Education Level

Master Degree or equivalent (> 4 years)

Experience Level

At least 1 year

Schedule

Full-time

Behavioural Competencies

Creativity & Innovation / Problem solving, Ability to collaborate / Teamwork

Transversal Competencies

Analytical Ability

title: Data and Analytics Lead - Dublin
role-description:
Data and Analytics Lead

Grant Thornton work with leading organisations in Ireland and internationally. These organisations are using (and seeking to use) more data than ever before to inform and drive their business, serve their customers and to meet expected standards and regulatory requirements. Most could be doing much more.

As data becomes more integral to the operations and management of businesses, the businesses and environments in which they operate are becoming more complex. This introduces new and ongoing challenges that organisations need to face in order to understand and make effective and efficient use of the data that they hold.

The GT Context – How We Respond

It is essential that we are equipped to help our clients face these challenges and take advantage of the opportunities that new techniques and technologies present.

We are investing significantly in our practice to offer a wide range of data-related services, from data strategy and architecture, through to data management, business intelligence, advanced analytics and machine learning and AI.

Our Data & Analytics teams work with clients to deliver crucial insight through data analytics, advanced modelling and big data architecture. We help our clients to use new emerging technologies to provide greater performance insight and to augment human decision making. We often work with clients to help them transform into customer-centric, data-driven organisations.

Our service based offerings are configured to provide the key skillsets required to deliver successful analytics: Data Strategy & Governance, Architecture, Data Warehousing, Analytics & Data Science, as well as BI and Visualisations.

The role

We have ambitious plans and are looking for a motivated, and enthusiastic individual to lead our Data and Analytics consulting team.

You will be given the opportunity to lead the design and implementation of leading edge solutions to meet our clients’ ever increasing needs to maximise the potential of data in realising their business goals. A key aspect of your role will be to maintain an insightful understanding of the evolving technology and industry trends in the D&A landscape, and applying that insight to the development of D&A strategy and solution offering portfolio, enabling us to best meet current and future client requirements and market opportunities. The work will provide you with opportunities to work with a wide range of industry leading data management and analytics product stacks as well as established and emerging open source components.

The Data & Analytics Lead role is client facing, and you will work directly with decision making client leaders from a broad spectrum of industry sectors; from capital markets clients such as retail banks, asset management companies and insurance providers, public sector entities, automotive bodies, media and telecoms groups, through to medical and life science agencies.

Success will be rewarded with a clear route to progression to senior levels within the firm.

Responsibilities
Work with Technology and wider practice leadership to set the direction for the D&A practice
Develop, promote and deliver D&A market propositions
Lead and support business development activities, grow your network– identify and develop relationships with new and existing clients
Lead and support sales through work on bids, proposal responses and developing relationships and opportunities.
Work with technology leadership to build and develop the D&A capability/team
Primarily responsible for the successful delivery of client engagements and initiatives within our Data & Analytics practice. Managing projects including project delivery, budget and risk
Actively contributing on client-facing project work, being self-starting and motivated to produce the required high standard of deliverables
Collaboratively develop our go to market Data & Analytics strategy and solution offerings based on your extensive industry knowledge and ongoing research
Provide subject matter expert input and advisory role input to client engagements as required – strategy and solution advisory, technical resource management, client workshop facilitation and overall engagement management
Collaborate with colleagues to share knowledge and promote Data & Analytics innovation and assets across the business
About You As An Individual

You will have the right blend of hands-on data experience, an eye for innovation to help us build client offerings and an understanding of the markets in which we work, who can develop and build our go-to-market propositions and excel in client delivery.
Required leadership skills to operate in a team environment involving multi-tasking, support and mentoring of junior resources and the consistent delivery of high-quality client deliverables to budget and on time
Proven experience of supporting business development activities, client relationship management and contribution to winning proposal development
Previous management experience in developing people and service capability through resource management, coaching and focused career development skills
Experience in facilitating effective workshops across all levels of an organisation
Strong written and oral communication skills with the ability to present complex data patterns, insights and arguments in a way that is accessible to everyone, especially senior stakeholders at CXO level.
Good emotional intelligence, resilience and energy, with the focus and determination to get the job done effectively, overcoming any difficulties that may be encountered
Strong negotiating and influencing skills, with the ability to influence decision-makers including those at CXO and Board level
A willingness to learn and develop new skills
About Your Domain Knowledge And Skills

Required skills: While you may not have everything on this list, you should have a deep knowledge of many, and at least a higher level knowledge of most.
Candidates must be able to demonstrate at least 6 years’ experience in senior project delivery roles across disciplines of enterprise data and analytics strategy and architecture development, across the domains ofdata warehousing,business intelligence and analyticsmachine learning (desirable),
Subject matter expert level knowledge of Data & Analytics technologies, best practice models and project delivery methodologies: Data Warehousing (SQL, Enterprise Architecture, OLAP)Data/Big Data Architecture (Database and EDW design – logical and physical, Big Data Architectures)Data Integration (ETL/ELT, API)Data Analytics and Data Visualisation – Traditional large vendor Business Intelligence platforms, next-gen visualisation toolsAdvanced data analytics, building models in Python, R, SAS programming languages and librariesExperience in multiple tools/language/frameworks within the Big Data
Practical experience of project delivery under Agile and LEAN type methodologies
The candidate should also have knowledge and experience of data quality and data cleansing techniques
Deep and eager interest in emerging technologies, and the ability to leverage those technologies into a solution to meet our strategic and operational client needs

title: Digital Data Analyst (m/f/d)
role-description:
YOUR PERSONAL NAVABI MISSION

As navabi's Digital Data Analyst (m/f/d) you are the bridge between our Business Intelligence and Marketing teams. You are on a mission to maximise navabi's results to satisfy our customers by analysing the data we generate.

YOUR NAVABI CHALLENGE
Your role is key to our success! You will gather data from diverse sources and make recommendations that support better, faster, data driven decision-making at both tactical and strategic level for a wide range of departments by:
Developing forecasting models for the our main KPIs;
Measuring and making recommendations to improve user and customer experience;
Fine-tuning and improving our marketing spend model;
Supporting various departments with ad hoc data analysis;
Multi channel funnel attribution modeling.
If you are hungry for data, we will let you deep dive into our numbers and find patterns, correlations, interdependencies which would help our business going forward.
You will monitor and assist with tests that occur within individual marketing channels. For example: Email subject line tests, email content tests, Facebook acquisition tests, PPC tests and campaigns.
Dive into our weekly reports and look for anomalies, areas of opportunity, recommendations.

What You Should Bring To The Table
A deep desire to constantly improve yourself both professionally as well as personally through intentional learning. You strive to become your best version.
The ability to self-manage & think independently. We don't want to hire someone who doesn't want to own their own destiny and needs to constantly be told what to do.
A kind and compassionate nature. Everyone is fighting a battle we don't know anything about and we need people who are able to be compassionate despite challenges, while also being able to practice tough love when necessary.

What Could Be Valuable Experience And Skills
You have a good grasp of financial and statistical methods, either self-taught or backed up by academic education.
You have already worked in one or more e-commerce companies and have experience with online marketing, ideally in an analyst role.
Large and diverse data sets may terrify others, but not you.
You have expert knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Advertising.
A great plus would be experience with user experience analysis, A/B testing, or conversion rate optimisation.
Technical skills in Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics implementation, and website tagging in general would be extremely useful.
You're a pragmatic person; your focus is getting things done and not losing yourself in the details.
Your English is fluent (spoken and written). German is a plus but not a must.
Last but not least, you love what you do!

CHALLENGE ACCEPTED?

title: Data Analyst, Product
role-description:
Description All about 8fit At 8fit, our vision is to make the world a healthier and happier place – that’s what gets us out of bed every morning. We help millions of people around the world reach their personal goals with workouts and customized meal plans. We understand the obstacles people face on their health and fitness journey. It’s not easy, and there’s no one-size-fits-all solution. Our app delivers delicious, accessible meal plans and quick, effective workout routines. We guide people in creating and solidifying healthy habits for a sustainable lifestyle. Project Description As a key part of the Product team, you’ll work with our cross-functional product squads and the data team to deliver on insights that impact our product decisions and ultimately drive business results. You are the expert on user behavior in the app, identify trends and opportunities, conduct deep dive analyses, synthesize findings, and present them to product teams and leadership to inform product decisions ranging from strategic to tactical. Requirements After your morning coffee, you’ll…
Help product managers design and analyze A/B tests in our mobile app and on our website to improve key product metrics like engagement, retention, or conversion rates
Analyze trends and movements in our key product metrics (from acquisition and activation over engagement and retention through to monetization), going beyond the obvious and identifying root causes
Drive discussions around data-driven product feature development, for example, using behavioral data to recommend meals or workouts to users
Help product squads define events to track in-app user behavior, analyze it, and make decisions based on the results
Develop, implement and maintain new and existing success metrics, reports and dashboards
Move beyond simple reporting and visualizations to perform analyses that provide in-depth insights and even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Build insights and recommendations for action based on your analytical work
Tell compelling stories using your insights and impactful presentation skills You...
Communicate: Whether one-to-one or in a group, the ability to exchange ideas effectively and with empathy is a vital part of your skillset.
Own it: Autonomy comes with responsibility. Good or bad, you own your decisions and their outcomes. There’s no such thing as ‘not my job.’
Are curious and creative: Ask questions. Think critically. Vocalize ideas. Try new approaches. Nurture creative problem solving, learning and troubleshooting.
Collaborate: Being able to share and develop ideas as a team makes us stronger. It’s a conversation, not a monologue.
Are agile: Adapting to changes and iterating on initial concepts is all part of the process. There’s no room for rigidity.
Value balance: Work to live, not the other way around. It’s important to have a rich, fulfilling life outside the office.
Are human: Be humble, admit mistakes readily, and never stop learning and growing. What’s in your toolbox? To be successful in this role you’ll need:
4+ years of professional experience in the field of analytics or business intelligence for a digital product
Outstanding analytical mindset with a strong strategic focus and ability to notice patterns
Skilled in SQL, behavioral analytics (e.g., Amplitude) and BI tools (e.g., Looker)
University degree in economics, mathematics, statistics or related field. Alternatively you’re self taught and paired that up with industry exposure.
Communicative nature and hands-on mentality
Proactive working style, enthusiasm and the will to create & achieve and thus impact
Fluent in English Bonus!
Programming in Python in the context of statistics/machine learning
Experience using Airflow, DBT, Redshift and/or Snowflake
Experience in product analytics for a subscription based / Freemium B2C product
Event modelling in the context of Snowplow Benefits What’s in it for you:
Competitive salary
Flexible working hours
Remote days
Professional development fund
Relocation to Germany support
Company pension scheme plan
Stock options
Urban Sports Club membership Perks of the job!
Healthy office snacks and weekly company lunch
In-house German lessons
Company events: game nights, workshops, meet-ups, parties etc.
Weekly in-house workout class Sweet surroundings Situated in the heart of Berlin, our spacious, modern open plan office is located right by the river Spree. We're a short bike ride or scenic walk away from cool cafés, historical and cultural sites, sports events, gyms and fitness studios, as well as spacious parks.

title: Sustainability Data Analyst
role-description:
Job location – Bristol

Savills Property Management works with a wide and varied client base. We manage all types of properties including shopping centres, out of town, retail, offices, leisure and residential assets.

Savills Sustainability Team is based within the Property Management division and works closely with management surveyors, property owners, assets managers and investors to embed effective sustainability strategies into the property value chain. Our vision is to become world class leaders in responsible sustainable real estate.

We are seeking a Sustainability Data Analyst who will support the Sustainability Team in the delivery and development of industry leading sustainability consultancy services for the real estate sector. This will be focused on sustainability reporting and benchmarking, system setup and review, data collation and analysis, environmental compliance and performance measurement services.

Key Responsibilities

Duties

Key duties will include, but are not limited to the following

Based in Bristol, the successful candidate will act as a data analyst in the Savills Sustainability Team, supporting and generating data and benchmarking outputs to both internal and external clients.
Assist the team in setting up and delivering key client reports via their SavIQ internal Sustainability data platform.
Oversee, collate and analyse key data streams for all environmental, sustainability and benchmarking performance indicators.
Generate key sustainability reporting outputs in a timely and accurate fashion for internal and external clients on utility and waste reporting and wider property data covering health and wellbeing aspects and site projects, certifications or initiatives.
Maintain and where necessary, cleanse all relevant software systems and reporting platforms, ensuring data integrity at all times whilst maintaining effective relationships with all software and data providers.
Assist all members of the sustainability team in the provision of data for key service lines such as ESOS auditing, GRESB, GHG and CRC reporting.
Keep abreast of all industry developments in relation to sustainability reporting and benchmarking practices, ensuring best practice in reporting methodologies is adopted for all outputs from the Savills Sustainability Team.
Where necessary, assist in developing and enhancing all reporting processes to improve efficiency, quality and innovation in delivering team output.
Assist the sustainability team in all other relevant team tasks including helpdesk enquiries, a variety of client account support work and production of marketing and case study materials.
Skills, Knowledge And Experience
Strong understanding and working knowledge of sustainability benchmarking practices, including knowledge of energy, water, waste, carbon, health & wellbeing and social value.
An evident passion for Sustainability
Ability to validate and analyse large data sets for production of reporting outputs in a timely and effective manner.
Interest in and knowledge of sustainability data reporting systems.
Ability to manage time effectively, delivering to tight deadlines and under pressure.
Develop lasting and effective relationships with key stakeholders internally within the Sustainability, Property Management, Compliance and Savills Energy teams and externally with all key service providers.
Strong analytical skills in handling data and reporting outputs with high level of competence in Microsoft Excel.
Strong attention to detail and produces work to a high, consistent and accurate standard.
Completely IT literate, numerate and proven experience with data analytics and reporting
Highly motivated individual – with drive for development of self
Excellent time management, punctual and organised, can deliver work under pressure and to fixed deadlines.
Resourceful team worker, with ability to be autonomous in certain specialist fields.
Grammar, spelling and document checking skills
Strong report writing and quality assurance focused.
Technical Experience
Required
BSc Degree in Data and Business Analytics, Mathematics, Engineering, Energy Management, Environmental Sciences, Sustainability or equivalent.
Understanding of Sustainability reporting and benchmarking assessments.
Working knowledge of data normalisation techniques and database management.
Desired
MSc or MEng in Data and Business Analytics, Engineering, Environmental Sciences, Energy Management, Sustainability or equivalent.
Working towards a professional qualification: IEMA, EI or similar.
Demonstrate knowledge of or experience in the commercial property sector
Advanced knowledge of data normalisation techniques such as energy measurement and verification approaches including regression analysis, degree day compensation and P-Values.
Knowledge of software development and database writing.
To apply for this role please forward a CV and Covering Letter to Stefanie.bongert@savills.com

Please note, we will use your personal data to respond to your application. For further details, or to view our Privacy Notice or Group Equality & Diversity policy, see our website - savills.co.uk.

Savills is a Disability Confident Committed Employer

title: EMEA Digital & Web Data Analyst, Marketing
role-description:
Job Category
Sales Marketing Operations

Job Details

Web Data Analyst
S alesforce is seeking a Web Data Analyst to join our European Marketing team. Based in Dublin, you will be part of the EMEA Scientific Marketing Data Science & Analytics team. As Web Data Analyst, you will help build and shape a world-class analytics function within Salesforce. In this role, you will dive deep into our digital / web data to uncover actionable insights and make recommendations that will influence the company’s strategic decisions. You will work within a collaborative, cross functional team to lead the charge on developing and enhancing data-driven approaches to customer engagement through rigorous experimentation. ...so we're looking for someone with a quantitative mindset who wakes up every morning with a curiosity to solve problems, and is unafraid to ask questions.

Reporting and Analysis
Monitor performance KPIs for online marketing activities and changes in trends, share insights and make recommendations to the marketing team
Apply a scientific method and approach to how we conduct our analysis activities, assist in the development of new custom reporting frameworks
Integrate disparate data sources to form a cohesive picture around the performance of marketing programs
Support transition to Google Analytics 360.
Effectively utilize both quantitative and qualitative techniques on ROI-modeling, consumer profiling/predictive modeling, segmentation and offer conversion optimization Implementation
Help Manage and support all aspects of our web analytics implementation, including tracking parameter, tagging documentation, tool configuration, and user administration
Strategic thinker who can see the forest through the trees in a dynamic environment, balance strategic priorities and interpret nuances of granular data to execute upon them. Develops relevant and repeatable solutions. Aligns the right resources to the task at hand; foresees and plans around obstacles.
Compelling story teller with the ability to tailor a data driven narrative and comfortably present to analysts right through to C-Level executives.
Collaborate with key stakeholders on how to best leverage analytics to construct dashboards and reporting mechanisms in order to inform better business decisions and optimization recommendations
Understand business users’ needs, and translate them to technical requirements for web analytics implementation
Collaborate with our engineering teams to ensure quality, accessibility, and consistency of collected data across web and other platforms

Key Skills & Experience
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Mathematics, Statistics, or technical discipline (Computer Science, Engineering, or similar degree)
2-3 years of web analytics experience, agency and/or client side preferably experience with enterprise consumer-facing web site (supporting Testing & Optimization, marketing, etc.)
Deep experience in web analytics tools, Google Analytics 360 Suite (incl Big Query) a must, Adobe Analytics Suite experience, working with granular web clickstream data is a plus
Highly motivated, detail oriented and a self-starter. Willing to drive projects in a collaborative way.
High energy with the ability to juggle multiple priorities in a fast-paced and changing environment
Data Storyteller creating data-driven stories, presenting to technical & non-technical audiences
Hands-on experience working with complex and unstructured big data sets.
Ability to ask the right questions to understand the business problem and identify the measurement or business objective
Strong knowledge of current best practices and standards to provide direction to web site developers/producers on tagging and tracking parameter methods
Familiarity with JavaScript, especially as it relates to tag management, 3rd party marketing tags and troubleshooting analytics implementations.
Proficient with SQL and in Statistical Programming in Python & R
