title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
role-description:
Responsibilities
As Data Analyst you actively shape the foundations of our future reporting as well as visualization setup and are accountable for its further development and maintenance
You take over responsibility for analyzing as well as evaluating data to ensure the long-term quality of our business processes
You are able to translate business requirements to technical solutions and create insightful reports to answer critical management questions
You work in close collaboration with different stakeholders and highlight performance as well as actionable insights using BI tools that enable our teams to make data-driven decisions
You have an eye for recent trends, as well as technologies and promote an open exchange culture within your team


Skills
You got a degree in Business Computer Science or similar and can rely on at least first professional experience in the area of Data Analytics
You have exhaustive knowledge of BI reporting tools (e.g. Qlikview, Tableau) and Excel as well as SQL
You are proficient in data visualization and ideally possess experience in Python, data warehousing and advanced analytics
You describe yourself as an excellent communicator and present your procedures and results to others in an understandable way
You are solution-oriented, pay high attention to detail and like to work in an agile environment that is characterised by an international and intercultural exchange

What we offer
Variety- A wide-ranging field of activity in a dynamic, fast growing digital company and the opportunity to actively shape the development of Aroundhome and grow with your role
Innovation- A challenging and diversified position in a international team, with the latest technologies to implement your own ideas and projects
Peers- An international team of specialists who are ready to bring you on board with their enthusiasm and teamspirit - you will notice this during pair programming or joint code reviews at the latest.
Development- We offer you weekly Tech-meetups as well as great workshops to seek new input and specific training for your personal development
Optimum working conditions- Agile methods, a workstation of your choice and a fully automatic coffee machine

That's exactly what you were looking for?
Then send us your application documents via our job portal or by e-mail to jobs@aroundhome.de.

Aroundhome is the largest provider of products and services for the home in Germany, Austria and Switzerland, and soon throughout Europe. Our 500 employees work every day to make our service even better for our specialist companies and customers. So that their house becomes a home.

No matter where our customers live. No matter what has to be done- Whether it be the terrace for the next family celebration, the garage for the new car or a front door for the perfect feeling of coming home. Today, Aroundhome already helps millions of people to make the right decisions about their homes. Not anonymous and not just digital. We take our time and are personally there for our customers.

Together with you, we want to develop Aroundhome into a platform around the house and look forward to welcoming you to our office at Potsdamer Platz.

ProSiebenSat.1 Group is one of Europe's leading media companies. Our stations SAT.1, ProSieben, kabel eins, sixx, SAT.1 Gold, ProSieben MAXX and kabel eins Doku captivate millions of viewers every day. But extraordinary TV entertainment is just one part of our concept for success. Today, our growth is based on four segments- German-speaking TV business, our digital units with a large entertainment and e-commerce portfolio, and our international program production and sales house. We have consistently diversified our company in recent years and created additional sources of revenue. This also reflects our vision- We are establishing ProSiebenSat.1 as a leading broadcasting, digital entertainment, and commerce powerhouse.

Although we refer to one gender in the text, all genders may be implied.

title: Data Analyst (H/F)
role-description:
Company Description

Ouvert en septembre 2017, Ubisoft Bordeaux est le dernier né des studios Français à l’origine de jeux tels que Ghost Recon, Just Dance, Beyond Good & Evil, Steep ou les Lapins Crétins.

Avec une quinzaine d’experts venus des autres studios du Groupe, Ubisoft Bordeaux travaille en co-développement avec les studios d’Annecy, Montpellier et Paris avec une vocation annoncée de studio AAA et plus de 200 collaborateurs. Dans la cadre de son développement, le studio de Bordeaux recrute un Data Anlyst (H/F).

Vous êtes prêt à relever de nouveaux challenges ?

Vous souhaitez offrir de belles expériences aux joueurs ? Rejoignez-nous !

Job Description

En collaboration directe avec les équipes de production, il/elle aura pour missions de comprendre le pipeline de production afin d’améliorer la gestion de la qualité et la productivité du projet. En se basant sur l’analyse de données, il/elle aura un impact sur toutes les étapes de production d’un jeu.

De Manière Plus Détaillée
Définir avec les leads des indicateurs de qualité et de productivité.
Définir les données à récupérer sur les outils de production, et coordonner l’implémentation de ces points de mesures sur le pipeline de production.
Etre garant de la donnée de production et faire le suivi des indicateurs.
Rédiger des synthèses de résultats et des recommandations applicables.
Conseiller les experts métiers sur la stratégie data autours de la gestion de la qualité et de la productivité.
Faire évoluer les usages, les méthodes et les outils au sein des projets et des studios France.
Vous serez également supervisé par l’équipe Data des studios France, qui est composée de Data Analyst, Data Scientist, développeurs outils et Data Visualisation Designer.

Type de donnée : résultats de tests automatisés, temps d’itérations, crash, performances techniques, base de code….

Qualifications
Vous êtes issu de formation bac +4/5 en Business Intelligence, Statistique, ingénierie de la production, gestion de la qualité informatique.
Forte appétence pour l’optimisation des systèmes de production et la gestion de la qualité
Background tech : analyser et comprendre les données, comprendre un pipeline de production de jeux vidéo.
Très bon communicant : vous serez en interactions permanentes avec les équipes de production (anglais requis);
Une bonne maîtrise du langage SQL est obligatoire;
Connaissances en programmation et bases de données: vous créez des requêtes et scripts afin de restituer les données de production de manière intelligible (R, Tableau, Python, SPSS…);
Vous êtes avant tout un passionné de jeux vidéo !

Plus
Vous avez déjà de l’expérience dans l’analyse de données appliquée à la production.
Vous avez une connaissance approfondie des méthodes de production d’un AAA.

Additional Information

Intégrer Les Studios France, C’est Aussi
Évoluer dans un groupe leader dans l’industrie du jeu vidéo en France et présent dans 30 pays différents, avec des opportunités d’évolution à l’international
Rejoindre des équipes passionnées et d’un excellent niveau technique, toutes animées par l’envie de concevoir et développer des jeux innovants et se démarquant par leur qualité
Collaborer avec des équipes reconnues pour leur expérience sur des franchises renommées
Développer une expertise en participant aux événements de partage organisés en interne (talks; conférences ; salons) et en bénéficiant de programmes de formation sur-mesure
En tant qu’employeur, Ubisoft offre à tous les mêmes opportunités d’accès à l’emploi sans distinction de genre, ethnicité, religion, orientation sexuelle, statut social, handicap et d’âge. Ubisoft veille à développer un environnement de travail inclusif qui reflète la diversité de sa communauté de joueurs dans ses équipes.

Toute information sera traitée de manière confidentielle conformément à la Loi sur l'équité en matière d'emploi.

title: Data Analyst (Product)
role-description:
We're BookingGo, the ground transport division of Booking.com. We're the ones who empower people to get where they're going. Whether they're taking the wheel or sitting back and leaving it to the driver. Whether they're heading straight from A to B or enjoying the freedom to go wherever their journey takes them.

To do that, we offer car hire to our customers through our Rentalcars.com brand and car hire, taxis and ticketed transfer services through Booking.com. We also have a B2B solution, Rentalcars Connect, providing great ground transportation options to the customers of our partners

With our HQ in Manchester, we're part of the worldwide Booking.com family. At the same time, we're proud of our own unique identity. Speaking 42 languages, our 2,000+ staff come from all over the world, just like our customers. What brings us together is our love of adventure: our own as well as other people's. It's easy to be passionate about a job that enriches so many lives on a daily basis, and our workplace reflects our passion, our diversity, our global focus. Just search "Manchester's coolest office" and see for yourself.

And we're in good company. Together with priceline.com, KAYAK, agoda.com, and OpenTable, we're part of Booking Holdings, the world leader in online travel and related services.

As BookingGo continues its journey to be a fully data driven organisation, we are looking for an exceptional self-led data analyst who wants to join the Taxi Team. This team focuses on offering pre-booked and on-demand taxis, we are on track to sell more than a million taxis this year, with more than 100% year on year growth.

This Data Analyst (Product) role provides the opportunity to be a close business partner for one of our product groups responsible for the integration with Booking.com. This product group is made up of 3 teams working on ensuring the customer journey from the core Booking.com site into Taxi purchase and management is as seamless as possible.

An ideal candidate would combine strong analytical skills, intellectual curiosity and a collaborative and communicative style. Business partnering will be a key factor in this role, and ensuring you can effectively link our product and insights teams is key.

Core activities: The analyst would…
Support & drive session growth using A/B (& multivariate) testing of taxi entry points on the accommodation site
Support & drive customer experience improvements
Suggest, create and implement fundamental improvements to taxi placement
Use a selection of analytics tools to evaluate and optimise entry point performance
Execute quantitative analysis from multiple data sources to develop hypotheses and challenge assumptions that underpin the strategic direction of the team
Ensure repeatable datasets are built where needed (e.g. after one-off analyses that could be used elsewhere)
Work effectively with diverse stakeholders across multiple departments within the business, including developers and architects
Able to defend analytical approach & explain benefits & drawbacks regardless of audience


Skills And Experience That We Are Looking For
Strong data analytical skills
Strong Google Analytics skills for querying and exploring data sets
SQL experience
Proven experience delivering insight from disparate data sets
Ability to clearly communicate complex ideas to varied and non-technical stakeholders
A flair for developing insightful analysis and solving real business problems using data
Technically capable in at least one data technology (e.g. R, SQL, SAS etc)
Experience of working in eCommerce with high velocity event data would be a plus
Working knowledge of BI tools such as Power BI and Tableau would be a strong plus
Working knowledge of Google BigQuery would be a big plus
Experience with statistical and Machine Learning modelling techniques would be a strong plus

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Data Analyst

Descripción de la posición

En las oficinas de BeRepublic Barcelona actualmente estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst, para unirse a nuestro equipo.

Contexto: El analista de Data es parte esencial en el desarrollo de proyectos del área estrategia de negocio y estrategia de cliente en los que para entender modelos de negocio actuales y realizar propuesta de mejora utilizando enfoque data-driven. Insights basados en análisis de datos

Analizar y estructurar fuentes de información origen para la base de análisis
Tratar tablas de datos en diferentes herramientas de visualización de datos
Interpretar los resultados analíticos y aportar conclusiones
Diseñar y evolucionar modelos de analítica histórica y predictiva
Diseñar, mantener y evolucionar dashboards
Elaborar informes de resultados complementando la parte analítica con el análisis cualitativo

Requirimientos
Formación técnica en analítica Estadística, Matemática o similar.
Conocimientos de herramientas de visualización de datos (Tableau, Power Bi, Data Studio…)
Serán valorables conocimientos de Google Analytics

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
MoneySavingExpert.com (MSE) is the UK’s biggest consumer website. It provides millions of users with free, independent, editorially-led information about all things money. The goal for everyone working at MSE is simple – we’re dedicated to cutting consumer bills and fighting hard for financial justice for everyone. We get around 15m Money Savers to our website every month. Our weekly email is full of exclusive deals, tricks and MoneySaving guides, all aimed at helping people make the most of their cash. The MSE Forum is a lively and supportive community, with more than 1.5 million users taking part in 3 million discussions ranging from making the most of your credit card to good old-fashioned thrifty budgeting. In addition, our Cheap Energy Club takes the hard work out of switching energy and saving on energy bills while Credit Club is a great way of managing an array of financial decisions.

But what really makes MSE stand-out from the crowd is the Editorial Code , which lies at the heart of everything we do. Regardless of your role at MSE, it’s everybody’s job to champion the consumer - and that makes us a truly unique, exciting and rewarding place to work. If you are inspired by what we do or see yourself as a passionate consumer champion, and have the grit and enthusiasm along with the skills we seek, a career in MSE might just be the right career step you are looking for.

Far more than number crunchers, our data analysts influence the direction of the company through actionable data-driven insight. The data analyst will work with the rest of the team to identify opportunities for personalisation, monitor performance of experiments, develop and track KPIs, and automate manual processes.

What Your Daily Life Will Look Like

In this hands-on role, you will apply your technical savvy and:
Work pro-actively within the data science & analytics team to deliver projects that will:
Empower people across the business to make data-driven decisions by building self-serving data reporting.
Support our product teams in A/B testing.
Use data to enhance user experience.
Work closely with stakeholders, building relationships throughout the business.
Communicate findings and recommendations tailored to the relevant audience.
Contribute to the development of demonstrable prototypes to showcase our innovations.
Identify potentially useful data sources and engage data engineers to provision data pipelines that deliver the data sets.
Work closely with other data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and technologists to share knowledge, evaluate opportunities, and pro-actively recommend improvements in data, systems, experimentation, and propositions.

What We Need From You
Educated to degree level within a mathematical, statistical, computer science, or similar discipline.
Experience with BI reporting tools such as Tableau or Google DataStudio.
Experienced in solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches.
Comfortable manipulating and analysing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources and formats.
A good working knowledge of SQL.
Familiar with languages such as R or Python
Adept at data visualisation.
Demonstrates the ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner to senior management.
A strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data.

What We Can Offer You
Data Analysts have the opportunity to work with one of the largest customer databases in Europe, holding records for over 24 million unique customers.
You will learn and grow your capabilities by working with the latest technology and services, in particular the Google Cloud Platform.
Working on a cross-functional team, you will learn and grow your capabilities in areas such as machine learning, statistics, data story-telling, web, and mobile technologies.
Training, sharing knowledge, and best practice are integral to our team ethos. In addition to formal training courses, every individual receives an annual allowance to spend on personal development.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Please be aware that, if you’re successful in securing this position, the offer will be subject to several colleague checks that may include: identity, right to work in the UK, credit, criminal record, references and, where relevant, professional qualifications.

title: Senior Data Analyst – Brussels
Data Analyst
role-description:
Our team is highly specialized in digital marketing, data visualization and data sciences that can yield valuable market insights and craft effective strategies to capitalize on market opportunities at the right time. The right candidate will complement the team by bringing a versatile skill set, using innovative tactics and strategies to increase effectiveness of all digital marketing initiatives."

About The Position

The ideal candidate will complement the team by bringing a versatile empirical skill set, using modern innovative tactics and strategies to expand our deep analytics initiatives. The Analyst will focus on developing data driven models to address project specific objectives with immediate and long-term impact. This includes gathering and scoping requirements; working with complex datasets; building statistical and econometric models; and effectively communicating findings to stakeholders.

Main Functions
Understand client’s objectives and translate business needs into the appropriate technical models.
Develop and Estimate Models: Collect, transform, and clean data from multiple sources.
Build/maintain relational databases.
Develop appropriate statistical and econometric models.
Estimate models.
Perform statistical tests.
Interpret and review output; ensure results and models accurately address question of interest and capture real-world market dynamics.


Requierements

The ideal candidate has to be an expert in fields like Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science or Econometrics, ideally with a Bachelour or a Master's degree. You have to be familiar with analytic tools and languages as R, SQL, SAS, Scala, Matlab and Python.

You have to be really comunicative with your team and the business stakeholders, have a analytical mindset and be resolutive with the problems it could appear.

This is an excellent opportunity for talented techies to grow their careers in Digital Marketing, which is one of the fastest-growing sectors in IT

You have to be also interested in the new trends in Advanced Analytis as Machine and Deep Learning, AI, NLP and other Data Science methods as Clustering, Classification, Regression Trees and much more!

title: Senior Data Analyst
role-description:
Due to being one of the fastest growing startups, at Glovo, we are constantly expanding and growing our teams. The dispatching tech department host Glovo’s key team - it is in charge of “Jarvis”, how we called the algorithm that assigns automatically orders to couriers and stores.

“Jarvis” has a direct impact in all our stakeholders and it is probably one of the biggest challenges that on-demand food delivery companies are facing: how to increase the efficiency of couriers while ensuring low delivery times.

We are at a stage that we want to boost and dedicate many resources to our algorithm. The team is growing like crazy and we are now looking for a senior data analyst with vast experience in analyzing data so as to provide data support to that team. As a Senior Data Analyst for the dispatching team...

You Will
Work closely with engineers (software developers) and data scientists in a diverse and talented team.
Be on top of any new implementation that is developed so as to track its impact and validate the success of the new feature.
Create models and perform analysis to provide actionable insights to improve the current algorithm.
Analyze in detail all the cities that we operate in (+90 cities, +20 countries) so as to extract local peculiarities that the system should consider.
Maintain all the dashboards that the dispatching team is checking every day. Propose new KPIs for these dashboards.
Deep-dive into specific cases that local teams are reporting, so as to extract opportunities for improvement for the algorithm.
Commit to contributing to Glovo's growth globally, getting the job done.


Requirements
+2 years of professional experience in a data analyst, data scientist or similar
A Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Statistics or similar with outstanding records
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Data-driven decision making
Knowledge in SQL (MySQL, PostgreSQL)
Knowledge of visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau or QlikView
Experience in Python (Pandas, Numpy, SciPy), R and/or programming is a plus. Machine Learning understanding is valued
Clean when presenting data. You know how to explain things in an understandable way
Proficiency in English is a must
To be able to manage the big picture, and the smallest details. You're always on top of your deadlines and an organization freak
The ability to take initiative in a constantly changing work environment
Our core values are very important to us:


Gas: We think big and take calculated risks to go for all business opportunities, no matter how challenging they are! We work hard as a team and execute fast.

Everyone Wins: We are here for the long run. Glovers, Partners, and Users are at the very center of everything we do. If they win, Glovo wins. So for every decision, we make sure we are positively impacting them.

Good vibes: Our teams are built of people that radiate positive energy and managers that are honest and fair. No assholes allowed! We stay optimistic no matter what, infecting each other with positivity, joy, and the desire to spend time together.

Stay Humble: Always act humble: Everybody must roll up their sleeves and get their hands dirty to make our big plans a reality. We are tiny! We are conscious of how big the opportunity is and how much we’ve got left to do.

Glownership: Act as one company—one team: Care first about Glovo, not your role or your department. Own your stuff, no question, but go beyond your role; help before you are asked. Everything you need to make things happen, you do it. Glow it!

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Benefits
A ticket to the moon sitting on the fastest rocket - an adventure filled with challenges and professional growth
Social benefits (such as fresh fruit every day, free lunches from our yummy partners once a week, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 6 weeks, the best coffee machine in the world,...)
Private Health Insurance
Unlimited Glovos (zero delivery fee on your Glovo orders)
Attractive compensation and equity plan
Gym membership discounts
Team building activities
International and talented team, used to working in a fast paced and vibrant way!

title: Data Analyst*

Data Analyst*

Vollzeit, Berlin

Bei RatePAY sind wir Experten für individuelle E-Payment-Lösungen für Onlineshops jeder Art. Wir liefern maßgeschneiderte Multichannel-Ansätze, übernehmen die gesamte Zahlungsabwicklung und tragen das Risiko von Zahlungsausfällen.

Wir suchen Kollegen*, die Verantwortung übernehmen. Die mit ihren Herausforderungen wachsen und niemals aufhören, sich zu verbessern. Kollegen*, die mit uns gemeinsam im Team arbeiten, einander unterstützend.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Who are Metapack?

We are a tech company that works with a lot of the world’s biggest ecommerce players to integrate them with over 470 carriers around the world to make delivery easy. We are a multi-tenant SaaS platform. We give them the platform to help consumers decide their delivery preference and track the parcel’s progress whilst also providing the retailer with intelligent smart decisions about how to send the parcel - all underpinned with lots of data. We work with well-known global retailers and major brands such as ASOS, Adidas, Burberry, John Lewis, Boohoo, eBay, and Zalando. In fact we work with so many retailers and carriers it’s highly likely that you’ve interacted with us at some point when ordering goods online!

In August 2018, we were acquired by Fortune 100’s 2nd fastest growing company, stamps.com. We have super ambitious and exciting plans all centered around our tech. Metapack will play a role in shipping around 600 million parcels in 2018 and with the wider stamps.com family the number rises to 2.5bn parcels. MetaPack has been growing at 40% year on year over the last 5 years and continues to grow at a rapid rate.

Our values: Innovation, Integrity, Collaboration and Passion

The way we work really is at the heart of Metapack, and our 4 core values are brought together to give a sense of our culture.

With Innovation and Integrity at our core, we have a flat and open culture where data & evidence, backed by honest and frank discussions, beats subjective opinion and hierarchy. We Collaborate with energy and Passion on meeting the needs of our fantastic customers and partners.

Why would I want to be a Data Analyst at Metapack?

Data is key to the Metapack’s strategy. We keep improving our data platform and data engineering stack to accommodate growth, enable novel solutions and provide the best service to both our customers and our internal stakeholders. Our massive dataset keeps growing at a staggering pace and allows us to draw deep meaningful insights, above what most other companies in this space can achieve.

We have a flat and open culture where data & evidence beats opinion and hierarchy, backed by honest and frank discussions. We passionately believe in forming autonomous, cross functional teams who are empowered to deliver our ambitious strategy. With stamps.com ownership comes the ability to operate largely independently away from Board meetings and old world thinking but with the financial support of a high performing tech company. Energy and passion for our business and customers is a part of the Metapack culture - and we love working with like-minded people.

What would I be doing?

Enabling our business and our customers to take advantage of our massive dataset to make data driven decisions
Providing analytics insights, through high quality dashboards and reports, to both our internal stakeholders and to customers
Designing, developing and maintaining the Metapack intelligence platform
Working on data governance and defining the business metrics and KPIs to be used throughout the organization
Pairing with data engineers in the development of dataflows that feed the Metapack intelligence platform
Working with the business and other engineering teams to understand our data sources, so we can take advantage of it to improve the quality and breath of our data analytics solution
Collaborating with product in the design and evolution of the Metapack intelligence platform
Promoting self-service BI and help other teams develop their own data analytics solutions
Being and advocate for data driven decision making
What key skills and experience do I need?
An engineering or science backgroundData analysis experienceKnowledge in designing and developing dashboards and reports using tools like Looker, Tableau, Power BI or even d3.jsStrong SQL knowledgeExperience with data modelling for analyticsGood skillset around data visualizationExperience in data processing/ETLKnowledge of at least one programming language besides S

title: Data Analyst (SQL + Python)
role-description:
At Elliptic, we believe cryptocurrency will play a huge role in the future of value transfer, and we care deeply about helping to build this future. In order for cryptocurrency to flourish, it’s important to prevent criminal abuse of the technology. Elliptic is the global leader in detecting, preventing, and pursuing criminal activity in cryptocurrencies. Our clients include the world’s leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies.

Our unique platform gives us an unparalleled understanding of cryptocurrency capital flows, using a combination of network science and machine learning to aggregate and interpret vast quantities of transaction data. We provide anti-money laundering (AML) compliance software and investigative services to the leading participants in the cryptocurrency ecosystem. Customers rely on us to analyse more than $150bn of their transactions every month, and include cryptocurrency businesses, major financial institutions, and federal government agencies.

The company has offices in London, NYC, Singapore & Tokyo. We are backed by SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group.

What's the role?

The quality of our data is at the heart of our business. This Data Analyst role is truly cross functional, supporting our Professional Services, Community and Data teams, through the identification and reporting of crypto and blockchain industry trends and activity, as well as producing accurate and insightful analysis with our internal data to improve our understanding of the business and shape the future of Elliptic.

The Data Analyst’s role is to discover value across all of our internal data assets, as well as integrating various third party data sources. The analyst will need to distil these data sources into easy to read dashboards and reports to be used both internally and for our clients. Ultimately, we are looking for someone who is used to working with unstructured large data sets and turning them into valuable insight, resulting in clear directions and actions rather than just producing charts and dashboards.

What You'll Do
Compile data from disparate systems to develop dashboards and reports for both internal Elliptic users, and Elliptic clients
Collect requirements from stakeholders across the business to improve internal and external reporting
Prioritise and schedule incoming data requests from various areas of the business
Understand the complex relationships of our data and maintain consistency of our reporting across various systems and currencies
Perform data quality reviews and communicate with data owners on any issues and work with them to request and implement change to promote more efficient analysis efforts
Work with the data team to gather data across systems, understanding changes, and troubleshooting errors that may arise
Take the initiative to look for areas to improve reporting and adjust reports as decisions change and priorities shift
Use datasets and queries to generate, maintain, and disseminate both routine and ad hoc reporting

Requirements
4+ years of work experience in a related field
Relevant experience with SQL and Python for data analysis
Good understanding of data management best practices and able to demonstrate an understanding of data process automation, ETL and databases.
Comfortable with quantitative data analysis and basic statistical analysis
Experience using data visualisation tools, such as Tableau, Power BI or Sisense
Excellent working knowledge of spreadsheets and BI tools
Ability to multitask in a fast fast environment while still operating with a high level of attention to detail
Knowledge and understanding of various data feeds and how to access them
Ability to express complex technical and non-technical concepts verbally, graphically, and in writing
Experience with managing large, unstructured datasets

Benefits
Competitive salary
Share options
Private Vitality health insurance & wellness incentive programmes
Work pension scheme
Shiny laptop and multiple monitors
Budget for training materials, events, and conferences
Collaborative, flexible and friendly environment with options for remote working
Quarterly full day offsites
Annual company 3 day offsite
Coffee and beer!
Being part of a business with a purpose, and the opportunity to work with a passionate team of mission-driven people who’ll stretch and challenge you
Elliptic is not a traditional financial services firm. We pride ourselves on having a laid-back and friendly ethos, while still expecting great things from our team. Fascinating work is the norm - working at Elliptic is never boring!
Being a self-starter and a self-directed team player who is well-versed the domains of agile processes and continuous improvement
Being willing to roll up your sleeves sometimes to help the team
Maintain reporting process documentation and train the data team on reporting and analysis functions

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
**The Company **

An innovative technology start-up in the Pharmaceutical/Biotech space. This organisation leverages technical thinking and advanced analytics techniques to help clients make better informed business decisions. Having just secured a new round of investment, this position undoubtedly provides a unique opportunity for someone to join this company on the next stage of their journey.

The Role

As a Data Analyst you will be focused on working collaboratively with developers, operations and the senior management team to deliver internal reports as well as consultancy projects for high calibre clientele. This position will act as the hub of information for the organisation for all things data.

The scope for development and progression is vast, there is a real opportunity here for an individual to own this analytical function within the business. Expect to be leading the way for all of the ongoing modifications to the web platform, which is a space where client interact with the organisation to gain market leading information.

The Successful Candidate Is Likely To Have
Strong academic record, preferably in a STEM based degree.
Technical expertise within Excel and VBA, additional analytical tools would be beneficial (SQL, R, Python, etc.).
Demonstrable experience liaising with senior stakeholders or clients.
An appetite for continuous learning and a commitment to a steep development curve.
A fantastic communication style.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Fitch Group is comprised of: Fitch Ratings, a global leader in credit ratings and research; Fitch Solutions, an industry-leading provider of credit risk products and services; and Fitch Learning, a preeminent training and professional development firm. With dual headquarters in London and New York, Fitch Group is owned by Hearst.

Fitch complies with all laws governing employment in each jurisdiction in which it operates, and provides equal opportunity to all applicants and employees. All applications will be considered without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, and other status protected by applicable laws.

Fitch Solutions, a leading emerging markets analysis firm, is recruiting a high-calibre graduate to join its team in London. We are seeking a bright, ambitious Data Analyst who will sit alongside and support our market-leading research team spanning offices in Centurion, London, New York and Singapore.

You will be contributing to our market intelligence service, providing data and forecasts for senior decision makers in banks, consultancies, multinational corporations, investment funds and government agencies.

Specialising in data mining and forecasting, your responsibilities will include:
Efficiently gathering time series data and compiling it for use by analyst
Forecast time series data to support our analyst teams
Working alongside our Sales team to explain our forecasting methodologies and promote our business development
Working with the Head of Data and Econometrics to develop our product offering

You will receive extensive training in all areas of data analysis and forecasting with the help of our university training material and regular training seminars hosted by senior members of the Research team, in combination with rigorous hands-on guidance from your line manager and team members. Fitch also encourages external training by subsidising external courses, such as the CFA and relevant language classes.

Areas Of Focus Include
Database Management
Industry Risk (e.g. Oil & Gas, Power, Mining)
Macroeconomics
Political and Operational Risk


We are looking for candidates with a strong academic background and a passion for data, with prior understanding of basic macroeconomic principles and a familiarity with world affairs.

Basic Requirements
Minimum 2:1 degree, ideally in economics. However, applications from candidates with any background who have experience of working with economic or industry data would be welcomed.
Keen interest in economics, global financial markets and world affairs.
Strong proficiency in Excel
Desire to learn forecasting, analytical and data handling skills in a dynamic and challenging working environment
Ability to question existing assumptions and develop ideas


Ideal Skills/Qualifications
Previous experience (academic or professional) in analysis and research of global markets, political risk and macroeconomics
Python experience
Postgraduate degree
Language skills
Prior work experience in related field (ideally private sector).

Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts for you and your Family Members prior to commencing employment. If you, or your Family Members, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, they must be sold before beginning work. In certain roles, employees and their Family Members may be limited to investments in diversified mutual funds only.

For more information about this policy, please visit the Code of Ethics and Conduct page.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Die emproc SYS ist die IT-Entwicklungsabteilung der emproc, einem international tätigen Unter-nehmensverbund, der im Bereich Bauprojektmanagement mit dem Fokus auf Kostenmanagement für renommierte Großprojekte, wie z. B. Flughäfen, Sportzentren, Hotels und Hochhäuser im In- und Ausland tätig ist. Dabei betreuen wir mit unserer Software PROBIS Expert und dem IT-Support sowohl Bauherren und Investoren als auch Architekturbüros und Banken.

PROBIS expert ist das Multi-Projekt-Controlling Tool der emproc SYS. Der flexible Aufbau von PROBIS Expert erlaubt die unternehmensspezifische Darstellung von Kostengerüsten und deren problemlose Weiterentwicklung im Rahmen der Kostenverfolgung.

Für die Weiterentwicklung unsere Software PROBIS Expert suchen wir für den Standort Starnberg einen Data Analyst/Business Intelligence Expert.

Dein zukünftiger Arbeitsplatz:

Berlin, Prenzlauer Berg

Deine zukünftigen Aufgaben:
Analysieren der Betriebsprozesse beim Kunden
Betreuung der Implementierung der Software im Kundenbetrieb
Kundenanforderungen aufnehmen und technische wie funktionale Spezifikationen erstellen
Sicherstellung der Datenqualität – Aufbereitung, Kombination und Bereinigung von Daten
Entwicklung leistungsfähiger Reportings, Bereitstellung aussagekräftiger Analysen sowie verständliche Visualisierung und Präsentation der Daten
Du entwickelst innovative und kreative Analysetools für relevante Unternehmensziele.
Du treibst die Automatisierung von wiederkehrenden Analyseprozessen voran und visualisierst Zusammenhänge in interaktiven Dashboards.

Was wir von Dir erwarten:
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder in einem anderen quantitativ anspruchsvollen Themengebiet
Berufserfahrung im Bereich Business Intelligence, Data Science, Predictive Analytics oder Big-Data Infrastruktur
Gutes Englisch in Wort und Schrift
Umfassende Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen in Datenbankstrukturen, Datenmodellierung und -visualisierung, relevanten Sprachen (MS SQL, .NET Framework)
Erfahrungen bei der Erstellung von Analysen und Berichten auf Basis von Excel und Power BI
Kenntnisse in SSIS und/oder Cubeware sind von Vorteil
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von SQL (T-SQL/MS SQL-Server, SQLite sowie ferner MySql)

Was Dich bei uns erwartet:
Abwechslungsreiche und herausfordernde Projekte und Tätigkeiten
Flache Hierarchien mit großen Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Angenehmes Arbeitsumfeld
Attraktives Gehalt
Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Unterstützung bei individuellen Zielstellungen und bei der Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf


Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen mit Gehaltsvorstellung und frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermin.

title: Junior Data Analyst
location: 2nd Floor, Deanland House 160 Cowley Road, Cambridge CB4 0DL, GB
role-description:
Do you want the opportunity to work with world-leading organisations such as Google?

Welcome to Ito World. We enable the smarter movement of people by providing real-time transit data and visualisation for urban mobility, journey planning, and transport planning. Our clients trust Ito to provide a single, quality-assured transit feed at national or city-scale in a format and specification that works for them.
We work with the leading journey planners, mapping & navigation providers and mobility service providers across the globe.

We are looking for an inquisitive, tenacious, well-organised Junior Data Analyst to join our Transit Data team. You will report to the Data Operations Manager.

What you'll do:
Explore and implement ways to improve and augment data to represent the reality or ‘ground truth’ of a city’s transit system
Identify and build relationships with transit professionals working in transit agencies and cities around the world
Assist in the resolution and response to customer support queries and requests
Use internal software to analyse and improve data
Identify opportunities to make improvements to Ito’s transit data quality tools and data management processes
Become “go to” data expert for all forms of public and shared transit in your portfolio of cities
Maintain an up-to date knowledge-base of the transit infrastructure and operators for each city and develop strategies to ensure that Ito has access to the most complete set of transit data
Work on exciting, bespoke projects with clients at the bleeding edge of new mobility technology
Aggregate all available transit data to help create a complete real-time model of the city’s transit infrastructure

Who you are
Diligent, analytically-minded and detail-oriented
You have excellent research and problem-solving skills using internet search tools
Comfortable with Spreadsheets and Databases
Ability to understand complex information and data, and communicate findings in an easy-to-understand format
Pro-active and willing to learn
Self-motivated and keen to a make a difference
Ability to derive insight from transit data and apply it to the real world
Well organised and able to deliver to tight deadlines
Enthusiastic approach and a can-do attitude
Persistent and demonstrate the tenacity and willingness to go the distance to get something done

What would be desirable
Passionate about cities, public transit, shared and micro-mobility
Multi-lingual speaker
Knowledge of open data and data licencing
Experience with mapping and GIS applications
Some knowledge of Statistics

What we offer
Salary: Up to £23,000 per annum
An innovative, tech-driven startup culture
Working with big clients, including Google, Microsoft, Facebook and City authorities across the world
Opportunities for personal development and career progression
25 days’ holiday

Brewin Dolphin is one of the UK's leading independent providers of discretionary wealth management. We offer award-winning personalised wealth management services that meet the varied needs of over 100,000 account holders, including individuals, charities, and pension funds.

Brewin Dolphin has embarked on establishing an Enterprise Data Function to improve and manage their information assets with a view to improving data quality, establishing data governance, building out strategic knowledgebases and provide Analytics capability.

Excel

Ability to learn quickly
High attention to details and tenacity to ensure timely completion of tasks
Ability to contribute to a team effort generating enthusiasm among team members

Initiative and self-confidence

title: Mid Data Analyst
role-description:
Lingokids’ mission is to break down language barriers and provide equal opportunities for kids all around the world. We have currently 11 million families using the product, but we want to get to 100 million. In order to help us with this goal, we are looking for a Mid Data Analyst that will join our HQ in sunny Spain.

The Company

We’re reinventing early childhood education through an online language learning service for kids. With fresh content - games, books, videos, interactive episodes, etc - every week, we are helping more than 11M families and their children around the world learn English in a fun and effective way. Our dream is to have a positive impact on 100M families and we’re working hard to make it a reality. Our talented team of product designers, software engineers, and content producers tweak and improve our product daily, while incorporating feedback from our customers.

THE POSITION

You should be a sharp, curious, and an autonomous fast-paced analytical individual who has a passion for going deep into data and understanding of how kids and parents use our service, and which are the opportunities to improve our product.

You will work with Product team and your insights will mainly influence how we make business decisions and build our growth strategies, but also drive UX through contents, features, and communication.

You will make your own cycle of data extraction, data analysis, data interpretation, summarizing data through presentations and visualizations, making recommendations, communicating to the team.
In addition, you will be responsible for statistical analyses, data transformations and presentation of relevant assessments related to user behaviour, process metrics and outcomes measurements.

You Will Also Get To Work On
Keep a pulse on day-to-day performance KPIs
Build compelling data visualizations to communicate data-driven insights.
Generating relevant and clear insights, identify and clearly articulates recommendations drawn from data.
Work with data engineering team to ensure the effectiveness and accuracy of our data.
Requesting new data points. When the team is about making new contents/ features, check to see if we are missing important data points for capturing necessary UX.
Owning data definition. Making clear, attainable, and consistent definition for data and communicate to the team to have a quality data driven decision making environment.
Work with our engineers and data scientists to support the development of system and process enhancements to support predictive models.
Support ad-hoc analysis as: impact analysis, data inconsistencies investigation, experiment results interpretation etc.
YOU
Have a degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or another quantitative discipline.
Have experience developing business analytical solutions, using databases and analytic tools, ideally in a Startup environment for at least 3 years.
Have experience in the data extract, transform and load process including data cleansing and quality review.
Have proficiency with SQL and any data viz tool.
You are experienced working with data mining, data discovery and/or modeling tool.
Feel comfortable working with statistical models and advanced analytics methods.
Are always curious and enthusiastic about learning new analytical methods.
Have worked with large volumes of data and have Strong decision-making with imperfect information.
Speak english fluently.
Perks & Benefits

We are proud of our culture and work hard to make sure every team member loves what they do. Check some of the perks and benefits of working in the EU and being a Lingoer.
Visa Sponsorship: If needed, we will fully-sponsor an EU visa to come work with us.
Stock-options: Joining the Lingokids journey means you own part of the company.
Flexible Hours: Busy parent, or night owl? We get it. 9 to 5 is not for all of us either.
Holidays: 23 days of paid leave, and 14 days of bank holidays a year!
Family Leave: Enjoy up to 4 months of paid family leave, regardless of when you joined.
International Office: Multicultural team with 17+ nationalities and day-to-day work in English.
Free books & training: we support you get better at job with any book and trainings you need.
Language Lessons: We offer language lessons in Spanish, Portuguese and English.
Unlimited Snacks & Drinks: Our kitchen is always full, from beer to daily fresh fruits.
Retreats & Social Gatherings: Our team celebrates monthly get-togethers and an annual retreat.
Fridays Lunch & Learn: Weekly all-hands gathering to lunch and learn from each other.
If any of this rings a bell let’s chat!

title: (Senior) Data Analyst (m/f/d)
role-description:
The Scout24 AG operates leading digital markets in Germany and Europe. Next to about 1200 new colleagues, a surrounding in which you can advance your innovative ideas like in a Start-Up awaits you. Sounds interesting? Get more insights into the world of Scout24 here: www.scout24.com or here #WorkingAtScout24

Scout24 Group – ImmobilienScout24, AutoScout24, Consumer Services

This is a key role to make Scout24 a fully data-driven company. As a data analyst you will be deeply involved in the core of our business and integrated in our product teams. While having the full support of a highly dynamic and innovative data organization in the background. You will be involved in working with cutting-edge technologies together with a big group of analysts, engineers and scientists. This role is perfect for someone who wants to go far beyond a traditional analytical approach. Someone who enjoys creating value by insights and who is always looking for new ways to bring the idea of a data-driven business to life.

You are really a data enthusiast, highly self-motivated and proactive

An attractive salary package and a lucrative employer-funded pension

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
company: The Juice Plus+® Company Europe GmbH
role-description:
Business Intelligence Analyst (Global) London

The Juice PLUS+ Company is a vibrant, innovative and very strong performing Health and Wellness organisation with global offices, operating in c.30 countries worldwide. We work with over 4 million customers inspiring healthy living through our products and our mission.

Owing to large growth, the need has arisen for an Analyst to join our busy Global Business Intelligence team assisting the company in making better decisions and understanding our customers more. Business Intelligence at Juice PLUS is a new and growing area and requires someone who is strong in Quantitative Analysis and holds a deep curiosity to learn, a determination to unearth trends in data and effectively communicate valuable insights to our business leaders.

On a day to day basis the person in this role will report to the Global BI Manager and will handle large volumes of complex data. You will build reports and conduct analysis using a variety of tools including Excel. The role of Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for developing clear summary documents and presentations and for performing Quality Assurance testing, ensuring the solutions add value for the stakeholder audience. Alongside of auditing the authenticity of data, the role holder will manage a schedule of reports and be highly focussed on building relationships with key stakeholders.

Candidates for this role will have relevant Business Intelligence Analyst experience and hold a Bachelors Degree or equivalent in a related subject. You will have advanced knowledge of Excel and Powerpoint / SWAY and be very experienced in manipulating large sets of data. You will be comfortable in communicating with people who speak English as a second language and may have a second language that you speak also.

This is a hugely exciting and fun time to join a dynamic team, focussed on enabling better decision making across the company.

title: Junior Data Analyst (m/w)
role-description:
Die Aufgaben des Datawarehouse-Teams sind die Konzeption, Datenanalyse und das Arbeiten mit Datenanalyse-Tools. Das Ziel ist, eine hohe Verfügbarkeit und gute Performance der Software zu wirtschaftlichen Bedingungen sicherzustellen.

Design, Datenmodellierung und Umsetzung von Reporting-Anforderungen
Datenbank - Skripterstellung für ETL-Strecken
Verantwortung für die technologische Weiterentwicklung und Optimierung des Datawarehouse

Erste praktische Erfahrungen (Praktika, Projektarbeiten) in der Softwareentwicklung

Ausgeprägte analytisch-konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten

Das Jahresbruttogehalt ab € 35.000,- ist abhängig von beruflicher Qualifikation und Erfahrung. Als Großkonzern bietet unser Kunde attraktive Weiterbildungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, vielfältige Sozialleistungen und Benefits sowie ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell. Flache Hierarchien, gutes Arbeitsklima, Platz für Kreativität und laufender Austausch mit Kollegen (Buddy-System) zeichnen das Unternehmen aus.

Fühlen Sie sich angesprochen? Dann freuen wir uns über Ihre aussagekräftige Bewerbung unter Angabe der Kennnummer 72.224 über das ISG-Karriereportal oder per eMail.

title: Data Analyst - UK Placement
role-description:
We currently have an exciting opportunity for an experienced analyst to join the UK Placement function. The positon requires strong technical and analytical skills completed by stakeholder management and interest to develop a sound commercial understanding of the business. The Placement function coordinates placement, product and portfolio strategy across Marsh UK. This is achieved by working closely with insurers and internal stakeholders across multiple client segments and practices. Data, MI and Analytics are essential enablers to drive and implement a successful placement strategy.

The Data Analyst plays a pivotal role to leverage Marsh data and drive the MI and analytics agenda for Placement across all the UK segments. The role sits within the Central UK Placement function, with a close relationship to the UK Data & MI team which sits alongside. The position holder will work on specific initiatives (e.g. supporting the creation of new facilities and products, renewal of large facilities, analysis of portfolio and client profitability) and will be responsible to deliver data driven insights. The position provides broad exposure to a number of stakeholders within Marsh, working closely with Practices leaders on specific projects and acting as Placement Data and Analytics business partner for selected Segments.

Key Responsibilities

Work on key Placement priorities/ projects
Provide a strong contribution in setting and driving placement Data, MI and Analytics strategy and agenda
Deliver Placement and Facility Analytics and Insights to drive
Placement strategy
Insurer management
Development of new facilities / renewal of large facilities
Execution of placement strategy for each Segment and Practice
Improvement of Profitability and Yield
Compliance with agreed Compensation Protocol
Be the placement owner for some of these themes/initiatives and follow up with relevant stakeholders
Core placement and facility MI
Internal MI (Portfolio MI, Product / Facility MI, Yield/ Compensation MI )
Drive evolution and improvement
Monitor MI and extract relevant insights
Work with key stakeholders to optimize process to collect / maintain necessary reference data.
External MI (Facility MI for Insurers)
Ensure consistency of internally and externally reported information, helping to integrate
Work in close collaboration with Portfolio Solutions team, Operations and colleagues in the Practices to define and maintain optimal process to collect the necessary data
Link with D&MI Production team to oversee regular production of MI and reports for insurer
Work closely with Segment and Practice Placement leaders and CEOs. Develop an understanding of business priorities
Act as Placement Data and Analytics business partner for selected Segments and Practices:
- Focusing on Placement/ Business related topics
- Managing Data and MI requests from Practice stakeholders
- Delivering directly or coordinating delivery from other colleagues in Data & MI team
Coordinate with Data &MI Development team to maintain/ upgrade of placement and facility MI tools
Coordinate with Data &MI Production team on delivery of regular reports
Ensure good level of understanding of how business stakeholders operate core systems and that use of data is aligned to that.
Work with Business stakeholders to influence correct use of systems and data collection processes. Aim is to drive improvement and standardization which ultimately drives better Data, MI and Analytics

Key Skills And Experience

Strong data analysis skills including a range of quantitative techniques
Very strong MS Office skills
Strong stakeholder management and communication skills
Project management techniques
Understanding of data management, modelling (databases / data warehousing)
Practical experience with MI/BI tools including QlikView or equivalent

Preferred Skills And Experience

Knowledge of the London insurance market
Prior experience in Insurance Portfolio MI or Facility Development

About Marsh

Marsh is a global leader in insurance broking and risk management. In more than 130 countries, our experts in every facet of risk and across industries help clients to anticipate, quantify, and more fully understand the range of risks they face. We work with clients of all sizes to define, design, and deliver innovative solutions to better quantify and manage risk. We offer risk management, risk consulting, insurance broking, alternative risk financing, and insurance program management services to businesses, government entities, organizations, and individuals around the world. To every client interaction we bring an unmatched combination of deep intellectual capital, industry-specific expertise, global experience, and collaboration. Since 1871, clients have relied on Marsh for trusted advice, to represent their interests in the marketplace, make sense of an increasingly complex world, and help turn risks into new opportunities for growth. Our more than 30,000 colleagues work on behalf of our clients, who are enterprises of all sizes in every industry, and include individuals, multinational organizations, and government entities worldwide. We embrace a culture that celebrates and promotes the many backgrounds, heritages and perspectives of our colleagues and clients. Visit www.marsh.com for more information and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter @MarshGlobal.

Marsh and its separately incorporated operating entities around the world are part of Marsh & McLennan Companies, a publicly held company (ticker symbol: MMC).

Marsh & McLennan Companies offers competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits and programs including: pension, health and welfare, tuition assistance, employee assistance program, domestic partnership benefits, career mobility, employee network groups, volunteer opportunities, and other programs. For more information about our company, please visit us at: http://www.mmc.com/.

Marsh & McLennan Companies & its affiliates aim to attract and retain the best people regardless of their gender expression or identity, marital and civil partnership status, ethnic origin, nationality, age, background, disability, sexual orientation or beliefs.

This role is for an ambitious and confident analyst wishing to develop their career within a FMCG environment. This market leader strives towards complete customer satisfaction, wishing to inspire clients and this can be achieved with your dynamic assistance.

Measure the success of the business through clients
Understand current trends and predict future client behaviour
Constantly look to optimise the client data model

Identify and understand trends and make recommendations for improvement

Look to combine new and interesting data sources to improve data models
Thorough understanding of insight
Bring data to life for business leaders through clear communication

Segment customers based on the breadth of their behaviour

Alternatively, you can refer a friend or colleague by taking part in our fantastic referral schemes! If you have a friend or colleague who would be interested in this role, please refer them to us. title: Data Analyst (H/F) – Mobile Gaming
role-description: Description du poste Dans le cadre de sa forte croissance, Gaminho recherche un(e) Data Analyst pour contribuer à développer son pôle Data et exploiter ses jeux de sport sur mobile, actuels et surtout à venir ! VOS RESPONSABILITÉS Produire le reporting des KPIs des jeux pour aider aux prises de décisions, pour tous les acteurs de l’entreprise, des game designers au pôle marketing. Mettre en place des tableaux de bord qui faciliteront l’analyse de résultats par les différents acteurs et par le management. Travailler avec l’équipe de production pour mettre en place et participer à l’évolution des plans de taggage sur nos jeux existants ou à venir. Aider à la définition des besoins et retours nécessaires à la mise en place et l’évolution du pipeline Data. Analyser les données de jeu et faire des recommandations concernant l’optimisation du contenu et l’équilibrage économique. Proposer et mettre en place des solutions de prédiction ou d’apprentissage pour créer des modèles statistiques au service des différents pôles (marketing, game design…) Vous serez un élément important d’une équipe à taille humaine (mais très ambitieuse), et travaillerez étroitement avec toutes les équipes sur des projets très différents. Les jeux sur lesquels vous travaillerez sont joués par des millions de joueurs à travers le monde, et l’analyse de ce grand volume de données sera cruciale pour nous permettre d’optimiser les performances de ces jeux à tous les niveaux. La société est en pleine croissance et à un moment charnière de son évolution ; le moment idéal pour rejoindre l’aventure et réaliser quelque chose de grand ! Profil recherché Au moins 2 ans d’expérience et au moins une expérience professionnelle en tant que Data Analyst ou Data Scientist, de préférence dans le domaine du mobile. Plusieurs réalisations concrètes au niveau de la mise en place de rapports de Business Intelligence sur les sujets suivants : data crunching, data visualization, data analysis Maîtrise approfondie d’Excel et du SQL. Expérience avec R et/ou Tableau (ou outils similaires) TRÈS rigoureux/se, méthodique, avec d’excellentes capacités d’analyse. Esprit de synthèse et capacité à communiquer de manière claire et concise. Anglais courant (pour échanger avec nos partenaires internationaux). Qualités recherchées Dynamisme, attitude positive et capacité d’écoute Rigueur, pragmatisme, toujours orienté(e) efficacité et résultat Autonomie, curiosité, proactivité Plus appréciés : Bonne connaissance du sport, idéalement pratiquant(e) et fan de longue date Connaissance de l’écosystème mobile (games & apps) et des best practices en terme d’analyse de données. Expérience avec les outils du marché mobile (Google, Amazon, …) Intérêt pour les systèmes économiques de jeux free-to-play et leur équilibrage. Informations supplémentaires Poste basé à Paris CDI temps plein Nos locaux sont situés au Cargo dans le 19ème arrondissement à Paris, dans un cadre entrepreneurial bouillonnant plein de startups à fort potentiel ! Accessible par le RER E (Saint Lazare en 10 minutes / Gare du Nord), Métro ligne 7 et Tramway A fournir CV, site perso, blog… Lettre de motivation répondant (notamment) aux 3 questions suivantes : 1/ Pourquoi le mobile gaming ? 2/ Vos trois caractéristiques clé ? 3/ Qu’est-ce qui vous motive au quotidien ? D’une manière générale, toute initiative ou travail personnel en rapport avec le poste sera grandement apprécié ! A propos de Gaminho Vous avez conscience de l’incroyable potentiel du mobile gaming et vous souhaitez donner une orientation nouvelle à votre carrière en rejoignant une startup à fort potentiel au meilleur moment ? Alors cette offre est faite pour vous ! Gaminho développe et édite des jeux de sport sur mobile. TOP SEED Tennis manager, notre dernier jeu, est devenu ces dernières années la référence mondiale des jeux de gestion de carrière de tennis sur mobile auprès de millions de joueurs. Plusieurs projets sont actuellement en cours de développement et dans le cadre de notre forte croissance, nous renforçons nos différentes pôles (développement, marketing, data) avec des personnes de qualité, compétentes et qui apprennent vite. Chez Gaminho, vous ferez partie d’une équipe où chaque membre est responsable de ses propres sujets, progresse quotidiennement et a un vrai impact sur la réussite collective. Le moment idéal pour nous rejoindre !

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
BookingGo - Insight Data Analyst

We're BookingGo, the ground transport division of Booking.com. We're the ones who empower people to get where they're going. Whether they're taking the wheel or sitting back and leaving it to the driver. Whether they're heading straight from A to B or enjoying the freedom to go wherever their journey takes them.

To do that, we offer car hire to our customers through our Rentalcars.com brand and car hire, taxis and ticketed transfer services through Booking.com. We also have a B2B solution, Rentalcars Connect, providing great ground transportation options to the customers of our partners

With our HQ in Manchester, we're part of the worldwide Booking.com family. At the same time, we're proud of our own unique identity. Speaking 42 languages, our 2,000+ staff come from all over the world, just like our customers. What brings us together is our love of adventure: our own as well as other people's. It's easy to be passionate about a job that enriches so many lives on a daily basis, and our workplace reflects our passion, our diversity, our global focus. Just search "Manchester's coolest office" and see for yourself.

And we're in good company. Together with priceline.com, KAYAK, agoda.com, and OpenTable, we're part of Booking Holdings, the world leader in online travel and related services.

We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated senior analyst/associate data scientist to join our Data Team . You will work alongside Data Scientists, analysts, designers, developers & product owners to produce valuable insights, shaping and creating models using analytics tools, statistics and data-mining techniques. Engineering and product are a multi-skilled group of over 400 people responsible for providing the technology to enable the Rentalcars.com, booking.com/cars and taxis businesses. It is a fast paced, dynamic, exciting and driven environment providing services on a 24x7 basis. We provide all the touch points for our online customer experience through a market leading app, great websites and all the software services and business systems to manage our customers and products. Our goal is to create a great customer experience across all platforms which help us deliver growth for our business.

We have a great journey ahead and our vision is to radically change the working practices to realise our ambition of being a “World Class” engineering function and the “Technology Employer of Choice” in the Northwest and beyond. Make no mistake we have a challenging journey ahead but we are committed to delivering a great customer experience across web, mobile, call centre and partner channels and this is where you could fit in.

Role Description

As Rentalcars continues its journey to be a fully data driven organisation, we are looking for an exceptional self-led data analyst/data scientist who wants to join the Data & Reporting and Data Sciences product teams, analysing, validating and shaping data held in Hadoop and SQL data stores. This is a fantastic opportunity to work with big data, new technologies and supporting and kick-starting innovative ML projects. The focus will be on assessing quality and suitability of data, taking a systematic approach to creating and exploring useful data sets, delivering insight and enabling and supporting advanced analysis and data insights in the team and beyond. THere will also be the opportunity for developing pipelines as well as experimentation, measuring success of initiatives, products and business changes.

Where we are going
Enacting a data driven approach by bringing advanced analytics and ML to the business
Collaborating with teams across the world to be at the fore-front of eCommerce
Revolutionising our online customer experience by personalising the car-rental experience for millions
Supporting these decisions using the state of the art infrastructure, and big data technologies


Essential

Skills and experience we are looking for
Advanced analytical skills (statistical background)
Strong SQL skills for querying and exploring data sets
Proven experience delivering insight from disparate data sets
Ability to clearly communicate complex ideas to varied and non-technical stakeholders
Creative and inquisitive: flair for developing insightful analysis and solving real business problems using data
Working knowledge of BI tools such as Power BI and Tableau to visualise insights from big data
Technically advanced in at least one data technology (e.g. R, Python, SQL,SAS, PySpark etc)

Desired
Experience of working in online or eCommerce with high velocity event data
Working knowledge of Spark, Hadoop, Python, R, Scala
Interest in Machine Learning techniques and applications
Ability to talk the language of Data Science

Key Accountabilities
Deliver hypothesis challenging analytics that can change the direction of the company.
Work with key in-house stake-holders to understand their business needs and develop the analytics to support them with insight and ML.
Use your experience and the knowledge you gain to advise multi-disciplinary teams on ways of keeping and maintaining quality data and workflows for its analysis. Owning this high value process.

Key Attributes
Analytical in approach, determined and passionate about delivering an impact on the business
A real team player
Commitment to personal and professional development, seeks and acts on feedback
Desire to understand how business processes and systems work, not afraid to get into the detail
Able to communicate effectively to all levels within the business – verbally and written, formally and informally
Robust & resilient, a completer/finisher with an attention to detail
Plans and prioritises effectively, while also demonstrating comfort with ambiguity and pragmatism when plans change
Sense of ownership of the understanding & quality of the data that the team rely upon
Have fun!


What We Offer In Return
Ownership of your work and a great technical challenge
A great office to work in the heart of Manchester
Great facilities including subsidised canteen and Starbucks, free breakfast & fruit and cycle hub
An exciting and dynamic place to work
25 days paid holiday plus bank holidays
Great discounts on car rentals and other group benefits
Opportunity to help shape the future of the team and data and analytics culture

title: Talent Management Data Analyst
role-description:
Agoda is transforming travel for millions of customers across the globe.

Headquartered in Asia, Agoda is one of the world’s largest online travel accommodation platforms. Founded in 2005 and now part of Booking Holdings (Nasdaq:BKNG), Agoda has a network of over 2,000,000 vacation rentals and hotels worldwide. Our web and mobile products provide a first-rate reservation service in 38 languages that uniquely combines local knowledge and local connections to provide the best deals for business and leisure travelers. Agoda employs over 5,000 professionals from 70 nationalities in locations around the globe. In every department – from engineering to customer experience – we provide an environment rich with creativity, collaboration, and experimentation, and the tools to work faster and smarter. At Agoda, we believe our people are our strength. We work hard and have fun, and we choose people who are dedicated to making things great.

Role Summary

As a Talent Management Data Analyst, you are expected to initiate and execute analysis projects that deliver significant and action-oriented recommendations to stakeholders in and outside of the department. You will be driving decisions with insights drawn from customer and operational data. Your work will be project-oriented honing on your strong project management and analytical acumen coupled with market knowledge and operational savviness.

This role is a unique blend of soft and hard skills. While you are part of the business organization, you are expected to leverage your advanced quantitative and technical skills to perform faster, more effective execution and more advanced analytics (requires statistical knowledge, advanced data analytics skills, and software development to optimize selected business processes). You need to be able to scale your impact with technology.
The individual needs to be self-motivated and proactive (initiate experiments and new initiatives). You will have to work cross-functionally to take ideas to action, be comfortable with ambiguity, and very capable at problem-solving. You should possess a can-do attitude (which often comes from your past experience with data analytics and computer science) and strong work ethics.

Responsibilities
Support business initiatives and ensures good coordination and collaboration between the teams in various Agoda’s departments and within the CEG organization to achieve projects milestones and goals
Improve scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing data analytic projects and establish projects based on extracted data insight
Work with tech and data teams to identify and build tools to support or automate data analysis/reporting tasks
Understand and report to your team and senior management on business performance
Drive data analysis projects aiming at improving and maintaining operational KPIs such as service-level agreement (SLA) / response time, customer satisfaction (CSAT), net promoter score (NPS), quality of service, productivity KPIs, costs, etc.
Provide efficient and automated regular reporting to management
Analyze issues, identify risks, report accordingly to management, and propose solutions to be implemented in efficient and effective communication


Requirements
5+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst, strong Business Intelligence/Data Visualization experience preferably in the field of HR
Bachelor’s in a quantitative degree
Experience with BI/reporting software in terms of building dashboards – Tableau in particular
Expert Excel user: ability to understand and build complex spreadsheets; ability to efficiently extract data from large and complex database
Quick learner, proactive/forthcoming attitude, problem-solving aptitude, effective prioritization, attention to detail
Strong “story-teller” that can communicate insights and recommendations effectively
Excellent problem solving and comprehension skills as well as strong business sense
Excellent communication skills: ability to communicate with people of differing levels of seniority and analytical understanding
Project management: able to initiate and drive projects, liaise with stakeholders and manage resources to reach objectives and deliver product
High level of organization: ability to manage multiple, competing priorities and deliver results under tight deadlines and pressure
Excellent communication skills in written and spoken English


Nice To Have
Experience working with relational databases (MSSQL, Postgress, MySQL, etc…)
Experience working with SaaS (Workday, Greenhouse.io) platforms and APIs in any programming language (Python, C#, Java, etc.…)


What We Offer
Be part of a dynamic and exciting data-driven multinational team in a successful and fast-growing tech company
A career path will help you to continuously develop your skills
The chance to propose ideas to improve operations based on data and have an impact on the customer experience

Benefit
Competitive compensation package (relocation support for successful overseas candidates)
International and domestic health insurance
Annual performance bonus

title: Data Quality Analyst / Lead
role-description: Are you passionate about Data? Do you have an understanding and awareness of the role data can play in delivering excellent services to our customers? At RBH we recognise data as one of our strategic assets and the important role it will play in underpinning the delivery of quality services to our customers. We've embarked on a major digital recruitment campaign to bring in people who are passionate about IT and Business Intelligence but most importantly delivering improved outcomes for our customers.
