title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Advert Sage is a global company with a local heart. The market leader for cloud-based accounting, financials, enterprise management, people, and payroll software, we empower the world’s business heroes—from single-person startups to large enterprises. Our people are passionate and positive. We inspire our colleagues to serve business builders everywhere and champion their success. As a FTSE 100 company with 14,000 colleagues across 24 countries, we do business the right way, while giving back to our local communities through the Sage Foundation. Sage is passionate about building a culture where our colleagues feel they can bring their whole selves to work. Where people know they’ll be judged on their performance and behaviours - not their identity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on their race, color, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Job Description Our IT mission is to transform the way technology is delivered to customers and colleagues across the world with the emphasis on simplicity, mobility, and efficiency. Data and Analytics will be central to enabling our colleagues to focus more on our customers and increasing revenue by providing innovative and deeper insights into our customers, as well as the ability to use these insights to personalise the customer journey across channels.

This is a great opportunity to work as a Data Analyst in a dynamic data and analytics team responsible for determining the global Sage Data strategy and driving adoption of, and insight into, Sage’s centralised data assets including big data sets such as Product telemetry, customer sentiment and click-data and uniting this with master customer and product data. This role will expose the Data Analyst to leading edge technologies and infrastructure with the opportunity to establish skills in big data, data science and new analytical methodologies.

The Data Analyst will be responsible for understanding business processes in relation to the data and supporting systems that underpin these processes. The Data Analyst will gather data and BI requirements for initiatives and projects using their knowledge of the as-is to model the data and integrations according to the requirements and target architecture. The Data Analyst will act as an SME and perform deep-dive analysis and identify any data issues as and when required.

Key Responsibilities Key Accountabilities And Decision Ownership

 Provide Data Analysis expertise across all business priority initiatives through data analysis and insights
 Act as the interface between the Business Analysts and the Architecture and Delivery teams on all data requirements
 Collaborate with the Data and Analytics team to design and develop solutions by providing the data needs aligned to the business requirements
 Carry-out data profiling and identify data integrity and quality challenges
 Answer urgent business questions through deep dive analytics
 Support data users across the business in their data analysis and challenge and guide the business in more advanced analytics (predictive, propensity etc.)
 Develop, maintain and publish Data Analytics standards and practices

Skills, Know-how And Experience

 Driven, analytical mind seeking to utilize skills to develop actionable insights from data to solve business problems
 Persistent, detail-oriented, curious, fast learner with experience in data analytics, modelling, prediction, and visualization.
 Strong communication skills, with can-do attitude; ability to convey complex information in understandable terms.
 Significant Experience in a similar role

 Expert SQL Skills, And JSON Experience

 Knowledge of databases – relational and unstructured
 Experience with BI/data visualisation tools (Qlik, PowerBI etc.)
 An inquisitive mind supported by sound business acumen, focused on addressing and solving data and analytical problems within a commercial context
 Desire to learn and adopt new analytical techniques and methodologies
 Desire to learn new big data, data science, machine learning etc. skills
Key performance indicators: (3-5 Max)
 Accurate, detailed and timely estimates
 Detailed data requirements for projects
 Data mapping documents (IMDs)
 Data dictionaries and other assets
 Assigned tasks completed to time and quality
 Training in relevant disciplines

 Adherence To Standards Technical / Professional Qualifications

 Degree in a subject with some numerate aspect
Qualifications/knowledge in Data Analysis, Business Analysis and/or BI
Qualifications/knowledge in Data and BI technologies

title: Associate Data Analyst
role-description:
HM Land Registry has an exciting opportunity for an Associate Data Analyst to join the team based in Plymouth . You will join us on either a Flexible working, Job share or Part-time basis and you will receive a highly competitive salary of £25,247 per annum . It is an exciting time for HM Land Registry (HMLR) as we continue to embark on a major transformation programme. HMLR's ambition is to become the world’s leading land registry for speed, simplicity and an open approach to data. We are now looking for an Associate Data Analyst to join our Digital, Data and Technology team to help us to achieve this. Responsibilities of our Associate Data Analyst include : As an Associate Data Analyst you will primarily be working as part of the Local Land Charges (LLC) quality assurance team. You will be responsible for supporting the migration and transformation of Local Authority Local Land Charges (LLC) data into the HM Land Registry LLC register. To do this, you will evaluate the accuracy, completeness and conformance of the supplied data at a variety of predesignated check points. You will assimilate output from the quality tests and feed findings into the wider quality assurance team, identifying trends and provide evidence to support recommendations and decisions across the program. What we’re looking for in our Associate Data Analyst :
Ability to analyse a variety of textual and spatial datasets against defined standards.
Able to interpret quality standards and quality assurance outputs to identify where automated validation routines can be introduced and/or enhanced.
Experience of delivering data quality analysis based on defined requirements and developing automated QA routines in FME, VBA, python or similar. Benefits of becoming our Associate Data Analyst :
An employee recognition scheme
Long-service awards
Maternity and adoption leave of up to 26 weeks’ full pay, followed by 13 weeks’ statutory pay and a further 13 weeks unpaid
Paternity leave allowance of two weeks plus four days’ paid leave;
Paid time off for public service duties, for example if you are an armed forces reservist
Paid volunteering leave
A social and sports club in every office
The opportunity to compete in national Civil Service competitions for a wide variety of sports
Access to our employee assistance programme for counselling and support on a wide range of issues
An interest-free loan for season tickets and/or bicycles and safety equipment
Many other rewards including access to discounted healthcare, a Microsoft Home Use programme and shopping, leisure and finance discounts. To continue your application for our Associate Data Analyst role , please click ‘Apply’ now. Closing Date : 15th November 2019

title: Data Analyst (JVBS).
role-description:
Who We Are

The Joint Venture between Banc Sabadell and Zurich is a business agreement that exists between the two companies since 2008 in regard to the management of the Bancassurance business. This business is managed through 3 companies: BanSabadell Vida, BanSabadell Pensiones and BanSabadell Seguros Generales. The current staff of the Joint Venture is 280 employees.

“We are actually living a cultural and business transformation process and that’s the reason why we need to hire people completely different. We are looking for some unique person, creative and exceptional who might want to be a part of this changes and assume new and completely different challenges”

Our opportunity

Be involved in the analytics process and provide support for all business lines (motor, households, shops, SME’s, life care, accidents, pensions and savings, health…). At the same time you’ll have to provide support and advice the most important areas and business process, including insights into underlying performance and implications for the business. You’ll have the opportunity to work with financial information applied to insurance business.

Your role

Under Supervision, Developing Analytical Models As Tariff Structures In Mass Lines Of Business, And Big Data Support For Strategically Decisions Of New/renewal Business, As Well As Modelling Marketing Events
Development and improvement of predictive modeling tools according to the market best practices like: Reverse engineering from market information, Elasticity models, lapse models, customization models or NPS.
Develop analytical tools and methods such as scenario testing analysis and projections.
Develop tariffs for new business and renewal, and assist in the monitoring of portfolio performance based on big data.
Coordinate, prepare and perform analyses including trend analyses, and analyses of loss and expense reserves, as it relates to business benefits and strategic direction.
Overview for life, non life, health and pensions business. Work with financial information to enrich the databases
Support different areas on strategically decisions.
Drive the design, testing and maintenance of pricing models and Tools.
Develop models according two different scopes, bank and insurance business

Your Skills And Experience

We hope that the person joining the team brings together the following skills and experiences:
Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or Actuarial Sciences.
More than 4 years of experience in big data, analytics, pricing, modeling or similar.
Industry experience: insurance, bank, pharmaceutical, massive retail, on-line market, others.
Account in Analytics Software’s (SAS, R, MS Office environment).
English (Advanced Level).
Interest in analytical tools and into develop new approaches.

Additional Information

The physical workplace will be in our offices in Sant Cugat.

We are already on our way and we are changing the way we do insurance. In order to do so we need people with talent, willing to learn and a lot of passion! Want to Join Us?

“ZURICH, 12 consecutive years being considered as top employer. For those who truly love!”



Zurich Insurance has the policy to be an equal opportunity employer. We aim to attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to criteria such as race/ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

Primary Location

Spain-Catalonia-Barcelona

Schedule

Full-time

Travel

No

Job Posting

10/30/19

Unposting Date

11/29/19

title: Market Data Analyst # 137682
role-description:
We Offer

ORLICA is the department in Credit Suisse that is responsible for the operational and financial management of the bank's market data inventory. For our team we are looking for a highly dedicated person with excellent analytical and interpersonal skills able to work independently when required. Our department controls managing the provisions and removals of market data services, its associated services inventory, invoice control, approval, cost recharge and usage of market data services. We take care of permissioning, controlling accesses and profiles, storing information about market data in our inventory tool. We are analyzing discrepancies which may occur between our systems, vendor’s systems and invoices.

We are happy to offer you flexibility and value diversity in dynamic and international environment. We give you an excellent platform for further grow your personal and professional skillset and to build up your own career within a creative and state-of-the-art organization.

You will be working on permissioning of users for market data services such as Bloomberg, Thomson Reuters, FactSet and other.
You will ensure that any new services are appropriately signed off by the cost center approver.
You will take care of keeping the internal inventory of market data users and services up to date and accurate.
You will communicate with Market Data vendors.
You will respond to internal queries regarding costs allocated to users and resolve queries on time to reduce impact on the cost.
You will investigate and own invoice/costs queries through to resolution.
You will cultivate and encourage collaborative, team working environment, work hand in hand with global teams to ensure global standards and optimal service provision.

Open to discussing flexible/agile working.

You Offer

You have graduate degree, a Finance or Economics focus is preferable but not mandatory.
You have control mindset and attention to detail.
You have an analytical mindset and ability to challenge the accepted status quo.
You possess excellent communication and organizational skills.
You have experience of using Excel and/or Databases.
You are fluent in English (written and spoken).
Experience in similar areas within a banking environment is preferred.

For more information visit Technology Careers.

Poland-Wroclaw-Wroclaw

title: Data Scientist, Data Analyst
role-description:
What are we trying to do?

We see an increased need for the wide business to explore and unveil the value hidden in the big amount of data we’re gathering every day. We want to growth substantially the data science team for modelling and developing innovative solutions across the group. Being a big player of services and information retrieval in many aspects of the Financial Markets put us in a privileged position, and we want to give our clients the benefit of primary data quality and analytical approach, in order to make it easier for them to discover values in their business and leverage them. This is possible when you conjugate a rigorous, clear and well proved methodology, to good quality data, deep understanding of the market, research and use of the most advanced technologies.

What do we need help with?

We need people that can think in a mathematical, solid way, business problems that are relevant for us and for our clients. Using the most advanced technologies in data analysis, we need people to be able to reframe the problems under study, propose an innovative modelling, find the relevant data and present the rational of the solution. We need people able to help with others’ ideas, bring different points of view, test, refine, enrich the solution that will enable us to give answers to unmet (and often, not completely known) needs.

What will you do?

You will be exposed to high level business ideas for new products, new technologies in the sector. You’ll be asked to form an opinion, look for counter examples, come up with proposals and tests to corroborate or discharge the hypothesis, unveil dynamics that keep us and our clients ahead of the competition.

Using the recent advances in technology for big data (machine learning, AI etc), you’ll be able to put them at work, customize, imagine and engineer innovative solutions.

What You’ll Need To Know

You need to be able to model and abstract relevant features in the problems under exam. You need to have a scientific mindset and approach to problem solving. You need to be able to structure the manipulation of large sets of data. You need to be able to suggest what can make the analysis better, which data can cross check the assumptions, how we can retrieve those data in an effective and scalable way. Knowledge of Python or R or Matlab (or some other programming language) is required.

Required Capabilities

PhD or Master Degree in Mathematics, Physics or other scientific disciplines. Previous experience in modeling complex problems.

Previous strong experience in coding.

Knowledge of Python, or R, or Matlab.

Industry knowledge is not essential.

Fluent in English.

Team player.

Be creative and innovative

Who You Are

You are a dynamic, creative, self-starter and team player, honest, goal-driven, good listener, persistent. You understand complexity and appreciate the different priorities in organizing work. You understand how to be effective in managing different tasks, and you can find the right trade-off between horizontal and vertical approach in problem-solving.

Who we are?

Automation positively transforms the lives of people and business. Our software helps you improve decision-making, increase efficiency, simplify complex processes andempower your people. We enable financial institutions, central banks and corporations to digitize and automate their most business-critical processes. We are reinventing the way business is done through innovations in automation technology.

We encourage creativity by automating repetitive tasks.

We think long-term to get it right the first time

We are not limited by the status quo: we challenge boundaries, question assumptionsand make transformative leaps.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
ExxonMobil is one of the world’s leading energy companies with more than a 100,000 employees and contractors located in over 50 countries around the world. Our large, in-house IT organization consists of 6,000 professionals supporting an array of business lines, plants, refineries, manufacturing sites, internal and external business partners.

Data Analyst

Data Analytics and Systems teams in Budapest are working as part of ExxonMobil’s global organization and accelerate high-value, actionable insights through the delivery of state-of-the-art, scalable, enterprise data platforms, data science and analytics solutions for our global internal ExxonMobil customers.

We are looking for Data Analysts in our growing Data Analytics and Systems team to help the business get actionable insights from their data for competitive advantage. This job role focuses on gathering and transforming data to enable presenting it in a meaningful format. Typical activities include data gathering, cleansing and transformation to support future Digital Transformation while working to provide step change improvements in master and foundational data for enhanced analytics.

Responsibilities
Acquire data from various transactional data sources
Identify trends, data quality issues, data cleansing
Identify process improvement opportunities, analyze performance indicators
Collaborate with various peer teams and business leadership during the whole data analytics lifecycle
Work closely with business and technology teams and other partners to understand requirements, assess and prioritize deliverables across the whole Data Analytics portfolio

Skills And Qualifications
At least BSC or equivalent industry certification in finance or technology domain and strong interest in data and analytics area
Some experience with relational database management systems, data gathering and transformation
Good understanding of key technical terms, concepts and technologies
Good communication skills and ability to work in global teams
Willingness for continuous professional development and improvement

We Offer
Learn and apply state-of-the-art Data Analytics technologies, work with and influence global vendors like SAP and Microsoft
Strong professional development in the Data Analytics domain and other IT areas such as relational databases, applications and ERP systems (SAP and non-SAP), network and security
Numerous internal and external training opportunities, support in achieving additional degrees, industry wide recognized certificates, learning new languages
Performance driven competitive compensation and benefit package
Healthy work-life balance, flexible working conditions, working from home
Floating holidays, pension and private health fund, and many more

Corporate Separateness Notice

Nothing in this material is intended to override the corporate separateness of local entities. Exxon Mobil Corporation has numerous affiliates, many with names that include, but are not limited to, ExxonMobil, Exxon, Esso and Mobil. For convenience and simplicity in this Site, those terms and terms like corporation, company, our, we and it’s are sometimes used as abbreviated references to specific affiliates or affiliate groups. Abbreviated references describing global or regional operational organizations and global or regional business lines are also sometimes used for convenience and simplicity. Similarly, ExxonMobil has business relationships with thousands of customers, suppliers, governments, and others. For convenience and simplicity, words like venture, joint venture, partnership, co-venturer, and partner are used to indicate business relationships involving common activities and interests, and those words may not indicate precise legal relationships

title: Data/Business Analyst
role-description:
En ARTYCO estamos en medio de un proyecto de evolución de nuestra propuesta de valor. Estamos alineando nuestros productos y servicios para mostrarnos como los expertos que somos en dar servicios avanzados de analítica de datos de clientes y desarrollo y ejecución de estrategias relacionales. Somos los que manejamos el dato en el marketing relacional.

Para hacer crecer este proyecto necesitamos a alguien que asuma el rol de Data / Business Analyst, analizando y comprendiendo las diferentes fuentes de datos para extraer la información relevante e insights. Buscamos a un nuevo componente del equipo que nos ayuda a definir una estrategia con recomendaciones y decisiones de negocio basada en datos.

Algunas de las funciones que realizarías junto con el equipo son:

Experiencia demostrada como Data Analyst o como Data / Business Analyst.
Habilidades analíticas orientadas a recoger, organizar, analizar y distribuir importantes cantidades de información con mucha atención al detalle y a la precisión.
Experiencia utilizando herramientas de inteligencia de negocio (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik, etc)
Con experiencia redactar informes y presentar descubrimientos.
Acostumbrado a realizar análisis de información de cliente, de campañas (emailing, redes sociales…) y web.
Acostumbrado a trabajar mediante metodologías ágiles.
Titulación en Marketing / Investigación de Mercados, Estadística o Sociología.
Complementario o titulación en Ciencias Informáticas, Ingeniería o similar, pero con foco o especialidad en marketing y análisis.
Se valorará conocimientos de estadística y experiencia usando paquetes estadísticos para analizar conjuntos de datos (SPSS, SAS etc)
¿Qué buscamos en ti?

Creación de informes, cuadros de mando y KPIs
Seguimiento de objetivos de negocio
Identificación de target para acciones de marketing
Explotación y análisis en Power BI
¿Qué conocimientos serían un plus?

Data-driven profiling, que se base en los datos para la toma de decisiones.
Perfil creativo, proactivo y disruptivo, que busque crecimiento y mejora continua tanto en su desarrollo profesional como en el desarrollo de los proyectos que acometa.
Visión global, capaz de entender diferentes puntos de vista y analizar situaciones desde ángulos que proporcionen soluciones diferentes.
¿Qué te podemos ofrecer?:

Formar parte de un gran proyecto de cambio y crecimiento
Jornada flexible
Teletrabajo
¿Crees que puede ser un proyecto interesante para ti? Nos gustaría hablar contigo y contártelo de primera mano. ¿Charlamos? ¡Muchas gracias!

role-description:

Who We Are

As part of RUPEAL group, KWAN is an IT Staffing company which specialises in the art of professional fulfilment, making sure that anyone who works with us, from clients, to candidates, to consultants, is in the right path for achieving their motivations!

title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst & Lead Management (m/f)
role-description:
We are looking for a growth hacker interested in creating and implementing experiments that validate revenue-influencing changes. You love playing with data and come up with impactful ideas for the growth of product and business.

Responsibilities
This individual will help lead the growth charge with innovative, data-proven changes to the website that drives revenue and traffic growth.
Build world-class A/B experiments using custom JavaScript, JQuery, HTML, CSS, as well as testing suites from the likes of Visual Website Optimiser and inhouse tooling.
Work with engineering, design and the rest of the product team to execute initiatives identified.
Define ‘minimally viable tests’ and implement them live.
Develop testing ideas based on web analytics, user testing and just your intuition.
Manage an ongoing queue of experiments from multiple business functions.
Run tests to not only prove new revenue opportunities but to also product developments that users don’t actually want.
Collaborate with product team, founders and other teams to develop hypotheses, analyze test data, derive insights and develop recommendations.

Skills Required
You are methodical in your approach to writing, testing, and designing code for experiments
Data analysis: You are very comfortable with gathering data and using spreadsheets to make data decisions
Are painfully familiar with all the challenges of the various web browsers
Have working knowledge of SQL
Ability to seamlessly transition from high-level creative brainstorming to conducting an experiment and sweating the details
Know your way around Web Analytics tools such as Google Analytics
You can make a cost benefit analysis of doing an experiment, so you can prioritise your experiments
Tinker with platform APIs and help create industry-leading growth tactics
Analyze and report growth success to the management team
Apply to Emoree: anwesh(at)emoree(dot)de.

More at Emoree: www.emoree.de/jobs

More at Emoree on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/emoree.de

title: Data Analyst (12 month FTC) - London Soho
role-description:
Why PlayStation?

PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. We’ve thrilled gamers since 1994, when we launched the original PlayStation. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in interactive and digital entertainment. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.

Role Overview

The European Sales Planning & Analysis team is looking for a Data Analyst to be based in the London office, operating in a team of 4 analysts, and reporting to the Head of Analysis.

The role requires an individual who possesses excellent technical ability, with an openness to learn and develop new skills and experience in both video games and analysis working alongside an experienced team. A self-starting attitude, a strong attention to detail and a passion to explore data are essential.

Responsible for interrogating large sets of data from various sources, using a variety of business intelligence tools. Before interpreting and transforming this data into actionable insight and presenting findings across the business.

The role combines performance reporting and automation across PlayStation hardware & First-Party software, with detailed analysis on how the PlayStation consumer interacts and engages with their console.

What You’ll Be Doing
Support the more senior team members with the current reporting process. Iterate and improve the suite of software & hardware reporting through automation.
Coordinating the collection of sell-through data and commentary with analysts based in each territory team.
Challenging current processes and ways of working, combining creative thinking and a deep understanding of the data and metrics.
Conduct deep-dive analysis and identify trends in consumer behaviour, gameplay and engagement.
Develop new forecasting techniques across hardware, software & peripherals to support the Budgeting process.
Experiment with different visualisations and dashboarding techniques to create new and innovative reporting to clearly communicate value and insights to stakeholders.
What We Are Looking For
1-2 years relevant experience as an analyst, data analyst, or other related occupation
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field, such as Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics or Business
Strong technical skills, ideally with database querying experience (SQL)
An ambition to learn new tools, including, but not limited to MicroStrategy, Tableau, Qlik and Power BI
Confidence to work on their own, and as a part of team, explore new ideas and comfort in presenting to senior management.
Excellent communication skills; able to articulate their analysis effectively and prepared to challenge current thinking backed up by data and insight.
Excitement and interest in videogames and the gaming industry is a definite advantage
Benefits
Discretionary bonus opportunity
Private Medical Insurance
Dental Scheme
London Allowance (if applicable)
25 days holiday per year
On Site Gym
Subsidised Café
Free soft drinks
On site bar
Access to cycle garage and showers
Equal Opportunity Statement

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, legally protected physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

title: Data Analytics Architect
role-description:
Hi. We are ASOS!

Here at ASOS, we want to give everyone the confidence to be their best self, because, when you’re at your best, you can achieve amazing things.

Our Technology team pioneer incredible solutions that change the way our millions of customers can access fashion. We believe that fashion can make you look, feel and be the best version of you and it’s this feeling of empowerment that we want our ASOSers to experience while working with us.

Our ASOSers reflect the diverse society they live in; we celebrate our differences and welcome people from all different walks of life. We’re looking for people who can live and breathe our values of being authentic, brave and creative and we don’t care about labels - we recognise there are endless ways to be ‘you’.

Data Analytics Architect

The Data and Integration Architecture Team is on a mission; empowering ASOS to be the best it can be by driving sustainable competitive advantage through innovative use of data, information and insights. Your expertise will be invaluable, architecting and delivering the right solutions to enable ASOS to become truly data driven.

What You’ll Be Doing
Responsible for driving value by understanding the business strategy and intended goals, ensuring that data analytics solutions can realise that value given the associated constraints
Providing architecture leadership, assurance and direction to analytics implementation teams
Working with Business Analysts and other Architects to understand the requirements needed of the data stored across the ASOS estate
Working with Engineering Team Leads to set and maintain standards and development practices that aid high delivery cadence without impeding robust, scalable and quality solutions
Making sure that data is available to allow projects and initiatives to align with the business strategy
Working with IT Architects, technical specialists, third party software vendors and consultants to ensure that ASOS.com becomes an innovative developer and adopter of data analytics solutions
Working with the Product & Project Managers, to deliver initiatives to scope, schedule and budget and to deliver commitments to the business
Working with the wider Architecture community to continually improve upon Data Analytics awareness and appreciation
Collaborating with the immediate Data Analytics Architecture team to help evolve a centre of excellence whose aim is to continually improve our capabilities to support implementation teams deliver World class software
Working as an ambassador for the technical capability of ASOS IT both internally and externally
Being a keen advocate of quality and continual improvement
Taking part in team and department level meetings and functions

Who We’d Like To Meet

You are an experienced Architect who lives and breathes Data Analytics who seeks to take this best practice and use it in a dynamic environment and make waves in the industry. You’ll also have:
Good analytical and problem-solving skills
Broad expertise in the design and delivery of advanced analytics and business intelligence use cases and solutions
Knowledge of Data Warehousing, Data Lakes, ODS, Data-Marts, CRM, OLAP and other data analytics associated concepts and designs
Excellent communication skills and a diplomatic nature
Highly collaborative and open working style
Commitment to provide a high level of customer service to internal users
Ability to work upon parallel projects to a high standard
Proven experience in the successful delivery and ongoing maintenance of complex, high volume, high performing and high-quality software systems
Working knowledge of big data implementation and associated issues
Experience of implementing/supporting cloud-based solutions

In-depth Knowledge In Most Of The Following Technologies
Data Warehousing and Lake techniques, methodologies, and modeling tools
T-SQL, and the effective use of constraints and Indexes
SQL Server, including SSAS
Database & Table Partitioning and Data Compression
SQL Server Security
Azure technologies in particular SQL DB and SQL Data Warehouse
Expertise with MicroStrategy, PowerBI, or another major end-user reporting and/or visualisation platform

Nice To Haves

Broader base of knowledge on (some of) the following technologies:
Previous experience within the retail industry, eCommerce
Microservices architectures and event capture and processing
Experience of solutions using any of Hadoop, HDInsight, Spark, Databricks, U-SQL
C# / .Net
Python and/or Scala
SSRS
ORM & the exchange between an object-oriented language and a relational database
Experience of virtualisation and containerisation and orchestration systems such as Kubernetes
Source Control, particularly TFS/VSTS and git
Automated deployments, particularly Team City/Octopus, and automated testing
Experience of optimizing SSAS for large data volumes and incremental, trickle-in updates

What’s In It For You
A truly unique, energetic and Agile working environment where you’ll be surrounded by passionate experts in their field from varying backgrounds and industries with two common interests: Technology & Fashion.
Generous salary, bonus and pension matching
Huge staff discount and regular £1 sample sales!
Flexible Benefits scheme
Generous holiday allowance & subsidised canteen
State of the art onsite gym at HQ with free membership
Life insurance, medical care, cycle to work scheme
Excellent Learning & Development schemes and career development programmes
Tech Develops Day – one day per month dedicated to developing yourself and developing others within Tech

title: Senior Data Analyst
role-description:
Senior Data Analyst
Glasgow

We are actively recruiting for a highly skilled Senior Data Analyst to join our Financial Crime Analytics & Data Science Infrastructure Function here in Glasgow. As a key member of this team, you will focus on designing, implementing and managing strategic data platforms and infrastructure to ensure that the Financial Crime function have the tools and the data to undertake analytics work and operationalise it.

What will you be doing?
Work in conjunction with the Product Owner to support the deployment and implementation of the Financial Crime Data and Analytics capability which includes; Data, Tools, Knowledge, Environment.
Support the design and the architecture of the multiple datasets within the Financial Crime Data Lake to ensure that they fulfil the needs of the FCA team and the wider function.
Work closely with the stakeholders across Financial Crime to provide Infrastructure and Data expertise, agree and define support for partnerships with external data vendors and software providers.
Support the wider Financial Crime Analytics, BUK Analytics and BI Analytics teams to productionise/operationalise of models, typologies, profiles and dashboards.
Collaborate with FCA Leads to understand key financial crime analytics priorities for the bank and identify how the existing data and infrastructure needs to be extended, enhanced and supplemented.
Source and incorporate new datasets based on the requirements of the Financial Crime function.
Manage and oversee the data lifecycle including access rights, retention, integrity and documentation
What We’re Looking For
Strong understanding of data structures with experience defining data and tools standards.
Strong understanding and experience of data engineering and data modelling
High degree of coding ability – significant experience required in any (preferably several) of: Scala, Spark, Python.
Experience in utilising analytic tools for data exploration, analysis and visualisation within the Financial Services / Financial Crime industry
Skills That Will Help You In The Role
The ideal candidate will be creative and forward thinking, striving to improve and find solutions through effective innovation and project management
Some knowledge of the UK and Global Financial Crime regulatory framework would be advantageous
Where will you be working?

This role will be based in the Aurora Building, 1 of our 3 modern City Centre locations until our exciting new campus location overlooking the River Clyde is opened in 2020. Aurora is close to the main stations, other transport links and also benefits from an onsite canteen.

Interested and want to know more about Barclays? Visit home.barclays/who-we-are/ for more details.

Our Values

Everything we do is shaped by the five values of Respect, Integrity, Service, Excellence and Stewardship. Our values inform the foundations of our relationships with customers and clients, but they also shape how we measure and reward the performance of our colleagues. Simply put, success is not just about what you achieve, but about how you achieve it.

Our Diversity

We aim to foster a culture where individuals of all backgrounds feel confident in bringing their whole selves to work, feel included and their talents are nurtured, empowering them to contribute fully to our vision and goals.

Our Benefits

Our customers are unique. The same goes for our colleagues. That's why at Barclays we offer a range of benefits, allowing every colleague to choose the best options for their personal circumstances. These include a competitive salary and pension, health care and all the tools, technology and support to help you become the very best you can be. We are proud of our dynamic working options for colleagues. If you have a need for flexibility then please discuss this with us.

Primary Location

UK-Lanarkshire-Glasgow

Job Type

Permanent/Regular

Posting Range

29 Oct 2019

title: Data Analytics Advisor
role-description:
Negotiable Salary – Plus Benefits – London - J9094

A highly respected organisation based in the heart of London are seeking a subject matter expert to join their highly skilled analysis team. This is an opportunity to influence policy and decisioning, through the delivery of insight.

Role and Responsibilities
Produce high quality statistical analysis on a range of data
Provide detailed insight on the key trends and findings from the data
Present analysis to key stakeholders in an engaging manner.
Play a role in identifying potential new data subscribers
Advise the team on how to use technology and analytics to leverage maximum value
Work collaboratively with colleagues
Explore ways to undertake market forecasting to produce estimated results.
Work with the Data Assistants to improve the level in the data collection process
Deliver the day to day running of the Statistics database
Qualifications, Experience & Skills Required
Strong technical statistical analysis skills.
Advanced knowledge of Excel is essential.
Ability to spot trends in data and communicate these to non technical stakeholders
Strong curiosity and inquisitive nature to unearth anomalies.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Collaborative approach is essential, this team are the data hub of this organisation and the ability to share ideas, mentor and engage is vital.
You are a strong communicator and have the ability to build infomed relationships with stakeholders.
Knowledge of programming, application development and web development would be highly desirable.
If you fit the above job description please contact Roisin McCarthy on click apply or email her on click apply. Please be advised that we can only accept candidates who have the right to work in the UK.

Alternatively, you can refer a friend or colleague by taking part in our fantastic referral schemes! If you have a friend or colleague who would be interested in this role, please refer them to us. For each relevant candidate that you introduce to us (there is no limit) and we place, you will be entitled to our general gift/voucher scheme.

title: Data-analyst (Product)
Sector Data Analyst
role-description:
OVERVIEW
Balyasny Asset Management is looking for an exceptional data analyst to work alongside our London-based Equities portfolio managers (PMs). In this position you will take ownership of the alternative data across all sectors and work closely with PMs to build out data projects that will provide actionable investment insights for your teams. You’ll be involved during every phase of the process, including coming up with potential data ideas to investigate, building out processes to capture new data, and providing recommendations/interpretations of the data. Ultimately you will develop expertise across sectors as you learn how to apply data from a wide variety of sources to answer investment questions.

The right candidate will be equipped with skills that allow them to be self-sufficient in the process of finding data sources, performing ETL, analyzing and then presenting data results to their team. The role requires a high degree of autonomy during the research, planning and execution phases, therefore the candidate must be a self-starter with an entrepreneurial mind-set and have exceptional problem solving skills.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborate with investment staff to brainstorm creative uses for data in the investment process
Conduct research autonomously to learn where data exists and how it can be retrieved and analyzed in order to help build investment theses
Work with portfolio managers to prioritize projects that show strong potential in answering questions on their stocks
Collaborate with data strategy team to discover new sources that can be beneficial for each sector
Build scripts that will improve our proprietary data evaluation process by making it more flexible or scalable across data sets
Design, develop, and deploy scripts and processes to connect various data sources (e.g. web, vendor databases, and unstructured survey data)
Monitor automated data collection and cleansing infrastructure
Analyze data using standard statistical tools and techniques
Pinpoint trends, correlations and patterns in complicated data sets to provide custom solutions to management
 QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science or a related field
Strong analytical, data processing and programming skills (Python/SQL/Excel a must)
Have experience with projects that leverage programming to perform modeling, visualization or web scraping tasks
Ability to explain technical concepts (programming/databases/stats) to non-technical audiences
Ability to make recommendations when faced with imperfect information
Strong oral and written communication skills, most importantly, must be a team player
Basic to intermediate understanding of financial models

title: Game Data Analyst
role-description:
GAME DATA ANALYST

Do you want to be part of a worldwide mobile games leader? We are an international team of more than 330 talented SocialPointers, based in sunny and cosmopolitan Barcelona. We create amazing games, positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, played and loved by over 50 million fans all over the world.

Join us and help us make 2019 the breakout year in mobile social gaming.

About The Role

As a Game Data Analyst in our global Analytics team you will work to understand our gamers' behaviour, work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention and user conversion.

Applying quantitative analysis, statistics and programming, you'll draw business insights that add real value to Social Point. To truly make an impact you'll need to learn quickly and work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with our Game Teams and Heads of Product.

You Will
Work with the Game Teams to provide insights into user behaviour and answer key business questions.
Perform hands-on research, data exploration and analysis.
Communicate, define and visualize analysis and results to senior stakeholders, including: Head of Analytics, VPs of Product, the CEOs and other C-level executives.
Acting as the liaison between product, game developers, data engineers and data scientists to ensure our data is precisely specified, understood and consistent.
Team up with other data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Using predictive analytics to predict how users will react to changes in the Games.

You have
Significant experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value, preferably in a mobile B2C business.
A strong undergraduate degree in a quantitative subject area (such as Statistics, Math, or Computer Science) from a leading university. A postgraduate degree is a plus.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.
Very strong SQL.
Solid skills implementing data science models with Python, R or Matlab.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, experience presenting to business stakeholders.
A passion for turning data into actionable insights.
You are fluent in written and spoken English. Fluent Spanish is a plus.
Solid skills visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau, Looker or Chartio.

You are
Creative and innovative, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.
A fast learner, highly meticulous, a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win
Able to operate sensitively in multi-cultural environments and build effective working relationships.


What We Offer You

First of all, we can offer you a challenging and fun role within a cool team!
Sounds like what other companies also say they have? Hold on, here's what's more:
You'll get the newest and most powerful devices and equipment to work with, along with a Spotify Premium account.
"Mens sana in corpore sano" is the Latin for "a healthy mind in a healthy body". Our SocialPointers get a healthy Monday breakfast + delicious daily lunch menus! Want to stay in shape? We have a brand new gym, football and basketball teams along with a fantastic physiotherapist.
"An apple a day keeps the doctor away" so we get fresh fruit at the office every day but of course you also get a private medical insurance, just in case.
Monthly events are there to get you to know your colleagues, drop by our hairdresser's to get ready (and forget your wallet).
People development is key for us: coupling an amazing training budget just for you and our internal mobility programs you get real growth opportunities!
If you are new to sunny Barcelona you can also join our Newbies Club: we offer weekend activities once a month, Spanish lessons and help with all your boring paperwork!

The list just goes on and on... so get your game on and apply now!

Are you ready to level up?

Press start.

title: Data Analyst - Asset Manager - Start up
role-description:
The Panel is currently engaged to source a Data Analyst on behalf of a new Asset Manager start up in Dublin city centre on a permanent basis . In this role you will work with the Head of Investments and the group investment team to enable the team to make smarter data-driven decisions and support an effective investment management oversight system. The role will also require the candidate to assist with other projects or initiatives across the Investment Office and the Irish office in general.

Responsibilities:
pply data mining techniques using state-of-the-art methods
Conduct statistical analysis, and build high quality prediction systems that assist with the research and risk management function behind our investment products
Use AI and data to explore ways to support Alpha generation and enhance risk and operational efficiencies
Extend company’s data with third party sources of information when needed
Enhance data collection procedures where necessary
Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis
Create automated anomaly detection systems and constantly track their performance
Assist the Head of Investments to embed the Company’s investment management processes and policies in light of’ business developments and Irish regulatory requirements

Requirements:

Advanced MS Office knowledge
Data mining / analytics background
Understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms
Experience with data visualisation tools
Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL
Experience with a variety of databases
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc

The salary for this role is negotiable depending on experience

Please contact Liam Murphy if you meet the key criteria and wish to apply.

title: Data Analyst - Lisbon
role-description:
At Daltix (Full-time), in Lisbon, Portugal
Expires at: 2020-01-08

Daltix is a fast-growing, successful data-driven start-up from Belgium with offices in Boom, Ghent and Lisbon. We bring real-time insights to the world of retail. How are we doing that? We have developed a set of tools to gather, process and analyze retail data at massive scale and bring it all together in a state of the art data platform we offer to our clients. So far, we have had great success in doing so. That’s why today Daltix serves customers such as Makro, Lidl, Dreamland, Jumbo, Greenyard, Unilever and many others.

Sign me up! No wait... What will I be doing?
We are looking for a kickass Data Analyst who is excited to become a true Data Master based in Lisbon. This role will give you the opportunity to have a direct, positive impact on our business as well as our customers.

What Your Typical Day Will Look Like

You will be working on projects that deliver immediate value to our customers. These will involve extracting, transforming & analyzing data to produce actionable insights and reports for our customers who are major retailers and suppliers across Europe.
(Data) Quality will be an important focus when doing these projects.
In addition to working with Daltix’s data lake you will also be cleaning, analyzing and extracting datasets from external sources as well as visualizing data using Tableau/Excel.
Technologies you’ll find yourself using daily include:Python, pandas & jupyter notebooks.
Snowflake Data Warehouse, S3.
BI tools such as Metabase & Tableau.
Schedulers such as Apache Airflow.

Main requirements

Minimum Qualifications

Why you're the one we are dying to meet:

You haveat least 1 year(ideally 2-3 years) ofprofessional experiencewith data analysis using SQL and Python (with pandas)
R experience is also relevant but you should be able to use Python (with pandas) in the end.

You have a great eye for detail and are able to produce accurate, timely reports that meet (or exceed) the needs of our customers.

You are highly proficient in both spoken and written English.
You are curious to learn and you learn fast.
You can work in a team.
You are proactive in your problem-solving.
Your business mind is just as strong as your technical mind. You will be working at the boundary between the technical team and the customer and will need to be able to effortlessly bridge between the two.
You thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment and can adapt to changes in priorities based on dynamic customer needs.

Nice to have

Preferred Qualifications

Previous experience with big data technologies (such as Hadoop, Spark, Airflow).
Great coding skills in Python (with pandas, numpy, …) and deep knowledge of SQL.
Experience with BI tools such as Tableau are a big plus.

Perks

If you still need more convincing…

We are a young, entrepreneurial and fast-growing company; you will have the unique opportunity to shape our future and have a positive impact on our clients’ business
You will be offered a competitive wage in a talented, international team of top-notch experts
Flexible work arrangements with a lot of autonomy in what you do and where you do it - we trust you to know your schedule and work when you feel most productive
You will be able to participate in relevant training to stay at the top of your field.
Health Insurance coverage

Fresh fruit, snacks, tea and coffee on the house
Occasional drinks and team events
A modern office in the heart of Lisbon, the sunshine capital of Europe

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
As a leading mobile games developer, Jam City is looking to “level up” our talent. We’re on the hunt for innovators who consider themselves dynamic, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Are you interested in using data to help drive product decisions and directly influence the experience of millions of people playing our games?

We are looking for passionate & proactive Data Analyst to join our team in Berlin! You will have the opportunity to collaborate with some of the gaming industry's top professionals, touching on large amounts of data, and helping our teams make quick & impactful changes to our games.

The game data analyst works with product managers inside the studio team to analyze player behavior and overall performance in our games. You will collaborate with data scientists and analysts across the company to support live operations that continuously improve engagement and monetization. We are looking for a creative analytical mind that combines quantitative rigor with and deep understanding of what makes mobile games great.

Responsibilities
Responsible for transforming raw data into digestible reports and actionable insights
Work closely with product management team to monitor product health, prioritize features, measure event performance, and optimize merchandising
Setup and maintain live dashboards (i.e. Tableau) and write SQL queries to support rapid decision making
Validate data sets and BI calls in live games to ensure accuracy of event logging and reporting
Conduct deeper inquiries into player behavior by coordinating with central data science team
Provide ad hoc analysis and insights to help interpret player reception of new features or events
Help design controlled experiments to test hypotheses about new features
Present reports on KPIs, event engagement, game economy, and more
Build models to run sensitivities and forecast outcomes
Develop reporting strategies for games in development to ensure event schema and data architecture are set up for efficient, comprehensive analysis
Think creatively about how to use data to answer question or confirm/reject hypotheses

Qualifications
B.A. or B.S. a quantitative field (Math/Statistics, CS, Engineering, Business, Economics, experimental science, or similar), graduate degree a plus
3+ years experience in an analyst role at a mobile gaming company, or similar experience
Ability to think strategically (big picture perspective, consider both the player experience and the business needs) combined with hands-on, execution-oriented attitude
Experience in analytics requirements gathering, solution design and implementation; solid experience in the area of user intelligence / behavior, event tagging / tracking
Knowledge of statistics and statistical models, such as linear / logistic regression, clustering and factor analyses
Expert knowledge of SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools like Tableau
Detail-oriented, leaves no stone unturned, never lets anything slip through the cracks
Communication skills to articulate complex quantitative analyses in a way that a broad game team can understand
Any experience using Python, R, Scala, BigQuery, Databricks, Bayesian Statistics, Machine Learning a plus.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently
Work closely with a cross-functional team, including remote team members and collegues in North and South America.

About Jam City

Jam City is an award-winning mobile entertainment studio providing unique and deeply engaging games that appeal to a broad, global audience.

Led by CEO Chris DeWolfe, former MySpace co-founder and CEO, and COO Josh Yguado, former 20th Century Fox executive, Jam City is the creative powerhouse behind some of the highest-grossing and most enduring mobile games. Jam City’s global franchise Cookie Jam has generated more than half a billion dollars, and Panda Pop has more than 120 million downloads to date.

The company also is the go-to studio for Hollywood, having developed immersive, narrative-rich mobile games around iconic entertainment brands. The company’s popular RPG game Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery was the #1 game in more than 40 countries at its launch in April 2018.

Jam City has nine studios located in Los Angeles (HQ), Berlin, Buenos Aires, Bogotá, Burbank, Cedar Falls, San Diego, San Francisco, and Toronto.

title: Data Analyst (Planning)
role-description:
This Data Analyst (Planning) role provides the opportunity to be a close business partner of our supply team within Taxi, and will provide opportunities to drive seven-figure improvements in EBITDA by improving our tracking and management of contracts. You’ll sit within our excellent in-house planning team, which is led by an ACA-qualified accountant (ex. BDO) and has full responsibility for our end to end management P&L. You’ll also get involved with day to day performance tracking, and forecasting processes
  An ideal candidate would combine strong analytical skills, intellectual curiosity and a collaborative and communicative style. It’s the ideal role for someone with finance skill set, who wants to develop in an “industry role” by working day to day with senior stakeholders.
  Core activities: The analyst would focus on…
  Supporting our Supply team from a Commercial Finance perspective
  Identifying and managing contract rebates - which have a multi million pound impact on our P&L
Working to enforce quality SLAs - driving higher quality of service, and capturing significant value for the business
Ensuring the supply team are appropriately targeted to drive the most value
To do this, you would partner with our core finance team and supply teams
  Understanding current performance (secondary responsibility)
  Provide information and insight into current trading understanding
Feed in to weekly performance meetings with management team
Constantly highlight opportunities and risks to improve business performance
  Planning and forecasting (secondary responsibility)
  Support all planning and forecasting and modelling - we have an independent management P&L owned in this team
Reporting (secondary responsibility)
Work with reporting analysts to rationalise and develop management information ensuring analysis is delivered in a concise,accurate and timely manner


Core skills and experience that we are looking for
Relevant degree in Accountancy, Mathematics, Statistics or Economics / Business
Strong SQL and excel skills for querying and exploring data sets
Experience of business partnering / stakeholder management
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to clearly communicate complex ideas to varied and non-technical stakeholders
Commercial awareness, linking behaviours to business benefit
Ability to prioritise work effectively
  Additional experience that would be beneficial
Relevant accountancy qualifications (CIMA / ACA etc.) – or working towards these
Experience of working in eCommerce, retail and/or travel would be beneficial
Working knowledge of BI tools such as Power BI and Tableau would be a strong plus

title: Data analyst - Copenhagen
role-description:
About Us Roger was founded to make day-to-day financial operations like bill pay, expense management, compliance and bookkeeping as worry-free as possible for business owners, finance teams, accountants and bookkeepers. Roger works as an automated layer on top of a company's accounting software, saving businesses and accountants hours of work every day. We're proud of the product that we've built so far, and our global customer base agree that we're making something complex and tedious simple and maybe even fun.We are backed by some of the best investors in the financial technology space, and most recently raised $7.5m from QED, Silicon Valley Bank and others. Joining Roger is a unique opportunity to join a team that's still small enough to be nimble but has great financial backing and cares about building an excellent product experience and a great team. We hire for attitude and not credentials. Please apply regardless of your educational background. The Opportunity We are looking for a data analyst for our growing product and team. Your primary responsibility will be to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. With a global product and customer base, we have a wealth of numbers waiting to be crunched and processed. You'll be helping the entire team acquiring the right data from our systems, and support our leadership in running the company based on a solid data foundation. We're looking for someone who is an excellent communicator and who can not only perform analysis but can coney the meaning and help strategize opportunities for improvement. You'll be the first data analyst on the Roger team so this is an excellent opportunity to break new ground within the company and make a huge impact from day 1! We expect you to have a strong background in analysis and modeling and very strong knowledge of databases (SQL etc). Programming (Python, Javascript) knowledge is a requirement. This is a remote role and we welcome applicants from anywhere to apply. If you happen to apply from the Bay Area or Copenhagen you are more than welcome to work out of the Roger office in that location. Our Values We're a global company with offices in Copenhagen and San Francisco. Our values are heavily influenced by our Scandinavian roots (both founders are from Denmark), and count humility, humor and inclusiveness. We strive to create a culture where anyone feels part of the family, and we place a great amount of value in hiring for attitude rather than resumes. We support flexibility in everyone's lives, and working at Roger can be easily combined with babies, toddlers and teenagers. We have two primary office locations but have a remote culture that we put a lot of effort into as we believe great talent can be found anywhere. As a remote worker you can be sure to feel like you are as much part of the team as those who come to an office every day. About every 6 months we all get together in person. Our last trips took us to Greece and Spain. Everyone on the team shares a passion for creating the best possible product and user experience, and that is something we value in future team members as well. The Roger Story Roger's founders started the company after exiting their first startup to Cisco Systems. Having experienced all the frustrations with daily financial operations when starting previous ventures, the first gist of an idea for Roger was born in 2016. Since then, international investors from both Europe and the US have supported the growth of the team and the customer base, and the product is now used and loved by thousands of customers worldwide.Roger is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to maintain and develop our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives.

Responsibilities
Working with the product team on product insights and metrics
Supporting broader team and leadership team in acquiring the correct internal data to make decisions
Conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. Develop analysis and reporting capabilities
Monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Excellent communication skills
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases (SQL etc), programming (Python, Javascript)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings

title: data scientist/analyst
role-description:
À propos La société Fluctuo a développé des solutions en mode SAAS pour collecter, analyser et visualiser les données relatives aux services de mobilité partagée (scooters, vélos, trottinettes). Ses clients sont des acteurs publics (villes, agglomérations, autorités organisatrices de transport) et des acteurs privés (opérateurs de transports, éditeurs de solutions de navigation et de cartographie, cabinets de conseil…). Descriptif du poste La mobilité partagée est un champ d’étude et de recherche récent, où presque tout reste encore à faire et à découvrir. Les données collectées par Fluctuo sont une occasion unique de faire avancer la connaissance et apporter une réelle valeur ajoutée aux clients de Fluctuo. Missions: (i) réaliser des études & modélisations statistiques (ii) élaborer des KPI, de leur implémentation en base à leur restitution en datavisualisation (iii) developper des process de traitement automatique des données Au sein d'une petite équipe, il/elle sera en contact direct avec les dirigeants et aura la possibilité de voir concrètement l'impact de son travail sur le développement de la société. D’un point vue métier, ce stage offre la possibilité d’intervenir sur l’ensemble des composants d’une stack data. Profil recherché Bac+4/5 en data science ou disciplines connexes. Maîtrise de R. Expérience en développement d’applications Shiny appréciée. SQL (bon niveau) et postgreSQL. Connaissance de PL/pgSQL appréciée. Interêt pour la datavisualisation de données complexes. Intérêt pour la traitement de la donnée spatio-temporelle & le secteur de la mobilité & des transports. Rigueur, autonomie et esprit d'initiative. Process de recrutement Entretien téléphonique puis entretien face à face Informations complémentaires
Type de contrat : Stage (2 à 6 mois)
Date de début : 01 octobre 2019
Lieu : Paris, France (75013)
Niveau d'études : Bac +4

title: IT Systems and Data Analytics Internship
role-description:
