title: Business/Data Analyst - Level 4
role-description:
Company Description

As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.

At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.

You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays.

Job Description

If you think you could support Visa as a Business/Data Analyst, we want to hear from you – together, let’s make Visa a great place to work.

What’s it all about?
We are seeking a leader to work directly with a top UK bank to deliver positive change for Visa, the Bank and, most importantly, their consumers.
The candidate will be tasked with supporting a long term program of work, with the objective of implementing market leading solutions and propositions for Visa and the Bank
The candidate will be exposed to all areas of the payments and banking landscape, and as such they will need a strong appreciation of the complex and competing drivers & priorities within the ecosystem
The candidate will be responsible for all data and business analysis requirements for the program, utilising Visa’s exceptional data set to identify and quantify areas of opportunity for Visa and the Bank
The candidate will play in critical role in understanding consumer problems and identifying opportunities, building upon quantitative analysis with qualitative insights to drive executive decision making, running research as required.
The candidate will play a key role in the development of propositions within the program, working with the wider team to build propositions and implement solutions to support the Bank’s consumers
The candidate will be joining the team at the very start of the program, and therefore there will be significant opportunity to play a key role in the direction and strategy of the program and for future growth
The program will be digital first, looking to leverage technology and innovation to deliver positive change, so a digital disposition and passion for innovation is a must

What We Expect Of You, Day To Day
Perform data extraction, processing and analysis to support the explicit needs of individual initiatives
Apply data analysis methods and techniques to large, complex data sets, identifying the macro focus areas for the team
Creation and delivery of business cases to support prioritisation and management of initiatives
Utilise data insights to develop propositions alongside the team, following the Visa proposition development process (Discover, Define, Develop & Deliver)
Creation of project content across different mediums such as analysis, reports and presentations
Regularly report upon and present findings to stakeholders across Visa and the Bank
Stakeholder management across all levels of Visa’s and the Bank’s businesses; identifying individuals, building relationships and regularly engaging to ensure smooth delivery of the program
Collaborate with the nominated counterpart inside the bank, developing a deep understanding of their needs and building relationships across the technology and delivery teams
Understand, articulate and champion the consumer and business needs for change across the initiatives, working with the team to ensure a consistent approach to developing propositions
Qualifications

What We’re After…
These individuals should be self-starters, with the ability to think and act independently and having an excellent attention to detail
Educated to degree level or equivalent professional experience
Strong experience extracting and manipulating large datasets using standard tools and is effective at learning new tools
Strong track record of developing customer centric, data driven propositions within financial services or equivalent industry – a consulting background is desired
Excellent business and data analysis skills, with a critical thinking mindset
Excellent written & verbal communication skills
Sound understanding of the product proposition lifecycle and go to market approach
Sound knowledge and experience of new technology, fintech and challenger banks
Strong interpersonal skills/ability to influence with multiple stakeholders both internally and externally, specifically in working in a ‘matrixed’ environment
Candidates should be happy to regularly travel across the UK
Proficient in data analysis tools such as SQL, VisualBasic and SAS is required
Additional Information
Diversity & Inclusion

Universal acceptance for everyone, everywhere, is not only our brand promise, it’s the foundation of our company culture. We foster a feeling of connectedness in the workplace, support diversity of thought, culture and background, fight for important initiatives like Equal Pay and actively work to eliminate unconscious biases that hold us all back.

By leveraging the diverse backgrounds and perspectives of our worldwide teams, Visa is a better place to work and a better business partner to our clients.

Diversity & Inclusion

Universal acceptance for everyone, everywhere, is not only our brand promise, it’s the foundation of our company culture. We foster a feeling of connectedness in the workplace, support diversity of thought, culture and background, fight for important initiatives like Equal Pay and actively work to eliminate unconscious biases that hold us all back.

By leveraging the diverse backgrounds and perspectives of our worldwide teams, Visa is a better place to work and a better business partner to our clients.

Job Number: REF22568D

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
An opportunity for a Data Analyst has just become available at Epyx. They specialise in eCommerce solutions for the automotive sector. Epyx are a member of the Fleetcor Group, a global pioneer in developing new technology to help the fleet industry boost productivity and profitability.

Epyx’s innovative 1Link platform empowers their fleet customers to supercharge business growth, by helping them manage not just vehicle procurement and hire, but maintenance schedules, as well as end-of-life vehicle disposal and relicensing.

1Link has been adopted by 18,000 fleet service providers and nearly all major car manufacturers on behalf of their franchise networks and, to date, has successfully managed more than four million fleet vehicles.

As a Data Analyst, you will be based in Meriden, Coventry working with the Software Engineering team refining data designs, engineering data lakes, and building compelling visualisations.

Key Skills & Duties
Transforming existing operational data into working data marts, lakes and not swamps.
Working closely with the rest of the engineering team, encouraging best practice and principles for data handling, security and storage
Delivering solutions that focus on clean data, positioning data in the right place at the right time.
Improving your skills, learning new technologies across the entire stack and getting exposure to the wider technical environment (e.g. Machine Learning, DevOps, cloud services and architecture).
Contributing to team improvement through discussions, pair programming and code reviews to drive continual improvement, deliver new projects and reduce technical debt

Technology/Tools Used
MS SQL Server (2016+)
SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Data visualisation using Tableau and Web
Data analytics using R
The permanent opportunity for a Data Analyst will pay up to £50,000 plus a competitive benefits package.

If you feel you have the experience to meet the requirements, please apply with an updated CV.

Please note, all third-party applications will be forwarded to Robert Walters.

title: Junior Data Analyst
role-description:
The Smarkets exchange is a multi-billion pound trading platform with a rapidly growing ecosystem of sophisticated users who apply financial trading techniques to the world of betting. We’re looking for a data analyst to join our marketing team and provide valuable, data driven insights on the impact of marketing campaigns. We’re big on continuous improvement at Smarkets, and so a large component of your role will be to analyse the results of campaigns and make actionable recommendations for what we can do differently next time.

Whether it's boosting our customer retention and reactivation, creating and optimising our marketing activities for our entrance into the US, or brainstorming how to measure the success of a new idea with your team, you’ll be able to see the impact of your work at Smarkets.Having generated terabytes of data from multiple sources in an interesting and challenging domain, we are now applying this data to more and more challenges, so there is definitely room for you to be involved in more engineering related activities, such as tooling, so we can sample, combine and extract data from our Redshift and BigQuery databases.

What You’ll Be Doing

Embedded in the marketing team, you’ll be able to help our marketers unlock the insights they need by shaping the questions they’re seeking answers to. Ultimately, the work you do will allow your team to make more informed, data-driven decisions.

More Specifically, You Will Be
Cleaning, structuring, analysing and visualising data from different sources, making it available and understandable within the company
Drawing insights about our customers from data and using that knowledge to design marketing campaigns
Transforming business questions into DB queries and dashboards
Collaborating with data scientists, engineers and marketers across Smarkets
Defining your role in the context of self management (we’ll help you with this)

About You
You’re great at taking ambiguous business questions and turning them into solvable problems
You are passionate about data analysis and engineering
You have a great working knowledge of SQL and database technologies in general
You have a good understanding of the maths behind exploratory data analysis
You have programming skills and some experience in data analysis libraries

Bonus Points
Good working knowledge of data warehouse systems like Redshift or BigQuery
Knowledge of data science, machine learning or scientific computing
Interest in sports betting or trading

About Smarkets

We've built one of the world's largest betting exchanges with significantly better odds than the competition. Our strength is technology and trading with a passion to push the known boundaries of real-time financial technology. With our self-management structure, flexible work environment and uncapped holiday allowance, Smarkets offers a unique opportunity to be part of a great work culture. Our office in St Katharine’s Docks (Tower Hill) comes complete with a fantastic roof terrace and a team of in-house chefs cooking breakfast and lunch every day.

We transfer and store the information you submit to help us process your application and to make our hiring process better. We also make use of third-party hiring tools to help us process applications. As we are based in both Europe and the United States, your data may leave the European Economic Area when we process it. Please only submit your application if you are happy for us to use your information in this way.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Data Analyst

Location: Newbury

We have an exciting position for a Data Analyst to join our Data & Insights team in UK Enterprise Transformation.

In this role you will be working on a high level programme where you will produce reports, task boards providing actionable insight to drive Transformation & Change programmes.

Your Role
Create consistent, accurate on-time reporting, understanding the numbers and their implications, flagging any suspicious changes internally and with the corresponding stakeholders.
Support on automating and scripting different process related to Simplify (ordering, sales, Kosmos validation…)
Find ways of improving the quality of the reports proactively, whether that is raising requirements into IT or finding alternative solutions to tackle existing sources
Work with other members of the Insight Factory and Product Management to compile and interrogate/interpret the initial data that can be retrieved to build confidence that we are proceeding in the right direction.

About You

You will have a background in BI/MI/Data Analytics with experience producing high quality reporting but also making actionable insight recommendations to the business.

You will be experienced in SQL, VBA, Business Objects and other MI tools such as Tableau, Visual Insights & MicroStrategy.

About Us

We are more than Mobile, check out the video below to find out more:

https://www.youtube.com/watchv=aIPJQse4QTs&feature=youtu.be

Why Us?

Not only would you be working for a global, innovative & forward thinking organisation, but you’d get to work with a fun, diverse and driven team who love what they do. You’d be supported by an encouraging leadership team who will inspire you to be your very best. We will also give you 28 days’ holiday, award winning maternity/paternity cover & flexible working options to help you balance work and life!

Apply now, we can’t wait to hear from you!

Our Commitment

Vodafone is committed to making reasonable adjustments for all candidates considered to have a disability during the recruitment assessment process. Should you meet the minimum criteria for the role you are applying to, we will contact you to discuss the reasonable adjustments that you may need.

title: Senior Data Analyst
role-description:

Understanding business needs to design and build statistical analysis to satisfy business requirements.
Being an expert at turning complex data and large data sets into easy to understand visuals which can be presented and articulated to senior audiences (up to MD level).

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
At Elliptic, we believe cryptocurrency will play a huge role in the future of value transfer, and we care deeply about helping to build this future. In order for cryptocurrency to flourish, it’s important to prevent criminal abuse of the technology. Elliptic is the global leader in detecting, preventing, and pursuing criminal activity in cryptocurrencies. Our clients include the world’s leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies.

Our unique platform gives us an unparalleled understanding of cryptocurrency capital flows, using a combination of network science and machine learning to aggregate and interpret vast quantities of transaction data. We provide anti-money laundering (AML) compliance software and investigative services to the leading participants in the cryptocurrency ecosystem. Customers rely on us to analyse more than $150bn of their transactions every month, and include cryptocurrency businesses, major financial institutions, and federal government agencies.

The company has offices in London, NYC, Singapore & Tokyo. We are backed by SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group.

What's the role?

The quality of our data is at the heart of our business. This Data Analyst role is truly cross functional, supporting our Professional Services, Community and Data teams, through the identification and reporting of crypto and blockchain industry trends and activity, as well as producing accurate and insightful analysis with our internal data to improve our understanding of the business and shape the future of Elliptic.

The Data Analyst’s role is to discover value across all of our internal data assets, as well as integrating various third party data sources. The analyst will need to distil these data sources into easy to read dashboards and reports to be used both internally and for our clients. Ultimately, we are looking for someone who is used to working with unstructured large data sets and turning them into valuable insight, resulting in clear directions and actions rather than just producing charts and dashboards.

What You'll Do
Compile data from disparate systems to develop dashboards and reports for both internal Elliptic users, and Elliptic clients
Collect requirements from stakeholders across the business to improve internal and external reporting
Prioritise and schedule incoming data requests from various areas of the business
Understand the complex relationships of our data and maintain consistency of our reporting across various systems and currencies
Perform data quality reviews and communicate with data owners on any issues and work with them to request and implement change to promote more efficient analysis efforts
Work with the data team to gather data across systems, understanding changes, and troubleshooting errors that may arise
Take the initiative to look for areas to improve reporting and adjust reports as decisions change and priorities shift
Use datasets and queries to generate, maintain, and disseminate both routine and ad hoc reporting
Maintain reporting process documentation and train the data team on reporting and analysis functions


Requirements
4+ years of work experience in a related field
Relevant experience with SQL and Python for data analysis
Good understanding of data management best practices and able to demonstrate an understanding of data process automation, ETL and databases.
Comfortable with quantitative data analysis and basic statistical analysis
Experience using data visualisation tools, such as Tableau, Power BI or Sisense
Excellent working knowledge of spreadsheets and BI tools
Ability to multitask in a fast fast environment while still operating with a high level of attention to detail
Knowledge and understanding of various data feeds and how to access them
Ability to express complex technical and non-technical concepts verbally, graphically, and in writing
Experience with managing large, unstructured datasets
Being a self-starter and a self-directed team player who is well-versed the domains of agile processes and continuous improvement
Being willing to roll up your sleeves sometimes to help the team


Benefits
Competitive salary
Share options
Private Vitality health insurance & wellness incentive programmes
Work pension scheme
Shiny laptop and multiple monitors
Budget for training materials, events, and conferences
Collaborative, flexible and friendly environment with options for remote working
Quarterly full day offsites
Annual company 3 day offsite
Coffee and beer!
Being part of a business with a purpose, and the opportunity to work with a passionate team of mission-driven people who’ll stretch and challenge you
Elliptic is not a traditional financial services firm. We pride ourselves on having a laid-back and friendly ethos, while still expecting great things from our team. Fascinating work is the norm - working at Elliptic is never boring!

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
At Stocard (Full-time), in Mannheim, Germany
Salary: €45.000 - €60.000
Expires at: 2019-11-11

Shape the future of mobile wallets with us!


We are Europe's market leader for mobile wallets and are looking for outstanding talent to join us on our quest to become the world's No.1 mobile wallet. Backed by some of the top investors in Europe, Australia and the US, our user base has quickly grown to more than 40 million loyal users across the globe, who digitize all rewards cards with their smartphones. Driven by passion and by using cutting-edge technologies, our team is redefining the future of shopping. We have been listed as one of the best apps of the year by Apple and are one of the selected few Android Excellence apps. If you are looking to work at a friendly and fast-growing startup in one of the most exciting industries, this is your chance!

As a member of our Data Analytics team, you will mine massive amounts of user data and perform large-scale data analysis to extract useful business insights.

We always keep the user in the center of our development, and want to make our app as simple to use as possible. Take initiative to analyze the user data and propose improvements that will lead to a better user experience while keeping the simplicity we strive for. Implement the new algorithms in a scalable and high-performance way, and develop internal tools to manage the data they need. During the entire process, you will be working in a cross-functional team contributing to the overall experience and architecture.

For our internal team, you will design and implement reporting dashboards that track key business metrics and provide actionable insights. Share your knowledge and keep up the high level of quality we strive for through reviews, pair programming and mentoring. Focus on a great user experience and use data from our users to make the app perfect!

Some great projects our Analytics team has been working on lately…


Location infrastructure that automatically identifies store locations based on a custom high-performance clustering algorithm, automatic merging and consolidation of different data sources, and a user interface to manage it all
Identified and created user segments to optimize utility for the users and our campaign performance
Algorithm to display better matching top cards for each user
Visualize our billions of data points to create live and actionable reports for our business customers

Main requirements

Interest in apps, mobile technologies and mobile wallets
Excellent data manipulation, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Experience in coding and scripting with JavaScript, Python or another programming language
Well-organized working style with a lot of attention to detail, ability to show initiative and determination
Ability to work well in a team-oriented environment providing ideas and open feedback
Bachelor, Master or PhD degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, or a related technical field

Nice to have

Work experience in a Startup

Perks

An energetic and motivated team in a product-focused culture
An inspiring working atmosphere in a beautiful open office space with a spectacular view of the waterfront
Excellent equipment of your choice and access to the best tools available
Skill sharing, tech talks and internal hackathons
Regular team lunches, fresh office snacks & drinks
Enjoy a healthy lifestyle with our subsidized gym membership

title: Senior Data Analyst
role-description:
Description

Whilst pockets of insight and analytics exist, building our analytical capabilities is a core pillar of Dyson's new global data strategy. As more consumers engage with Dyson, owning more types of products, and across more markets, the volumes of data is now vast. Understanding how to use this data to improve everything from customer experiences, campaign development and retailer business planning will all be key to Dyson’s success.

This role sits within the Great Britain & Ireland (GB&I) Business Intelligence & Analytics team and is tasked with ensuring that the GB&I market are able to leverage rich, accurate, timely data that drives reporting and analytics to generate insights and make data driven decisions.

Accountabilities
Bring together disparate data sources & metrics from both internal and external data sources leveraging the latest cloud technologies and programming languages
Build data pipelines, data models & utilise predictive analytics that answer key questions in relation to the respective business units
Create relevant and meaningful outputs that enable data sharing and aid decision making
Make improvements and efficiencies to existing processes, specifically through automation in Google Cloud Platform
Skills
Previous experience with data lakes and or data warehouses, preferably Google Cloud Platform
Skilled in writing performant SQL & Python.
Experience with Google Cloud Data Analytics Products such as BigQuery, Data Flow, Data Proc etc. (or similar cloud based platforms)
Experience with statistical programming languages
Working knowledge of data science modelling concepts
Enthusiasm to explore new technologies, methods and techniques.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Benefits
27 days holiday plus eight statutory bank holidays
Pension scheme
Life assurance
Sport centre
Free on-site parking
Subsidized café and restaurants
Discounts on Dyson machines

title: Insight Data Analyst
role-description:
Founded in 2007, Babbel is the world’s top-grossing and most effective language-learning app. No small feat, and no small challenge. In a moment rife with talk of walls, we’re building bridges — making the language-learning journey as exciting and empowering as possible, helping people forge new connections and participate in worlds bigger than their own. We do things that matter. And foremost, we make people speak their new language as they’ve always wanted to. Come work with us.

There’s still so much to do.

Babbel is for everyone, not some niche or elite strata of learners. Everyone. As our user base has grown, so has what they need from us. Their learning needs, life experiences, and reference points become more varied and colourful by the day. Meeting that means ensuring users see themselves reflected —not just in our product— but the world it allows them to imagine with us. That means reflecting the dynamism and diversity of our users, as much as possible, in the production of Babbel. We currently have 600 people from more than 50 nationalities working in our Berlin and New York offices, challenging and learning from each other at every step. A culture of difference and dignity is critical to how we’ve connected with millions of users, in every hemisphere.

We are looking for a Data Insight Analyst to join our Team in Berlin!

In this role you’ll work in a small team of internal consultants specialised in data analytics, data democratisation, and data communication/storytelling. We want to make our organisation data-driven with carrots, not sticks. Together we will find a way to drive organisational change and create processes and initiatives to inspire Babbelonians and change the way we work.

You will
Work closely with Data Scientists and our stakeholders in Product, Marketing, Didactics, HR supporting them with their daily work with (self-service) BI tools and data insights in general
Drive data literacy in the organisation, e.g. by holding workshops, visualizing data, ideating initiatives to make us more data driven
Help level up, co-own and run our Data Academy program with your expertise and your ideas

You will:
2+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, BI Analyst, Data Visualisation Specialist, Data Journalist, or Researcher
Experience with R or Python, SQL or other RDB; and/or, experience with BI tools like Tableau, or Amplitude
Experience with metrics and KPIs, how to track and contextualise them
Experience working in the tech/online industry
Excellent communication
Good organisational and project management skills

You are

Equal parts analytical and creative, enjoy working with numbers and with people
A creative problem solver, you think outside the box
Proactive in addressing issues and problems
Capable of dealing with uncertainty
Detail oriented
Flexible and adaptable
Patient and empathetic

Why Babbel?
Babbel is the world’s most successful language learning app. Work with us to make a real impact in the world, in a meaningful way.

Work directly with our unique language learning data
Hackdays and technology brown-bags
A lively startup atmosphere with friendly working hours
Great company benefits (company bike, fresh fruits & drinks etc.)
Start-up mentality and attractive working environment in the heart of Berlin

#LifeAtBabbel

Work on something that truly matters and transforms the lives of millions
Learn and grow with the Babbel Academy, great trainings, and challenging projects
Work with creative discretion and ownership from day one
A culture that treats individual differences as strength
Meet and collaborate with colleagues at hackdays, brownbag talks, and parties
30 vacation days, flexible hours, a company bike, a metro ticket and a family room
Offices in the heart of buzzing Berlin and New York

title: BI ANALYST (m/f/d)
role-description:
BI ANALYST (m/f/d)

title: Data Analyst Intern
role-description:
As a Data Analyst Intern, you will be placed within our Supply Chain Planning organization, in Central Analytics Team (which was created just a year ago) in Barcelona. The main tasks of the team include developing new ways of reporting using the latest technologies, with special focus on standardization, automation and visualization. Apart from that, the team is also delivering training on reports and new tools to the wider SC organization, and occasionally supports the Planning community with ad-hoc analytics related tasks.

In this role, you will take part in all of the team’s activities, all the way from business requirements mapping / consultations with stakeholders, to delivering a solution using our cloud-based data warehouse as a back-end, and PowerBI and Excel as a front-end tool. You will also have the responsibility to prepare a few reports on a regular basis, until they are in a good enough state to be handed over to our reporting center in India.

In This Role, You Will
Set the new standards of analysis by migrating Excel-based reports into PowerBI, in order to make interactive, drillable visualizations
Take part in the journey of automating a significant part of our reporting portfolio using different data transformation tools
Collaborate with planners and other functions like Procurement and Logistics to identify and carry out data-driven improvement projects
Prepare high complexity, ad-hoc analysis to different stakeholders
Create / Take-over, document, and maintain standard reports that are used by the business on daily, weekly or monthly basis
Maintain SQL databases, oversee automation pipelines and manually intervene if needed
Support solving any issue we might face regarding our current reporting portfolio, which usually means de-bugging, root cause analysis, reflecting changes in documentations, training and communication
You are the ideal candidate for this role if you:
Are currently studying / just finished studies in an Economic / Technological / IT field
Are fluent in English
Use Microsoft Office, especially Excel confidently (complex formulas, pivoting is a minimum)
Have a large interest towards database management and development – the knowledge of SQL or other DML languages is a huge plus
Are keen to learn about cloud-based technologies (Azure Data Factory) and develop automation pipelines
Have already experimented with data visualization methods using BI tools – experience withtools such as Tableau, QlikView or PowerBI is a large plus
Know your way around SAP, and understand the logic of ERP systems
Are familiar with the latest technologies and follow the new developments in the area of technology/multimedia
Work well within a team, are ready to build good relationships and communicate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Have the ambition to “walk that extra mile”, and open for intellectual challenges
Focus on delivering results and have a project-oriented mindset
Are motivated by working independently on projects with occasional support from other team members and your team leader
Are passionate about your work, and love if others around you feel the same
Are able to successfully manage your responsibilities, even if it means multitasking with limited oversight
Having a self-developers mindset, and willingness to constantly learn is much more important than meeting all the above criteria – feel free to apply if you don’t meet some of the conditions

What Ecolab Offers To You In This Role
Competitive internship stipend
Flexible work-time, respecting your other duties at the university (but at least 20 hours/week)
Being part of a new team that has been established from scratch only one year ago
Discovering together how a team of young enthusiasts can work efficiently on new processes to improve the way how a multinational company operates
Workshop and project-like team environment, where creative ideas and additional effort is greatly appreciated
Chance to lead subprojects, experiment with different technologies to translate data into value-adding solutions
Focus on your personal and professional development
Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Ecolab, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every associate can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.

In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce. Ecolab is a place where you can grow your career, own your future and impact what matters.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Make an impact on the browsing experience of 322 million users worldwide.

Have you ever dreamed of making a real impact on the way people access the web? Well, then working at Opera should be exactly right for you! Here, the innovations you create quickly get implemented and delivered to our users.

Opera seeks exceptional data analysts to join our team in Wrocław. You will work with product managers, other analysts and designers for improving our products. Everything the team does is being used on a daily basis by our executive team for decision making

Responsibilities
Identify, analyze and interpret trends and patterns in complex data sets
Analyze results using statistical methods
Provide and visualize reports
Develop dashboards presenting various product metrics
Develop prediction models
Working in Google BigQuery, Jupyter Notebooks, JIRA and GIT

Requirements
Bachelor's/Master's in Mathematics/Computer Science/Data Analysis or equivalent
1+ years of experience in working with big data
SQL / Python programming skills
Experience with statistics
Analytical skills
Fluency in English, written and spoken
Location: Wrocław, Poland (no remote work)

title: Business DATA Analyst
role-description:
Au sein de la direction grand public et pro, vous serez rattaché au pôle Performance de la Direction du Développement Commercial de Bouygues Telecom qui sont en charge d'animer l'activité commerciale /clients de Bouygues Telecom sur l'ensemble des canaux : RCBT, Ventes On Line, Télévente / Direction Commerciale.

Un(e) Business DATA Analyst conçoit et réalise des outils de suivi et pilotage de la performance commerciale des canaux de distribution de Bouygues Telecom

Développe une dimension omincanale avec pilotage des flux et rebonds entre les canaux.

Réalise des bilans quanti sur les opérations commerciales (trade, communication, prix produit, …) et réalise des analyses de performance ad'hoc

title: DATA ANALYSIS SPECIALIST
Junior Data Analyst
role-description:
Junior Data Analyst
Based at Asda House in Leeds

About The Role
Working in the Merchandising Strategy team, an integral team within the Merchandising function, you will be responsible for producing and maintaining insightful analytical reports to enable the Merchandising teams manage their categories and produce market-leading planograms. You’ll be working alongside our international partners developing new solutions for the business, whilst also collaborating with internal data analysts.

You will ideally have 1 year industry placement experience as a Data Analyst or 6 months + employment experience. This role will suit someone looking to progress in their career and learn new tools such as R, C# and Python.

What You’ll Be Responsible For
Develop and maintain SQL code and Alteryx flows
Work alongside our International Data Analytic Teams in developing tools for all Walmart markets
Have the ability to manage data, testing and feeding back for continual improvement
Develop & maintain accurate Tableau dashboards
Develop, maintain and ensure accurate Merchandising BI reports
Day to Day administration and continuous improvement of Core Merchandising Systems
Identify opportunities for innovation, to meet or exceed the needs of our customers and colleagues
Ensure all operational solutions are fit for purpose
Ensure all solutions make things better for customers, simpler for colleagues and cheaper for Asda
Deliver internal metrics
Resolve issues quickly, effectively and without disruption to our colleagues or customers

About you:
Degree in Maths, Statistics or Computer Science (or similarly highly numerate subject) or experience within a Data Analysts role would be desirable
Understanding of Alteryx, SQL, Tableau and/or Power Bi software
A working knowledge of languages such as C#, Python and R is desirable
A problem solving mind-set
An ability to engage with key stakeholders from all areas of the business
A proactive approach, owning and managing several projects at once
Strong written and verbal communication skills

Your benefits:
You’ll receive an excellent benefits package which includes colleague discount off your shopping, share save scheme, free parking, competitive pension and discount off selected gyms. We also like to share our success; after all you made it happen, so every eligible colleague is also part of the Asda bonus scheme. The development opportunities are endless and we’ll support you every step of the way.

title: Stage Data Analyst (H/F)
role-description:
QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?

Thales propose des systèmes d’information et de communication sécurisés et interopérables pour les forces armées, les forces de sécurité et les opérateurs d’importance vitale. Ces activités, qui regroupent radiocommunications, réseaux, systèmes de protection, systèmes d’information critiques et cybersécurité, répondent aux besoins de marchés où l’utilisation des nouvelles technologies numériques est déterminante. Thales intervient tout au long de la chaîne de valeur, des équipements aux systèmes en passant par le soutien logistique et les services associés.

Nos équipes de l’activité Systèmes d’information critiques et cybersécurité fournissent des services et des solutions globales optimisant la performance, la résilience et la sécurité des systèmes d’information afin de faire face aux ruptures technologiques et aux cybermenaces.

Thales cherche un(e) Data Analyst en stage - H/F

Basé(e) à Grenoble

Projet

Créations de rapports d’analyse

Pour un client de l’énergie, Thales travaille sur l’architecture et d’industrialisation d’indicateurs financiers sur l’application de Business Intelligence « QlikSense » et « Power BI » dans un contexte confidentiel des données.

Les Principales Attentes Sont
Importer, agréger et sécuriser les données
Optimiser le modèle de données actuel pour en faciliter la compréhension et la maintenance
Concevoir et pérenniser un système de mise à jour des données
Design de nouveaux graphiques/indicateurs selon les besoins

Encadrement

Pendant ce stage, vous apprendrez les bonnes pratiques de la data visualisation puis les mettrez en pratique sur les projets proposés et participerez à un projet utilisant une méthodologie Agile.

Vous êtes accompagné par un data analyst senior.

Missions

Dans ce contexte, le stage proposé permettra de participer au développement de rapports d’analyse, dans une équipe de quatre ingénieurs afin de découvrir les aspects métiers et prendre en main les outils, bonnes pratiques et règles de codages utilisés sur le projet.

Environnement Technique
Power BI
QlikSense
Talend
Bases de données PostGre

Profil

De formation Bac+5 à dominante informatique avec un premier contact avec les technologies data.

Stage en vu d'une embauche.

Innovation, passion, ambition : rejoignez Thales et créez le monde de demain, dès aujourd’hui.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Barcelona
role-description:
En Iwantic , primera agencia española especializada en selección de perfiles digitales, reclutamos a los candidatos más brillantes para los empleos que están cambiando el mundo.

Desde nuestra división especializada en Big Data , estamos seleccionando varios perfiles de Business Intelligence Analyst para desarrollar su labor en una empresa del sector retail con sede en Barcelona .

Funciones
Desarrollo de análisis funcionales y técnicos de procesos de negocio, en especial en las áreas de operaciones, ventas y marketing.
Configuración y desarrollo de herramientas de visualización (QlikSense y Cognos).
Construcción y mantenimiento del Datawarehouse: modelado de datos, diseño de procesos, testing, despliegue de software, construcción y gestión.
Desarrollo de procesos de ETL y modelado de datos en SSIS y ODI.
Organizar workshops de training a usuarios de negocio.
Requisitos
Formación superior técnica (Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones o similares).
Experiencia en análisis de procesos de negocio, preferentemente en el sector Retail.
Conocimientos técnicos en herramientas de BI (SQL Server, Cognos, QlikSense).
Conocimientos en ofimática y macros VBA.
Conocimientos QlikSense: creación de visualizaciones, conectores, scripts...
Orientación al desarrollo de software y análisis de datos (ETL).
Conocimientos de Bases de Datos (SQL server).
Conocimientos OLAP y análisis multidimensional en Cognos.
Ser una persona motivada y resolutiva en ambientes muy dinámicos.
Capacidad de comunicación a nivel funcional y técnico.
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo.
Conocimientos de inglés.
Si estás buscando un cambio profesional, ¡no dudes y aplica!

title: Data Analyst and Reporting
role-description:
As a data analyst you bring your technical expertise to ensure the quality of accuracy of data. You will take responsibility for collecting, organizing and analyzing data that can be translated in relevant insight which are reported. As a reporting specialist you contribute to active improvement of software and play a direct role in detecting flaws.

Your duties include
Managing big data, including creation, updates, and deletion
Processing confidential data, “Clean” data and indicate correct code problems
Create best-practice reports based on data mining, analysis, and visualization
Communicate ongoing reports with engineers/managers/executives
Interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities through analysis of complex data sets

Profile
You have a relevant bachelor’s degree (Information Management/ Statistics/ Economics/ Mathematics)
Work experience as a data analyst or in related field
Strong knowledge of and experience with database management systems eg. MySQL
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets and visualization tools. (Tableau/Excel/SPSS/SAS)
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy
You can communicate your findings or translate the data into easy-to-understand documents and visualization. So you have strong communication skills and have the ability to communicate complex data, and write/speak clearly.

We offer
A full-time fixed contract
Being part of growing company within a dynamic, young team with a great deal of innovative spirit
Competitive salary package in line with your experience, including extra-legal benefits
Strong team-oriented culture

How To Apply

Send your CV and motivation letter to click apply

You will always receive a response from us.

title: Junior Data Analyst
role-description:
Role purpose:
As a Junior Data Analyst, you will be responsible for shaping and delivering Product insights to support the decision-making process of the Product team and improve business performance.
 Primary responsibilities:
Analyze user behavior, product usage and feature adaption to identify opportunities for the product teams
Execute sophisticated quantitative analyses and modeling.
Translate data into actionable insights and business opportunities.
Synthesize and present quantitative results to an executive audience of product and/or engineering colleagues.

Desired qualifications and skills:
Strong strategic, organizational, and analytical skills.
Experience in SQL
Ability to present results of complex analysis compellingly to both technical and non-technical audiences and on an executive level.
Full working knowledge of and expertise in Microsoft Office is a must.
Knowledge in any other language for statistical programming (e.g. R, SAS, Python) will be considered as an advantage

Benefits & Perks:
Flexible working hours
Free yoga, ballgames and running competitions (like Ultrabalaton)
Sushi Wednesday, BBQ tools and grilling accessories
In-office snacks, fresh fruits, and beverages
Learning and self-development opportunities
Team building days and weekends

title: Head of Data & Analytics
role-description:
Affinity is a line of business (LoB) within Corporate Risk & Broking (CRB) that supports clients to develop ancillary revenues through targeted solutions that help reduce costs, create differentiation, and improve customer retention and satisfaction rates. This is a high focus area of the Willis Tower Watson (WTW) business with huge potential and challenging targets.

Currently Affinity is delivered through a variety of platforms and solutions. A key part of the role is aggregating data from our bespoke, proprietary system, Affinity Technology Platform (ATP), and other Affinity legacy systems to provide insights into consumer behaviours that will help us tailor the solution to provide more value for our clients. In addition to this, the development of advanced analytics and reporting capabilities will make it easy for our clients to have complete transparency and control over their Affinity programmes.

The Role

The Head of Data and Analytics will be responsible for the creation of the Affinity Data Strategy and delivery of the Data & Analytics Roadmap for Affinity. This will cover both internal and external analytical propositions. This role is a combination of both strategic and delivery and the successful candidate will be required to work with our Technology teams across WTW to best utilise the WTW data stores and ensure the best application of emerging technologies such as Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to widen the Affinity Value Proposition. They will be supported by a scrum team of Full Stack Developers to deliver the Data & Analytics Roadmap for Affinity however they must also be able to utilise their own analytical capabilities to support the core teams with insights into, for example: financial i.e. investment returns, internal performance dashboards, and prospect performance reporting.
Reporting directly to the Director of Technology and Operations, this is a role for an experienced, personable, high energy Head of Data and Analytics, with strong data analysis skills, excellent interpersonal skills and experience working collaboratively with senior stakeholders across geographies - Europe, Asia Pacific and Latin America - in a matrix environment.

Responsibilities
Create and maintain the Data & Analytics Strategy for Affinity.
Understand key concepts i.e. Big Data, Telematics, Machine Learning, AI and Augmented Analytics etc and propose how these can be incorporated into the Affinity Value Proposition for the benefit of our clients and to maintain competitive advantages
Lead the delivery of data, analytical and related technology capabilities to support Affinity strategic priorities.
Understand, advocate and execute the CRB’s Data strategy
Lead the team(s) responsible for various initiatives related to developing data architecture, data models, reporting needs, analytics, Data Governance, and Data Quality
Development, growth and utilization of data assets.
Manage teams in a global setting including teams consisting of WTW and partner resources.
Maintain strong working relationships with other IT functions and business units to deliver the information needs
Develop delivery plan, resource requirements and dependencies to successfully execute the data related projects/initiatives

The Requirements
Preferably educated to degree level or relevant professional qualification in the field of data analysis or certificated evidence of data analysis training courses attended (desirable)
Excellent communications – written and oral – in English (and Spanish is highly desirable)
Strong analytical problem solving and critical thinking skills
Ability to work under tight timelines for multiple project deliveries
Ability/flexibility to travel and work abroad (infrequent).
Good level of management accounting and financial understanding is a plus.
Experience of working with IT departments and supporting the development, testing and maintenance of IT systems
Has an understanding and experience of the full project lifecycle and required documentation
Essential Skills:
Software development experiences in Java and/or Python/R, C/C++ as well as advanced databases.
Experience with data models is key.
Data analysis experience gained from projects of similar nature
Power BI experience
SQL Enterprise Manager experience
In-depth experience of managing and interrogating large datasets using SQL (T-SQL scripts)
Advanced Excel (including lookups and pivot tables)
Ability to manipulate, analyse and interpret different data to derive insight and drive decision making
Equal Opportunity Employer

Willis Towers Watson is committed to finding opportunities to foster flexibility in the workplace, whenever business and client demands allow. We are delighted that this opportunity meets the criteria for flexible working. For specific details, please discuss with your Recruiter.

title: Data Analyst (Predictive Modeler)
role-description:
Our client is a leader and market maker in the Big Data industry. With HQ in the US, they power ‘end to end’ marketing programs for some of the world’s leading brands.

Recipe
You will:
Develop newfangled predictive and recommender systems that support business objectives.
Support and maintain KPI dashboards using Tableau.
Collaborate with other teams to gather requirements and provide reporting solutions.
Use scripting languages like Python (Pandas, PySpark and Sci-kit) and MySQL to extract, transform and load data.
Collaborate with cross-departmental teams to drive analyses and insights that lead to insightful decisions and improved financial performance/ROI for the business.


Ingredients
2+ years of experience in building Statistical or Machine Learning models.
Experience with implementing statistical or machine learning techniques in R, Python, SAS or Spark.
Exceptional attention-to-detail.
Ability to translate insights using data visualization tools like Tableau.
Excellent story-telling skills.
Strong knowledge of modeling algorithms in R or comparable algorithms in Python or Spark.


Dessert
Interesting projects with global impact.
Inspiring and flexible working environment.
Great opportunities to learn the latest trends and technologies.
We are building a team from scratch – participate in something big!

title: Data Quality Analyst
role-description:
Data Quality Analyst
Sector Inmobiliario
Especialista en Calidad y Gobierno del Dato
About Our Client
Multinacional del Sector Inmobiliario

Job Description

El Data Quality / Governance participará en el desarrollo y ejecución de la Estrategia de Gobierno del Dato, tanto desde una perspectiva técnica como de negocio. Por otra parte implementará soluciones líderes en la industria y las mejores prácticas en torno a las soluciones de gobierno de los datos. Principales Funciones:
Explotación, tratamiento y validación de la calidad del dato
Explotación de datalakes y validación de la calidad del dato colaborando en los planes de pruebas para la posterior creación de soluciones analíticas
Creación de modelos de gobierno y glosarios de términos de negocio
Participación en proyectos de calidad del dato (perfilados, limpieza, normalización y enriquecimiento)
Capacidad para acompañar y desplegar el modelo de gobierno de datos en arquitectura Big data y arquitecturas tradicionales
Particpación en proyectos de Business Intelligence, desde la gestión de datos (modelado DWH, metadatos, procesos ETL, ...) hasta el diseño de cuadros de mando (definición y construcción)
Colaboración, liderando la parte funcional, en proyectos tecnológicos de implantación de alguno de los ejes del gobierno del dato: calidad de dato, diccionario de negocio, MDM, trazabilidad de información, aspectos regulatorios referentes al dato
Conocimientos y/o experiencia en Analytics: haber trabajado en proyectos analíticos de forma que pueda identificar el valor del dato y su complejidad
The Successful Applicant

El Data Quality / Governance Aportará
Experiencia en puestos en proyectos de gobierno del dato: Gobierno del Dato corporativo, Calidad del dato, Gestión de metadatos, Gestión de Datos Maestros
Conocimiento de herramientas de mercado para el gobierno y gestión de datos (Principalmente de Informatica y Talend) Experiencia en creación de modelos de gobierno y glosarios de términos de negocio
Experiencia con alguna herramienta de gestión de metadatos, data lineage, semantic rules
Conocimientos y experiencia en uso de cualquier herramienta (ETL, Data Quality, MDM, etc...) Capacidad e interés por desarrollar frameworks o herramientas a medida que complementen o sustituyan las herramientas de mercado
Habilidad de interlocución habitual con negocio

What's On Offer

Interesante oportunidad profesional
Contact: Maria Mosquera
Quote job ref: 295611

title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) in München
role-description:
PAYBACK ist weltweit einzigartig im datenbasierten Marketing. Mit der Fähigkeit, digitale Geschäftsmodelle zu entwickeln und technische Trends umzusetzen, sind wir Vorreiter der Data Economy. Alle technischen Lösungen rund um das PAYBACK Programm werden in München erfunden und verwirklicht. Dafür arbeiten wir mit den neuesten Technologien cross-functional und agil. Du hast Lust Verantwortung zu übernehmen, Deine Ideen rund um unser einzigartiges Produkt einzubringen und PAYBACK mit uns weiterzuentwickeln? Dann bist Du hier genau richtig. Wir freuen uns auf Dich. DEINE AUFGABE
Kanalübergreifendes Kampagnenmanagement und -auswertungen
Klassisches Database Marketing: Beraten von unseren Partnerunternehmen bezüglich Zielgruppenbildung und Kampagnenoptimierung
Datenanalysen auf Basis eines Oracle DWH bzw. eines Hadoop Big Data Clusters
Entwickeln von Scoring-Modellen und Kundensegmentierungen
Analyse einer Customer Journey mit Hilfe von Attributionsmodellen
Übernahme der Leitung von (Teil-) Projekten, z.B. Big Data, und Führung von Projektteams
Unterstützung in der Akquise von neuen Partnern
Durchführen von Data Mining Projekten für unsere Partner DEIN PROFIL
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Statistik, Mathematik, BWL oder eines verwandten Studiengangs mit quantitativem Schwerpunkt
Mindestens fünf Jahre Berufs- und/oder Projekterfahrung in einem relevanten Umfeld
Umfangreiche Erfahrung im Umgang mit Daten aus Online- und Mobilkanälen
Umfangreiches Expertenwissen zu statistischen Methoden und Verfahren, sowie Erfahrung in deren praktischer Anwendung
Umfassende Kenntnisse und praktische Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit Datenanalyse-Tools (z.B. SPSS, SAS, R, Big Data Tools)
Kommunikationsstärke, Überzeugungsfähigkeit und eigenverantwortliches Handeln
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse UNSER ANGEBOT Wir erwarten Außergewöhnliches - in jeder Beziehung. Dafür motivieren wir mit Außergewöhnlichem - in jeder Beziehung.

Wir haben ein tolles Team mit vielen schlauen Köpfen
Kostenlose Getränke, Obst, unser ESSZIMMER mit kulinarischen Leckereien aus Bella Italia sowie unsere 24/7 TURNHALLE versüßen Dir den Arbeits-Alltag
