Im SPIELZIMMER mit Bällebad und XBOX kannst Du Dir Dein Feierabendbier oder ne Limo gönnen

title: Data Privacy Analyst
role-description:
The role

The DPO Team advises the business on data privacy matters on a global scale, including but not limited to GDPR and CCPA, by promoting an ethical environment where compliance adds value to our mission. We are seeking a Data Privacy Associate who will be an integral part of our global compliance efforts working in a truly multicultural environment.

Responsibilities
In whatever you do, we expect you to look for improvement opportunities. We are not afraid of making radical changes to the way how we work if this is needed to enhance efficiency while maintaining compliance. But often smaller changes or fine-tuning of our processes is what we need to achieve a positive impact
Handling data requests, ensuring compliance with the relevant laws and regulations by working with other teams to meet regulatory deadlines. Learning about our connected products, working with authorities, technical experts and other lawyers
Performing compliance audits across the business and getting an understanding of how risk gets addressed by the business as part of our overall compliance efforts. Helping the business improve, if necessary, by providing value-adding recommendations
Researching specific areas of law which are critical for our compliance efforts. Privacy law is rapidly changing and we need to understand how it impacts us and what actions we may have to take to remain compliant
Benchmarking with other organizations even if they are from other industries
Supporting members of the global privacy team with various projects and tasks
Possibility to assist the wider Legal team
Requirements
Bachelor or Master degree in law, business or any other related field with an interest in data privacy
Strong English skills, other languages are a big plus
Eagerness to work in a dynamic and fast-changing environment
Detail-oriented but at the same time with the ability to see the big picture and how even a small change can impact many other areas of the business
Proactive and problem-solving attitude

title: Technical Data Analyst
role-description:
Hi. We are ASOS!

Here at ASOS, we want to give everyone the confidence to be their best self, because, when you’re at your best, you can achieve amazing things.

ASOS is the UK’s number one fashion and beauty destination, expanding globally at a rapid pace. Technology is at heart of this business growth and by delivering incredible solutions we’re able to pioneer the technical innovation needed to keep our 20-something market engaged, the cloud-based architecture to support our global reach and the agile engineering methods to deliver value fast.

Our Technology team pioneer incredible solutions that change the way our millions of customers can access fashion. We believe that fashion can make you look, feel and be the best version of you and it’s this feeling of empowerment that we want our ASOSers to experience while working with us.

Our ASOSers reflect the diverse society they live in; we celebrate our differences and welcome people from all different walks of life. We’re looking for people who can live and breathe our values of being authentic, brave and creative and we don’t care about labels - we recognise there are endless ways to be ‘you’.

Sound like a place you’d love to be? Come and join us!

TECHNICAL DATA ANALYST (ADVANCED ANALYTICS) | LONDON

ASOS is the no.1 fashion destination in the world and to achieve that we need data. Data is the life blood of the ecommerce system that powers the ASOS experience. Without data we wouldn’t be able to tell you the products we have on offer, ship to your address, record your returns, and identify when you should be getting rewards or recommend products that you might like.

Data engineering at ASOS is about ensuring that our data platform, is robust, secure, timely and flexible. We achieve this by being integrated with engineering practice and follow principles such as, agile development, continuous delivery, and continuous improvement. We are pushing the boundaries of data engineering to ensure we can be true to these principles

Cue Advanced Analytics… We work with big data, leveraging advanced data engineering, analytics and reporting tools/techniques to deliver an accessible store of enterprise data that can be used for business-critical insights and recommendations and enable ASOS to be a Data Driven business.

If you are passionate about technology and data engineering, love hands-on development, you should work with us!

About The Role

ASOS is the no.1 fashion destination in the world and to achieve that we need data. Data is the life blood of the ecommerce system that powers the ASOS experience. Without data we wouldn’t be able to tell you the products we have on offer, ship to your address, record your returns, and identify when you should be getting rewards or recommend products that you might like.

ASOS is a unique and forward-thinking company and understands the opportunities data and technology has on driving the business forward. Data and analytics remain a key priority focus area and the Advanced Analytics team will be at the heart of supporting and driving new insights within the organisation.

As a Technical Data Analyst, based in our Advanced Analytics technology team, you will play a key role in delivering and supporting insights & BI solutions. You will be working as part of a functional delivery team alongside BAs, Architects and Data Engineers to ensure our Insights business are supported to create great data insights for ASOS.

What You’ll Be Doing
Working as part of cross-functional agile team who design and develop a large-scale, high-volume and high-performance data platform.
Working with data analysts in Insights to identify and implement report automation.
Deliver new datasets for our end users across multiple areas of the business (such as Finance, Retail, Marketing, Digital) .
Work with analysts to identify and implement dashboards for business insight, using SQL and Power BI .
Investigate and fix reported data or reporting issues , working with engineers to ensure robust & timely solutions for insights dashboards, data and technology pipelines.
You’ll be at the forefront of the technology team , helping us manage the relationship with the ASOS Insights business team and working directly with the data analysts to create a great working data environment containing a great breadth of data such as orders, customer demographics, web interactions and customer communications.

Who We’d Like To Meet
You are a self-starter, who loves technology and bringing solutions to people.
You have a passion for bringing data and people together to drive business value.
You have some working knowledge of SQL and shell scripting (ideally PowerShell) and data warehouse concepts.
You are keen to and able to learn new tools and technologies.
You are organised with a desire to be in a data driven service role.
You enjoy problem solving, using analytical skills and you have excellent communication skills.
Knowledge of data visualisation principles and skills –including good user experience/UI Design within BI solutions.
An ability to build strong relationships with end users, eliciting requirements and enabling them to get the most out of the BI platform .

It Will Be a Plus To Have
Experience in a service or data role previously, although training will be provided on the job.
Understanding of CI / CD and deployment options for Power BI reporting.
You have worked in an Agile environment.

What’s In It For You
A truly unique and agile working environment where you’ll be surrounded by a diverse range of passionate experts, with two common interests: technology & innovation
Generous salary, bonus and pension matching
Life insurance, free private medical care, cycle to work scheme + more
A bespoke flexible benefits scheme catered to you
Best in class Learning & Development schemes and career development programmes
25 days holiday + never work on your birthday again!
Free modern onsite gym, plus personal training and wellness rooms
Tech Develops days– one day per month dedicated to developing yourself and others within Tech
Tech Presents days- breakfast mornings to collaborate and share your work with other teams
A dynamic social environment, from company-wide sports days, charity days, ‘Give A Week Away’ opportunities to visit our charity partners in India, company-wide celebrations across Christmas and Summer to name just a few
Huge staff discounts and sample sales
Plus much more…

title: Credit Risk Data Analyst
role-description:
Imagine…
That your data analysis truly drives the solutions that sustain our business and the products that serve our customers. Our Credit Risk Data Analysts have to stand out from the rest. Much more than just code-writers, we need Credit Risk Data Analysts who constantly question the status quo and continue to look for better solutions.

Making a difference

You have the freedom to choose the path that leads to the solution
As a Credit Risk Data Analyst you’ll need to ensure that the request matches the needs and assess whether the data sets are fit for purpose
You will translate requests for data from the modelling teams directly into code or adequately instruct developers on how to do so
You’ll develop the principles for creating data sets that meet the latest internal and regulatory requirements for data quality
You’ll need to have the skills and personality to act as an advisor and lead the way for your team and guide them towards the goals you have agreed to achieve

With Each Other

Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. The Risk Analytics – Group ALM team safeguards Rabobank’s stability and sustainability. The decisions made in the department affect every level of the organization from overall strategy to individual products. As we develop risk models that shape these decisions, we rely on a diverse team of specialists: from data collection to modelling to validation and support. Every member of the team plays an important role in the process. But it is only through collaboration that the job gets done. With you as a Data Analyst, the team will consist of diverse colleagues in a variety of roles, including:

Randolph Claus, Credit Risk Data Analyst “As a credit risk data analyst we make sure that we really understand the needs of our stakeholders before we dive into, different databases and combine data attributes to create a proper answer. It’s often a team effort so that knowledge and experience grow within our team and even beyond. Our aim for the future is to add more (graphical) insights not only for reasons like data quality but also to explain what the data is trying to tell the bank.”

With you

The work you do will impact your team and your internal and external stakeholders, but also the client servicing process and therefore the bank’s core business. Our Credit Risk Data Analysts have been able to incorporate sophisticated data sources into the latest model development projects. This directly impacts the way Rabobank actively serves its clients.

In addition, it's important that you recognise everything in the checklist below:

A Master degree in Economics, Finance, or quantitative field (mathematics, physics or similar)
Strong communication skills in English, both spoken and written
Hands-on expertise in Python programming (preferred, not required)
A thorough mastery of SQL
A deep understanding of banking
The ability to present solutions and provide clear documentation of all steps, so that data sets are not only useable, but sustainable
Proficiency in leading small teams to achieve agreed objectives together (senior)

Growing a better world together
You'll already be aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for 7.1 million customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our 'Growing a better world together' mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:

We make sizeable annual investments in the voluntary sector in the Netherlands. This allows us to support about 1,250 sport and cultural organizations that are a second home to many people
We provide 500 million Euros in financing to the Dutch education sector annually because, after all, good education is the bedrock of tomorrow’s society
With the Rabobank Foundation, we support social enterprises. This gives people experiencing barriers entering the labour market the opportunities they deserve, and helps them to participate fully in our society

Interested?
Do you want to become the ideal version of yourself? We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 36-hour working week), you can also expect:

A gross annual salary between €44124 and €89506 depending on your experience and Seniority
A thirteenth month and holiday pay
An Employee Benefit Budget (10 % of your monthly salary). You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving a monthly cash payout
100 % reimbursement of the costs of home/work travel if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a home/work travel allowance
A pension scheme, to which your contribution is only 5%

Let's meet
Are you the person we're looking for? Are you ready to join Rabobank as a Credit Risk Data Analyst and to make a difference to yourself, our customers and to society? We look forward to receiving your application for this vacancy in Utrecht.

Good to know

Jerrol Spier, recruiter, would be happy to answer any questions about the application procedure via Jerrol.Spier@rabobank.nl or on +31 611 95 55 96
The application process includes screening. Based on the screening procedures in place at Rabobank, we assess whether new staff are reliable enough to work at Rabobank
The application process for this vacancy may include an individual assessment
Your privacy is important to us. Do you want to know more, click on this link
Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!

Acquisition further to this vacancy is not appreciated

title: Consultant/Senior Consultant - Data Analytics
role-description:
Job Description

JOB TITLE: Data Analytics Consultant

About The Opportunity

Our Client is an international consulting firm specialising in Forensic Accounting, Data Analytics and eDiscovery with six offices and datacentres across the globe. Our client is currently looking to hire an experienced Data Analytics Consultant to join their team.

Primary Duties
Managing and being accountable for complex work streams within a project, and effectively delegating responsibilities to junior team members.
Designing and implementing complex database models of financial, operational, or transactional data to generate meaningful insights.
Identifying, acquiring, synthesizing, mining and analysing relevant data.
Maintaining detailed logs of information sources, assumptions and methodologies used in performing analytical tasks.
Preparing visualisations and written analyses, reports, or presentations.
Basic Qualifications
Minimum of a Bachelor's Degree.
3+ years of relevant experience with an emphasis in complex problem solving, data analytics, or related competencies.
Experience working in a team-oriented environment.
Required Skills
Proficient (meaningful experience applying well-developed skills to actual business challenges) in analysing data within database systems such as MS SQL Server, Oracle or NoSQL.
Proficient (meaningful experience applying well-developed skills to actual business challenges) in one or more of Python, Perl, PHP, JavaScript, VBA, or other programming languages for data processing/analysis purposes.
Preferred Skills
Familiarity with visualisation tools such as Tableau, QlikView, or open source libraries such as D3.js.
Familiarity with common accounting and ERP packages such as PeopleSoft, SAP, JD Edwards, Hyperion and Oracle Financials.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
We are a team of Analysts that specialise in extracting and interpreting data to identify efficiency opportunities with a multi-million pound scope, directly impacting thousands of colleagues and hundreds of thousands of customers. We pride ourselves on making quick affirmative decisions and data is the driver to make this happen. We have billions of data points at our disposal, mapping the customer journey from the time they log on to the website to their orders arriving at the door.

From picking orders in our automated warehouses, to our transport operations on the road, we look to maximise profitability whilst improving our customer offering. This can range from the short-term configuration of planning processes to long-term logistical strategy, shaping the future growth of Ocado.

Your insight will have a direct impact on our operational efficiency, will enhance both customer and workforce experience, and contribute to Ocado’s long term goal of changing the way the world shops.

What will you be doing?
From day one, you will be using state-of-the-art tools to interrogate Big Data, analysing the results to develop and improve tools and algorithms, delivering recommendations to senior management and driving operational decisions.
Project Management and Support. Whether it is your own idea you are proposing or a project related to our Warehouses from a planning perspective, you are helping, you will be involved in different projects across the department.
Working closely with the Planning Team. This team will rely on you to provide them with up-to-date to and accurate data on our Warehouse operation, giving them insight on key KPIs.
Problem Solving. With our Warehouse operation growing rapidly and with even bigger growth plans ahead, new challenges and insights for you to tackle.


About You
Accomplished analyst with experience working with Big Data
Exceptional quantitative & qualitative problem solving skills
Strong command of analytical SQL and/or Excel, VBA, or similar to these (e.g. SAP, SPSS, SAS, programming experience)
Comfortable communicating with senior management and key stakeholders, both within the business and externally


About Ocado Group

When our journey started, we were all about changing the way people shop for groceries. 20 years later, we’re a FTSE 100 business developing our own groundbreaking technology, opening multiple sites at an accelerating rate and engaging in exciting new business partnerships around the world!

Transforming an industry means also transforming the way we do business. As we continually develop new technologies and customer propositions, we’re looking for the brightest talents to lead us into the next stage of our evolution: enhancing our capabilities, inspiring our teams and developing new ways of working.

Only a 20-minute commute from London King’s Cross and with a free shuttle bus provided from Hatfield Station to the office.

Benefits

Ocado employee experience is very important to us. As well as keeping a smile on your face with weekly massages, a games room, coffee shop, weekly food samples and amazing food hall to satisfy your daily breakfast and lunchtime taste buds. All Ocado employees are offered a benefits package of - 23 days holiday + the option to buy an additional 3 via salary sacrifice, 15% discount on your weekly Ocado shop, pension, share options, discounts on gym memberships and much much more….

Our values: we’re in it together, we are proud of what we do, we can be even better.

title: Data Analyst - Barcelona
role-description:
En Iwantic, primera agencia española especializada en selección de perfiles digitales, reclutamos a los candidatos más brillantes para los empleos que están cambiando el mundo.

En este momento, estamos buscando un Data Analyst para una gran multinacional con al menos tres años de experiencia en analítica y minería de datos en un entorno comercial, para B arcelona .

Funciones
Identificar oportunidades para explotar los datos, demostrando el valor de estos nuevos enfoques, en consonancia con los objetivos de negocio.
Diseño y puesta en marcha de modelos analíticos avanzados
Establecimiento de estrategias y metodologías comunes a las distintas divisiones, implantando mejores prácticas y asegurando la consistencia en el uso de datos.
Trabajar estrechamente con los analistas de las distintas áreas de negocio, con el fin de garantizar la evolución y mejora continua de nuestros activos de datos.
Colaboración con TI para desarrollar una hoja de ruta, identificar nuevas fuentes de información y apoyar acciones relacionadas con la visualización de los datos.
Mantener estrechos vínculos con los propietarios de los datos, tanto internos como externos, y dar respuesta a las consultas e incidencias de los usuarios.
Comunicación, sensibilización y formación permanente a todos los niveles de la compañía para impulsar una cultura basada en los datos.

Requisitos
Experiencia en el desarrollo e implementación de modelos analíticos avanzados.
Experiencia trabajando con una amplia variedad de conjuntos de datos, incluyendo datos transaccionales, de comportamiento e investigación, y en su utilización para responder a las diversas necesidades de negocio.
Comodidad a la hora de trabajar en un ambiente de negocio, en contacto directo con los clientes internos, así como en la gestión de tareas diarias del proyecto.
Visión empresarial, con capacidad de identificar nuevas oportunidades y pensar de forma innovadora.
Habilidad para planificar y gestionar múltiples tareas, trabajar con plazos acordados, y gestionar y responder a prioridades cambiantes.
Excelentes habilidades interpersonales, capacidad de comunicación y competencia para presentar análisis complejos de forma clara y sencilla a equipos multidisciplinares y con distintos niveles de seniority.
Competencia profesional de inglés, hablado y escrito.

Conocimientos
SQL Python, ROctave, JMatLab, Scavis, Microstrategy
herramientas estadísticas como R, SAS o SPSS
VBA y Excel o herramientas de visualización de datos, preferentemente tales como BO y/o Tableau u otros

La persona seleccionada gozará de grandes beneficios sociales( tickets restaurante, seguros...), contrato indefinido y plan de carrera desde un primer momento, además de un interesante paquete retributivo.

title: Data Analyst - Junior/Senior (m/f/x)
role-description:
At their core, Business Intelligence Analysts at Wayfair are strong in quantitative analysis, enjoy coding but also want to balance that with their interest in the key of our business. They think critically to tackle complex challenges, thrive in a
fast-paced
environment and are seeking a high-growth opportunity where they will have an immediate impact on day one. There are significant opportunities for new passionate team members fresh out of school or with previous professional experience.

You will join the Supply Chain team focused on driving the design, creation and operation of the business infrastructure that supports our operations teams and our business strategy primarily driven by the synergies of the tech and business world.

Whether you re analyzing sales, inventory or distribution trends or developing new recommendations to tackle business problems, or constructing and optimizing SQL queries, building tables or designing dashboards to represent your findings you will be working with cutting edge technology and multi-terabyte datasets.

What You Ll Do
Identify and visualize the most impactful ways for data and analytics to drive decision making and accelerate profitable growth
Comprehend, extract, automate processes and model information from complex data sources including sales, operations, logistics, product, and customer databases to deliver business insights and recommendations
Become the subject matter expert for data, analytics, and testing within the Supply Chain organization to ensure accurate and proper interpretation of core business metrics and consumer behavior
Perform deep-dive analysis, including the application of advanced analytical techniques, to solve some of the more critical and complex business problems including supplier segmentation and supply chain optimization
Collaborate with other Supply Chain areas (e.g., Supplier Operations, Warehousing, Logistics) to create and evaluate project ideas and drive their implementation to validate your analytics insight and scale working solutions across our supply chain to achieve meaningful impact

What You Ll Need
Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Economics, Management, Social Sciences or other quantitative discipline field with strong academic record
Numeracy & strong analytical ability
Experience in an analytics, business intelligence, data science or engineering role performing quantitative analysis a plus
Hands-on experience conducting quantitative analyses on large data sets; experience with Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, etc. ) and Tableau
Proficient knowledge of SQL (incl. aggregate functions, joins, etc.).
Other structured programming languages (Python, R) a plus
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
Solution-oriented & curious intellectual mindset and curiosity - We provide fast results, we scope projects and we are always learning
Strong written and verbal communication with a team player, highly collaborative attitude- We communicate effectively without sugar coating, we focus on helping the team on the most value add projects
Junior and Senior analysts with e-commerce or supply chain analytics experience a strong plus

About Us

Wayfair is one of the world s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair and world for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That s why we re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

title: Big Data Analyst (Trainee)
role-description:
For over 80 years, GfK has been a reliable and trusted insight partner for the world’s biggest companies and leading brands who make a difference in every consumer’s life - and we will continue to build on this. We connect data, science and innovative digital research solutions to provide answers for key business questions around consumers, markets, brands and media. With our headquarters in Germany and a presence in around 60 countries worldwide, you benefit from our global company with a diverse community of ~9,000 employees.

Harnessing the power of our workforce, the greatest asset we have is our people. As part of GfK, you can take your future into your own hands. We value talent, skills and responsibility and support your development within our international teams. We are proud of our heritage and our future: Currently we are in the latter stages of a transformational journey from a traditional market research company to a trusted provider of prescriptive data analytics powered by innovative technology. This is only possible with extraordinary people and this is why we are looking for YOU to help create our future. For our employees as well as for our clients we pursue one goal: Growth from Knowledge!

Job Description

We´re recruiting! In GfK we´re using different big data platforms to understand the consumer and market behavior. We´re searching a new profile to work directly in a global team to develop the maximum potential of our data assets.

If you want develop your professional career in big data we have to know you!

This Role Includes The Following Duties

Work in Big Data environments (Hyve, SQL, R ...)
Develop statistical analysis with behavioral data.
Support the commercial teams of South Europe.
Analyze the possibilities of new databases.
Develop projects for our clients

Requirements

We are looking for a person focused on the digital world with high interest in developing in our market.
Digital Marketing degree or another degree similar to these contents
Good level of English
Jumpshot qualified


We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.

Can there be a better place to take center stage in the digital revolution? We are excited to getting to know you!

title: Data Analysts & CRO
role-description:
We are looking for a Digital Data Analyst & CRO profile that will help us in our tactics of understanding our digital process and optimizing their conversion rates through the implementation of Web Tagging and different A / B tests.

Among The Functions He/she Will Perform
Convert business objectives into metrics and KPIs.
Implementation of measurements through Tag Managers.
Configuration and use of digital analytics tools and data visualization through Dashboards.
Analysis of the data captured in the digital channels, with the aim of making recommendations and hypothesis for improvement and optimization.
Proposal for the UX design and implementation of the test A/B
Based on the proposed improvements, implement the A/B test using test tools.
Analysis of the results and if the solutions converts better than the original
So We Think He/she Should Meet The Following Requirements
Expert in the use of Adobe Analytics.
Experience making implementations in Dynamic Tag Manager
Practical experience in the testing tool Adobe Target
Experience with marketing automation across the funnel. You know the difference between a CDP vs DMP and have previous experience in managing such tools
It will be positively valued to know other CRO tools (ideally Hotjar, Optimizely or similar)
Advanced knowledge and practical experience in JavaScrip, HTML and CSS for the implementation of both digital analytics and A / B tests
Knowledge of UX / UI design tools is a plus
Knowledge of data visualization tools (Tableau, Qlik View, Power BI, etc.) is a plus
Fluent in English (mandatory)
Primary Location

ES-Community of Madrid

Job Type

Standard / Permanent

Job

DATA

Education Level

Bachelor Degree or equivalent (>= 3 years)

Experience Level

At least 2 years

Schedule

Full-time

Behavioural Competencies

Ability to collaborate / Teamwork, Organizational skills, Proactivity, Critical thinking, Adaptability

Transversal Competencies

Analytical Ability

title: Data Analyst
company: U.S. National Archives and Records Administration
role-description:
Responsibilities

The full job description is attached.

As our Data Analyst, you will have a strong background in organising, managing, enriching and manipulating data, including structured and text-based information. You will have excellent experience of the relevant database technologies and programming languages and be highly skilled in structuring, converting, analysing and exploring data to reveal underlying patterns and stories. You will have the ability to think rigorously about the complex issues involved in data collection and manipulation and will enjoy working with records specialists to support access to the digital archive.

You will remain calm whilst working under pressure, dealing with a wide variety of tasks and will have experience in problem solving using data design. You will see opportunities for improvements and be able to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences through appropriate medium.

This is an opportunity to work with committed and talented developers, designers, archivists and researchers who share a passion for creating high quality, user-focused digital services for a range of audiences.

Join us here in beautiful Kew, just 10 minutes’ walk from the Overground and Underground stations, and you can expect an excellent range of benefits. They include a pension, the option to work part time or job share and discounts with local businesses (e.g. beauty salons and bars). We also offer wellbeing resources (e.g. on-site therapists) and have an on-site gym, restaurant, shop and staff bar.

To submit your application please click the 'Apply now' button on this page, where you will be asked to provide CV details and complete a personal statement. In your personal statement please explain how you meet the criteria below. You may draw on knowledge, skills, abilities, experience gained from paid work, domestic responsibilities, education, leisure interests and voluntary activities. Please note selection for interview will largely be based on the information you provide in this section so please make full use of the 1250 word count.

Essential Criteria
Extensive experience of large scale data analysis and manipulation using different programming techniques (for example, Python, Shell scripting, XSLT, SQL) for structured and text based data analysis and manipulation.
Excellent knowledge and experience of working with data encoded in different formats (for example, XML, CSV, JSON, RDF).
Practical experience and knowledge of a range of database technologies (for example: no-SQL, RDBMS, triple stores / linked data, graph databases).
Awareness of the issues with manipulating complex structured and unstructured data, with excellent skills in pattern analysis and strong accuracy and attention to detail.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and organisational skills coupled with the ability to work to a high degree of accuracy demonstrating a proactive and solutions focused approach to problems.
Strong communication and relationship building skills, suitable for working with multidisciplinary stakeholders at all levels; able to lead and facilitate work to gather user requirements from the business and to explain technical concepts clearly to non-technical staff.
Highly motivated to work independently and as a project team member. Ability to prioritise tasks and deliver products to deadlines

title: DATA ANALYST/ MARKETING ANALYST/ BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST
role-description:
Full-time in Vienna at the earliest possible date

Start your career with Philip Morris International, the world's leading tobacco company! Since the foundation of Philip Morris Austria GmbH in 2012, the Austrian market has been developed even more intensively, with the clear aim of further expanding its market leadership. Become part of this success story and join our Data Team at the HQ in Vienna.

WE OFFER YOU
• A unique opportunity to join Philip Morris – and be part of the biggest transformation in the history of our company – to „Design a Smoke-Free Future“
• The opportunity to develop in a world-leading, international company.
• An inspiring working environment, flat hierarchies and an open-minded, team-oriented company culture.
• An all-in employment relationship with flexible working hours, various benefits, team events, various insurances, and much more.
• A basic salary of min. € 40,000/year gross, with willingness to negotiate overpayments in line with the market, depending on experience and qualifications.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
• You keep track of our data in the commercial area and function as an advisory interface between our teams.
• You analyze internal data and processes, initiate checks for irregular data and deviations, create reports and identify optimization potential.
• You organize coordination meetings and initiate relevant next steps.
• You support product launches in coordination with our management team.
• You are our Business Intelligence Key User and are familiar with relevant IT tools.

YOUR PROFILE
• You have successfully graduated in business informatics, IT or an equivalent field.
• You have more than 5 years of professional experience in a comparable position.
• Ideally, you have knowledge in project-based working and you are an expert in consulting teams and executives.
• You are familiar with databases and have experience with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau or similar).
• You preferably have knowledge of Python, R or comparable.
• You are communicative and open minded with analytical skills and an affinity for numbers.
• You are fluent in spoken and written English.

JOIN A GLOBAL MARKET LEADER
PMI is the world's leading international tobacco company, with six of the world's top 15 international brands and products sold in more than 180 markets. In addition to the manufacture and sale of cigarettes, including the number one global cigarette brand, and other tobacco products, PMI is engaged in the development and commercialization of Reduced-Risk Products ("RRPs"). RRPs is the term we use to refer to products that present, are likely to present, or have the potential to present less risk of harm to smokers who switch to these products versus continued smoking. We have a range of RRPs in various stages of development, scientific assessment and commercialization. Because our RRPs do not burn tobacco, they produce far lower quantities of harmful and potentially harmful compounds than found in cigarette smoke. For more information, see www.pmi.com and www.pmiscience.com.

title: Data Analyst - Advanced Analytics
role-description:
Apply Now

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in quantitative field (mathematics, quantitative methods, computer science, engineering, finance etc.); Advanced degree is a plus
Hands-on experience in reporting, data analytics, data engineering or business intelligence
At least one of the below skills
Strong data management skills with focus on database design, data quality management and data analysis of small to medium datasets, including hands-on experience with SQL and ETL software.
Good business modelling and programming skills using Excel, VBA.
Experience with building interactive visualization and BI platforms (R Shiny, Tableau/Qlikview/Power BI etc.)
Programming experience in R or Python will be a plus.Understanding of business environment and ability to translate business problems to analytical frameworks and technical end-products
Entrepreneurial mindset proactively thinking about potential improvements to how things are done
Ability to work collaboratively and self-driven in a diverse team environment, under tight deadlines and changing priorities
Good communication skills with the ability to communicate analytical and technical content
Business level fluency in both written and spoken English
Willingness to travel abroad
Who You'll Work With

You will be a part of McKinsey Analytics Wroclaw hub and a member of our global analytics community. As data analyst, you will interact and collaborate with McKinsey consultants, data scientists and data engineers.

In McKinsey Analytics we shape the future of what data-driven organizations look like, creating new lines of thinking within a diverse range of clients and situations. We help clients harness data to solve their toughest challenges and pride ourselves on fostering an atmosphere of ongoing learning and development for those seeking to constantly enhance their capabilities and knowledge.
What You'll Do

As a skilled storyteller with a passion for data, you will analyze and evaluate data to create concepts, prototypes and iterate on ideas effectively balancing quality and time factors.

Leveraging your visualization and data analysis skills, you will create the foundations for sound client recommendations. In doing this, you will manage the data cleaning pipeline, apply analytic methodologies and data visualization techniques, generate insights and communicate them back to the team. Your end-products will include business models, scenario planners, reporting dashboards or data visualizations. You may be expected to travel to other McKinsey offices.

Working on projects and exchanging experiences with your colleagues means you will face new intellectual challenges, while continuously building your methodological knowledge and skills. Growing in the role will also create opportunities to coach junior colleagues and contribute to team strategy on knowledge and capability development.

We are recruiting both junior and senior profiles, so the role will be calibrated during the recruiting process based on candidate’s experience.

• You are fluent in spoken and written English.

JOIN A GLOBAL MARKET LEADER
PMI is the world's leading international tobacco company, with six of the world's top 15 international brands and products sold in more than 180 markets. In addition to the manufacture and sale of cigarettes, including the number one global cigarette brand, and other tobacco products, PMI is engaged in the development and commercialization of Reduced-Risk Products ("RRPs"). RRPs is the term we use to refer to products that present, are likely to present, or have the potential to present less risk of harm to smokers who switch to these products versus continued smoking. We have a range of RRPs in various stages of development, scientific assessment and commercialization. Because our RRPs do not burn tobacco, they produce far lower quantities of harmful and potentially harmful compounds than found in cigarette smoke. For more information, see www.pmi.com and www.pmiscience.com.

title: Data Analyst - Advanced Analytics
role-description:
Apply Now

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in quantitative field (mathematics, quantitative methods, computer science, engineering, finance etc.); Advanced degree is a plus
Hands-on experience in reporting, data analytics, data engineering or business intelligence
At least one of the below skills
Strong data management skills with focus on database design, data quality management and data analysis of small to medium datasets, including hands-on experience with SQL and ETL software.
Good business modelling and programming skills using Excel, VBA.
Experience with building interactive visualization and BI platforms (R Shiny, Tableau/Qlikview/Power BI etc.)
Programming experience in R or Python will be a plus.Understanding of business environment and ability to translate business problems to analytical frameworks and technical end-products
Entrepreneurial mindset proactively thinking about potential improvements to how things are done
Ability to work collaboratively and self-driven in a diverse team environment, under tight deadlines and changing priorities
Good communication skills with the ability to communicate analytical and technical content
Business level fluency in both written and spoken English
Willingness to travel abroad
Who You'll Work With

You will be a part of McKinsey Analytics Wroclaw hub and a member of our global analytics community. As data analyst, you will interact and collaborate with McKinsey consultants, data scientists and data engineers.

In McKinsey Analytics we shape the future of what data-driven organizations look like, creating new lines of thinking within a diverse range of clients and situations. We help clients harness data to solve their toughest challenges and pride ourselves on fostering an atmosphere of ongoing learning and development for those seeking to constantly enhance their capabilities and knowledge.
What You'll Do

As a skilled storyteller with a passion for data, you will analyze and evaluate data to create concepts, prototypes and iterate on ideas effectively balancing quality and time factors.

Leveraging your visualization and data analysis skills, you will create the foundations for sound client recommendations. In doing this, you will manage the data cleaning pipeline, apply analytic methodologies and data visualization techniques, generate insights and communicate them back to the team. Your end-products will include business models, scenario planners, reporting dashboards or data visualizations. You may be expected to travel to other McKinsey offices.

Working on projects and exchanging experiences with your colleagues means you will face new intellectual challenges, while continuously building your methodological knowledge and skills. Growing in the role will also create opportunities to coach junior colleagues and contribute to team strategy on knowledge and capability development.

We are recruiting both junior and senior profiles, so the role will be calibrated during the recruiting process based on candidate’s experience.

title: Leadership Partner - Data & Analytics
role-description:
LEADERSHIP PARTNER
Gartner Leadership Partners serve as trusted advisors to our clients. Our clients are IT
executives from Global 2000 organizations and large government agencies who report
directly to the CIO.

The role of the Leadership Partner is to coach and critique strategies, guide clients in
building their organizations, assist them in developing IT strategy, establishing priorities
and planning for implementation around key IT initiatives. With the support of their
Leadership Partner, our clients are able to achieve their goals more quickly and more
cost effectively and with a higher assurance of success.

RELATIONSHIP MANAGEMENT
The Leadership Partner manages approximately 35 – 40 client relationships and
supports account planning in collaboration with Leadership Client Managers, and the
respective Gartner Account Executive. These three individuals collectively have
responsibility for each assigned account.
The Leadership Partner participates in all phases of the client lifecycle:
Pre-sale, On-boarding, Relationship Management, Full Delivery, Review and Renew.
Success is defined by a smooth hand-off from the sales team, consistent member
engagement, creation of complete member profiles, accurate identification of the
member's agenda, development of an engagement plan, successful quarterly member
satisfaction reviews and preparation/delivery of value added on-site engagements and
member meetings.

PROGRAM DELIVERY
Define and deliver innovative solutions by assessing member needs and developing a customized value plan in accordance with overall EITL strategy and EITL product deliverables.
Establish and maintain working relationships with various internal groups to create a comprehensive, well designed, sustainable set of key deliverables for clients (including targeted research, personal coaching sessions, scripted analyst sessions, involvement with appropriate events, etc
Direct and facilitate bi-annual member peer group meetings on topics of relevance to the community.
Deliver bimonthly webinars to community members on topics of relevance; including both analysts and peer experts

CONTENT DEVELOPMENT & MANAGEMENT
Represent Gartner/EUP/Enterprise IT Leaders publicly as a respected content expert
Participate in presentations, panels and workshops
Participate in relevant research communities to keep topic area knowledge current and share client experiences with analysts
Facilitate member interaction and collaboration through the EITL community portal and assisted member connections
Facilitate and participate in local events and round tables.

SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTISE
CDO Focus
Provides advisory guidance to CDO’s with regard to enterprise-wide data and information strategy, governance, control, policy development, and data optimization
Extends CDO insight into risk, compliance, policy management, and business insight to data

Data Science Focus
Broad and deep understanding of core Data Science precepts, such as: Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, Conceptual Modeling, Statistical Analysis, Predictive Modeling, and Hypothesis Testing
Ability to provide insight into Data Monetization/Infonomics, Data Management/Governance, Customer Insights/Customer Intelligence

Information Management Focus
Leadership perspective in Business Intelligence, Analytics, and Master Data Management approach in key industry verticals.
Experience/expertise in one or more of the following application disciplines is also desired, in addition to business intelligence / analytics:
Agile / Bimodal IT
DevOps
Lean Development
Mobile application development and deployment
Cloud application deployment strategies
Integration Strategy and API Management
Application Maintenance Methods and Outsourcing
Application Portfolio Management

OTHER REQUIREMENTS
University graduate (Masters preferred) with a 10+ years experience working in a senior IT management role for 5+ years or with 5+ years in other IT area (e.g. Consulting, IT Supplier, etc.)
In-depth understanding of the IT industry and the role of Sr. IT leadership
In depth understanding of the business value of IT and the alignment of business and IT strategies
Critical thinking and problem solving skills needed to assess client situation and provide actionable outcome based business/technical advice along with access to appropriate Gartner services
Excellent relationship management skills and experience working with Senior IT management
Superior verbal, written, facilitation and presentation skills
Collaboration and team leadership experience
Demonstrated sales and / or business development experience focused on Sr. IT management
Strong time and project management skills

title: Senior Data Analyst - London, UK
role-description:
Quizlet’s mission is to help students (and their teachers) practice and master whatever they are learning. Every month more than 50 million active learners from 130 countries practice and master more than 300 million study sets on every conceivable topic and subject. We are developing new learning experiences by modeling how students learn and drawing upon knowledge acquisition, retention, and pedagogy in cognitive science. We are always seeking to help students master any subject by optimizing study efficiency and engagement.

We're looking for a quantitative Senior Data Analyst to drive inquiry and informed decisions in our international markets. Someone who is passionate about analytics and wants to help shape the future of our international playbook at Quizlet. Our team is scrappy, focused on results and self-starters who drive the understanding, growth, and success of the product. We serve in a pivotal role, identifying as well as driving inquiry on behalf of leaders at the company.

Quizlet is located in San Francisco, CA and Denver CO. and our London team is our first outside the United States.

The Role
Working directly with Quizlet’s Country Manager to partner in strategy and growth in new or existing markets.
Important role to help define the growth strategy of Quizlet's first international office.
Explore, understand, and own the entire international user lifecycle, including acquisition, retention, and Lifetime value.
Measure the success of paid marketing and email campaigns, as well as other product growth initiatives, with various tools such as A/B testing.
Foster a strong data culture as the first data hire in the new London office.
Drive maturity and excellence in the way we measure the success of our business.

Required Qualifications
Advanced SQL skills, including highly developed QA skills and ability to write the most efficient, optimized code.
Experience coding in Python including modeling and forecasting techniques.
Experienced, practical knowledge of running A/B tests.
Strong communicator: effectively synthesize, visualize, and communicate your ideas to others.
Deep understanding of the analytics toolkit, including funnels, cohort analyses, long-term trends, user segmentation, regression models, and more.
5+ years of experience in analytics.
Degree in Math, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative fields.

Preferred Qualifications
Experience with BigQuery, Airflow, and Periscope
2+ years running analytics at a consumer internet company

We hope you are excited about everything you read so far. We highly encourage you to apply for this position, even if you feel you do not meet all the requirements. Quizlet is always looking for amazing folks that believe in our mission and can contribute to our team in various ways - not merely candidates that fit a certain mold.

Quizlet's Team Culture

We are here to make education better and more accessible. We strive to improve the lives of students and teachers at every stage and in every setting. We have a bias for action, take initiative, and hustle to deliver results. We make informed decisions whenever possible but are unafraid to take calculated risks on great ideas to promote learning. We embrace challenges and see effort as the path to mastery. We’re constantly seeking opportunities to learn and we embrace curiosity. Quality matters at Quizlet, and we hold the bar high on everything we do. We sweat the details and take personal accountability and pride in anything that carries the Quizlet name. We speak up, jump in and work with each other to fix problems, and never say "that's not my job." We treat each other with honesty and respect, encourage vigorous debate, and seek critical feedback. We value diversity, humility, transparency, and collaboration as the best paths to our success — as individuals, as a team, and as a company.

Quizlet’s success as an online learning community depends on a strong commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion. We are actively working to build a team that is representative of the diverse communities we serve, and an open, inclusive work environment where all employees can thrive. As an equal opportunity employer and a tech company committed to societal change, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ+ community, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Come join us!

title: Financial Data Analyst - Paris
role-description: Chez Back Market , nous avons à cœur de promouvoir un nouveau mode de consommation favorisant l’économie circulaire tout en luttant contre le gâchis électronique et l’obsolescence programmée.1ere marketplace européenne (et bientôt mondiale !!!) dédiée exclusivement à la vente de produits électroniques reconditionnés, nous connectons professionnels certifiés (usines de reconditionnement, distributeurs, etc..) donnant une seconde vie à vos équipements et clients à la recherche de qualité, d’accessibilité et d’un type de consommation plus écologique.Ce que l'on recherche au sein de Back Market? Une bonne dose d'humour, respect et bienveillance, un amour pour les lapins, un peu de zèle et une réelle expertise dans ton domaine ! Pour la bonne personne, c’est l’occasion de participer à la construction d’une marketplace de premier plan, directement dans l'équipe au cœur de l’innovation : le Bureau Of Technology. Tu veux en savoir plus sur l'organisation des équipes techniques et les features teams. : Un peu de lecture. Travaillant au sein de l’équipe BI, tu participeras à la croissance et à la rentabilité de Back Market grâce à une exploitation innovante et intelligente de notre data.Basé dans notre bureau Parisien ou Bordelais, tu travailleras particulièrement avec l'équipe Finance de Back Market afin de mettre à disposition des dashboards et analyses leur permettant de prendre les meilleures décisions. Tu seras donc au coeur du réacteur ! Reportant à notre Head of BI, tes missions incluront : * Utiliser la donnée (financière et autre) pour aider au pilotage de l’activité et améliorer les process existants avec notamment :-La modélisation de nos échecs de paiement pour réduire leur coûts associés et ainsi augmenter le CA de backmarket-la création de modèle pour détecter les marchands & les clients à risque-La création de reporting (financiers, comptable, …) * Automatiser la production et restitution des dashboards / KPIs * Accompagner les autres départements de Backmarket, sur leurs besoins et leurs problématiques de finance opérationnelle (tu aideras sur la bonne gestion des paiements, tu accompagneras les lancements de produits côte Finance, tu créeras des deposits sur des balances virtuelles et tu mapperas les nouveaux flux…) * Aider à la mise en place de nouveaux process, de KPI et d'alertes pour intégrer les nouveaux services aux clients (ex : services d'assurances) et aux marchands (ex : sous-traitance de services logistiques) dans nos suivis financiersCe que nous recherchons * Tu as au moins 3 ans d’expérience sur un poste et un secteur similaires * Tu as une formation Bac +5, Ecole d’ingénieur ou de commerce * Tu as une vraie appétence au secteur de la finance * Tu fais preuve d'une grande rigueur * Tu es quelqu'un de transparent, qui communique aisément sur tes avancées et tes difficultés * Tu as un esprit d’entrepreneur, tu es ouvert d’esprit et tu as envie de te dépasser * English is a no brainer for you :) * SQL et Tableau n'ont aucun secret pour toi, snowflake, looker, alteryx, python, airflow, dataiku, ELK seraient un plus * Tu as à cœur de rendre nos clients heureux * Tu aimes faire des choses concrètes et mettre les mains dans le cambouis * Tu sais prioriser, prendre soin des détails et la pression ne te fait pas peur * Tu as soif d’apprendre et tu veux t’immerger dans une startup en très forte croissance * Tu es un fantastique coéquipier qui aime travailler en équipe, apprendre des autres et partager ses connaissanceProcess de recrutement :- 1er entretien téléphonique avec Stéphane, notre chargé de recrutement- Test technique - Entretien avec Marie, notre head of BI- Entretien avec Pauline, notre Head of finances- Entretien avec Quentin, notre CTO et Thibaud, notre CEO Sauve la planète.. Rejoins Back Market !

title: Data Analyst - London
role-description:
Position Purpose

About The Team

Data sits at the heart of Revolut and plays a uniquely crucial role in what
we do. With data we build intelligent real-time systems to personalise our
product, tackle financial crime, automate reporting, track team
performances and enhance customer experiences.
Fundamentally, data underpins all operations at Revolut and being part of
the team gives you the chance to have a major impact across the company –
apply today to join our world class data department.
What we need
We are looking for smart and ambitious people who would help us understand
our data better. We are creating a centralised team of business analysts
who will be working with all teams across the company. This is a unique
opportunity to learn about all aspects of our business. Your main weapons
will be SQL, dashboards, and a thorough understanding of our business. You
will also be acting as a bridge between product owners and engineers.
What you will be doing
Understand our business and its processes through our data
Apply this understanding and knowledge of our data to help product teams
Come up with key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Create and maintain new aggregated views and tables to simplify data
querying
Maintain and create new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promote data literacy across the company, organise and hold workshops
What you will need
Strong SQL skills, experience with analytical databases is a plus
Datadriven storytelling and visualisation
Attention to detail
Empathy and compassion
Experience coding in Python is a plus
A Little About Us
We believe that there are better ways for people to control their money.
Easier, fairer ways.
Revolut started in 2015 with fee-free card transactions abroad. We’ve since
added current accounts, business accounts, savings, insurance, and even
cryptocurrency trading.
We reached 4 million customers in February 2019 and we’re adding another
million every quarter.
And we’re only just getting started.
Come and help Revolut build the world’s first truly global bank.
What we are looking for
From employee 1 to employee 1000, you will be slotting into a global team
that shares a number of traits.
You can work autonomously and take ownership. We thrive with the space and
responsibility to solve problems.
You operate best without lots of bureaucracy. We don’t hide behind fancy
job titles or clunky processes ‘because that’s how things are done’.
You approach work in a logical way. We are not afraid to make mistakes but
we use data and logic to backup decisions and improve understanding.
And you share our mission to improve people’s relationship with their
money.
The benefits
Competitive salary
Biannual equity bonuses
All the latest tech you need
Skip the commute and work from home once a week
Roll with a free Revolut Metal subscription
Pension plan
Private health insurance
Don’t panic about cooking: get free dinners with Deliveroo
Start the day properly with fresh fruit and cereals
Stay refreshed: get juice, tea, coffee and soft drinks on tap
Rest up with 29 days’ holiday per year

title: Data Analyst - F/H
role-description:
Votre rôle et votre mission

Votre futur environnement de travail
Au sein de notre filère Conseil, vous intégrerez notre équipe Intégration, Innovation, Industrie en Cybersécurité. Vous serez encadré
e par des Consultant
e
s expérimenté
e
s et suivi
e par votre tuteur
riche tout au long de votre stage. Vous interviendrez auprès de nos clients multi-secteurs d'activités sur des sujets de sécurité fonctionnelle des SI au sein de projets complexes à forts enjeux.

Les missions du stage
Vous interviendrez au sein d'un projet phare de l'Innovation, consistant au développement expérimental d'un système de détection de cyberattaques inconnues au sein du SOC. Le système à ce jour repose sur une approche par apprentissage non-supervisé, à base de features extraits des logs proxy. Des systèmes complémentaires à base de supervisé sont envisagés en vue d'opérationnalisation.

Votre mission consistera à assister le développement du système, depuis la conception de features en passant par sa mise en oeuvre jusqu'à sa mesure et à son analyse de performances. Vous pourrez être amené(e) à présenter et communiquer sur le projet.

En dehors du projet, vous serez amené
e à participer aux différents travaux et initiatives de l'équipe.
Technos utilisées
Développement : python, ScikitLearn, C,
Machine learning (supervisé et non supervisé) :
BI et Data Mining tools
Mathématiques (statistiques et probabilités notamment)

Les apports du stage
Déployer une méthodologie de Data Science et Machine Learning appliquée à la Cyber
Découvrir l'ensemble des activités liées à la cybersécurité grâce à notre vision 360
Bénéficier d'une formation technique chaque semaine, où vous pourrez alors interagir avec notre réseau d'experts
Profiter du soleil toulousain !
Rejoindre une entreprise engagée : les Soirées Cyber, Women in Cyber, le Hack, le FIC!
Démarrer votre carrière chez l'un des leaders européens de la Cybersécurité

Votre profil

En dernière année d'école d'Ingénieurs ou de Master Informatique, vous êtes intéressé
e par la diversité des expertises Cybersécurité et souhaité y développer vos compétences de Data Science.
Vous êtes curieux
se, autonome et avez l'esprit d'équipe. Vous êtes également capable de vulgarisation avec des connaissances en Machine Learning.
Un bon niveau d'anglais est préférable.

A compétences égales, tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.

A propos de nous

Sopra Steria, l'un des leaders européens du conseil, des services numériques et de l'édition de logiciels, aide ses clients à mener leur transformation digitale et à obtenir des bénéfices concrets et durables. Il apporte une réponse globale aux enjeux de compétitivité des grandes entreprises et organisations, combinant une connaissance approfondie des secteurs d'activité et des technologies innovantes à une approche résolument collaborative. Sopra Steria place l'humain au centre de son action et s'engage auprès de ses clients à tirer le meilleur parti du digital pour construire un avenir positif. Fort de 45 000 collaborateurs dans 25 pays, le Groupe a réalisé un chiffre d'affaires de 4,1 milliards d'euros en 2018.
The world is how we shape it. A l'heure où les cyber-menaces sont de plus en plus nombreuses et complexes, les entreprises doivent les anticiper et se protéger. La division « Cybersécurité » compte 250 experts à Paris et Toulouse. Elle accompagne ses clients grands comptes pour apporter des solutions sur de prévention, de détection et de réaction. Intégrez nos équipes de passionnés en Cybersécurité pour aborder de nouveaux challenges !

title: Data Analyst Business Intelligence (m/f/d) - Munich, Germany
role-description:
The Westwing mission is to inspire and make every home a beautiful home. We are on a quest to bring the wonders of eCommerce for home & living to our more than 900,000 customers in 11 countries. In only 8 years on the market, we have grown to more than 254 million Euros in annual revenue. More importantly, the opportunity ahead of us is massive.

The Westwing team is the secret to our success. Our more than 1,100 team members balance creativity and style with innovative technology and strong business fundamentals. We are proud to be working with inspiring colleagues who are smart, fun, ambitious, and looking for the challenge to transform an industry and take it into the future.

Do you think this could be you? To pursue our ambitious growth strategy, we are looking for a Business Intelligence Data Analyst (m/f/d). In this position, you will use your excellent analytical skills to provide actionable insights supporting our Management team and Business Departments to make data-driven decisions.

Your Responsibilities Will Be
Provide analytical expertise and actionable insights to support our Management team and Business Departments to make data-driven decisions
Establish and constantly improve reporting tools for business stakeholders, in order to support data-driven decision
Conduct ad-hoc analyses and present the results with passion and brevity to stakeholders, both visually and verbally
Develop and advance analytical models

You Come With
A passion for identifying and solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches and for translating your insights into data-driven and actionable recommendations
Ability to balance a fast-paced working environment with the need for precision. Yet, being able to apply a high degree of pragmatism to solve data challenges and get fast results if needed
Excellent skills in SQL, Excel and Tableau (or any equivalent visualization software). Additional programming skills (e.g. R, Python) or basic experience with setting-up ETL processes and working with Google Analytics data are a plus
At least two years of practical experience in the area of Business Intelligence / Data Analysis / Data Science
Excellent communication and presentation skills including fluent business English

We Offer
Plenty of room for personal growth, professional development and high impact
A highly talented, dynamic, and international team
Entrepreneurial experience in a leading eCommerce company
An attractive compensation package
Location: Munich

Contact Person: Elena Behr

Interested? Looking forward to your full application (cv & cover letter references) under specification of your possible starting date and salary expectation.

title: Data Analytics Internship
role-description:
G-Research is a leading quantitative research and technology company. By using the latest scientific techniques, we produce world-beating predictive research and build advanced technology to analyse the world's data.

The role

This is a great opportunity gain experience in the growing field of data analytics while making a real contribution to the quality of decision making in a market-leading company.

Data is at the heart of our business. The ability to use the information available to us to drive management decisions is a core driver of competitive advantage for the firm, making our data analytics team a key function in the firm.

Our team operates a world-class business information platform using Tableau, Alteryx and other tools to create a set of dynamic and highly available reports used across the firm from individual teams to senior management.

In This Role You Will
Use your analytical skills and business acumen to source, analyse and visualise a wide range of data
Meet with stakeholders to scope requirements
Use a range of analytical and statistical techniques to answer questions using data
Present findings and recommendations based on your analysis
Who are we looking for?

We Are Looking For a Strong Undergraduate Or Masters Student In a Numerical Subject In Their Penultimate Year Of Study At a Top Tier Institution Who
Is enthusiastic about data visualisation and can demonstrate interest in data/statistical analysis
Has excellent problem-solving ability
Has good communication skills and is able to work effectively as part of a team
Has a self-starting attitude and willingness to learn
Although exposure to specific applications or technical languages is not required, experience with Python, Matlab, Excel, R, Excel, Tableau, Alteryx or similar languages/applications would be a positive.

Why should you apply?
Highly competitive compensation
Informal dress code and excellent work/life balance
Comprehensive healthcare and life assurance
25 days holiday pro-rata
Cycle-to-work scheme
Subsidised gym membership
Monthly company events
Central London office close to 5 stations and 6 tube lines
Additional Information

This internship is available for 3 or 6 months, ending in September 2020. We are exclusively looking for those in their penultimate year of University with a view of converting strong performers into full time employees in 2021.

title: Data Analyst - Utrecht
role-description:
Trinamics

Data Analyst / Data Engineer
Master / SQL / Python / Big Data / Real Time

role-description:

Data Insights Analyst

Up to £50,000 per annum (dependent on experience) plus a range of benefits including 25 days annual leave, life assurance, an online benefits platform with a wide variety of discounts, and more…

Purplebricks is a unique hybrid estate agency. Having successfully disrupted the market with a strong focus and utilisation of technology and data, we are now the UK’s largest estate agent, selling more homes than anyone else in the market

We’re proud to be an official partner of Team GB and will be showing our support for the nation’s Olympic athletes in the run up to 2020. Our mission is simple: to be the best and most loved place for customers to buy, sell, and let their homes. We will achieve this through our amazing people – our #TeamPB – and by living our Purple Promises, which bring us together and ensure we live and breathe the same beliefs and values.

What does ‘Digital’ at Purplebricks look like?

Our ever-growing Digital team is made up from Design, Engineering, Infrastructure and Product experts. Our beanbags, sofas, mini fridges and standing desks create a relaxed environment in our Shirley headquarters – supporting our culture of trying new things, failing fast, and being open about our successes and struggles. You’ll be joining a team with a clearly defined product strategy led by a solid and experienced leadership team at the helm.

What will your day to day look like?

Intelligent use of data is central to our strategy at Purplebricks. As Data Insights Analyst you will be at the forefront of BI evangelism, upskilling the business in use of data and how it can help make better informed decisions. You should be highly skilled in manipulating and analysing data sets from a variety of sources and proficient at highlighting key metrics and presenting insight and recommendations in a confident, concise and easy to digest manner

You'll build and implement data solutions to provide deeper analysis and valuable insights to unlock opportunities and drive informed business decisions. You will use the data to communicate key insights through internal reports, presentations and dashboards. You will ensure the use of data is compliant to GDPR standards (and local legislation) and that best practices are applied. You will contribute to the design, implementation and delivery of a digital Business Intelligence strategy supporting the product and design functions and the wider Digital team.

What do we look for in a Data Insights Analyst?

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
ClarusONE Sourcing Services, LLP, provides strategic generic pharmaceutical services for both Walmart Stores, Inc. and McKesson Corporation.

This is a natural next step for the companies, which have more than two decades of history working together to improve the quality and lower the cost of pharmaceutical care to patients.

This new partnership will leverage McKesson’s demonstrated strength and expertise in global pharmaceutical sourcing in conjunction with Walmart’s strength and commitment to delivering leading health and wellness services to their customers.

As part of this arrangement, McKesson and Walmart have established this organisation in London to provide strategic sourcing services for both companies.

Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: London, United Kingdom

Job Purpose

The Data Analyst will support, manage and deliver reporting, analytics and insight that enable a wide range of strategic business decision processes. They will support all areas of the business in driving business growth, reducing waste and supporting automation though the use of appropriate data.

This role will work in collaboration with both internal and external stakeholders to provide data expertise and support the ongoing demand for new or enhanced data sets.

Responsibilities
Leverage visualisation tools and technology resources to plan, evaluate and execute strategic initiatives; design, build and support data solutions and dashboards conducive for business insights, reporting and analytics
Lead the development of dashboards and reports that compile, analyse, and report on data using multiple technologies (SQL, Tableau, etc); gather requirements and modelling criteria leveraging agile methodology
Apply various analytical techniques (i.e. mathematical models and/or statistical techniques) to support business growth
Leverage analytics and dashboards to create effective supplier-facing and internal communication materials
Assist in the development of team, departmental, and organisation metrics to analyse business performance and identify areas of opportunity
Be an advocate and champion of the ClarusONE data and information assets
Use supporting data to address key questions and concerns; partner with internal clients to identify and measure opportunities for relationship with Clarus
Support the development of metrics needed to accurately manage performance
Analyse opportunities for Clarus to expand product sales, services, and sourcing strategies while examining market channels and exploring innovative business opportunities
Manage the compilation, analysis, and reporting of data to forecast trends, apply various analytical techniques (i.e. mathematical models and/or statistical techniques) to support supplier and cost optimisation.
Analyse purchasing trends and generic launch conversions to provide clear internal guidance with product conversion strategies
Evaluate business performance and analyse impact to market share ensure Clarus ability to exceed targets
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, partners and internal clients
Manage delivery and support objectives of the ClarusONE
Leverage strong analytical capabilities, problem solving skills to make recommendations based on data
Demonstrate the ability to quickly identify solutions to complex problem
Present ideas and recommendation to various level in the organisation
Collaborate with all team members to problem solve and create solution
(The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties.)

Requirements

Education
Bachelor Degree level or above

Minimum Skills/Experience
Strong level and experience in data query language/tools (e.g. SQL, Alteryx). Direct experience of Alteryx would be preferable.
Experience with visualisation tools such as Tableau, Qliview, SAS, Business Objects & Power BI. Direct experience of Tableau would be preferable.
Experience with database technologies and concepts (Snowflake, Oracle, Teradata, SAP HANA, DB2, PostGres, SQL Server)
Expertise of data design and analysing data requirements

Additional Knowledge/Skills
Strong experience of Excel with skills in V-lookups, pivot tables, reporting and macro programming
Experience with data performance optimisation
Experience of Life Sciences/Pharmaceutical business
