title: Business Intelligence & Data Analyst (m|w|d)
role-description:
Ihre Aufgaben
Thementreiber werden. Sie haben den Biss und Ehrgeiz, Kompetenz in einem BI Thema aufzubauen und dieses thematisch sowie organisatorisch als Person zu besetzen.
Teamarbeit ist Ihr Ding: Gemeinsam mit Ihren Kollegen erarbeiten Sie neue Kennzahlen sowie Auswertungen und entwickeln die BI Lösung, auf Basis aktueller und zukünftiger Verfahren und Technologien, weiter.
In Ihrer Rolle erarbeiten Sie Fach- und IT-Konzepte im Business lntelligence-Umfeld.
Sie haben Spaß daran, in agilen und klassisch gesteuerten Projekten, Bl Lösungen umzusetzen. Ihr Profil
Ihr Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung, haben Sie erfolgreich abgeschlossen. Idealerweise haben Sie Ihr Können im BI/DWH-Umfeld in den letzten Jahren unter Beweis gestellt.
Sie sind immer am Puls der Zeit und kennen sich in der BI Entwicklung, idealerweise mit SAP BI / HANA, aus. Ebenso sind Sie aber offen für neue Themen und Technologien.
Sie weisen zudem solide Kenntnisse und Kompetenzen/Erfahrungen in den Themenbereichen Anforderungs-, Projekt- und Testmanagement auf.
Analytisches Denken, eine proaktive und selbständige Arbeitsweise sowie eine hohe Serviceorientierung und sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch runden Ihr Profil ab.
Themen wie Artificial Intelligence, Big Data Technologien oder Data Science finden Sie spannend und wollen sich hier weiterentwickeln. Was wir bieten
Einen modernen Arbeitsplatz und ein spannendes Aufgabengebiet in einer zukunftssicheren Branche
Interkulturelle Zusammenarbeit und kurze Kommunikationswege - auch über Ländergrenzen hinweg
Eine offene Unternehmenskultur und Vertrauensarbeitszeit für ein freies und selbstbestimmtes Zeitmanagement
Gezielte Mitarbeiterförderung: Fachliche Weiterbildung und Entwicklung der persönlichen Fähigkeiten in unserer hauseigenen Academy
Vielfältige Corporate Benefits in Bezug auf Gesundheit, Sport und Mitarbeiterevents Kontaktieren Sie uns Wenn Sie sich in der beschriebenen Position wiedererkennen, lassen Sie uns bitte Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (Anschreiben, Lebenslauf, Zeugnisse) online zukommen. Bitte geben Sie Ihre Gehaltsvorstellung sowie Ihren frühesten Eintrittstermin an.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Job Description

Job Description - Data Analyst (BRU202SR)

Data Analyst - (BRU202SR)

Description

Division

Audit mission is to provide independent assurance and insight, globally and locally, on Governance, Risk Management and Internal Controls, in order to support the Board and senior management in reaching their objectives.

We add value to the Company by promoting a control culture and by providing advices to management. We report to senior management, Management Committee and Audit Committees.

We are a team of about 50 persons, based in London, Paris and Brussels and our activities cover the entire Euroclear group.

Role

The key role of Data Analyst in Audit is to use data through various advanced analytics techniques to derive value and insights to support Audit division activities.

Your Objective

You work with data to generate insights and create value as part of Internal Audit’s assurance work
Contribute to deliver the Audit Plan on time, within budget and quality standards
Manage relationships and establish proactive interactions with auditors, business managers, data suppliers, IT specialists and other data analysts in the company
Continuous improvement: propose ideas or contribute to initiatives to further improve the functioning and productivity of the Audit division through the use of Data Analytics and Process Automation techniques.

In Order To Reach These Objectives, You Will
Conduct Business Data Analysis and Manipulate internal/external data in order to produce quality and actionable outputs in a timely manner
Make use of data analytics, data visualization, scripting and automation techniques
Make use of our Data Analytics technologies such as Hadoop echosystem (HDFS, Impala, Apache Hue), SQL Server, Microsoft PowerBI, MS Excel+VBA, MS Access+VBA, Powershell scripting, Python scripting, Knime (or equivalent)

We offer an excellent opportunity to practice and develop your talents in a highly professional and motivated team, dealing with multi-domains and getting involved in some of the most strategic files for the company.

We Offer a Continuous Professional Development Through
A comprehensive and transversal view on Euroclear and its business
Appropriate training per year related to the Audit Data Analytics function
Support to acquire external qualifications and professional certifications
Opportunity to acquire detailed knowledge of other division/departments within Euroclear
Opportunity to help improve the processes and control culture of the company
Focus on individual coaching by your people manager

Qualifications

Technical skills
You hold a University degree in a field where data are pivotal (Scientific domain, statistics, mathematics, computer science, laboratory, quantitative field, …)
You already have 3 years of professional experience as a data analyst using same technologies
You have experience with relational databases, Hadoop echosystem, SQL queries, Apache Hue, data exchange formats, high-level machine learning,
You understand the basics of data importation and data validation
You are very analytical and possess proven problem-solving ability, by quickly understanding and analysing different domains
You are able to analyse and understand business flows in order to create value with data
Experience with the following technologies is a plus: Hadoop echosystem (HDFS, Impala, Apache Hue), SQL Server, Microsoft PowerBI, MS Excel+VBA, MS Access+VBA, Powershell scripting, Python scripting, Knime (or equivalent)

Soft Skills
You have good networking skills since you will work in close collaboration with auditors, data suppliers and business users
You stay abreast of new tools and technologies to practice up-to-date data analytic
You are able to learn quickly, adjust to changes and think outside the box
You have excellent time management and organizational skills with attention to details
You are able to build relationships in a consultative style in order to understand the business of the data
You can influence and constructively challenge
You are self-confident and motivated, able to work independently and as a team member
You possess excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
The position is Brussels based and for a full time schedule. You are flexible, when travelling is required to other locations of the company.

This role is part of the Advisory career orientation.

Explore or develop your soft skills? More on Pulse+ Euroclear Development Centre

Euroclear recruits people from all walks of life. Our 3,500 employees represent 89 nationalities, of which over 50% are women. We are deeply convinced that diversity of talents, backgrounds and opinions is a key to success, by fostering engagement, energy and innovation. We are committed to promoting diversity within the organisation, as well as an inclusive environment where everyone can be themselves, feels valued and respected, regardless of their background.

Primary Location
: Brussels Office

Area of Interest
: Audit

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Data AnalystPromptly - Trofa

Jobdescription

PROMPTLYis an eHealth startup company that aims to revolutionize healthcare by making health outcomes available to everyone. Within one year, we aim to be conducting several pilot-studies in hospitals and healthcare systems in different geographies and by 2020 we will be reaching 1M patients in at least 4 different countries.

title: Data Analyst - Contract
role-description:
Description

Bird’s eye view of your role –

Yodlee’s Data Products team is driving innovations within the Financial Services Sector using Big Data. We have a high-caliber, focused and mission-driven culture within our teams. The models we build and the analysis that we derive from financial data matters in crucial cutting-edge business decisions made daily across global financial services firms and provides insight into real world problems.

In this role, you will gain a deep understanding of income and expense transactions, financial classifications, and long-term financial management within the UK market. You will participate in customer and partner calls to review requirements and client needs. You will quickly gain an understanding of how local income and expense calculations, and financial management best practices can be leveraged to deliver financial wellness tools to the UK market.

This role will allow you to partner with Yodlee analytics teams to review and enhance data categorization for key income and expense transactions. You will develop a specification for both rules based and machine learning-driven enhancements to categorization by defining transaction types. You will also interact closely with the Financial Wellness Product team to provide requirements to localize the financial management tools for the UK market. You will perform regular and ongoing analysis of consumer transactions to identify methods for improved categorization, testing and certifying enhancements, and validating performance metrics. You will also work with the Financial Wellness Product team to adapt their products for the UK market. This requires you to develop a deep understanding of the UK financial management space in order to develop an ongoing UK roadmap with the rest of the Financial Wellness Product team.

You will have –
Bachelor’s Degree
2 – 4 years of experience in software-oriented Product Management, preferably in Financial Services
Experience in financial modeling
Knowledge of Financial Services transactions

You Will Definitely Possess These Technical Skills –
Experience/interest in analyzing data
High attention to detail, especially in regards to data cleansing

Preferred Skills –
Product Management Certifications, particularly Pragmatic Marketing
Financial analysis skills

What Will You Bring –

You will be a thinker, a doer, and someone that likes to solve problems by analyzing data. You possess superb written and oral communication skills. You have analytical skills with a background in financial analysis. You will carefully seek to understand underlying business needs, both at a market level as well as at an individual client/prospect level. You are adaptable and can work successfully in a technical environment as a non-technical leader. You are inquisitive and highly detail-oriented. You are focused on execution and are able to make definitive decisions with limited data in uncertain environments.

What Are Your Performance Objectives –
Provide regular and deep analysis of transactions and propose new rules and feedback into machine learning
Analyze transactions and associated enrichment output for accuracy. Tag and label transaction data with accurate and appropriate attributes including, but not limited to, category of transaction, geo, etc.
Define and assess data product performance, identify gaps and incorrect outputs, tag correct values and improve expected performance
Contribute to the Yodlee transaction data enrichment and financial wellness roadmaps
Develop analytics requirements and rules based on the analysis
Ensure analysis output is incorporated into product after review with Data Science and Product Teams
Apply your knowledge and expertise of local and country-wide companies, merchants, types of businesses and nature of transactions towards analysis of the country/region
Bring your local/country/region expertise to highlight financial services nuances, prevalent financial behavior, popular technology choices, etc.
Provide a specific data-oriented approach to developing list of top merchants and companies, details on financial attitude, data sources for identifying long tail of merchants and businesses, etc.
Document your analysis and findings for knowledge base
What’s in it for you? –
Work with transactional data in a dynamic and rapidly growing space both within Fintech as well as Financial Wellness
Gain knowledge that can be applied towards various industries as the use of aggregated transactional data continues to spread and gain increasing popularity
Partner with cutting edge startups and traditional financial institutions
Open culture and technology agnostic which helps you be on top of the big data technology stack

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Company Description

Nexthink is a global leader in Digital Employee Experience. Our product allows enterprises to create highly productive digital workplaces for their employees by delivering optimal end-user experience. Through a unique combination of real-time analytics, automation and employee feedback across all endpoints, Nexthink helps IT teams meet the needs of the modern digital workplace.

Headquartered in Switzerland, Nexthink also has offices in France, UK, Germany, Spain, UAE, Australia and the US. Our growing team of Nexthinkers is proud to be making the digital work lives of seven million employees across 1,000 customers more productive.

At Nexthink, we believe actions are stronger than words when it comes to diversity, inclusivity, and equity in the workplace. Nexthinkers are multinational and multilingual, and come from all walks of life. We are committed to hiring a genuine representative workforce that can help us create solutions and foster innovation for the modern digital employee experience. Join us today!

Job Description

To support Nexthink Manage Services, we are looking for a Data Analyst who can provide remote Analytics activities to Nexthink strategic accounts in order to provide ongoing value to Nexthink customers on different areas of operations.

The focus of the role is to work with set of Service Delivery Managers to provide analysis for customer’s dataset and provide recommendations. The role is expected to work collaboratively with SDMs, Professional Services & Customer Success teams.

The Main Responsibilities Of The Role Are As Follows
Being able to analyze, baseline and benchmark customer’s data-set to drive insights for ongoing operations
Lead data projects end-to-end, including business requirements gathering, data requirements definition, technical specifications and follow-up;
Run complex analyses to deliver business insights to the different teams – automate reporting for scalability reasons whenever it is relevant;
Being able to find and highlight false positives or one off events
Ensuring that results and milestones are documented consistently and regularly shared with internal and external stakeholders
Being able to speak with experience IT stakeholders and explain data analysis, insights and assumptions
Analyze customer needs, goals, strategic plans and constraints
Being able to prioritize and work on different projects at the same time
Being able to suggest remediations and automation opportunities
Work against a set of Service Levels (SLs)
Stay current on product development/releases to a level required for the above activities;
This position requires 10% travel to headquarter for training purposes.
Seniority Level: Mid-Senior Level
Function: Information Technology
Qualifications
BA/BS preferred in computer science, computer engineering
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in technical consulting, analytics & automation
Ability to perform data analysis and drive to actionable insights and automation
Deep experience in either workplace management, network management, productivity and collaboration management
Experience over transformation projects (e.g. Win10, O365)
Extensive technical knowledge on end user computing
Good knowledge of IT operations in challenging environments
Ability to quickly learn new technologies in an unsupervised environment
Excellent communication, customer facing and teamwork skills
Exceptional analytical skills; outstanding communication and social awareness
Enthusiasm for working in an international, collaborative and fast-paced environment and learning new technologies
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Windows and Linux clients and its applications
Outstanding Excel skills. Great command of business intelligence software and data visualization tools such of R , Mathlab and Python as well as strong data visualization skills and experience with relevant data visualization tools would be a significant asset;
Practical knowledge of SQL, XML, windows PowerShell. Practical experiences in data integration
Relevant software industry experience in any of the following: IT systems, enterprise or infrastructure management, application development and management, security, and/or analytics
Fluency in English, with excellent written, digital and verbal communication skills; knowledge of other languages would be an asset
Additional Information
This is an exceptional opportunity to join a fast-growing, successful and innovative company. Nexthink allows you to thrive in a unique work environment where the emphasis is on excellence, innovation, openness and collaboration.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst or an analytical graduate to join our market leading Data Analytics Team.

Aviva UK Health pays over £400m in claims every year, through a wide spectrum of healthcare suppliers (over 1,500 facilities and 35,000 specialists). Therefore, the focus of the Supply Chain Team is to lead these providers in the most optimal way, to ensure excellent customer experience and clinical outcomes, at the best price.

As the Data Analyst, you will use data analysis and modelling techniques to play a key part in forming the strategy that we will utilize with our suppliers. The main objective is to deliver an outstanding service and clinically appropriate treatment for our members whilst we achieve our desired business outcomes as authoritatively as possible. You will be involved in complex modelling of customer behaviour and clinical pathways, as well as identifying any potential area of claims leakage and inefficiency within current processes.

Duties & Responsibilities

Contribute with improving the data analytics techniques and tools to deliver proactive models and insight to help to optimise the suppliers used
Investigate new data to improve optimisation and minimisation of supplier leakage and fraud
Support the development of a dedicated approach to fraud and claims leakage management across the business
Maintain and update the data analysis tools for the detection of Financial Loss
Assist the ongoing development of the strategy and roadmap of Supply Chain
Develop and conceptualise data analytics and modelling to support the critical thinking that underpins Aviva UK Health’s supply chain activity
Research and understand the private health market and products to enable optimal strategy
Review processes to facilitate a can-do approach to identify key trends and future issues
Present analytical findings to both internal and external stakeholders to inform and influence the strategy used

Skills & Experience Required

You will be educated to a degree level (can be recent graduate)
You will be highly numerate with strong data analytical capability
You will be able to develop professional relationships with internal and external customers
You will have the ability to work on multiple activities at the same time, juggling priorities
You will have experience of handling, analysing and reporting on large data sets
You will have knowledge of data handling and statistical tools such as SQL or SAS or R or Python or Excel or SPSS

Desirable

Familiar with statistical techniques and methods including hypothesis testing (t-test, p-values), confidence intervals, regression & classification
Knowledge of the Healthcare industry
Experience in a commercial or project-based environment

What will you get for this role?

Salary between £25,000 - £35,000 depending on skills, experience and qualifications
Generous defined contribution pension scheme
Annual performance related bonus and pay review
Holiday allowance of 29 days plus bank holidays and the option to buy/sell up to 5 additional days
Up to 40% discount for some Aviva products through “My Aviva Extras” plus discounts for Friends and Family (some exclusions apply)
Excellent range of flexible benefits to include a matching share save scheme

We care about the wellbeing of our employees

How you feel at home, work and all aspects of your life are important to us. Our programme – ‘Be Healthy’, ‘Be Mindful’, ‘Be Secure’ and ‘Be Awesome’ supports your physical, mental, financial and social wellbeing.

Here are just a few highlights:

You’ll be able to download Aviva Digital GP - a 24/7 personal GP service that enables you to get a video consultation with a GP and pharmacy service at the touch of a button
We offer all UK employees subscriptions to Headspace for FREE
We have subsidised 70% off the normal gym membership prices, meaning for a reduced monthly fee you will have access to a wide range of fitness venues

Additional Information and Equal Opportunity

One of Aviva’s core values is Care More, and this is brought to life through the flexible ways we love to work. This may include working from home some of the time, or flexible work schedules to accommodate parent and carer responsibilities, further studies and hobbies.

Our diversity and inclusion policies and initiatives are shaping an environment where everyone feels welcome regardless of age, disability, race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, religion, culture, sexual orientation, national origin, marital status, pregnancy, maternity or those with other caring responsibilities. Our approach helps to ensure that Aviva is a place which values difference and provides equal opportunities for all.

As a disability confident employer, we guarantee to interview anyone with a disability (as defined in The Equality Act 2010) whose application meets the minimum criteria for the post. (By ‘minimum criteria’ we mean that you must provide us with evidence which demonstrates that you generally meet the level of competence required, as well as meeting any of the qualifications, skills or experience defined as essential). Please apply through the website and then email the contact listed in the advert to notify us that you meet the conditions for the guaranteed interview scheme.

We prefer all applications to be submitted online, however if you require an alternative method of applying please contact Lacey Lane Mckoy in the Resourcing team on 0121 234 7612 or Lacey.lane-mckoy@aviva.com

title: Data Analyst (Power BI)
role-description:
The Company

The company is international and located in the center of Brussels, but you’ll closely work together with colleagues from around the world. The company has a clear vision and knows which goals they want to strive for; growth, innovation and qualified employees. The team is very open, transparent and supportive. You can clearly see they don’t only want to invest in the company, but also in their employees because of the trainings you get at the start (and during) your career. There are a lot of growth possibilities for the future, it’s only up to you to take them!

The job

As a Data Analyst you’ll be the one responsible for the visualization of large amounts of data coming of the web. There is a lot of traffic on their website and they would like to increase it even more in the future. In order to do this you have to be able to work with large datasets and find the correct data needed for the analysis you want do to. Afterwards you’ll visualize it with PowerBI. You’ll work closely with other teams and communicate with business stakeholders on a daily base. Besides that there are some quarterly workshops where you discuss the current challenges, create roadmaps etc.

The Requirements

Min. 2 years’ experience in a similar role

Strong experience in data visualization (preferably Power Bi and/or Tableau)

Analytical mindset with a self-steering personality

Strong communication skills and a certain business maturity

SEO knowledge is a big plus

title: KDB Developer - Data & Analytics
role-description:
Job Description

Corporate Title: Vice President

Location: London

Line of Business: GBAM Tech

Here in our London office we are looking for a committed KDB Developer with prior experience in developing large scale enterprise data capture and analytical applications to join our Equities DNA (Data & Analytics) team to participate in development and maintenance of the existing equities data warehouse platform and work on build out of the next generation solution.

Employees in EMEA benefit from working in a company that invests billions of dollars each year in leading-edge technology, and from working in a company that excels in delivering operating services.

Our team expects excellence, rewards high performance, develops its leaders, encourages innovation, demands integrity, cultivates trust and teamwork, and promotes diversity and inclusion. That culture, combined with market leadership and a wide array of professional opportunities, enables us to attract and retain the brightest minds in the business.

What will your main responsibilities involve?
Capture, record keeping and distribution of pre-trade transaction data and derived (real-time and daily) analytics and reports for Equity business
Added value services TCA/Cost+/Facilitation Cost Estimation
Work on delivery of new features (feeds, analytics, availability and resiliency improvements) and stability of the existing platform build using KDB/Q/Java technologies
Be actively involved in design and delivery of the next generation platform based on Java/Apache Storm/Kafka, Oracle Exadata
What skills and qualifications will you ideally possess?
Team mentality and experience is critical. You will be able to work with and mentor junior members as well as take direction from leaders
Good communication skills and the ability to coordinate different tasks and work with different partner groups from business, through development to infrastructure and support
Big data knowledge including real time stream processing, analytics and large data stores
Trading lifecycle knowledge
Excellent Q/KDB skills
Core Java skills are very helpful
Knowledge of UNIX/Linux environments
Extensive analytical and problem solving skills
Investment Banking/Equities Domain experience
FIX Protocol
Data capture/Data warehouse/TCA development experience
Middleware (EMS/TibRV/others)
Knowledge of modern SDLC practices and tools (SVN/Git, Agile, Code Reviews, CI, TDD)
Investment banking IT experience
C++/Python knowledge

About Bank Of America Merrill Lynch

Bank of America is one of the world's leading financial institutions, serving individual consumers, small- and middle-market businesses, large corporations and governments with a full range of financial and risk management products and services. Bank of America Merrill Lynch is the marketing name for the global banking and markets businesses.

The company has had a presence in EMEA since 1922. With offices in 19 countries on three continents, it offers an integrated and comprehensive set of products and services across Global Corporate and Investment Banking, Global Markets and Consumer Card, serving the needs of individual, corporate, institutional and government clients, combining the best of local knowledge and global expertise. Developing solutions for social and environmental challenges is at the core of Bank of America Merrill Lynch’s responsibility platform. In more than 90 countries around the world, we partner with employees, clients and stakeholders to help make financial lives better.

Apply

If you‘re interested in this opportunity please send your details to us by applying online.

Good conduct and sound judgment is crucial to our long term success. It’s important that all employees in the organisation understand the expected standards of conduct and how we manage conduct risk. Individual accountability and an ownership mindset are the cornerstones of our Code of Conduct and are at the heart of managing risk well.

We are an equal opportunities employer, and ensure that no applicant is subject to less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, gender identity, marital status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origins, age, sexual orientation, socio-economic background, responsibilities for dependants, physical or mental disability. The Bank selects candidates for interview based on their skills, qualifications and experience.

As part of our standard hiring process to manage risk, please note background screening checks will be conducted on all hires before commencing employment.

title: Business / Data Analyst
role-description:
Description

Selina is a hospitality ecosystem for a new generation of travelers. We make it possible to work, live and travel, anywhere in the world by offering accommodation, co-working spaces and different life experiences. Whether you prefer a remote location on the coast of Costa Rica or the city scene of Miami, we offer a holistic balance of work-life-well-being experiences that will get you covered.

Selina is looking for a self-starter and ambitious Business Analyst looking to make a huge impact on a global company in hyper-growth. The role is a strategic one, impacting the performance of the company by leveraging and analyzing data from all sources, and transforming it into an actionable business strategy.

In your day-to-day you will create data-driven recommendations to improve performance across different departments in Selina. You will build and implement dashboards to monitor performance, and work closely with the teams to find optimization points and opportunities, and you will become the strategic source of information to guide their performance.

Responsibilities
Use data analysis to optimize performance
Ask business questions, creating hypotheses and experiments to prove (or contradict) them
Analyze large complex data sets to identify trends and opportunities and communicate them to managers and leaders
Lead the implementation of new analytical models by collecting needs from stakeholders and working with the BI team
Manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously that involve cross-functional collaboration, while delivering high-quality results on time

Requirements
Significant experience as a business analyst: 2-3 years in an analytical role with proven impact on a company’s performance, preferably in a global company, preferably as a marketing and/or product analyst
Internally-motivated self-starter with ability to plan, organize, and establish priorities to manage multiple projects and achieve results
Confident facilitator and communicator who can lead meetings and manage relationships with executive-level stakeholders and make recommendations for improvements in the business
Degree-level education in one of the following: Economics, Business, Statistics, Industrial Engineering or other similar quantitative field
Highly capable in SQL
Experience building dashboards and reports in data visualization software (Tableau/Microstrategy/ PowerBI/ Looker)
Master in both Excel and Powerpoint
Excellent spoken and written English
Experience with product analytics and A/B testing tools: MixPanel, Amplitude, Google Analytics, Google Optimize
Advantage: Experience with data analysis in Python/R
Working permit - a Must

title: Data Analyst - Richmond
role-description:
About the job Summary The National Archives is looking for a Data Analyst with in-depth experience in design and data architecture, creating conceptual models and transforming them to logical models and physical schemas and in defining mappings / transformations between data models. You will work in an open, transparent and collaborative environment, engaging with internal and external communities to share your work and learn new from others, maintaining your understanding of developing technologies that can be applied to archival content enhancement and to enable the re-use of public data. Job description The full job description is attached. Responsibilities As our Data Analyst, you will have a strong background in organising, managing, enriching and manipulating data, including structured and text-based information. You will have excellent experience of the relevant database technologies and programming languages and be highly skilled in structuring, converting, analysing and exploring data to reveal underlying patterns and stories. You will have the ability to think rigorously about the complex issues involved in data collection and manipulation and will enjoy working with records specialists to support access to the digital archive. You will remain calm whilst working under pressure, dealing with a wide variety of tasks and will have experience in problem solving using data design. You will see opportunities for improvements and be able to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences through appropriate medium. This is an opportunity to work with committed and talented developers, designers, archivists and researchers who share a passion for creating high quality, user-focused digital services for a range of audiences. Join us here in beautiful Kew, just 10 minutes’ walk from the Overground and Underground stations, and you can expect an excellent range of benefits. They include a pension, the option to work part time or job share and discounts with local businesses (e.g. beauty salons and bars). We also offer wellbeing resources (e.g. on-site therapists) and have an on-site gym, restaurant, shop and staff bar. To submit your application please click the 'Apply now' button on this page, where you will be asked to provide CV details and complete a personal statement. In your personal statement please explain how you meet the criteria below. You may draw on knowledge, skills, abilities, experience gained from paid work, domestic responsibilities, education, leisure interests and voluntary activities. Please note selection for interview will largely be based on the information you provide in this section so please make full use of the 1250 word count. Essential criteria:
Extensive experience of large scale data analysis and manipulation using different programming techniques (for example, Python, Shell scripting, XSLT, SQL) for structured and text based data analysis and manipulation.
Excellent knowledge and experience of working with data encoded in different formats (for example, XML, CSV, JSON, RDF).
Practical experience and knowledge of a range of database technologies (for example: no-SQL, RDBMS, triple stores / linked data, graph databases).
Awareness of the issues with manipulating complex structured and unstructured data, with excellent skills in pattern analysis and strong accuracy and attention to detail.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and organisational skills coupled with the ability to work to a high degree of accuracy demonstrating a proactive and solutions focused approach to problems.
Strong communication and relationship building skills, suitable for working with multidisciplinary stakeholders at all levels; able to lead and facilitate work to gather user requirements from the business and to explain technical concepts clearly to non-technical staff.
Highly motivated to work independently and as a project team member. title: Audit Data Analyst
role-description:
Division

 

Audit mission is to provide independent assurance and insight, globally and locally, on Governance, Risk Management and Internal Controls, in order to support the Board and senior management in reaching their objectives.

 

We add value to the Company by promoting a control culture and by providing advices to management. We report to senior management, Management Committee and Audit Committees.

 

We are a team of about 50 persons, based in London, Paris and Brussels and our activities cover the entire Euroclear group. 

 

Role

 

The key role of Data Analyst in Audit is to use data through various advanced analytics techniques to derive value and insights to support Audit division activities.

 

Your objective:

 You work with data to generate insights and create value as part of Internal Audit’s assurance work

Contribute to deliver the Audit Plan on time, within budget and quality standards
Manage relationships and establish proactive interactions with auditors, business managers, data suppliers, IT specialists and other data analysts in the company
Continuous improvement: propose ideas or contribute to initiatives to further improve the functioning and productivity of the Audit division through the use of Data Analytics and Process Automation techniques.


In order to reach these objectives, you will:

Conduct Business Data Analysis and Manipulate internal/external data in order to produce quality and actionable outputs in a timely manner
Make use of data analytics, data visualization, scripting and automation techniques
Make use of our Data Analytics technologies such as Hadoop echosystem (HDFS, Impala, Apache Hue), SQL Server, Microsoft PowerBI, MS Excel+VBA, MS Access+VBA, Powershell scripting, Python scripting, Knime (or equivalent)


We offer an excellent opportunity to practice and develop your talents in a highly professional and motivated team, dealing with multi-domains and getting involved in some of the most strategic files for the company.

 

We offer a continuous professional development through:

A comprehensive and transversal view on Euroclear and its business
Appropriate training per year related to the Audit Data Analytics function
Support to acquire external qualifications and professional certifications
Opportunity to acquire detailed knowledge of other division/departments within Euroclear
Opportunity to help improve the processes and control culture of the company


Focus on individual coaching by your people manager

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Job Description


We are looking for a Data Analyst who will be instrumental in delivering, reporting and analysis of commercial analytics across the entire global business.  

The successful candidate is an analytical and technical problem solver, who can dive into unstructured environments and build solutions. You will drive analysis behind company-wide decisions and build scalable processes that enable stakeholders to leverage data and act upon insights.

You will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies on the AWS cloud platform on a wide range of high-priority projects and have exposure to multiple stakeholders within Product, Sales, Marketing, Research and Engineering. You are a self-starter looking to add value using your data experience in a collaborative, commercial and client-centric environment.


Main Responsibilities

Play a pivotal role in developing the capability and business impact of the analytics team
Works with cross-functional teams to gather, wrangle, cleanse, structure, and build models aligned with organisational goals.
Providing analysis of business data, commentary and recommendations to inform business strategy, drive improvement and business growth opportunities
Contribute to generating insight from analytics - by performing efficient and insightful data analysis
Maintain and develop ‘self-service’ analytics dashboards for the key business areas (Sales, Research, Marketing and Finance)
Build deep knowledge of the analytics domain – provide support and guidance to business and technical teams
Compile monthly and ad-hoc slide packs for consumption by the Execs, senior management and key stakeholders
Experiment and innovate with technology and analytical techniques to uncover new ways of deriving value from data
  Team Profile

The analytics team are responsible for delivering insights and reporting to the business, based on the data gathered from our digital channels and commercial systems.

Key guiding principles for the team:
Enable the business to make timely, well-informed and data-driven commercial decisions
Democratise the ability for business users to perform analysis and create dashboards
Continuous innovation – seek out and adopt cutting edge techniques to improve the storage, collection, visualisation and analysis of data
Strive for the highest standards of data quality and governance


Qualifications

University Degree - Minimum 2 year of professional experience within analytics or business intelligence functions

Technical
Experience in querying, manipulating and summarising large amount of data through SQL, in addition to experience in scripting languages such as R or Python
Understanding of building reports and dashboards using PowerBI or equivalent (e.g. Tableau, Spotfire)
Understanding and related experience in the integration of data from multiple data sources and automation of data processes
Understanding of data warehousing & data lake concepts with coding abilities in the field of data manipulation
Strong MS Excel skills and proficient in the other MS Office suite applications (Word, PowerPoint)
  Behavioural
A strong track record of applying problem-solving skills, particularly in relation to large data volumes and technical systems
Must have a curious and innovative mind-set, with a determination to understand challenging concepts and find new solutions
Intellectually curious and enjoys problem-solving, requirement gathering, and adaptive to lead with example
Ability to sense check and identify trends or patterns in data
Comfortable taking ownership of tasks and working with limited supervision or instruction
Thoughtful and comfortable communicator (in person or on paper) with both technical and business stakeholders, with the ability to facilitate discussions and conduct training
Ability to thrive in a flexible and collaborative environment

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Company Description

Fascinated by the future and captivated by technology?

Smart, driven and want to make a difference in the world?

You’ll fit right in.

Join a diverse team at Visa, where your individuality fits right in. We can provide the opportunity to shape the payments experience globally. Together, let’s transform the way the world pays.

Think you know us?

Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, reliable and secure digital payment network that enables individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.

Individuality fuels our brand and our global team – we’re proud that we are a talented team of 15,000 individuals with unique backgrounds, perspectives and experiences. Therefore, we understand that you are much more than your day job. We encourage quality of life outside of the office, whether it’s taking advantage of agile work schedules or our wellness programs, Visa respects and encourages meaningful work/life balance for everyone. In addition, we offer market leading salary and have a fantastic benefits offering.

So, if you’re not satisfied with the status quo, we can satisfy your desire to explore new territory, giving you the runway to really make an impact, whilst connecting you with teams around the world in a truly inclusive culture that celebrates our uniqueness.

If you think you could support Visa as a Data Analyst, we want to hear from you – together, let’s make Visa a great place to work.

Job Description

The Business Planning and Operations Team (BPO) provides the European CEO with Executive Support and Engagement, Governance & Performance Management, and Business Planning & Initiatives.

This is an exciting, fast moving area of the business where we oversee the successful completion of activities critical to the European CEO.

The Data Analyst is a key role within our team reporting directly to the Head of Governance and Performance Management. The role is responsible for the production of key sources of Management Information (MI) utilised by the Business Planning and Operations team and Europe’s Broader Leadership Team (including the European Scorecard and Executive Action Log).

This hands-on role requires a strong data and business analysis skillset. You will be highly numeric, have excellent working knowledge of excel and experience of managing the mechanics related to reporting including: data extraction, data translation, information logging, analysis and interpretation. You will have the ability to summarise and communicate insightful analysis of key trends, highlighting key Business Risks & Opportunities. You will also be experienced in operationalizing and automating MI processes and driving their continuous improvement.

The role requires a proactive and highly resourceful individual with strong emotional intelligence, self-motivation, analytical skills and the ability to drive high profile work. You will require excellent organisational skills, a willingness to learn and, be comfortable navigating challenging forces and working in a fast-paced environment with significant change. Adaptability is key, as our team must respond to the needs of the CEO and European business.

Responsibilities
Supports the Performance Manager to refine effective scorecards and performance measurement, as a mechanism to drive successful execution of strategic objectives and improved visibility of performance shortfalls.
Responsible for the production of the European Score Card and ensures that the scorecard is available in a timely manner each month.
Supports the delivery of proactive and insightful analysis of key trends to enrich commentary and understanding of the key operational and strategic Risks & Opportunities
Develops a knowledge and understanding of the European Region’s business drivers and develops a comprehensive understanding of how this fits into the overall business strategy
Works with stakeholders to ensure that they understand their responsibilities concerning data contribution and that they provide source data to the required quality on a timely basis.
Champions good Data Management practices
Performs data analysis as needed to identify root causes of trends and recommends corrective actions.
Ensures that data is managed in compliance with relevant regulations and European policies – including GDPR and records management.
Supports Governance Management on an as needed basis – including maintenance of the executive action log.
We are a diverse, supportive and resourceful team, who are committed to delivering the best outcomes for Visa via the successful execution of cross-functional initiatives. Every day brings new challenges and opportunities. This is a great place to learn, develop and build your profile.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications
Minimum of Bachelor’s degree or equivalent

Preferred Experience
Experience in financial services or payments, ideally with some combination of commercial, operations, and finance experience
Demonstrated exceptional analytical skill with experience managing and manipulating large relational data sources (Tableau, PowerBI etc.)
Qualified in one of the following: Statistics, Finance, Economics, Business, or Computer Science, Engineering or other quantitative fields
Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively – both verbally and in writing to stakeholders at all levels
Proven ability to service and support a range of internal and external customers, often in parallel and within a shifting set of priorities.
Experience working across European markets in the payments sector
Advanced Microsoft excel skills including ability to create and understand complex formulas, link databases and create working MI Tools.
Microsoft Word, PowerPoint
Additional Information

You Will
Build support, commitment and respect from others by demonstrating professionalism, integrity and expertise.
Make a positive impact by executing on commitments to consistently deliver exemplary results.
Demonstrate excellent collaboration skills partnering with internal stakeholders to support the work of the BPO.
Embody Visa’s Leadership Principles and inspire others to as well.
Diversity & Inclusion

Universal acceptance for everyone, everywhere, is not only our brand promise, it’s the foundation of our company culture. We foster a feeling of connectedness in the workplace, support diversity of thought, culture and background, fight for important initiatives like Equal Pay and actively work to eliminate unconscious biases that hold us all back.

By leveraging the diverse backgrounds and perspectives of our worldwide teams, Visa is a better place to work and a better business partner to our clients.

title: Big Data Analyst
role-description:
Description

Amaris est une société indépendante et internationale de Conseil en Management et Technologies créée en 2007. Présent dans plus de 50 pays, le groupe accompagne plus de 850 clients pour la réalisation leurs projets. Notre expertise s'étend sur 5 domaines d'innovation le business management, le digital, l'ingénierie, les télécommunications et la santé. Fort de plus de 65 bureaux à travers le monde, le Groupe offre un soutien de proximité à ses clients aux quatre coins du monde et de nombreuses opportunités de carrières internationales pour ses employés.

En 2019, Amaris vise les 350 millions d'euros de chiffre d'affaires et les 6500 employés à travers le monde. Pour y arriver, le groupe prévoit recruter de nouveaux talents avec plus de 2000 postes à pourvoir. Nous prévoyons de tripler nos effectifs dans les prochaines années et souhaitons nous positionner comme le leader international du conseil indépendant.

Your Role

Afin d’accompagner cette croissance constante, Amaris investit largement dans l'innovation. Après avoir ouvert son laboratoire R&D à Nice et son usine R&D à Tunis, spécialisée dans l'intelligence artificielle, suivie de l'ouverture du département C&D offrant des partenariats de long-terme sur des sujets comme la blockchain et la Big Data,Amaris continue de d’orienter son activité vers des solutions toujours plus innovantes et uniques en data auprès de ses clients en France (Lille, Paris, Lyon, Toulouse, Grenoble et Nice) et en Suisse (région de Genève et Lausanne).

Actuellement, le groupe travaille avec plusieurs clients dans le cadre du déploiement à grande échelle du Big Data. Nous recherchons donc des Consultant(e)s Big Data pour définir des principes d’architecture et designer des solutions de la plateforme Big Data. Vos responsabilités serons les suivantes
Appréhender fonctionnellement et techniquement l’environnement et les applications Big Data de votre client
Participer à la définition de l’architecture et des solutions de la plateforme Big Data afin d’optimiser sa performance
S’assurer du respect du scope, du budget et des délais impartis avec des contraintes de performance, de disponibilité et d’accès concurrents
Etre constamment en veille technologique afin de proposer de nouvelles idées et solutions
Candidat(e) idéal(e)

Diplômé(e) d’un Master d’Université ou Ecole d’Ingénieur, avec une spécialité IT, Ingénieurie logicielle ou Data Science, vous êtes à la recherche de nouvelles opportunités de carrière dans la conception et le développement de solutions Big Data.

Passionné(e) par ce domaine, vous bénéficiez déjà d’une expérience réussie en Big Data
Vous maîtrisez l’environnement Hadoop
Vous avez travaillé sur d’autres projets de l’écosystème Hadoop comme HDFS, MapReduce, HBase, Hive, Pig,…
Vous souhaitez travailler avec des bases de données NoSql (MongDB, Cassandra)
Vous possédez éventuellement des connaissances en Spark, Kafka et/ou en programmation R et/ou Python
Vous êtes une personne organisée et rigoureuse, proactive et audacieuse. Vous êtes en mesure de trouver

rapidement des solutions pragmatiques.

Vous parlez couramment français et pouvez occasionnellement parler anglais dans un cadre professionnel.

Si vous êtes intéressé(e) de travailler au sein d’une entreprise internationale en pleine croissance, sur un projet unique et innovant où vous pourrez utiliser votre créativité, cette opportunité est faite pour vous !

Vous êtes mobile dans la villes de Brussels

If you want to know more about life at Amaris or you need any extra information on the job application you want to apply to, visit our Amaris Discussion page. Our ambassadors are here to guide you or answer any question you have.

title: Data Insight Analyst
role-description:
Description

Dyson’s Health & Beauty (H&B) business unit, which includes Environmental Care, Personal Care and Airblade products has ambitious plans to scale. The product range continues to expand into new technologies, markets and categories. To maximise our potential within these areas, it is essential that Dyson demonstrates credibility and superiority within these fields at both a global and local level. The Category Development team has been established to drive strategic analytics, credentialing and commercial engineering activities across the H&B business unit to enable these growth plans.

The Category Development Data Insight Analyst will be responsible for delivering category analytics work packages across H&B, and for the development of the H&B knowledge portal (a site that is accessible to everyone who works within H&B globally). The category analytics work packages involve extracting, blending and analysing data from a variety of different internal and external sources in order to deliver and communicate actionable insights. These insights will be integral to guiding engineering and commercial strategy, sales volume projection, and operational capacity planning for current and future products across the H&B portfolio. The development of the knowledge portal, will involve working closely with the cross-functional content owners, all the analytical teams across Dyson, and collaboration architects to build and evolve the site. The aim is to successfully provide information to support the knowledge and decision making of everyone within H&B.

The ultimate goal of the team is to transform our analytics capability to drive strategic activity, decision making and category development activity, which is key to the growth of H&B.

Accountabilities

Ability to query large datasets using SQL
Competent programming with a scripting language (e.g. Python, R)

title: Investment Data Analyst

To serve as the point of contact for FFS, IMG and other enterprise data clients for investment data related inquires and partner with internal teams to ensure integrity of investment and fund data. Serves as the point of contact for FFS, IMG and other enterprise data consumers for investment data related inquires and partners with internal teams to ensure integrity of investment and fund data. Completes daily and ad hoc tasks while working under tight deadlines, managing competing priorities, and analyzing multiple inputs to meet operational objectives.
Provides oversight of operational activities to ensure accurate and timely data delivery. Analyzes and resolves complex data issues supporting Data Management as a process expert per assigned data domain.
Proactively identifies and leads process enhancement initiatives to gain efficiencies and improve quality. Recognizes and resolves roadblocks to maximize team impact. Partners with external data vendors and industry contacts to enable best in class data management practices
Develops a strong and consistent knowledge of funds and securities assigned and obtains an end-to-end knowledge of the operational processes being supported. Participates in new product implementations and other improvement projects by capturing, documenting, and validating business requirements, ensuring systems are properly set up for go-live. Communicates appropriately with all necessary clients and stakeholders.
Recommends changes that will enhance workflows and procedures. Integrates new or existing technologies into workflows and communicates updates to all team members, analyzing impact, preparing environment for change, and updating or creating procedures.
Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Excellent analytical capabilities, research, problem solving, and time management skills required. Proficiency in Data Management procedures and strong knowledge of data domain workflows preferred.

Strong, demonstrated problem identification, analysis, and resolution skills.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
UK Biobank have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join their growing team in Cheadle.

Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Cheadle, with regular travel

Salary: £25,000 - £35,000 per annum

Owing to the increasing volume and complexity of data contained within the UK Biobank study, we have recently expanded our data analytical capacity to teams based at two sites – Oxford and Cheadle – and are now recruiting for a Data Analyst to join the Data Analyst team based at the Cheadle site.

Data Analyst – About Us

UK Biobank is a large prospective study of 500,000 men and women aged 40-69 from across the United Kingdom, recruited between the years of 2006-2010. A rich variety of genetic, biochemical, lifestyle and health-related information is available on each participant, making the resource unprecedented in its size and scope. The study continues to collect extensive information about its participants with data originating from a range of sources including questionnaires, ongoing assessment clinics, electronic health records, assay technologies (e.g. genotyping, sequencing, multi-omics data), multimodal imaging and biomarker assays.

UK Biobank is an open-access resource and since access to UK Biobank opened in 2012, there are now over 12,500 registered researchers worldwide and over 1,500 research applications to use the resource.

Data Analyst – The Role

UK Biobank is seeking a suitably qualified individual to provide data analytical support to its Access, Epidemiology and IT teams. The main responsibilities will involve processing, managing and curating the large and diverse amounts of data acquired by UK Biobank, including:
Incorporation of data into the resource from the UK Biobank Imaging Study (that is conducting multi-modal MRI scans of 100,000 participants);
Incorporation of returned results from researchers into the resource; and
Providing analytical support to researchers who wish to access the resource.
The post will be based at the UK Biobank Coordinating Centre in Cheadle, although regular liaison with UK Biobank staff at the Big Data Institute (at the University of Oxford) will be required.

The post-holder will work closely with a multi-disciplinary team of programmers, statisticians, epidemiologists, research and administrative staff and will report to UK Biobank’s Senior Data Analyst based in Cheadle.

This is an exciting opportunity to interrogate and resolve issues and challenges associated with these large and highly complex real-world data sets (e.g. coding errors, missing, incomplete and/or inconsistent data).

The role will suit an enthusiastic and self-motivated individual with proven data analytical skills.

Essential Criteria

Data Analyst – About You:
An MSc or equivalent in a scientific or numerate subject.
Proficiency in using relational databases and writing SQL queries.
Proficiency in using one or more statistical software packages (e.g. STATA, SAS, R).
Excellent written and oral communication skills in English.
Ability to communicate ideas to technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to pay attention to detail, and experience showing a detailed approach to documentation.
Ability to prioritise workload and to work under pressure.
Ability to work within a team.
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.
Highly motivated, able to work on own initiative.
Desirable Criteria
Understanding of the application of statistical methods to epidemiological studies.
Understanding and/or experience of the use of health records for medical research.
Experience in managing large and complex information resources – extraction, conversion, integration and data transfer.
Experience of programming and/or scripting in a linux environment
Experience using data visualisation tools such as R Shiny or Tableau
Experience of bioinformatics and genetics-related toolsets.
Experience working with cloud-delivered environments.
Experience of working in a multidisciplinary team (e.g. a team involving clinicians, scientists, etc.) and/or in wider collaborative groups
We offer a competitive salary, and holidays based on an equivalent of 26 days holiday, membership of the generous USS pension scheme and several other employee benefits such as cycle schemes and PerkBox are offered.

To submit your CV for this excellent opportunity, please click ‘Apply’ now.

Closing Date: Monday 25th November 2019

title: Data Analytics Consultant
role-description:
Who are we?

Afiniti is the world’s leading applied artificial intelligence and advanced analytics provider. Afiniti Enterprise Behavioral Pairing™ uses artificial intelligence to identify subtle and valuable patterns of human interaction in order to pair individuals on the basis of behavior, leading to more successful interactions and measurable increases in enterprise profitability. Purpose

You will be able to partner with and build strong relationships with client partner teams including business owners, marketing, IT and other teams as well as internal Afiniti business analytics, artificial intelligence and IT teams to develop and deliver analytic work product. Proactively identify, prioritize and conduct analysis that drives meaningful insight on target objectives.

Key Responsibilities
Liaise with client stakeholders, including senior and executive level client staff, to communicate data requirements and help secure data assets from clients as well as offline data sources
Able to drive successful completion of deliverables and analytic deliverables
Ensures quality and reliability of data obtained from client sources and offline data sources (ensuring that data contains required information for analytics and modeling)
Responsible for performance reporting aspects on concurrent new installations (or expansions) and for existing billing accounts
Respond to requests for performance results (at levels other than provided on production reports or to confirm results on production reports)
Drill down on results (problem solving analysis) and conduct custom analysis
Validate monthly billing
Reconcile data (internally and with the client)
Reconcile data and procedure with internal AI team
Define data joining procedures (collaborate with and audit procedures from AI team) for new installations and expansions. Document and get client to agree to procedure. (Well written document with flowchart)
Break down and audit join production join procedures
Confirm that call outcomes can be determined from data being offered
Ensure data integrity on review of historical data
Confirm that AI team is able to optimize the performance metric desired by the client and that the data provided by the client is sufficient (completeness and usability)
Define data validation reports to be shared with client
Show client how to look at the data and give them comfort around the procedure and the various checks that are part of validation. (Present results and SQL procedures to client via web session)
Perform other duties as assigned - prepare succinct, clear, and easy to follow documents that summarize findings and insights

The ideal candidate will have
5+ years of working experience
Experience of working in a client facing role; consulting experience preferred
Possess the ability to manage clients and internal stakeholders in ensuring that data is received and managed in timely and efficient manner
The ability to convey mathematical concepts in meaningful way to business clients and internal team members
The ability to work independently and in a team environment
The ability to work effectively across functions, levels and disciplines
Knowledge of MS Office Suite – particularly Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Knowledge of SQL; R and Python would be beneficial
Strong knowledge and understanding of statistical concepts
Possess strong problems solving and critical thinking skills


Education & Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Economics, Statistics, Psychology, Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or Finance
MBA is highly desirable

Salary & Package

As well as a competitive base salary dependent on the number of years of experience, we also offer generous stock options, an annual discretionary bonus plus Corporate benefits.

title: Junior Data & Analytics Consultant
role-description:
Palkkaamme uransa alkuvaiheessa olevan data- & analytiikkakonsultin kehittämään asiakkaidemme liiketoimintaa. Information Management -yksiköllämme on pitkä kokemus analyyttisista sovelluksista, joissa suurten tietomassojen käsittely ja hallinta ovat arkipäivää. Suunnittelemme ja toteutamme asiakkaillemme tiedonhallinnan ja analytiikan ratkaisuja, jotka palvelevat mahdollistavat monipuolisen tiedon hyödyntämisen suoraan liiketoiminnan tarpeisiin. Valitsemme käyttämämme teknologiat aina asiakastarpeen mukaisesti ja hyödynnämme ratkaisuissamme myös Azure- AWS- ja Google -pilviratkaisuja.
  MISTÄ ON KYSE
  Työssäsi pääset varmistamaan kollegoidesi tukemana, että asiakkaamme hyödyntävät keräämäänsä dataa mahdollisimman tehokkaasti. Rooliasi voidaan muotoilla omien tavoitteidesi mukaisesti – pääset kasvattamaan asiantuntemustasi asiakasprojekteissamme esimerkiksi tietoarkkitehtuurien, mastertiedon hallinnan, tietomallinnuksen ja tietovarastoinnin parissa. Työskentelet osaavassa porukassa Espoon tai Tampereen toimistoillamme sekä tiimisi kanssa asiakkaidemme tiloissa pääkaupunkiseudulla. Työskentelemme suomalaisten ja kansainvälisten keskisuurien ja suurien asiakkuuksien parissa.
  Löydät aina kokenutta sparrailuseuraa useista eri tiimeistämme ja työskenteletkin noin 150 ammattilaisemme ja eri asiantuntijatiimiemme kanssa Suomessa ja Ruotsissa. Saat työkavereiksesi alan rautaisia ammattilaisia, joilla on laajaa kokemusta eri teknologioista sekä palvelujen ja ratkaisujen kehittämisestä asiakkaille. Pääset työskentelemään kokeneiden kollegoiden lisäksi myös muiden kehittyvien junior-konsulttien kanssa.
  TUNNISTATKO ITSESI TÄSTÄ?

Olet meille oikea junior-konsultti, kun olet aidosti innostunut työskentelemään liiketoimintalähtöisissä projekteissa, joissa saat rakentaa ja olla mukana kehittämässä asiakkaidemme liiketoimintaratkaisuja. Onnistumisesi mittari löytyy kiinnostuksesta ja uteliaisuudesta dataan sekä aidosta halusta auttaa asiakkaitamme. Päivittäisenä työkielenäsi on suomi ja puhut lisäksi konsernikieltämme englantia.
  Menestyt roolissa parhaiten, mikäli:

Olet opiskellut tiedonhallintaan liittyviä kursseja, tai sinulta löytyy teknistä ymmärrystä esim. järjestelmien kehittämisen puolelta tai ohjelmoinnista
Opinnoissasi olet saanut peruvalmiuden relaatiotietokantoihin ja SQL:ään. Lisäksi eduksesi on ymmärrys ETL- tai raportointivälineistä ja pilvipalveluista
Olet valmis laittamaan itsesi likoon ja oppimaan virheistäsi. Ideoit mielelläsi uusia ratkaisuja työkavereidesi kanssa sekä työskentelet kädet savessa asiakasprojekteissa
Haluat liittyä lämminhenkiseen ja osaavaan porukkaan, jossa sinulla on tiedossa monipuolisia asiakasprojekteja ja ammatillisia kasvumahdollisuuksia nyt ja tulevaisuudessa
  MIKSI TÄMÄ ROOLI VOISI OLLA SEURAAVA SIIRTOSI
  Meillä pääset työyhteisöön ja rooliin, jossa asiantuntemustasi arvostetaan ja työlläsi on näkyvä vaikutus. Mahdollistamme työn ja yksityiselämän sujuvan yhteispelin joustamalla molempiin suuntiin. Tarjoamme sinulle uskottavat resurssit onnistumiseen, tukea työhyvinvointiin ja kouluttautumiseen, uramahdollisuudet talon sisällä sekä työyhteisön, joka kannustaa tiedon jakamiseen ja avoimuuteen.
  HAKUOHJEET JA LISÄTIEDOT
  Kuulostaako kiinnostavalta? Aloita haku rekrytointijärjestelmämme  & apply-painikkeen kautta, haethan viimeistään 20.11.2019 mennessä. Keskustelemme jatkuvasti kiinnostavien ehdokkaiden kanssa, joten yhteyttä kannattaa ottaa heti mahdollisuuden tullen.
  Kysymyksiin sinulle vastaa mielellään Terhi Mattila (Vice President, Information Management) numerossa +358 50 376 0241 tai sähköpostitse terhi.mattila@enfo.fi.

Hakupäätöksesi tueksi kerromme mielellämme lisää meillä työskentelemisestä, joten ethän epäröi olla yhteydessä!

title: Bloomberg Data Analyst – European Language Speaker
role-description:
Bloomberg runs on data, and in the Global Data team we're responsible for acquiring it and providing it to our clients. We collect, analyse, process and publish the data which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal- the facts and figures which ultimately move the financial markets. We apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies and we implement technology solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes- and all this while providing platinum customer support to our clients.


In Global Data, you will apply your problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, implement technical solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes, build relationships with key players in the financial market by providing exceptional client support, and manage the financial data that feeds the Bloomberg Terminal.


The Role:
Data Analysts possess a unique combination of technical skills and business acumen, as well as strong communication and interpersonal skills. They use these skills to collaborate with a variety of stakeholders to provide timely, accurate, and comprehensive data to our clients. They also play a key role in evolving our products and processes, which makes the role challenging and entrepreneurial.


We'll trust you to:

Utilise a variety of software solutions to extract and rationalise data to Bloomberg taxonomies

Analyse internal processes to identify opportunities for improvement, as well as devise and implement innovative solutions

Implement business rules for programmatic data validation by codifying market conventions and/or data relationships

Design and manage workflow configurations for critical functions such as acquisition, worklist management, and quality control

Contribute to continuous improvement by generating ideas to improve our data products and/or associated processes and building prototypes to validate and illustrate requirements

Lead ad hoc projects to optimize processes and/or improve the quality of the data set

Utilise statistics and data visualization skills to report on results of on-going operations and projects, as required

Build subject matter expertise and technical skills to generate premium content, including data-driven news stories

Partner with a wide variety of stakeholders from Engineering to Sales on product development

Provide in-depth customer support for users of Bloomberg products such as the Professional Service, News, Enterprise Solutions, and Bloomberg Law by resolving inquiries in a timely manner


You'll need to have:

A bachelor's degree, preferably with combined studies in Information Systems and Finance, or related business and STEM fields

Fluency in English and a main European language

Strong passion for data, technology and finance

Demonstrated project or work experience using one more programming language such as Python, SQL and R

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Understanding and experience of statistics and data modeling

Strong attention to detail and high degree of demonstrated decision-making and problem solving skills

Eagerness to learn and collaborate with others

Customer focused mindset

Ability to work under pressure and in a frequently changing environment


We'd love to see:

Prior work experience in information technology, engineering, finance, data analysis or research

Exposure to Bloomberg products such as the Professional Service

Established presence in virtual development communities such as GitHub, Stack Overflow and HackerRank

Familiarity with Data Science and/or Machine Learning

Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau or QlikSense


Does this sound like you?
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are!


In the meantime feel free to have a look at this:https://www.bloomberg.com/careers/global-data/


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status


Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments to be made for the recruitment process. If you would prefer to discuss this confidentially, please email access2@bloomberg.net. Alternatively, you can get support from our disability partner EmployAbility, please contact +44 7852 764 684 or info@employ-ability.org.uk.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Description

Amazon Fashion is a fast moving innovative team that is revolutionizing the future of online Fashion retail to become each customer’s most loved fashion destination. We are looking for candidates that are passionate about big data and data warehouse technologies (Redshift, EMR, Spark), visualization (Tableau, Amazon QuickSight) and statistical modelling/ML. This role will design, execute, and iterate on reporting directly visible to Senior Leadership in EU Amazon Fashion. Beyond reporting, the role will lead strategic deep dives and build algorithmic solutions that drive discoveries in search, marketing, and pricing to surprise and delight Fashion customers at every turn.

The ideal candidate has a strong track record and end-to-end ownership of the full stack of data analysis (data engineering, ETL, data modelling, and data visualization), with a high fluency in SQL and Python/R. You should also thrive on independence and be relentless in finding automated solutions and eliminating manual solutions.

Primary Responsibilities
Own Reporting/BI roadmap by working with business leaders on strategically prioritizing numerous requests and long-term adoption of new technologies
Develop performance dashboards with key metrics for review with senior leadership and business teams
Empower non-technical, internal customers to self-sufficiency in analytics and reporting via business intelligence and visualization software (e.g., Tableau, Amazon Quicksight, etc.).
Create data pipelines from a data lake to various reporting, visualization, and modelling tools
Use statistical and Machine Learning techniques for strategic deep dives and generate actions, as well as communicating in front of senior leadership.
For This Position We Expect

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
BS in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related field
Multiple years of relevant work experience in BI, Analytics, or Data Science fields or comparable fields
Proven SQL/Python skills in data transformation, analysis, and optimization
Excellent communication written and verbal communication skills, especially in regards to quantitative topics discussed with non-technical colleagues
Ability to influence multiple stakeholders to align roadmap and priorities
Strong organizational and multitasking skills with ability to balance competing priorities
Further Qualifications Would Be a Plus

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
MS or PhD in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related field
Broad experience in big data technologies (Hadoop, Hive, etc.)
Familiarity with AWS services such as S3, Redshift, EMR, Athena, etc.
History of applying statistical or machine learning models to business problems
Familiarity with fashion world and seasonal online retail
Are you interested? We look forward to receiving your application. Please submit your online application including your CV and covering letter in English.

By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize Amazon to transmit and store your information in the Amazon group of companies' world-wide recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies.
