title: Junior BI Data Quality Analyst
role-description:
Position Overview

For our newly established IT Delivery Center in Sofia, we are looking for a Junior Data Quality Analyst to ensure and safeguard data quality, data completeness and data monitoring for our global BI applications. Experience and interest in data analytics and creating business friendly reports are key. Strength in analytical thinking along with being an excellent communicator. If you also have a sense of business acumen and problem-solving aptitude, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, you will ensure and enhance our business intelligence systems to help us make better decisions.

Key Responsibilities
Design - and perform daily, weekly and – monthly validations in strong collaboration with our business partners and bottler
Validate and perform data uploads in collaboration with our business partners and bottlers, seek opportunities to automate
Identify - & resolve data inconsistencies
Create data quality reports (Power BI, SQL, MS Excel) and monitor success
Seek continuously improvements in process and activities, participate in service improvements plans
Validate correctness of new products (new data) and ensure all attributes are correct
Support resolution of data issue’s, coordinate data issue’s between clients and application support teams
Perform application testing and validation
Provide input to improve master data maintenance of BI systems

Education Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field

Related Work Experience
Studies or experience with BI, data Modeling or Analytics
Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g. Microsoft Power BI)
Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative
Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
Strong communicator
Development languages: SQL

Our Growth Culture

One of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years is having a company culture that supports and rewards behaviors that lead to growth. Our “Growth Behaviors,” as we call them, are ways of being and working that help to make us successful. Think about how you can bring this to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.

Curious
Keep seeking, never settle. Staying curious about what is outside, and two steps ahead inspires us to challenge the status quo. Having the courage to look and leap is the way we grow. Because asking “what if?” pushes us to the next level as people and as a company.

Empowered
Make it happen. True empowerment is the result of taking responsibility. This means giving yourself permission to see it, say it and do it, and owning the outcomes. Because we move forward faster when we all take action.

Version 1.0, 2.0, 3.0
Push for progress, not perfection. There are very few overnight successes. Greatness is borne of many little victories (and failures). Share v 1.0, test it, and make it better. Then create the next version. Because the moment we think something is perfect, it will be obsolete.

Inclusive
Include, value and trust each other. We are smart alone but together we are genius. This means being inclusive, giving the benefit of the doubt and being responsible for each other. Because, for our company to thrive for the next 100+ years, smart isn’t enough. We need genius.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: Social Media Data Analyst
role-description:
Who We Are

As the German office of POSSIBLE, a world-wide creative network, we sit right at the intersection of local traditions and global trends. We're deeply rooted in a long history that shapes the way we work and who we work for: some of the world's biggest and coolest brands.

We've come together from different places and varying backgrounds united under a common cause: deliver brilliant creative results. We like to think of ourselves as one big family. So here's a promise: We're people you'll enjoy sharing a table with.

Who We Are Looking For

POSSIBLE is looking for a Social Media Data Analyst to lead and manage the ongoing research needs for several brands/clients. In this role, you will be responsible of providing analysis, research estimates, be the day-to-day research resource in meetings, create and execute full research plans, and manage budgets.

What You´ll Do
Perform analysis on quantitative data qualitative research primarily in the field of social media (support and organize)
Work with social monitoring, social listening, and community tools (e.g. Brandwatch and Hootsuite).
Prepare performance reports and summaries based on customer specific targets (brand management, trend monitoring, crisis monitoring, market research, influencer identification, competitor analysis, etc.).
Deliver presentations of research findings to clients.
Develop innovative ways of measuring and optimizing digital advertising campaigns
Support continued development of new research products and processes.
Quality management & project coordination.


What You´ll Need
2-3 years of experience in the field of digital analytics, social media analysis and/ or social media success measurement.
University and university of applied sciences degree in economics, media science, mathematics or computer science, preferably with reference to market research or statistics.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
Experience using R or python preferred.
Knowledge of current social media KPIs.
Knowledge of planning and executing qualitative marketing research methodologies and facilitation techniques.
Excellent written and verbal communications skills.
Strong organizational and presentation skills.
Strong focus on customer satisfaction.
Excellent command of German and English, both verbal and written.


About POSSIBLE

POSSIBLE believes that a promise is the foundation of every good relationship – and the truth is, brands make promises every day. We are visionaries and innovators working in creative, technology, strategy, and data science to create experiences that keep brand promises so that every interaction is an opportunity to build trust and loyalty. We use data to help us identify opportunities, technology to help us take advantage of them and emotion to make the resulting experiences magical.

We've built our agency with our own promise: to foster a culture of inclusiveness and collaboration that appeals to those who want to do great work and make a difference. POSSIBLE creates experiences for some of the world's most dynamic brands, including Microsoft, AT&T, Nestle, Adidas, and Turner. POSSIBLE is part WPP and the Wunderman Group.

Follow POSSIBLE on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/possible-com/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/possible/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/POSSIBLE

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/POSSIBLE.com

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We rely on legitimate interest as a legal basis for processing personal information under the GDPR for purposes of recruitment and applications for employment.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Data Analyst – SAS/SQL
London

You will be part of the Strategic Analytics team that shapes UK Credit Cards strategy using data analytics as the key competitive tool. With a portfolio of 10 million customers and £16bn in assets, data driven intelligence is integral to our future growth strategy.
You will support UK Credit Card business in delivering “best in class” data delivery and reporting solutions ensuring timely and accurate datamarts and reporting are available to service the business.

What will you be doing?
Supporting the investigation and remediation for complex incidents identified by the business
Developing, leveraging a strong understanding of Barclaycard’s data system to understand details of complex data problems develop methodology for remediation of incidents
Identifying and summarizing of any further risks or incidents and risk mitigation strategies
You will be Developing controls for proactive early identification of future incidents
What We’re Looking For
Experience in data, BI and analytics in a commercially led environment
A proven ability to engage with commercially focused stakeholders and clearly present the results of data analysis in a way that is easy for others to understand
Significant experience in SAS/SQL
Working experience of reporting and visualisation tools, such as Tableau or QlikView
Skills That Will Help You In The Role
Experience within a financial services organisation or equivalent is preferred
Knowledge of the financial services industry, preferably card and payments industries
Experience in data analytics – particularly in relation to credit cards
Excellent professional communication skills – making oneself understood, sharing information, listening to others
Where will you be working?
In the heart of Canary Wharf, our headquarters at Churchill Place boasts onsite amenities such as; a gym, staff restaurant and deli bar, and is easily accessible by tube and bus links. With a population of around 5000 staff the atmosphere is second to none with a real buzz being created around the offices within.

Interested and want to know more about Barclays? Visit home.barclays/who-we-are/ for more details.

Our Values
Everything we do is shaped by the five values of Respect, Integrity, Service, Excellence and Stewardship. Our values inform the foundations of our relationships with customers and clients, but they also shape how we measure and reward the performance of our colleagues. Simply put, success is not just about what you achieve, but about how you achieve it.

Our Diversity
We aim to foster a culture where individuals of all backgrounds feel confident in bringing their whole selves to work, feel included and their talents are nurtured, empowering them to contribute fully to our vision and goals.

Our Benefits

Our customers are unique. The same goes for our colleagues. That's why at Barclays we offer a range of benefits, allowing every colleague to choose the best options for their personal circumstances. These include a competitive salary and pension, health care and all the tools, technology and support to help you become the very best you can be. We are proud of our dynamic working options for colleagues. Where appropriate, and for UK based roles, we will consider requests that the role be based at alternative Barclays’ key UK location from that advertised.

We will consider applications from job share applicants

title: Data Analyst (w/m/d) - Salzburg
role-description:
Atos ist ein führender Anbieter für die digitale Transformation mit circa 120.000 Mitarbeitern in 73 Ländern und einem Pro-forma-Jahresumsatz von rund 13 Milliarden Euro. Als europäischer Marktführer in den Bereichen Cloud, Cybersecurity und High-Performance Computing bietet die Gruppe end-to-end Orchestrated Hybrid-Cloud, Big Data, Business Applications und Digital Workplace Lösungen sowie Transaktionsdienste der Tochtergesellschaft Worldline, dem europäischen Marktführer in der Zahlungsbranche. Mit ihren Spitzentechnologien und ihrem Branchenwissen unterstützt Atos die digitale Transformation ihrer Kunden in allen Geschäftsbereichen.

Der Konzern ist der weltweite IT-Partner der Olympischen und Paralympischen Spiele. Atos firmiert unter den Marken Atos, Atos Syntel, Unify und Worldline. Atos ist an der Pariser Börse (CAC40) notiert.

Ihre Aufgaben

Analyse, Konzeption und Realisierung moderner Business Intelligence & Data Science Lösungen
Datenbeschaffung (S/4Hana, SQL Server) und Datenauswertung mit Hilfe von gängigen BI-Reporting Tools (Tableau, QlikView) bzw. Process Mining (Celonis)
Laufende technische Betreuung und Beratung der Kunden inkl. Entwicklung und Implementierung kundenspezifischer Lösungen
Zusammenarbeit mit dem Projektteam von der Kundenanfrage bis zur Produktivsetzung
Selbstständige Konzeption und Realisierung passender technischer Architekturen
Übernahme eigener (Teil-) Projekte


Ihr Profil

Abgeschlossene technische oder betriebswirtschaftliche Ausbildung (weiterführende Schule, FH, Universität) idealerweise mit einschlägigem Schwerpunkt
Erfahrung in der Umsetzung und Weiterentwicklung von BI Lösungen inkl. selbstständiger Anforderungsanalyse und Lösungskonzeption
Know-how im Bereich Konzeption und Entwicklung von Datenmodellen bis hin zur Gestaltung von Berichten mit Frontendtools
Programmier- und SQL Kenntnisse
Hohes Maß an Eigeninitiative, sowie Lern- und Einsatzbereitschaft
Teamfähigkeit und Spaß an der Zusammenarbeit mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern
Ausgeprägte Kunden- und Lösungsorientierung
Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse zur Kommunikation auch mit internationalen KollegInnen und Kunden
Moderate Reiseanforderungen


Wir bieten

Abwechslungsreiche und herausfordernde Tätigkeiten bei namhaften Kunden
Eigenverantwortliche Betreuung Ihrer Kundenprojekte
Mentoring für die ersten sechs Monate sowie laufende Fortbildungen
Harmonisches Arbeitsumfeld und ein engagiertes Team
Home-Office Möglichkeit sowie flexible Arbeitszeiteinteilung
Persönliche und fachliche Weiterentwicklung in einem internationalen Umfeld
Leistungsorientierte, marktgerechte Bezahlung
Attraktive Sozialleistungen (Kantine, zusätzliche Urlaubstage uvm.)


Je nach Erfahrung beginnen Sie Ihre Karriere bei Atos auf Consultant oder Senior Consultant Level. Sie übernehmen in jedem Fall eine verantwortungsvolle Rolle in einem engagierten Beratungsteam, in dem ständige Weiterentwicklung, wechselseitiger Austausch und Teamwork großgeschrieben werden.

Wir haben uns zum Ziel gesetzt, Diversität in unserem Unternehmen zu fördern. Wir freuen uns über eine Bewerbung, unabhängig von Geschlecht, Herkunft, Alter, Behinderung oder sexueller Orientierung.

Für diese Position erwartet Sie je nach konkreter Erfahrung ein Jahresbruttogehalt ab € 58.000, - zzgl. eines leistungsorientierten Bonus.

Weitere Informationen

Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Für Fragen steht Ihnen unsere Recruiterin Alisa Dittmann (alisa.dittmann@atos.net) gern zur Verfügung.
Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung inkl. Lebenslauf und Motivationsschreiben!

title: Senior Data Analyst
role-description:
Bolt is one of the fastest growing startups in the world with over 30M happy customers in 30+ countries, from Europe to Mexico to Africa. We're building the future of transport – one platform that connects you with cars, motorcycles, scooter sharing, and anything else you need to move around in your city. Fast, convenient and affordable for everyone, as transport should be.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics team. You will be be responsible for analyzing business and technical data, building metrics and insights to make better and timely business decisions across the globe.

Let's build the future of transportation together!

What You'll Be Doing
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide reports
Proactively work together with Data Science and Data Engineering teams to get best out of Bolt's data.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs


Requirements
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
At least 2-4 years experience dealing with large volumes of data
Amazing SQL skills
Experience with Python or R
Experience with some BI tools and data visualization
Experience ML frameworks is a plus
Great written communication
Experience with business and financial analytics is a big plus
Fluent in English


Benefits
Motivating compensation – motivational base pay and company stock options
No corporate BS – we're moving too fast for that
Amazing personal growth experience at one of the fastest-growing startups in Europe
Working with a motivated and talented international team, plus regular team events
Working in one of the coolest offices in Tallinn – ping-pong table, free snacks/drinks
Flexible working hours – as long as you get the work done
Monthly Bolt credit for rides
Impactful work – you'll have a rare opportunity to build a product literally used by millions of people across the world

Our team is made up of thinkers, innovators and go-getters shaping the way millions of people move around the globe. We value passionate and down-to-earth people who are driven to get things done and find creative solutions to problems. We recognize that our strength and success are directly linked to the talent and skills of our team members and a lean approach to our work. Our headquarters are situated in Tallinn, Estonia and we have offices in 30+ countries around the world.

Did we spark your interest? Get in touch and let's talk!

title: Supply Excellence Data Analyst
role-description:
Glovo is a global marketplace, making items from anywhere in your city accessible in under 40 minutes. We launched in March 2015 and now operate in over 24 countries. Our goal is to conquer as many countries and cities as possible: the sky's the limit!

One of the key actors of the platform are the riders, Glovers as we like to call them. They are the core of the supply department, and one of the three pillars of our platform, along with Partners and Customers.

We are looking for a creative problem solver to join our Barcelona HQ. Working in Global Supply Excellence team you will be the one to analyse and automate all of the courier-related processes to impact Glovers at the right time, to help them get the most out of the platform, and deliver the best customer and partner experience. Also you will need to collaborate with other Global, Regional and Local teams to collect their input and knowledge about our operations.

You will need to gather insights, identify problems and find the best solutions for them! Also, you will need to come up with scalable ways to automate tasks, in a way that they can remain adaptable to local needs and practices, while minimising manual work. This role will require a strong analytical mindset, knowledge of automation techniques and, most importantly, an ability to think outside of the box when normal methods don't work to complete a task.

You Will
Provide analytical support to the team of operations managers from Glovo HQ
Perform analysis to come up with some insights to help improve Operations in all the cities around the world
Build the Operational Tools and design processes from scratch
Run A/B Tests fast and smartly to get new insights
Be in touch with our Data/Tech team to request and implement new product features
Make good use of internal data to build dashboards that measure and track the impact of your actions
Roll out the tools you build to different markets, adapting them to local needs
Give life to your craziest ideas and have an immediate impact


Requirements
Strong analytical knowledge and experience with reporting, driving insights, and data-driven optimisation
Proven track-record of devising and delivering successful automations using off the shelf tools
Analytical skills: experience working with SQL, Python, Google Scripts. Other coding languages are a big plus
Ability to adapt in an ever-changing environment - balancing intense attention to detail with swift turnaround while working in a collaborative, positive manner
Strong drive for continuous improvement
Problem solving: You always find a way to get things done
Proficiency in English
Our core values are very important to us:

Gas: We think big and take calculated risks to go for all business opportunities, no matter how challenging they are! We work hard as a team and execute fast.

Everyone Wins: We are here for the long run. Glovers, Partners and Users are on the very center of everything we do. If they win, Glovo wins. So for every decision, we make sure we are positively impacting them.

Good vibes: Our teams are built of people that radiate positive energy and managers that are honest and fair. No assholes allowed! We stay optimistic no matter what, infecting each other with positivity, joy, and the desire to spend time together.

Stay Humble: Always act humble: Everybody must roll up their sleeves and get their hands dirty to make our big plans a reality. We are tiny! We are conscious of how big the opportunity is and how much we've got left to do.

Glownership: Act as one company—one team: Care first about Glovo, not your role or your department. Own your stuff, no question, but go beyond your role; help before you are asked. Everything you need to make things happen, you do it. Glow it!

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!


Benefits
A ticket to the moon sitting on the fastest rocket - an adventure filled with challenges and professional growth
Social benefits (such as fresh fruit every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 6 weeks, the best coffee machine in the world,...)
Private Health Insurance
Unlimited Glovos (zero delivery fee on your Glovo orders)
Attractive compensation and equity plan
Gym membership discounts
Back to School Fridays (it's all about learning and sharing knowledge)
Team building activities
Relocation package
International and talented team, used to working in a fast paced and vibrant way!

title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
role-description:
As a Business Intelligence Data Analyst, you will be a valued member of the company’s Data Analytics team whose main role is developing BI solutions as well as providing analytical service to various internal stakeholders (Sales, Product Development, Finance, Customer Support, Risks, etc.).

Main Duties & Responsibilities
Support internal stakeholders with appropriate data analysis and help them to make really data driven decisions
Work closely with internal stakeholders and – where it is possible - automate analytics by building dashboards and reports in BI tool Tableau
Propose suggestions on how to improve content of reports, data warehouse, analysis
Gain expertise in data science and analysis by staying abreast on best practices and methodologies
Present data and findings in clear, easy to digest way

Qualifications
Previous experience with data analysis and building content in some BI tool (Tableau, Qlik, Power BI or similar)
Ability to demonstrate creative thinking and passion about data and data analysis
Ability to be careful and thorough about details
Experience in writing queries in SQL
Willingness to acquire additional technical skills where it can help to make work more efficient
Ability to communicate fluently in English both verbally and in writing

Nice To Have Skills
Knowledge of statistics
Knowledge of scripting/programming languages (python, vb, js)
Previous experience with Big Data

Required Education/Experience
2+ years related work experience
University degree in computer sciences, mathematics or other exact sciences
Additional Information
Gross monthly salary from 1700 EUR to 3200 EUR
Dynamic, challenging work in a very profitable, successful company
Possibility to work with really Big Data and various technologies (Hadoop/Hive, MS SQL, Yandex ClickHouse, Tableau, Python, etc.)
Competitive salary
Friendly, helpful colleagues

title: Data Analytics Technical Lead
role-description:
Data Insights Data Science Technical Lead - AlcobendasSpain

Who We Are

Solera is a global leader in data and software services that strives to transform every touchpoint of the vehicle lifecycle into a connected digital experience. In addition, we provide products and services to protect life’s other most important assets: our homes and digital identities. Today, Solera processes over 300 million digital transactions annually for approximately 235,000 partners and customers in more than 90 countries. Our 6,500 team members foster an uncommon, innovative culture and are dedicated to successfully bringing the future to bear today through cognitive answers, insights, algorithms and automation. For more information, please visit solera.com.


The Role

This is an opportunity to work on strategic projects that will power the next wave of automation and intelligence transforming every phase of the automobile lifecycle. 
We are a focused and fun team of engineers spread between USA, Spain, and Switzerland that provide plenty of opportunities to learn and grow together. We are looking for a Data Science Technical Lead to join the Data Insights team.


What You’ll Do

At Solera, we believe in providing clarity and focus to the primary responsibilities of the role. The priorities associated with this role are:

Oversees strategic plan, monitoring and adapting as needed
Creates project plans
Be part of the project design and development planning efforts
Be a development team member
Monitors production and quality to customer/stakeholder/sponsor standards
Identifies and resolves issues and risks
Reports on project progress, offers viable solutions and opportunities as they arise
Lead meetings and set expectations for project team
Reporting on projects


What You’ll Bring

Bachelor’s degree required; masters preferred
3-5+ years as a Big Data, Data Science or Analytics developer
1-3+ years’ experience in project management, especially larger projects
PMP certification and PMO experience preferred
Experience in Agile teams
Proven leadership skills
Expertise in conflict resolution
Analytical and strong organizational skills, with excellent verbal and written ability
Proficiency with related software tools including but not limited to ProjectManager.com, JIRA, MS Excel, etc.
Strong communication skills


WHAT WE OFFER

Competitive salary & solid benefits (How does free restaurant tickets & medical insurance sound?).
Flexible working hours & fun, relaxed office.
International working environment (Over 20 nationalities based in Madrid).
Being part of a digital transformation working with cutting edge technologies.
Free coffee & (Mostly) Healthy Snacks .
Highly collaborative environment & connected team .

title: Data Analyst - People Analytics & Measurement
role-description:
Apply Now

Qualifications
Bachelor's or advanced professional degree with a focus in data analytics, mathematics, computer science, statistics, econometrics, or social science-organizational-operations research
1-3 years of relevant professional experience in analytics performing exploratory data analysis to understand the characteristics of a data set and identify patterns
Ability to intuit, understand and communicate the meaning of data analyses with individuals in a wide range of strategic and operational roles, in both written and oral form
Familiarity with software development methodologies like Agile, including issue/workflow tracking tools like Jira and Trello and version control tools like git and GitHub
Proficiency in SQL, including experience retrieving data from relational databases
Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel, including manipulating large datasets
Depth of experience with advanced analytical tools such as R (preferred), Python, Tableau (preferred), Alteryx, in addition to other advanced analytics packages
Who You'll Work With

You will be based in Amsterdam and will be part of the People Analytics and Measurement team (P.A.M).

This group designs and executes projects supporting McKinsey’s people mission to build a great firm that attracts, develops, excites, and retains exceptional people. The team is a collection of over twenty analysts and data scientists - bright, driven colleagues with varied backgrounds focused on driving insight and action around key strategic people issues at McKinsey. We work in a highly collaborative environment, and partners with other teams within the firm to deliver meaningful innovation when it comes to McKinsey’s firm member journey’s - and the analytics behind them.

The Business Intelligence group is specifically responsible for all reporting, performance metrics, and descriptive analytics enabling the firm to understand and optimize our people operations and measure the impact of our strategic initiatives.
What You'll Do

You will work closely with data analysts, data scientists, and data engineers to extract, clean, and analyze our firm's people data.

You will develop fluency in our people systems and combine this with your analytical knowledge to help translate rigorous analysis into business solutions. You will also be responsible for supporting projects that examine the our feedback and evaluation processes, headcount planning, and organizational health and performance metrics.

Additionally, you will communicate the results of the analysis to the team's internal clients, helping them understand the results and suggesting potential actions supported by the results.

You will serve a variety of internal firm clients including the Chief People Officer, People Committee, Operating Committee, Regional and Office leadership, key initiatives and task forces, Professional Development and Recruiting staff, in addition to other McKinsey stakeholders and communities.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Viber is one of the most popular apps in the world, and the most downloaded app to have come out of the start-up nation. Working with Viber is a unique opportunity to influence the hundreds of millions of people using our messaging app. Our Data Analyst team provides the understanding to how millions of users interact with our products. As a Data Analyst, you will be part of the marketing team and deliver insights that translate directly into business growth.

Working hand-in-hand with the global managers for each region, you will spot new opportunities, challenge the status quo, and present your findings back to the broader leadership team. We are looking for an experienced, hands-on individual with both strong technical skills (SQL, Python / R and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Excel, Looker etc) and a business mindset.
  Responsibilities:
Deliver cutting-edge marketing analytics projects optimizing across regions, channels and analytical functions
Report on key performance marketing metrics against targets on a daily, weekly and monthly basis and provide actionable insights to improve performance
Partner with other departments (i.e. Management, Finance, Product) and Analytics teams to drive step changes in growth
Share expertise and best practices within analytical functions to develop a shared center of excellence
Proactively craft stories from data to clearly identify opportunities in the markets/channels
Build and maintain reporting dashboards, reports and data models
  Requirements:
2+ years experience in a role equivalent to data or business analysis
Analytical and problem-solving skills
An ability to communicate complex findings to key stakeholders in a clear, simple way
Good command of Excel, experience with SQL and BI software (ideally Tableau, Looker or similar)
BSc degree (or higher) in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science or any other quantitative field
Experience with deep analysis of customer behavior for large datasets
Advantage:
Knowledge of basic marketing terms, funnel conversion, churn analysis, CRM activities
Experience with simple ML algorithms and technical skills R, Python etc

title: Data Analyst (m/f)
Data Analyst - Berlin
role-description:
As a leading mobile games developer, Jam City is looking to “level up” our talent. We’re on the hunt for innovators who consider themselves dynamic, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. Are you interested in using data to help drive product decisions and directly influence the experience of millions of people playing our games? We are looking for passionate & proactive Data Analyst to join our team in Berlin! You will have the opportunity to collaborate with some of the gaming industry's top professionals, touching on large amounts of data, and helping our teams make quick & impactful changes to our games.The game data analyst works with product managers inside the studio team to analyze player behavior and overall performance in our games. You will collaborate with data scientists and analysts across the company to support live operations that continuously improve engagement and monetization. We are looking for a creative analytical mind that combines quantitative rigor with and deep understanding of what makes mobile games great.

Responsibilities
Responsible for transforming raw data into digestible reports and actionable insights
Work closely with product management team to monitor product health, prioritize features, measure event performance, and optimize merchandising
Setup and maintain live dashboards (i.e. Tableau) and write SQL queries to support rapid decision making
Validate data sets and BI calls in live games to ensure accuracy of event logging and reporting
Conduct deeper inquiries into player behavior by coordinating with central data science team
Provide ad hoc analysis and insights to help interpret player reception of new features or events
Help design controlled experiments to test hypotheses about new features
Present reports on KPIs, event engagement, game economy, and more
Build models to run sensitivities and forecast outcomes
Develop reporting strategies for games in development to ensure event schema and data architecture are set up for efficient, comprehensive analysis
Think creatively about how to use data to answer question or confirm/reject hypotheses
Qualifications
B.A. or B.S. a quantitative field (Math/Statistics, CS, Engineering, Business, Economics, experimental science, or similar), graduate degree a plus
3+ years experience in an analyst role at a mobile gaming company, or similar experience
Ability to think strategically (big picture perspective, consider both the player experience and the business needs) combined with hands-on, execution-oriented attitude
Experience in analytics requirements gathering, solution design and implementation; solid experience in the area of user intelligence / behavior, event tagging / tracking
Knowledge of statistics and statistical models, such as linear / logistic regression, clustering and factor analyses
Expert knowledge of SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools like Tableau
Detail-oriented, leaves no stone unturned, never lets anything slip through the cracks
Communication skills to articulate complex quantitative analyses in a way that a broad game team can understand
Any experience using Python, R, Scala, BigQuery, Databricks, Bayesian Statistics, Machine Learning a plus.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently
Work closely with a cross-functional team, including remote team members and collegues in North and South America.
ABOUT JAM CITY Jam City is an award-winning mobile entertainment studio providing unique and deeply engaging games that appeal to a broad, global audience. Led by CEO Chris DeWolfe, former MySpace co-founder and CEO, and COO Josh Yguado, former 20th Century Fox executive, Jam City is the creative powerhouse behind some of the highest-grossing and most enduring mobile games. Jam City’s global franchise Cookie Jam has generated more than half a billion dollars, and Panda Pop has more than 120 million downloads to date. The company also is the go-to studio for Hollywood, having developed immersive, narrative-rich mobile games around iconic entertainment brands. The company’s popular RPG game Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery was the #1 game in more than 40 countries at its launch in April 2018. Jam City has nine studios located in Los Angeles (HQ), Berlin, Buenos Aires, Bogotá, Burbank, Cedar Falls, San Diego, San Francisco, and Toronto.

title: Senior Data Analyst
role-description:
Senior Data Analyst
Quest Computing Ltd, a leading software development company based in Dublin and established 30 years ago, is expanding the team.
We are looking for a passionate Senior Data Analyst to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.
You will conduct full lifecycle activities to include requirements analysis and design, develop analysis and reporting capabilities, and continuously monitor performance and trends.
Responsibilities
Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data, and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Requirements
Minimum 2 years’ working experience as a Data Analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with business intelligence toolsets e.g. Oracle OBIEE, etc., database languages (SQL, PL/SQL, etc.), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages and languages for analysing large datasets (Excel, SPSS, R, etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Excellent communication skills both verbal and written
Third Level qualification in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Management, etc.
Ability to work as part of a team.
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.

title: Data Analyst - Otley
role-description:
The role
In order to support the tombola business, Data Analysts are required to
deliver consistent and timely business intelligence across all functions of
the company and to ensure that data quality and assurance is maintained at
all times.
The role is within the Data Engineering team and is based in our Gibraltar
office. You will be working with both local and remote teams and with a
wide range of business units to provide data analytics solutions. Data is
becoming increasingly important to the business and you will play a key
part in helping to continue the transformation of the company into a
data-driven business that differentiates and competes on analytics.
You’ll get involved in many aspects of the data engineering process
including but not limited to the creation of reports and visualisations,
developing bespoke analysis, ongoing maintenance and improvement of the
reporting platform and systems, business process modelling, supporting the
data extraction process, manipulating data extracts, ensuring data quality,
ad-hoc analysis and data exploration as and when required by business
stakeholders.
We’re looking for someone that can immerse themselves in to the business
processes and develop a deep understanding of our products in order to
truly understand the customer interactions with our online business. You
will be analytically minded, curious and able to effectively interpret data
and then communicate data backed insights to a variety of end users across
the company.
You’ll be needed to mentor and train colleagues on the reporting and
analytical platforms and provide your specialist knowledge as and when
required.
You'll be confident working independently with minimal supervision and
enjoy being part of a wider team. You’ll be comfortable working on multiple
projects at the same time and be able to self-organise your time to deliver
to deadlines when needed.
We’d expect you to be keeping up to date with industry developments and the
latest trends in the areas of business intelligence and analytics and to
make recommendations where appropriate.
Main Skills
You should have strong analytical, conceptual and problem-solving
abilities.
You will have excellent attention to detail and a methodical approach.
An ability to communicate verbally and with data visualisations across
different audiences and abilities is required.
You need a willingness to learn and improve and must take pride in what you
do.
Knowledge and Experience
Strong SQL skills are a must.
Experience of a data visualisation or BI tool such as Tableau or Power BI
are preferred.
Some development or coding experience would be advantageous, knowledge of
Python or C# even better.
An understanding of Data Warehousing, SQL Server, ETL processes, AWS
technologies, Amazon Redshift are all desirable but not necessary.

Benefits

We offer a competitive salary as well as an amazing new HQ, free food and
snacks, generous pension, discretionary bonus & private medical to name a
few... To check out all of our perks please visit our benefits & perks
page.

title: Data Analyst - Business Analytics
role-description:
We’re looking for curious and engaged Data Analysts to join our Business Analytics team. Are you passionate about helping small businesses succeed through the use of data? Do you enjoy solving business problems and seeing a measurable impact of your work? Join our team in Stockholm!

Make sense of big data for small businesses

Business Analytics is a part of the central Analytics team, with a focus on supporting commercial teams such as Marketing, Support and Sales in making informed decisions based on data. Your mission is to help iZettle make life better for our merchants by ensuring that we focus on what matters and apply a data-driven way of working throughout the organization - whether it’s about refining our acquisition engine, improving the customer experience or experimenting on a new go-to-market strategy. With the power of Google Cloud Platform and using state-of-the-art tools and techniques, we make sense of data to continuously improve our business and create value for iZettle.

As a Data Analyst at iZettle
You’ll own end-to-end analytics for your area, from tracking and defining KPIs to setting targets and running A/B tests to evaluate the impact of new initiatives
You’ll partner with department leads and other stakeholders within the organisation to enable and promote data-driven decision making and provide clarity on how each team is contributing to iZettle’s success
You’ll empower other iZettlers to use data in their work by training them and developing our data platform and making data accessible through our BI tools
You’ll articulate and communicate actionable insights and recommendations based on data


The Skills You Need To Succeed

As a Data Analyst at iZettle, you’ll join a central team of 10+ inspiring analysts who support all areas of iZettle. You will be at the heart of driving understanding of how our business performs and be able to see your ideas and recommendations make business impact. The team works across a wide range of business areas and questions, so your role will vary and evolve based on your interest, expertise and business need.

You’ll be a great addition to the iZettle team if…
You have previous experience in using analytics to support decision-making, ideally within a fast-changing, digital environment
You have an analytical mind-set and a strong business sense, with a creative approach to scoping problems while striving to make an impact
You have a clear understanding of how data shapes product and business decisions
You are a great communicator and you're comfortable explaining complex methods and results to both technical and non-technical audiences
You have knowledge in statistics and know how to deal with random chance
You are fluent in SQL and have programming experience

Additionally, if you have used analysis tools such as Pandas, R or SPSS, have advanced coding skills or previous exposure to senior leadership, let us know. If not, we'll be happy to help you get started.

Small minds never helped small businesses

It takes originality and an open mind to start a small business. That’s why small minds have no place in ours. At iZettle, we celebrate the individuality of the people we work with, valuing the impact that diverse experiences, backgrounds, perspectives and ideas can have on our culture and the products we build. We’re proud to be an equal opportunities employer, a place where everyone can benefit from equal access to professional development and bring their whole personality to work.

We’re iZettle.

iZettle is on a mission to help small businesses succeed in a world of giants. Founded in Stockholm in 2010, we revolutionised mobile payments with the world’s first mini chip card reader and software for mobile devices. Today iZettle’s commerce platform for small businesses in Europe and Latin America provides tools to get paid, sell smarter and grow your business. We’re more than 500 employees of 45 different nationalities operating in 12 countries, and we’re recruiting the best and brightest from around the world to help us grow further.

Bring your talent to our attention.

Go on, hit apply and say hello!

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
We have an exciting new opportunity to join EXL UK's Insurance Consulting team in London.

Data Analyst - Bromley / London 
  Role Summary

EXL’s consulting practice is a specialized consulting group based in New York, London and across Asia-Pacific region. We are a world class, global professional services group dedicated to help CFO’s and CEOs develop and execute winning strategies and to drive improvements in effectiveness across the organization. EXL’s F&A Transformation practice focuses on 4 key areas including Finance Transformation, Finance Technology, Assurance & Compliance and Accounting advisory. EXL serves the retail, insurance, healthcare, banking and financial services, utilities, travel, transportation and logistics industries.

Key Requirements:

5+ years of experience working closely with data migration, data governance, data quality, operations and compliance functions to ensure cross functional objectives are addressed with chosen solutions
Strong Knowledge of Insurance domain with familiarity of business processes, regulatory models, data privacy and management principles
Hands on skills in data retrieval from various data stores or files; data transformation and reporting/visualization as required for the analysis
Expert knowledge of SQL for querying databases and using insight to offer solutions
Proficiency in SAS, VBA experience and advanced Excel/Macros
Data visualization (Tableau/Qlik) experience is a plus
Effectively communicate results of highly technical projects to stakeholders and senior leadership
Bachelor’s Degree/Master’s Degree (Finance, Statistics, Math, Economics)
  Experience & Background:

Essentially includes executing/leading advisory or related data engagements in a client environment and performing following activities on a day-to-day basis
  Project Delivery – Ownership and support of deliverables as mandated by project requirements. Execution of engagement tasks independently or in a team setting and delivering to high quality standards
Project Support - Support the Engagement Manager in planning engagements and adhering to engagement delivery requirements
Data Analysis – Work within the clients Enterprise Data Management team and play a designer/developer role to create new/existing solution using ETL/Reporting tools. Work closely with compliance, data quality and governance standards across enterprise
Practice Development – Supporting and contributing to various internal practice initiatives

title: Data Analyst (Dplay)
role-description:
Discovery House - Chiswick Park Building 2 566 Chiswick High Road, London W4 5YB, GB

General Summary

As the Data Analyst, you will join Dplay's growing Insights, Analytics & Implementation team. You work as both a technical business resource and data analyst to help prioritise requirements based on value and effort, perform data analysis and drive actionable insights.

You will be a key technical member of analytical projects, from the beginning stages of requirements gathering all the way through final product delivery. Thus, this role will require you to have strong analytics experience and be comfortable with working with various tools and methodologies.

In addition, you will be comfortable with the connection and analysis of large, disparate data sets from a variety of sources in order to understand viewers, increase consumer engagement, retention and optimise conversion. Creativity and attention to detail is critical as you envision and build data solutions that change the face of the SVOD TV industry.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Engineering

Work closely with the Central Data team to scope, document, extract, transform and load new data sources into Discovery’s central data repository for analytics
Measure & analyse data quality and performance within Discovery’s central data repository for analytics
Test & QA data coming from various sources to make sure it is legible, clean and transformed before reporting is performed

Data Analytics

Work with managers and stakeholders to fully understand business requirements and desired outcomes
Document & record data definitions and structure as well as specifications for Business Intelligence reports & dashboards
QA and test various calculations of dashboards based on business requirements
Develop & deploy various analytics dashboards
Assist in scoping & designing analytical projects and solutions.
Execute analytics projects ranging from small to large either individually or as part of a project team
Ensure project delivery within the allocated timelines and priorities
Generate queries & data dictionaries, analyse data and create visualisation/dashboards related to audience and direct-to-consumer insights
Extract, understand, format and map data from multiple sources into cohesive reports
Utilise Business Intelligence tools to build reports and dashboards that will allow departments to visualise and interact with data
Identify gaps and areas of improvement related to data analytics
Support roll-out of multiple sprints as a key technical resource

Advanced Analytics

Data cleansing & preparation for analysis
Work closely with data science team to support data and statistical models
Identify opportunities to create and automate repeatable analysis or build self-service tools for business users
Create repeatable processes to support similar business problems in the future
Stay current with new analytical tools and industry trends

Key Requirements

Degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or Data Science
Proficiency & advanced level understanding of MS Excel is a must
A sound grasp of Adobe Analytics and other reporting tools
Hands-on, extensive and proven experience with data visualisation tools (especially Tableau, MicroStrategy)
Deep experience in developing queries and reporting based upon user requirements
Thorough understanding of data modelling and relational/non-relational databases
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Knowledge of CRM tools
Experience with modern statistical learning methods (regression techniques, classification models, supervised and unsupervised learning, etc.)
Hands-on experience of statistical packages such as R or the Python scientific stack (NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn, etc.)
Experience with Amazon Web Services (RedShift, S3, EC2, EMR, etc.)
Genuine interest in the rapidly changing video industry with understanding of OTT video services and direct to consumer technologies
Working experience/certifications in Agile (Scrum) and/or Lean (Kanban) delivery frameworks preferred
Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills
Ability and eagerness to constantly learn and teach other

title: Senior Data Analyst - US Market - Paris
role-description:
Chez Back Market , nous avons à cœur de promouvoir un nouveau mode de consommation favorisant l’économie circulaire tout en luttant contre le gâchis électronique et l’obsolescence programmée.1ere marketplace européenne (et bientôt mondiale !!!) dédiée exclusivement à la vente de produits électroniques reconditionnés, nous connectons professionnels certifiés (usines de reconditionnement, distributeurs, etc..) donnant une seconde vie à vos équipements et clients à la recherche de qualité, d’accessibilité et d’un type de consommation plus écologique.Ce que l'on recherche au sein de Back Market? Une bonne dose d'humour, respect et bienveillance, un amour pour les lapins, un peu de zèle et une réelle expertise dans ton domaine ! Pour la bonne personne, c’est l’occasion de participer à la construction d’une marketplace de premier plan, directement dans l'équipe au cœur de l’innovation : le Bureau Of Technology. Tu veux en savoir plus sur l'organisation des équipes techniques et les features teams. : Un peu de lecture. Travaillant au sein de l’équipe BI, tu participeras à la croissance et à la rentabilité de Back Market grâce à une exploitation innovante et intelligente de notre data.Basé à Paris (ou à New-York à terme), tu occuperas une postition transverse te permettant de travailler avec l'ensemble des départements de Back Market. Ton but : mettre à leur disposition des dashboards et analyses leur permettant de prendre les meilleures décisions. Tu seras donc au coeur du réacteur ! Reportant à notre Head of BI, tes missions incluront :=> L'utilisation de la donnée pour aider au pilotage de l’activité et améliorer les process existants avec notamment :-La récolte du besoin auprès des départements business-Le challenge des équipes métier pour s'assurer de la pertinence de leurs demandes-La création et l'automatisation de dashboards à forte valeur ajoutée-La restitution des analyses en garantissant la qualité du rendu-Proposer de nouvelles analyses qui te sembleraient pertinentes pour le métier => Travailler en équipe avec les data analyst spécialisés dans un département de Back Market pour les aider à mener à bien leurs analyses

Rejoins Nous
Tu as au moins 3 ans d’expérience sur un poste et un secteur similaire
Tu as un état d'esprit orienté business et tu fais preuve d'une grande rigueur
Tu as un esprit d’entrepreneur, tu es ouvert d’esprit et tu as envie de te dépasser
English is a no brainer for you :)
SQL et Tableau n'ont aucun secret pour toi. Des connaissances sur snowflake, looker, alteryx, python, airflow, dataiku, ELK sont un plus
Tu aimes faire des choses concrètes et mettre les mains dans le cambouis
Tu sais prioriser, prendre soin des détails et la pression ne te fait pas peur
Tu as soif d’apprendre et tu veux t’immerger dans une startup en très forte croissance
Tu es un/une fantastique coéquipier(e) qui aime travailler en équipe, apprendre des autres et partager ses connaissance
Sauve la planète.. Rejoins Back Market !

title: Data Analyst - Shopping Platform
role-description:
Discover ING Tech

ING Tech is an international hub for technology & innovation, developing IT solutions across ING in areas such as Core Banking, Big Data, Financial Markets, Data Management, Touch Point Architecture and many more. By using the latest methodologies in software development, our fast growing team gathers more than 750 tech enthusiasts who work for international projects that go beyond traditional banking.

ING Shopping platform

ING will develop a new Shopping platform, empowering consumers and merchants to bring a new shopping experience, using data from the entire ecosystem: mobile-bank-merchant, curated by the Platform through machine learning algorithms.

Mission

We are looking for an enthusiastic data analyst who can build strong relationships between data and share insights with the business, provide reports on the basis of insights from transactions, profile and other public data, therefore strengthening the Shopping platform in realizing fantastic shopping experience. You are razor-sharp in an analytical sense and always make decisions based on facts and data. Ideally, you are knowledgeable in marketing and e-commerce.

Your day-to-day
You combine marketing and data management expertise. are responsible for carrying out data analysis and research in order to strengthen and improve offer relevancy, the customer journeys and to gain valuable insights for the rest of team.
You provide data reports for management
You build strong relations between data and share insights with business/analytics
You compile and analyze data related to business features

What You Bring To The Team
Education level: higher education (eg Econometrics, (technical) business, Mathematics) Psychology and Marketing (Intelligence)
You are an innovator, a strong communicator and energetic
You dare to take risks and have the courage to question the status quo.
You are analytically very strong
You have extensive hands-on experience with tools and techniques for data visualisation (eg Power BI, Tableau)
You have experience with drafting reports including conclusions and the translation of data into (management) advice;
Ideally previous experience in marketing, e-commerce

title: Senior Data Analyst
role-description:
Bolt is one of the fastest growing startups in the world with over 30M happy customers in 30+ countries, from Europe to Mexico to Africa. We're building the future of transport – one platform that connects you with cars, motorcycles, scooter sharing, and anything else you need to move around in your city. Fast, convenient and affordable for everyone, as transport should be.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics team. You will be be responsible for analyzing business and technical data, building metrics and insights to make better and timely business decisions across the globe.

Let's build the future of transportation together!

What You'll Be Doing
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide reports
Proactively work together with Data Science and Data Engineering teams to get best out of Bolt's data.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs


Requirements
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
At least 2-4 years experience dealing with large volumes of data
Amazing SQL skills
Experience with Python or R
Experience with some BI tools and data visualization
Experience ML frameworks is a plus
Great written communication
Experience with business and financial analytics is a big plus
Fluent in English


Benefits
Motivating compensation – motivational base pay and company stock options
No corporate BS – we're moving too fast for that
Amazing personal growth experience at one of the fastest-growing startups in Europe
Working with a motivated and talented international team, plus regular team events
Working in one of the coolest offices in Tallinn – ping-pong table, free snacks/drinks
Flexible working hours – as long as you get the work done
Monthly Bolt credit for rides
Impactful work – you'll have a rare opportunity to build a product literally used by millions of people across the world

Our team is made up of thinkers, innovators and go-getters shaping the way millions of people move around the globe. We value passionate and down-to-earth people who are driven to get things done and find creative solutions to problems. We recognize that our strength and success are directly linked to the talent and skills of our team members and a lean approach to our work. Our headquarters are situated in Tallinn, Estonia and we have offices in 30+ countries around the world.

Did we spark your interest? Get in touch and let's talk!

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Är du en driven och nyfiken analytiker som trivs med att jobba brett och vill få möjlighet att påverka? Har du ett analytiskt sinne och dessutom en affärsmässig förståelse? Då kan denna roll vara något för dig. Skandia erbjuder dig en roll där du får en viktig specialistfunktion på kreditavdelningen och stora samarbetsytor med de flesta avdelningar inom Skandiabanken.

Arbetsbeskrivning
Som dataanalytiker inom krediter består din huvuduppgift av att löpande analysera och rapportera kreditrisk i bankens portfölj och bankens kreditgivning. Genom dina analyser ser vi till att kreditgivningen sker inom beslutad risknivå och mot de mål som banken har. Rollen som analytiker på kreditavdelningen är ansvarsfull och omväxlande, eftersom du förutom analys och rapportering av kreditrisk även får vara med och utveckla bankens låneaffär och stötta organisationen med olika affärsanalyser. Med utgångspunkt från dina analyser och med synpunkter från verksamheten kan vi effektivisera kreditgivningen genom smartare kreditregler.
Inom kreditavdelningen ingår även inkassoverksamheten och kontrollverksamheten inom första linjen.

Kvalifikationer och egenskaper
Vi söker dig som har minst 3 års erfarenhet av affärsanalys eller kreditanalys från bank/finans där du har hanterat stora datamängder. Du har stor vana av att arbeta i SAS inklusive egen kodning.
Det är en fördel om du har erfarenhet av att kravställa rapporter mot IT.
Du har en högskoleutbildning inom ekonomi, statistik, finans eller matematik.
För att lyckas i rollen måste du vara analytisk men samtidigt ha en kreativ förmåga och kunna arbeta lösningsorienterat. Eftersom du kommer att arbeta i en avdelning som samarbetar över hela verksamheten bör du vara utåtriktad och ha lätt för att bygga relationer. Du förstår att framgång ligger i att kunna samarbeta och lösa problem. Vidare bör du ha ett intresse och förståelse för affärsfrågor och är intresserad av att utveckla analysarbetet inom banken.

title: Supply Chain Data Analyst (m/f/d)

Circ is an urban mobility platform, oriented towards personal vehicles powered by electricity and by human.
We're changing how people move around cities by developing and deploying a smart, fun and environmentally-friendly transportation system.
We're starting an urban mobility revolution!
Headquartered in Berlin, but with mostly-autonomous local teams distributed across major European cities, we are starting by launching a fleet of next-generation electric kick-scooters.

Be part of our team in Germany and create mobility technology with us together

Responsibilities
Help manage and oversee multiple aspects of the supply chain including but not limited to production and supply planning, strategic sourcing and warehousing
Provide reports and data insights with compelling visualization
Conducting ad-hoc deep dives on specific topics to produce sound and actionable insights
Defining KPIs and reporting for business areas together with responsible stakeholders
Gather data from internal and external source dockings
Interacting with key stakeholders to gather insights, define requirements and possibilities in infrastructure and processes


Requirements
Bachelor degree and/or 1+ years of professional work experience in Production Engineering, Business Administration and/or Supply Chain Management
Fluency in data analysis and communication around data and with advanced data visualisation abilities (Python, Tableau, Sisense or similar BI tools)
Strong knowledge and experience with Databases, incl. SQL and spreadsheets
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English. Other languages are a plus
Hands-on experience in using data to generate insights and drive business results
Experience with supply chain, mechanical engineering, industrial engineering is a plus


What We Offer
The opportunity to revolutionize urban mobility and change cities for all of us
Professional and personal growth building one of the fastest growing startup of 2019 with a very experienced team of entrepreneurs
A rapid environment where autonomy, fast decision making and learning by trying is key
Working together in a team of the best in their fields from top companies around the world

Ready to undertake your next big thing? Awesome! We look forward to talking with you.

Your application and personal data will be collected by LMTS Germany GmbH.

title: Data Analytics & Insights Consultant (R1091918)
Data Analyst
role-description:
ENGIE, is a multinational group able to lead the energy transition with its efficient and innovative services and solutions, seeks to incorporate a Data Analyst for an exciting and innovative project.

Job Description

The Business Analyst is responsible for helping understand customer behavior across and within different content areas. In this highly visible role, he/she will provide reporting, analyze data, make sense of the results and be able to explain what it all means to key stakeholders - ranging from managers to engineers, from marketers to product managers.

The successful candidate will be an expert with analyzing large data sets and have exemplary communication skills. The candidate will need to be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, and able to think big while paying careful attention to detail.

Responsibilities

You love working with data, can create clear and effective reports and data visualizations, and can partner with customers to answer key business questions. You will also have the opportunity to display your skills in the following areas:
Define requirements for reporting sales data, customer behavior, and technical performance metrics, and work with technical teams and product managers to integrate into our development schedules
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions
Develop, implement, and automate processes to collect and manage usage data from multiple sources
Partner with internal and external market research teams to analyze our customers and the competitive environment
Derive insights from customer feedback and usage data and provide input into new product development
Basic Qualifications
Fluent in Spanish and English, both oral and written
Relevant work experience in analytics, data engineering, business intelligence, market research or related field, and demonstrable professional experience (experience in consumer-facing industry preferred)
Experience using industry standard business intelligence tools to extract data, formulate metrics and build reports
Experience using scripting languages for data wrangling
Proven experience using POWER BI, and SAP Analytics products (Business Objects, WEB Intelligence, Lumira, Analysis for Office, Analytics Cloud)
Proven track record of successful communication of analytical outcomes through written communication, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
It Offers
Professional growth.
Dynamic, professional and positive work environment.
Integration into a highly qualified team.
Engie is the answer if...
You are looking for a stable, solid and professional project.
You value being part of the world's first independent energy group, with a dynamic and challenging culture.
If you like teamwork and the spirit of continuous improvement.
Do not miss the opportunity to grow in a leading company, within an exciting and innovative sector, collaborating on challenging projects and developing with the best professionals!

title: Digital Data & Insights Analyst
role-description:
Job Type: Permanent

Contract Duration: Permanent

Purpose Of Role

Manage the measurement, reporting and insight generation for the McLaren Group online, mobile and social media channels and all related content and campaign activity.

Principal Accountabilities
Capture, manage and report on all activity relating to the McLaren Group digital, social media and CRM channels, focusing on performance of the brand and commercial value driven through digital and social media
Track and report on data pertaining to digital content, audiences, valuation and competitor performance
Share data-driven insights and performance trends across the digital and social content team
Support brand and partner campaign planning and distribution
Support McLaren’s Partnership Development and Strategy teams via regular and ad-hoc reporting on audience growth and channel performance. Includes audience insight, performance benchmarking and earned media valuations, delivering competitive advantage in new business proposals
Collaborate with McLaren’s Strategy team to align data and insights to overarching market research and audience segmentation profiling
Implement a regular reporting schedule for McLaren’s Digital & Social, Partnership Development, Partnership Activation and Executive teams. Includes monthly, quarterly, annual and ad-hoc reporting against defined processes, schedules and rights
Support database reporting through the marketing cloud solution, focusing on campaign performance and exposing trends to help optimise growth of the fan universe
Ownership of the McLaren Marketing Digital Dashboard, liaising with individual department stakeholders to ensure up-to-date data capture and a reporting schedule adapted to the needs of a range of stakeholders
Manage the use of digital reporting toolkit, ensuring data technologies align to business needs and budget
Manage third party agencies to ensure effective capture and management of data for both regular and ad-hoc reporting
Provide support to online marketing campaigns, liaising with the digital marketing agency to optimise campaign performance through data analysis
Provide insight to the broader digital operations team and McLaren IT to ensure robust and secure channels
Monitor and report industry trends pertaining to data analysis and insight

Knowledge, Skills And Experience
Excellent use of Microsoft Excel and third-party data management tools
Excellent knowledge of Google Analytics
Comprehensive understanding of native and third party social media monitoring and performance tools
Experience in a similar role, with evidence of supporting web team or management with regular reporting
Degree educated or equivalent qualification in a relevant discipline
Experience working in a real-time, reactive digital environment
Knowledge of basic digital and social media content marketing principles
Experience working for / on projects related tosports marketingor retail brands
Personal Attributes
Impeccable attention to detail
Analytically minded;continuously striving to recognise and highlight trends in data

Who We Are

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

What you will be doing: Key responsibilities

As a Junior Data & Analytics Consultant, your role will encompass:
Conducting ambitious projects in the transformation of your clients businesses through the effective collection, processing and activation of data
Ensuring quality and continuity of the full range of Data & Analytics services
Actively contributing to the expertise level and competencies of the Data & Analytics team
Closely collaborate with the other divisions (Media & Activation, Creation, Consultancy, Data Science and Data Infrastructure) to provide comprehensive services to your clients

Among your responsibilities as a Junior Data Analyst, you will be responsible for:

Executing Data & Analytics projects

Communicating your work and achievements among the team and within the company
Working closely with experts from the other divisions to build and maintain strong relationships with your clients and best understand their needs

Being a great tech person

Researching and developing new technical approaches to address problems efficiently
Staying up-to-date on developments within the industry, sharing best practices and contributing to Artefact’s institutional knowledge
Embodying Artefact’s values and inspiring others to do the same

Qualifications: Education & experience required
Academic level of education (Bachelor or Master)
A minimum of 1 year of work experience in a data-driven working environment

What We Are Looking For
A Doer: you get things done and inspire your colleagues to do the same

A Mentor: your clients and teams naturally seek you out for advice

Why you should join us

Come join us!

In this position you will be part of the Transaction Monitoring Area within the Global KYC Delivery Tribe.

As Data Analyst Investigation Acceleration you will analyse international payments and transactions and our Transaction Monitoring (TM) systems to support functional analysis of the correctness of the TM.

Responsible for the execution of look-back & back testing to enable alert scenario optimization and conduct what if scenario analysis in response to emergingunusual patterns of payment behaviors
Responsible for translating alert scenario design into business requirements so as to enable solutions design teams to build automated alert solutions.
Responsible for monitoring the integrity of the data feeds into central alert system.
Support the design and maintenance of predictive models to enable prioritization of alerts. In so doing, improve on alert investigation efficiency and effectiveness
Who are you?

You are a driven Data Analyst who feels personal responsibility for the quality of your work. Capable to translate your analysis and explain them to your colleagues

Flexible and capable of mastering new data-analysis tools and methods quickly
Possess working knowledge in the field of Financial Crime Threats and typologies so as to enable an informed view of anomalous patterns of payment behaviours

a full-time position
competitive salary based on your experience including a 13th month, holiday allowance and individual savings plan

personal growth with many opportunities to develop yourself further
informal work environment with innovative colleagues who strive for the best

title: Production Data Analyst - H/F
role-description:
Company Description

Le Monde d’UBISOFT

Les équipes d’Ubisoft sont animées par leur volonté d’enrichir la vie des joueurs avec des expériences de divertissement originales et mémorables. Elles donnent vie à des mondes, de véritables terrains de jeux où l’imagination peut s’exprimer librement, donnant naissance à des moments de surprise, de fun et d’aventure qui permettent aussi au joueur d’apprendre et se découvrir.

Chez Ubisoft, vous avez l’opportunité de collaborer et d’évoluer avec des équipes passionnées et pionnières dans leur domaine, partout dans le monde. Vous progresserez dans un environnement bienveillant et inspirant dans lequel vous repousserez les limites de l’imaginaire et de la technologie pour créer les mondes qui passionneront nos joueurs.

Job Description

Dans le cadre de son développement, Ubisoft recherche pour son Studio de Production de Montreuil, où ont dernièrement été développés les titres « Ghost Recon Breakpoint », « Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle », « Just Dance 2019 » ou encore « Watch_Dogs 2 » un/une :

Production Data Analyst – H/F

En collaboration directe avec les équipes de développement, il/elle aura pour mission de comprendre le pipeline de production afin d’améliorer la gestion de la qualité et la productivité du projet. En se basant sur l’analyse de données, il/elle aura un impact sur toutes les étapes de production d’un jeu.

De Manière Plus Détaillée
Définir avec les leads des indicateurs de qualité et de productivité : Qualité du code, performance des moyens de production, qualité technique du jeu…
Définir les données à récupérer sur les outils de production (outil de gestion de projet, éditeur de jeu, build system…), et coordonner l’implémentation de ces points de mesures sur le pipeline de production.
Etre garant de la donnée de production et faire le suivi des indicateurs.
Rédiger des synthèses de résultats et des recommandations applicables.
Conseiller les experts métiers sur la stratégie data autour de la gestion de la qualité et de la productivité.
Faire évoluer les usages, les méthodes et les outils au sein des projets et des studios France.
Vous intégrerez plus globalement l’équipe Data des studios France, qui est composée de Data Analyst, Data Scientist, développeurs outils et Data Visualisation Designer.

Qualifications
Vous êtes issu-e d’une formation bac +4/5 en Business Intelligence, Statistique, ingénierie de la production, gestion de la qualité informatique, Data analyse.
Vous avez une forte appétence pour l’optimisation des systèmes de production et la gestion de la qualité
Background tech : analyser et comprendre les données, comprendre un pipeline de production de jeux vidéo.
Vous êtes un très bon communicant : vous serez en interactions permanentes avec les équipes de production.
Anglais courant requis.
Une bonne maîtrise du langage SQL est indispensable.
Connaissance d’un outil Business Intelligence (Tableau par exemple)
Vous êtes avant tout un-e passionné-e de jeux vidéo !

En Bonus
Vous avez déjà de l’expérience dans l’analyse de données appliquée à la production.
Connaissances en programmation orientée objet.
Connaissances en ETLs
Vous avez une connaissance approfondie des méthodes de production d’un AAA.

Additional Information

Ubisoft veille à développer un environnement de travail inclusif qui reflète la diversité de sa communauté de joueurs dans ses équipes.

En tant qu’employeur, Ubisoft offre à tous les mêmes opportunités d’accès à l’emploi sans distinction de genre, ethnicité, religion, orientation sexuelle, statut social, handicap et d’âge.
