title: Data Analyst
role-description:
We're searching for a motivated, full-time Data Analyst to strengthen our team! 
Do you see the beauty in actionable numbers, well done? 
Are you interested in testing, fine-tuning, and perfecting a life-style game with insights from data? 
If you said yes, you might be a perfect match to join our small, but experienced team.

We're creating a next-generation home design game called Redecor on mobile. The game is on soft launch and our state-of-the-art big data platform runs on Google Cloud. 
We take excellent care of our people by providing them the compensation, work environment, and resources they need to succeed in their roles. Read more about Reworks on our website ! You have a chance to join the team at an early stage! You'll also have an opportunity to influence your role and grow with us while we're rolling out Redecor globally. 
  YOU WILL
Perform hands-on research, data exploration and analysis as part of the team.
Provide data-based, analytical insights that help optimize features of the game and user experience. To start with, you will be monitoring and improving the in-game economy (stuff users have, gain and spend in the game) and randomized reward boxes.
Improve the data we collect from the game with our developers.
Collaborate in projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation and monetization.

YOU HAVE
A degree in a quantitative subject area (such as Physics, Statistics, Math, Economics, or Computer Science). 
Working knowledge of SQL
Understanding of statistics and mathematical modelling.
Knowledge on Python/R, BigQuery, TensorFlow, Probabilistic modeling (Bayes), or particular ML models is a plus, but you will learn more on these as we go.

WHY JOIN OUR TEAM
Be part of an industry where data is fast, big, easy-to-collect, and a key to success. 
You can learn and build on top of an existing state-of-the-art data platform. The data is there, ready to be used, and we are already e.g. predicting with TensorFlow models.
You can be a part of the team building a global, next-generation home decor game
You'll be working with a motivated, experienced, and fun team in a zero-bureaucracy environment
You'll have a possibility to work remotely with flexible hours; a great work-life balance
You can affect your role and the company
We offer extensive healthcare plans and great compensation
 You will be located in our office at Kamppi, Helsinki. There's also an option to start as part-time.

Does this sound like you? 
Send your cover letter and CV/Linkedin profile to vesa@reworksgames.com. Please mention your availability and a possible starting date.

The Data Research Analyst will form closer links with providers related to data acquisition processes and gain expert knowledge of our database. The position will be based in our Data and Development Centre in Madrid and will report to the Data Director.

 Collect and maintain Morningstar data, ensuring high levels of data accuracy, completeness and coverage. Looking for and eliminating inconsistences in data. 
Identify, analyse and interpret trends in complex data sets 
Meet the predetermined production deadlines for internal and external clients.  
Collaborate strongly with the global data teams on projects  
Continuously evaluate procedures, create and enhance analytical tools, and implement process improvement projects. Using project management methodology such as LEAN Six Sigma. 
Act as an expert regarding investment data points and calculations, answering questions and escalations from data team.  
Maintain and strengthen existing relationships with fund companies and clients as well as 3rd party data providers.

Proven work experience of working as a data analyst, expertise in data, methodology, quality and processes.

Excellent writing, communication, problem solving, and presentation skills.  
Strong organizational and time-management skills

Ability to adapt well to different situations and thrive in a challenging, fast-paced environment.  
 Morningstar is an equal opportunity employer.

role-description:
Function

Market Research/Intelligence

Closing Date

29/11/2019
Senior Data Innovation Analyst

Hook, Hampshire RG27 9UP

£40,000 to £50,000 per annum + other excellent benefits

This is an exciting time to join Virgin Media as a Senior Innovation Analyst as you will play a major role in delivering the data and insight agenda to extract maximum business value from the multiple datasets across multiple platforms in VM using various BI tools. You will work as part of a high-performing data intelligence team, which has the remit to ensure value is inherent in all of our work

Role Purpose

The Core Purpose Of The Function Is To Transform Current Capabilities To Drive Competitive Advantage Through Performing Deep Analytics In Order To Provide Actionable Insight

Insight Hub is a new organisation recently formed through the merging of a number of data-led teams.
Deliver on all aspects of ‘red hot’ analytical projects, including data requirements gathering, in depth analysis, presentation and communication of findings and implementation into production environments
Realise opportunities to drive value from new datasets or commercialising data into a standalone revenue stream
Identify relevant technology and tool trends to ensure best in class capabilities and techniques are made available to drive competitive advantage
Build SME knowledge of the available data across a range of business areas and become a focal point for business questions
Engage across the business in an Agile way to deliver impactful analysis and develop strong and lasting relationships
Key Accountabilities
Aid the development of data driven decision making, shaping the improvement of customer focussed tools to ensure a joined up contact approach
Help transform the data intelligence environment within the Insight Hub Division through rapid development and deployment of various analytical products
Collaborate across the business to develop strong stakeholder relationships, with a view to build a full view of our customer focussed activities and identify new areas in which data driven approaches can add value
Adopt an innovative mind-set where the data importance or value is not constrained by end requirements
Provide buddy support to incoming graduate and apprentice, being a point of contact for technical and pastoral queries
Knowledge, Experience And Skills
2+ years providing analytical insights in a large organisation
Strong SQL skills with various examples of delivering major pieces of time bound analysis
Strong stakeholder management and communication skills. Proven experience of working across teams and adapting to a variety of audiences

Degree level or equivalent within numerical subjects.

Join and you’ll be part of the Virgin Media family. We’re a great place to work - and we offer impressive benefits too! You will get a generous holiday allowance, contributory pension, performance related bonus and, of course, discounts across Virgin Media products and Virgin brands!

title: Junior Data Analyst (SAS) (R1087307)
role-description:
Job Description

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

Join us on our exciting journey!

IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward. With a global team of 50,000, we harness insights, commercial and scientific depth, and executional expertise to empower clients to achieve some of their most important goals. https://www.iqvia.com/

Position Purpose

We are recruiting an awesome new team member to join us at our Madrid Production Hub office! We are looking for French and English speakers.. diversity is our way of life!!

You will work in the Real-World Insights (RWI) business unit. The team is over 80+ consultants with various capabilities in real-world evidence, epidemiology, market access and health economics.

You Will Work Closely With The Project Manager And The Statistician

As part of a project team, you will run analyses and oversee the deliverables for client projects.
Performing strategic analyses (recurrent and ad hoc) to derive trends, conclusions, and actionable recommendations for clients on qualitative and quantitative data, including longitudinal datasets
Evaluating secondary data on markets, physicians, pharmacists, patients, and competitive products
Creating reports, presentations and other client deliverables
If you want to play a key role in a multicultural, dynamic and committed fun team this could be the role for you!

Our ideal candidate: Skills & other requirements
At least 2 years experience in data analysis
Excellent knowledge in data analysis and business intelligence
Detailed and solution-driven, quality and service-oriented way of working
Programming in SAS is required.
Good level of practice with Office tools: Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint
Strong communicative skills, orally and in writing in English
Ability to work on several projects in parallel
Team player, able to integrate in an international and multidisciplinary team

Knowledge Or Experiences In The Following Areas Are Appreciated
Native speaker of French language
SQL programming
Predictive analysis
Database studies
Experience in data mining and the application of SQL, or other common databases and software tools
Experience in the life sciences industry
Big data
IQVIA
IQVIA recognized by Great Place to Work as the second best company to work for in Spain (March 2018)
FORTUNE Magazine's World's Most Admired Companies list for the third year in a row.
Recognised by the 2016 Scrip Awards as the Best Full-service Provider Contract Research Organization (CRO)
Awarded the 2016 Eagle Award from the Society for Clinical Research Sites (SCRS) for the fourth consecutive year. A site-nominated award recognising contract research organizations (CRO) and biopharmaceutical sponsors dedicated to building positive relationships with research sites through leadership, professionalism and integrity.

You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there!

We invite you to join IQVIA™.

IQVIA™ is an equal opportunity employer. We make employment decisions based on qualifications and merit. We prohibit discrimination based on any unlawful consideration such as age, race, national origin, gender or other "protected status.“

Before applying you must obtain your Manager’s authorisation and notify your Talent Acquisition team
If you know the right candidate or for more information on this role please contact marta.saiz@iqvia.com

Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

title: Graduate Data Analyst - Trowbridge
role-description:

Specifically,
you will be analysing customer behaviour, product purchase patterns,
customer interactions and business processes to help develop strategies to
maximise customer satisfaction and to improve customer acquisition,
retention and revenue.
you will work with your Marketing, Product Management, Operations and CRM
colleagues and our Franchise Partners, providing analytical consultancy and
championing the understanding and adoption of data insights.
you will work with large datasets both internal and external - creating
queries and analysis directly off the customer database. This would involve

latest tools that become available.
you will be expected to build your understanding of our products and

business.

completing) a degree in computer science/ maths/ statistics/
engineering/sciences.

in any of the major program languages.
You would need to bring a collaborative mindset and a drive to reach out
and work across the business to create new opportunities.
You will often present your ideas to the senior management so excellent
communication skills and the confidence to engage with senior managers are
vital.

title: Data Analyst

title: Data Analyst - London
role-description:
Data Analyst Job Market
Insurance / Data Analytics Data Analyst
About the role Based within the Pricing Team of a leading Lloyd’s insurance company this role would suit a graduate with a numerate degree who has experience of programming languages such as R, Python and/or SQL. Data Analyst
Key Responsibilities The Pricing team works closely with underwriting teams: Building pricing models to allow underwriters to price, compare and monitor accounts Performing detailed statistical analysis on individual accounts to support underwriting and quotation Performing ad-hoc analysis of new business opportunities and portfolio/segmental performance Providing support to underwriters during business planning Assessing outwards reinsurance pricing Supporting the Pricing Team to leverage data from a range of sources to provide data insights and to enhance pricing and portfolio analytics capabilities. Prepare monthly pricing-related management information Help to design, build and enhance pricing analytics and reporting capabilities Support the collection, maintenance and exploration of pricing data so that it is available for modelling use by the Pricing Actuaries Build, develop and document streamlined, efficient processes to support pricing Communicate and present data-derived insights to business stakeholders Collaborate, present and share knowledge with the wider Actuarial team Assistance for other pricing team activities as required our requirements Data Analyst

title: Data Analyst
location: Jessop House Jessop Avenue, Cheltenham GL50 3SH, GB
role-description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst looking for a new opportunity? Do you thrive on a challenge and enjoy problem solving? Do you possess excellent presentation skills? If so, please keep reading!

Attivo Group is looking to recruit a Data Analyst to join our busy and growing Cheltenham office to provide expertise and support to the Senior Management Team and wider company in the collection, manipulation, maintenance, administration, and representation of business data. The role will be instrumental in enhancing our business intelligence so, having worked across a broad range of data environments, the Data Analyst will have the skills to build the database, structure the data from different sources, and visually represent the information.

This role is key to the delivery of our transformation programme to effectively optimise the operational efficiency of the business whilst improving the client and staff experience by ensuring that data is secure, accurate, and that its use is maximised to provide smart decision making. The Data Analyst will need excellent presentation skills and the ability to form successful working relationships with the Senior Management Team and Board of Directors.

We provide our advice and service through Attivo Financial Planning, one of the very few genuinely Independent, Chartered, Occupational Pension Specialist, financial planning firms in the UK. We aim to deliver the most professional, technically competent, independent advice and service to our clients. We want to be seen as a leader in the financial planning sector, to help change the standing of financial planning to be recognised as a genuine profession and to ensure we, and the profession, contribute positively to society and the economy.

Main responsibilities

Data quality and integrity
ensure that data is captured, stored, cleansed, and protected to facilitate presentation
develop data accuracy insights, providing reports and guidance to maintain and enhance data integrity for business managers
interrogate business acquisition data for integrity and integration into the CRM.
Data warehouse management
work with the Technical Team to design the new Attivo Group Data Warehouse
manage the data warehouse ensuring that data is available for presentation
ensure that the business can efficiently identify information for data subject access requests.
Information visualisation
develop the business intelligence capability, leveraging visualisation products such as Microsoft Power BI
design and develop business dashboards for executive and management information
provide advice, training, and guidance on the use of information visualisation products.
Data trend analysis
identify trends using data analysis techniques and tools such as Power Query
use company data sources to manipulate and interrogate data.

Qualifications, skills and experience
relevant technical competence
SQL language skills
knowledge of API integration
excellent understanding of Microsoft 365
experience of information visualisation products such as Power BI
knowledge of Intelliflo Intelligent Office would be an advantage
ability to maintain excellent working relationships within a professional team and manage multiple stakeholders
highly analytical with logical problem-solving skills
diligent with attention to detail
ability to continuously identify opportunities for data enrichment
ability to work autonomously to performance objectives
experience of mapping and documenting processes
a good understanding and experience of the Financial Services industry would be an advantage
excellent Microsoft database product knowledge
minimum 5 GCSEs graded A-B, including Maths and English.
Salary and benefits
£25,000 to £35,000 depending on experience and qualifications.

Attivo Group also offers:
excellent company benefits package including a non-contributory Pension Scheme, Private Medical Insurance, Income Protection, Critical Illness and Death in Service
generous holiday allowance
corporate gym membership
parking allowance for employees who live over 1.5 miles away from the office (Cheltenham only)
regular company social events
charity days
excellent culture, promoting employee wellbeing and engagement.


Please visit our webiste to view our privacy policy for prospective employees.

title: Data Analytics Internship

Data Analytics Internship

Advisory and Assurance

Navigate through ambiguity, manage multiple projects

SOX 404 and internal controls environment

title: Data Analyst

Data & Platform Management – Customer Platform Data Analyst

Competitive salary

Bratislava

We are transforming Marketing at Dell. Come join the best and the brightest to bring “Personalization at Scale” vision to life. Leveraging Dell Technology intellectual property, we are building one of the worlds largest customer data lake bringing billions customer contacts and data together to drive our #digitaltransformation. Dell is a collective of customer-obsessed, industry-leading visionaries. At our core is a commitment to diversity, sustainability and our communities. title: Data Analyst, Nielsen Sports
role-description:
Data Analyst, Nielsen Sports - 43138

DATA ANALYST, Nielsen Sports - London, Paddington

About This Job

Nielsen Sports is a trusted adviser and partner in sports and entertainment intelligence, helping our clients worldwide to maximize their commercial success. With our expansive suite of products and services, Nielsen Sports is uniquely positioned to provide insights and intelligence which help drive more effective decision making for clients.
We are recruiting for a talented Analyst to join our dynamic Data team in our London office located near Paddington.
This is an exciting opportunity to work with some of the biggest brands and right holders in the Sport and Sponsorship industry.

Responsibilities
Transform and evaluate data adhering to methodologies and processes
Complete data management
Build data sets through collection of TV audiences and advertising rates
Identify, analyse and interpret key performance measures and trends in multidimensional data sets
Communicate with internal stakeholders regarding project requirements, interpretation of data and the development of recommendations based on findings


a Little Bit About You
Very conscientious
Strong attention to detail
Happy to work both individually or as part of a team


Qualifications
A keen interest in Sport, where knowledge of the UK/Europe sports business and sponsorship landscape is an advantage
Strong analytical skills and great attention to detail
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel (formulas, logical functions, pivot tables etc.)
VBA/Python knowledge needed for programming and process automation is an advantage
High level of organisation and prioritisation
Ability to work under pressure to fulfill delivery deadlines
Exposure to audience ratings, CPMs, and other media exposure data an advantage

If it sounds interesting to you, do not hesitate to apply as it might be a perfect match for you!

About Nielsen

We’re in tune with what the world is watching, buying, and everything in between. If you can think of it, we’re measuring it. We sift through the small stuff and piece together big pictures to provide a comprehensive understanding of what’s happening now and what’s coming next for our clients. Today’s data is tomorrow’s marketplace revelation.

We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 100 countries. From global industry leaders to small businesses, consumer goods to media companies, we work with them all. We’re bringing in data 24/7 and the possibilities are endless. See what’s next with us at Nielsen: careers.nielsen.com

title: Data Manager & Analyst
role-description:
Descripción Del Puesto

Buscamos un profesional en Analítica de Datos para responsabilizarse de la implementación de las herramientas, procesos y técnicas necesarios para establecer un sistema de análisis capaz de traducir la información, de los diferentes sistemas de gestión de la empresa (ERP & CRM), en conocimiento para la toma de decisiones por parte de la dirección general, comercial, de marketing y producto.

Para esta posición se requiere un profesional con un perfil de alta capacidad en la lectura e interpretación de datos abstractos, y en capacidad comunicativa y divulgativa de los mismos.

Se valorará positivamente experiencia previa en posiciones de gestión e interpretación de datos en entornos de Business Intelligence, CRM & Big Data.

Funciones Del Puesto

Crear y mejorar los protocolos para conseguir una gestión de datos efectiva.

Definir las técnicas de recogida de datos para asegurar su adecuación, corrección y legitimidad.

Establecer e implementar procedimientos seguros para la gestión y el análisis de datos, con especial atención a los aspectos técnicos.

Interpretación de los datos y análisis de los resultados, empleando las técnicas estadísticas adecuadas y ofreciendo informes periódicos.

Desarrollar la implementación de bases de datos, recolección de datos, su análisis y otras estrategias para mejorar la eficiencia y calidad en todos los procesos de la empresa.

Responsabilizarse de la supervisión de la recolección de datos de fuentes primarias y secundarias, para manterner las bases y los sistemas de análisis.

Desarrollar estrategias para la creación de análisis de datos e informes efectivos.

Selección, configuración e implementación de las soluciones analíticas adecuadas.

Liderar la creación de los informes y análisis de datos.

Responsabilidades

El candidato seleccionado deberá comprender las necesidades del negocio y los objetivos de la empresa.

Se responsabilizará del control de calidad de la recogida de datos en los sitemas CRM / ERP.

Desarrollará estrategias, procesos y herramientas para un análisis de datos e informes de dirección efectivos.

Definirá las métricas y KPI’s del negocio y las diferentes fuentes que definirán su desempeño.

Aportará su experiencia y conocimiento para mejorar la interpretación de los datos y el desempeño general de la empresa.

Se mantendrá actualizado en torno a las novedades y tendencias del sector y de su campo.

Requisitos

Experiencia previa demostrable en etornos de gestión de información Big Data.

Nivel muy alto en gestión de bases de datos y manejo de las herramientas necesarias (SPSS, Navision, CRM, Hojas de cálculo, reporting…).

Altas capacidades analíticas, de interpretación de datos y creación de reportings significativos para la toma de decisiones.

Inglés nivel avanzado, otros idiomas valorables.

Vehículo propio.

title: Data Analyst - MENA
role-description:
Company Description

Believe in Better.

With 53 millions of tracks and a presence in 180 countries,

Deezer is the most personal music streaming service in the world.

Behind the code and the pixels is our team of 500 music lovers, and we’re building something incredible together. Want in? If you’re looking for an adventure, not just a job, and you fancy seeing ideas come to life in a heartbeat, you’re in the right place.

We believe in better product, better speed and better people.

Job Description

What you will do:
You will be the analyst responsible of the MENA region (Middle East & North Africa) but also working on other markets.
You will be responsible for providing insights regarding the markets, trends, competitors, potential and existing customers, and current campaigns.
You will provide regular update on Deezer KPIs to the country managers.
You will generate analysis of market results, ad-hoc analyses and recommendations, that will help markets identify and seize opportunities of growth.
You will support marketing actions and initiatives by analyzing their performance: CRM campaigns, promotional offers, acquisition of new users, partnerships, conversion from free to paying user, churn,

Qualifications

What about you?
2+ years of experience in a similar position, with a degree in Engineering / Statistics / Datamining or equivalent.
Passion for data, numbers and statistics.
Proficient in SQL and an experience with large sets of data.
Experience with Tableau Software.
Capacity to operate independently, being thorough, and delivering results in a highly organized manner.

Additional Information

Life @ Deezer

Start-up environment and philosophy

In-house Deezer Sessions with your favorite artists, gig tickets
Hackathons & meetups
Friday drinks, summer and winter parties
A stocked kitchen with free drinks and snacks
Areas to relax and collaborate with beanbags, guitars and table football
An ‘at home’ vibe, with great outdoor spaces

If you feel like this is the right opportunity for you, press play!

We are an equal opportunity employer.

title: Data & Analytics Engineer
role-description:
Je verantwoordelijkheden

Is een job als Data & Analytics Engineer helemaal jouw ding? Wel, bij Delhaize kan jij je helemaal uitleven. Wij hebben namelijk bergen data waarmee jij aan de slag gaat op innovatieve manieren. Jij speelt een cruciale rol want je zorgt ervoor dat je in die data duidelijkheid en structuur schept. Enerzijds verzamel je de data vanuit interne en externe bronnen en transformeert ze in een duidelijk overzicht waarmee de collega’s aan de slag kunnen. Anderzijds zorg jij ervoor dat je interne en externe stakeholders toegang hebben tot de gegevens via verschillende interfaces, zowel visueel als technisch. Uiteraard waak je erover dat zij deze ook effectief begrijpen en kunnen gebruiken. Ingewikkeld? Nee hoor want jij goochelt met data! Uiteraard verlies jij daarbij de coding standaarden niet uit het oog die je in overleg met het team hebt gedefinieerd. Zie jij mogelijkheden om de scope van businessoplossingen uit te breiden, processen te verbeteren of te automatiseren en manieren naar voor brengen om de intelligentie van onze data te verbeteren? Wij laten je graag je gang gaan.

Je profiel

Wat verwachten wij van jou? Jij hebt minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring binnen een Big Data, A.I. en/of Data Science omgeving. Dat jij zowel de taal spreekt van IT-specialisten, Data Scientists als van de eindgebruikers, dat spreekt voor zich. Jij communiceert helder en past je taalgebruik aan het kennisniveau van je gesprekspartner aan. Uiteraard in zowel het Engels als het Frans en/of Nederlands. Bovendien kan jij vlot aan de slag met volgende tools en platformen: MS Azure en/of AWS, SQL, Python, R, Scala, Databricks, Spark, Power BI of Table, Webservices, Java, Container (Orchestration), etc. Ken jij bovendien ook één of meerdere van volgende tools: Confluence, Jira, GIT? Dan zijn wij NOG meer onder de indruk!

Ons aanbod

Een job én een rijkelijk gevuld privéleven? Bij Delhaize kan dat. Je krijgt een aantrekkelijk loon aangepast aan jouw ervaring. Bovendien geniet je van diverse extralegale voordelen: bedrijfswagen met tankkaart, gsm plus abonnement, nettovergoeding, jaarlijkse bonus, maaltijdcheques, uitgebreide groeps- en hospitalisatievergoeding, en uiteraard een personeelskorting in de winkel! En groeien? Dat gaat hard bij Delhaize. Door de opleidingen, op de werkvloer én via onze opleidingscatalogus, krijg je daar de ruimte voor. Doorgroeien? Ook dat kan. Vraag maar aan één van je toekomstige collega’s.
Spreekt bovenstaande functie jou aan? Solliciteer dan onmiddellijk en ontdek wat jouw mogelijkheden zijn bij Delhaize!

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
We’re Sky, Europe’s biggest entertainment brand. Think top-quality shows. Breaking news. Innovative tech. Must-have products. Careers here mean the freedom and support you need to make an impact – pushing boundaries, creating solutions, hitting targets. And as part of our close-knit team, you’ll enjoy plenty of benefits. Plus, experiences you’ll only find at Sky.

“As a member of the analytics team within Strategy, Delivery and Performance, you’ll use data from across our technology platforms to help improve the customer experience of our Tv, broadband and mobile customers” - Head of Analytics

The perks

Sky Q, a generous pension and private health care. Access to over 12,000 LinkedIn Learning courses to support your development. And if that’s not enough, our award-winning Osterley campus boasts six subsidised restaurants, a cinema, gym, and much more.

To find out more about working with us, search #LifeatSky on LinkedIn, Twitter or Instagram.

You Will

Use data to improve current services (TV, Broadband and Mobile) and set the future strategy. You will:
Be innovative with our data and technology to find new insights
Support the decision-making process across Sky’s new propositions
Support stakeholders by providing ad-hoc analysis on provisioning, repair and quality of service
Ensure outputs are accurate, timely and meet the business need
Work closely with our data engineers to ensure accurate and timely data
Work closely with our data scientists to leverage machine learning to find new insights
Communicate findings with the wider business
Grow domain expertise and champion data analysis
You’ll Have
Interest and knowledge (experience is ideal) of current telecommunications, TV and/or mobile technologies
Degree (or equivalent experience) in applied quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, IT)
Ability to interact with senior stakeholders to gather requirements and answer the “so what”
Hands-on experience in simple to complex reporting, metrics/KPIs and performance insights
Hands-on experience in business intelligence and data analysis
Working knowledge of databases, data structures and reporting systems (ETL knowledge ideal)
Advanced SQL and the ability to efficiently analyse large amounts of data
Working knowledge of Tableau
Previous experience in complex project environment, managing your own projects, owning the process from start to end
So, what are you waiting for? Apply now for a chance to forge your own career path and be brilliant as part of a bright, talented team.

Just so you know: if your application is successful, we’ll ask you to complete a criminal record check. And depending on the role you have applied for and the nature of any convictions, we might withdraw the offer.

We’re happy to discuss flexible working.

It’s our people that make Sky Europe’s leading entertainment company. That’s why we work hard to be an inclusive employer, so everyone at Sky can be their best.

Dentro de la nueva Dirección de Generación Distribuida, se encargará de analizar los diversos modelos a tener en cuenta para definir el mejor sistema de Pricing con el objeto de conseguir una oferta competitiva y rentable.

Desarrollar el modelo analítico, estructura de datos y KPIs.
Optimizar y agilizar los procesos relacionados con el flujo y la calidad de datos para mejorar su precisión, viabilidad y valor.
Analizar conjuntos de datos para proporcionar información y realizar recomendaciones. Implementar modelo de datos y reporting (Dashbaards).

Definir y monitorizar los principales KPI´s de Pricing, con el fin de evaluar el rendimiento de la unidad y los canales utilizados, e identificar áreas de mejora.

title: Data Analysis Assistant
role-description:
Job DescriptionWe have an extremely exciting opportunity for an Analytics Intelligence Executive to join our 'custodians' of data - the Analytics team. You will be providing perspective to the business on the issues and insights that the business does not know it needs to know..... Intriguing isn't it? Stretching the mental agility to ensure that we are placed to provide cutting edge solutions and a foundation to enable rapid globalisation across all business units. The requirement of data driven decision-making is only becoming more apparent within the ever-changing fashion industry. Analytics are a small but powerful business function, acting as the formidable champions of business partnering across Lyle & Scott. Taking appropriate risks and driving us to be a 'leading' organisation, not a follower. It truly is an exciting time to join the team. It goes without saying that the role will require an individual who is both a fan & a proficient user of Microsoft Excel, as well as a basic knowledge of other data platforms such as PowerBI & Tableau... if this is not you, thank you for your time.. Your main responsibilities will include but are not limited to:
To provide structured information on customer & market insights to the business to derive competitive advantage from the data available in the market and on its existing and potential customers/markets
To be the commercial and consumer conscience for the business; pioneering business partnering with the other directorates, providing challenge and focus on the short, medium and long term commercial well-being of the company
Working with external suppliers such as Kantar Worldpanel & Statista to understand how the market is performing to feed back to all areas of the business
To provide seasonal analysis to the wholesale sales team, supporting the sales managers for their buying season appointments
Deliver results with a high degree of ethics, Integrity and passion ensuring compliance and transparency to business policies
Supports the business by acting as a trusted advisor in strategic sourcing initiatives and reporting on findings as required Desirable experience/qualifications:
Educated to Degree level or higher
1+ Years' experience working in a Fashion Head office in a similar role
Proficient in Microsoft Works - Excel, PowerPoint, Word, as well as other database programs such as PowerBI & Tableau
Strong knowledge of the menswear clothing industry and where the industry is going both online & in-store
Multi-dimensional thinker & proactive approach Personality and culture fit is something which is extremely important to us as a company, so please list all exciting skills in your application.

title: CIB - Operations Transformation - Insights & Analytics Team – Data Analyst – Associate - London
role-description:
About J.P. Morgan Corporate & Investment Bank

J.P. Morgan’s Corporate & Investment Bank (CIB) is a global leader across banking, markets and investor services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. With $18 trillion of assets under custody and $393 billion in deposits, the Corporate & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world.

Department Description

The Operations Transformation Group is a dedicated team of Program resources that are focused on delivering large scale change initiatives that span across business units to address Business, Industry and Client requirements across the Digital & Platform Services (D&PS) organization. The group provides a unique mix of project skills and product experience that are not tied to a specific business unit enabling it to provide a consistent, high-quality and responsive approach to the way we manage and execute change across the Corporate & Investment Bank.

The Insights & Analytics (I&A) team within Operations Transformation provides business intelligence solutions to CIB Digital & Platform Services organization. The team makes use of a suite of modern data analytics tools to deliver self-service analytics used by Ops management, Product and other groups looking for data insights to drive change, understand the business landscape, client behaviour and inform data-driven decision-making. The key toolset is based on Alteryx, QlikView and Tableau, and utilizes a RAD (Rapid Application Development) model, working flexibly to produce analytics that give senior management required insights in short timeframes.

As the central team in CIB Digital & Platform Services, we also manage the toolset, framework and templates; provide standards, best practices and foster a data-driven culture in the organization. We build & support cross-CIB dashboards that are used by all levels of management. The candidate will play a key role in helping the team manage, extend and enhance the framework. The position requires strong technical, analytical, communication skills as well as experience with business intelligence tools and programming languages.

Role Description

The team is seeking a high performing Associate candidate to play a key role within the I&A team, based out of London (Bank Street). The role will be focused on the design and build out of the metrics suite for the LIBOR Replacement program. The key toolset is based on Alteryx, QlikView and Tableau, and utilizes a RAD (Rapid Application Development) model, working flexibly to produce analytics that give senior management required insights in short timeframes. The successful candidate will play the lead role in designing and shaping the toolset that provides analysis and intelligence to the LIBOR Replacement Program. The position requires strong technical, analytical, communication skills as well as experience with business intelligence tools and programming languages.

Key Responsibilities
Design and build a suite of metrics for use by the LIBOR Replacement Program
Partner with I&A team to develop and document best practice to be leveraged by the analytics community
Help support and develop data-driven business culture across CIB Digital & Platform Services
Maintenance of feed validation frameworks to ensure data accuracy and consistency
Investigate and resolve any technical issues with data visualization or feeds

Core Skills
Minimum 3 years of experience with data visualization tools (QlikView, Qlik Sense, Tableau, PowerBI)
Minimum 2 years of experience with Alteryx or other data blending tools
Experience in structured data mapping from multiple platforms/file structures
Familiar with SQL or another programming language and willing to learn new programs and techniques
Strong data modelling skills
Familiarity with database platforms (Oracle, SQL Server, Hadoop) for data acquisition
Superior analytical ability with experience in collecting, analysing, and synthesizing large datasets
Business acumen; experience in financial services industry preferable

Desired Skills
Experienced Alteryx user capable of developing complex macros and managing workflows on a server
Experience with web and/or mobile analytics and technology tools (e.g. D3js, javascript, creating Qlik extensions)
Familiar with accessing data via APIs

The Successful Candidate Should Also Possess The Following Attributes
Self-starter who is creative with a ‘can-do’ attitude and strong work ethic
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to multitask and handle high stress while maintaining accuracy in tight deadlines
Team player, comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
Excellent problem solving skills and ability to work with tight deadlines
Organizational skills, be able to prioritize task based on priority level

About J.P. Morgan’s Corporate & Investment Bank

J.P. Morgan’s Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across banking, markets and investor services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. With $18 trillion of assets under custody and $393 billion in deposits, the Corporate & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world. Further information about J.P. Morgan is available at www.jpmorgan.com.

JPMorgan Chase & Co. offers an exceptional benefits program and a highly competitive compensation package. JPMorgan Chase & Co. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a member of the UK Government’s Disability Confident Scheme.

title: Data Analyst (H/F)
role-description:
A propos du poste
  Chez TechnipFMC, nous réalisons des projets d’une ampleur, d’une portée et d’une difficulté que vous ne trouverez pas ailleurs. Pour rejoindre notre équipe multiculturelle à Paris, nous recherchons un Data Analyst (H/F) en CDI au sein du service Gestion des documents de projet.

Description du poste

Rattaché(e) à la Division Ingénierie, sous la responsabilité du Responsable de Service, vous avez en charge de participer au développement de la cellule « Reporting » et de la promouvoir auprès des différents services et départements de la Division Engineering. Vous avez pour missions principales :
D’étudier et d’analyser les demandes d’élaboration de rapports/KPI émanant des projets, services mais aussi des Clients
D’être l’interlocuteur de la Division, du Projet et du Client
De produire les différents rapports et les analyser
De préparer et de rédiger les procédures liées à la mise en place des tableaux de suivi
De participer à l’amélioration d’un template générique applicable sur tous les projets
De documenter le code source développé pour l’ensemble des tableaux de suivi
De produire et consolider le « Feed-Back » au fil des projets
De former les personnes à l’utilisation de l’outil PowerBI
A propos de vous
De formation Bac +5 de type Master en analyse ou formation en ingénierie informatique, vous justifiez d’une expérience de 2 ans minimum dans une fonction similaire.
Vous êtes rigoureux(se), organisé(e), vous avez un esprit d’analyse et êtes force de proposition.
Vous avez de larges aptitudes relationnelles pour assurer les différentes interfaces (collaborateurs, clients, sous-traitants).
Vous parlez anglais couramment.
Connaissance et pratique de l’outil Power BI.
Votre avenir chez TechnipFMC 
Au sein de nos équipes, vous développerez vos compétences techniques et humaines pour devenir nos managers ou nos experts de demain.
Au sein de nos projets, vous serez amené à vous déplacer ponctuellement en France, en Europe, et dans le monde entier. En fonction de l’évolution de votre poste, et de vos aspirations personnelles, des mobilités plus longues pourront vous être proposées.
Tout au long de votre carrière, TechnipFMC vous offrira l’opportunité d’améliorer vos compétences techniques et managériales grâce aux formations professionnelles.
Au quotidien, vous serez immergé dans des équipes internationales et multiculturelles.
En savoir plus sur TechnipFMC
  En savoir plus sur nous et trouver d'autres postes vacants sur notre page carrière.
  Suivez-nous sur LinkedIn pour les mises à jour de l'entreprise.

title: Data Analyst (Pricing and Inventory Management) - Zalando Lounge
role-description:
As a Data Analyst for Pricing and Inventory Management at Zalando Lounge , you help us run and automate processes based on intensive data crunching, revamp our reporting and insights landscape to better cover our stakeholders and internal needs, and last but not least, you help us maximize the revenue and profit we make through the insights you generate, in particular on categories / countries specificities.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED

You leverage your business understanding, analytical thinking and technical skills to generate insights which help us to understand how to better steer our prices / discounts and the stock across our campaigns portfolio. Particularly, you drive the initiative to generate the first structured insights on category and country specificities.
You take an active role in the revamp of our data and reporting landscape, turning recurring data export / insight requests into automated report. You reflect our main business questions into standardized descriptive analytics to speed up decision making and processes.
You own some of our team processes. Beyond ensuring on time and error free deliverables, you take initiatives in favor of automation and ensure that fast evolving business requirements can be implemented.



What We Are Looking For

a strong analytical and technical profile
You have at least 2 years track record as an Analyst, ideally in fast paced e-commerce environment
You have experience with Tableau, SQL, Python is a plus and can work with these tools autonomously.
You have already helped businesses making decisions through the insights you generated, preferably in the field of ecommerce, pricing or inventory management
Excellent educational background in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or similar quantitative field
You are a fast learner and feel at ease dealing with multiple senior stakeholders


PERKS AT WORK

A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)


We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

About Zalando Lounge

Zalando Lounge is an online shopping club for fashion and lifestyle products in 13 European countries. We offer our members daily, time-limited sale campaigns with discounts of up to 75% off the recommended retail price. However, Zalando Lounge is so much more than discounts. Our strength lies in our focus on fashion from sought-after labels to niche brands, from famous international names to trendy luxury brands, we make sure to meet the fashion taste of all our customers, who are always on the hunt for the best products at the best prices. Working with our brand partners, we're pioneering innovative supply-chain and production processes and offer them an impactful and smart solution, creating a new way to shop for fashion - and a new way to sell it.

title: Data Analysis Trainee - Madrid
role-description:
About Us

At seedtag our mission is to create the best in-image advertising on earth. We are the leading company in in-image advertising and we believe in high-quality and non-intrusive advertising content. The seedtag platform allows some of the largest online publishers to get the most out of their images.

Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, today we proudly count over 100 employees in 7 countries. Our team is composed of eager self-starters who cultivate innovation and constantly bring fresh ideas.

Design and build dashboards and features to help optimize the business
Leverage data to perform analysis across all areas of our business to improve operational efficiency and streamline process.

Form the bridge between different parts of the business, thereby cooperating closely with other teams
YOU

Are highly proficient in excel and have experience with python, MongoDB and SQL
Have fluent proficiency in Spanish and a good level of English
Are proactive and eager to work in a dynamic and informal environment
Are a real teamplayer with really good communication skills
Experience with BI tools such as clickview and Tableau, and information processing languages such as SQL, R, SAS and python are considered a big plus
What We Offer
A fun and international work environment in a young AdTech company

The opportunity to gain relevant work experience in the field of Data Analysis in the growing AdTech market
A great work location in the heart of Madrid with great coffee, free snacks and even an arcade games machine. Also, we recycle everything we can!

Many fun offsite activities with your colleagues!
Would you like to join the team? Send us your application via the "apply" button!

title: Data Analyst Pricing Strategy (Budapest)
role-description:
About this role

About BlackRock

BlackRock helps investors build better financial futures. As a fiduciary to investors and a leading provider of financial technology, our clients turn to us for the solutions they need when planning for their most important goals. As of June 30, 2019, the firm managed approximately $6.84 trillion in assets on behalf of investors worldwide. For additional information on BlackRock, please visit www.blackrock.com | Twitter: @blackrock | Blog: www.blackrockblog.com | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock.

Pricing Strategy Data Analyst (Budapest)

Are you a highly motivated, technically proficient self starter who can build data models? Do you have a passion for visualizing data patterns and a desire to connect these patterns to strategic business opportunities? If so, this is an exciting chance to join our team as a data analyst.

The Pricing Strategy and Analytics team is a small, nimble, and highly visible team focused on building cross-functional analytical capabilities in response to shifting pricing dynamics in the asset management industry. We form part of BlackRock’s Strategic Product Management (SPM) team, which works to bring innovation, discipline, and focus to BlackRock’s investment product line by partnering with Client Businesses, Investment Teams, and Corporate Functions on product priorities.

What We Do
Analyze industry and firm pricing trends across all divisions and asset classes
Work with product strategy and client teams to model, detail, and socialize complex pricing methodologies
Accelerate negotiations by building repeatable/scalable pricing models and demonstrating existing precedents
Plan and execute on longer-term strategic pricing projects with teams across BlackRock

What You Will Be Doing
Data wrangling, mining, and visualizing. Curate and maintain pricing data from multiple internal and external sources
Building databases (initially in excel) to house data from pricing negotiations. These databases are critically important for analyzing trends in our internal book of business and across clients
Data visualization and trend analysis. Research, build, and maintain Tableau dashboards of pricing data. Implement appropriate data frames to present analysis in a way that accelerates decision making
Develop and track critical metrics whilst ensuring accuracy of results
Partner with all parts of the organization to capture relevant data sources and understand the reporting needs

What We Look For
Results-oriented innovator with an ambitious work ethic and professional disposition
Passionate about problem-solving and continuous learning. Able to conceptualize the first step towards solving a business challenge, and to quickly pivot to a different approach if warranted
Standout colleague who takes a collaborative and cooperative approach to tasks, but can work independently if necessary
Organized and precise, with the ability to prioritize effectively, multi-task quickly and efficiently adapts to new situations in a fast-paced environment
Must be comfortable gathering and synthesizing data, drawing conclusions, and summarizing/translating output into relevant commercial takeaways for different audiences
Familiarity with the Agile/SCRUM development environment
Experience with data ETL tools, VBA, SQL, Tableau and Python. Proficiency in PowerPoint

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Job Title - Data Analyst

Salary - Competitive Salary plus Veolia benefits *listed below

Grade - 5.1

Location - Cannock, Staffordshire

Hours - Full time, 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday

What you’ll do

Do you like solving complex problems? Are you a logical thinker? Do you want to be part of an innovative team that is trying to leverage the power of data to rapidly improve a business?

We are currently looking for a talented Data Analyst to join a large data and analytics function within a leading Environmental company. You will be surrounded by like minded people who are all trying to achieve similar goals. As a business we are making more and more decisions based on data and you can play a big part in helping us to achieve our growth objectives.

This role reports into the Analytics Manager and is aligned to a specific business function.

You Will
Create a suite of automated reports and dashboards by which we can effectively manage our business
Identify KPIs within the business and ensure that they are measurable with achievable targets
Develop an understanding of the various end users of these reports and ensure that they are suitable
Use advanced analytics practises delving deeper into trends and patterns in the data
Be able to communicate technical solutions to non-technical people.

You will be degree level educated in a relevant field (strong mathematical experience preferred) and have strong coding ability in either SQL, R or Python. You will also have high problem-solving ability, with strong communication and presentation skills, with a proactive and forward thinking approach.

Benefits You Will Receive Within This Role Are
The option to join the Veolia Pension Scheme
Access to Veolia Rewards, benefits and discounts
Free eye testing and money towards glasses if required for work purposes
25 days annual leave + statutory bank holidays

Where you’ll work

The role is based at our Kingswood offices in Cannock, Staffordshire but there may be an element of travel to other UK and Ireland sites in pursuit of your duties.

Who is Veolia?

We are the UK leader in Environmental Solutions. We offer services and expertise in waste, water and energy management helping to build a more sustainable future. As a global organisation, our work focuses on delivering simple but innovative solutions to preserving natural resources, reducing pollution and protecting our environment.

We live in a world that needs to take care of its resources, and our mission is to 'Resource the World'. Improving communities and protecting the environment are right at the heart of our business.

It takes more than just words and ambition to achieve this, it takes the daily efforts of thousands of people across the UK to bring it to life. Together our employees make our communities better. They are the resourcers, behind the resources.

Veolia is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applicants meeting the minimum criteria for the role will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, gender or gender expression, disability, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, sexual orientation, or veteran status.

title: Data Analytics & Insights Consultant
Job | Customer Data Analyst | Bruxelles
Senior Data Analyst
role-description:
We are The Mobile Bank.
Our vision is to build a bank the world loves to use.
Technology and design empower everything we do.

N26 is Europe’s first Mobile Bank with a full European banking license. We have 3.5 million customers across 24 markets. Our team of over 1300 employees in 3 locations is concentrated on reinventing the banking experience for the digital generation. Valentin Stalf and Maximilian Tayenthal founded N26 in 2013 and launched the initial product in early 2015. Since January 2015, N26 has been available for Android, iOS, and desktop. N26 has raised more than $500 million from investors including Insight Venture Partners, GIC, Tencent, Allianz X, Peter Thiel’s Valar Ventures, Li Ka-Shing’s Horizons Ventures, Earlybird Venture Capital, Greyhound Capital, Battery Ventures, in addition to members of the Zalando management board, and Redalpine Ventures.

Once here you will
You will develop self-driven analyses on customer behavior and product usage which drive growth and inform product development.
You will help foster a data-driven mindset across the organization, ensuring that data is at the heart of every decision we make.
Your analysis will lead to actionable insights, meaningful KPIs and dashboards.
You will manage the relationship with stakeholders from across the company to define and track relevant business goals.
You will work with data scientists and data engineers to design and maintain scalable data models and pipelines.
You will collaborate bringing N26’s data culture to help to shape our global data vision.
You will mentor more junior data analysts and teach them what you've learned throughout your career.


What You Will Bring Along
Minimum 2 years experience in a similar role
Outstanding analytics skills
Deep understanding of SQL for analytics
Proven experience with Python as a data analytics language
You are creative, organized, self-motivated and a strong communicator


What We Offer
High degree of autonomy
Working with international, highly engaged peers
Flat hierarchy and open communication
Getting things done attitude
Keep up to date with our InsideN26 Magazine
A stack of the most modern technologies
Personal Development Budget
Find a career path. Not just a job. Some of our benefits and rewards can be found on our careers website


Sound good? Send us your application online, and we’ll get back to you soon.

title: Data Analyst, Adobe XD
role-description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join the Adobe XD team as we embark on the exciting journey to deliver an industry leading software solution for the design community. As a Data Analyst, you will develop and maintain a modern data architecture to further our reporting, analytics, and experimentation capabilities, and – on a longer term - you will leverage predictive modeling and machine learning to help the XD team understand, manage, and optimize the experience throughout the customer journey. Ideal candidates will have a strong academic background as well as technical skills such as applied statistics and data engineering. Our team prides itself on being customer focused, agile, and data driven. If you are looking for a chance to be a part of a industry-game-changing opportunity, this one is for you!

What You'll Do
Partner with product managers and software engineers to gather and define data requirements, and build the necessary tooling required to ensure timely delivery of high-quality data
Build and maintain various product and engineering dashboards to inform the team about the state of the business, as well as to alert stakeholders when issues occur
Optimize scheduled jobs and explore new solutions to increase operational efficiency
Develop predictive models to address various business problems by leveraging statistical modeling or machine learning
Collaborate with product management and engineering groups to develop new products and features

What You'll Need To Succeed
MS degree in Computer Science, Applied Math, Finance or other related fields
5+ years of meaningful data engineering experience
Proficient in querying languages such as SQL
Proficient in one or more programming languages such as Python, R, Java
Some experience with one or more of Hive, Hadoop, Spark, Splunk.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau is a plus
Good understanding of statistical modeling and machine learning concepts is a plus
Proven business acumen, previous experience with product analytics
Possess natural curiosity, creativity, and technical acumen, being capable of asking critical questions about data and always ready to solve any challenges
Excellent communication, relationship skills, and a strong team player

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.

If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Collaborate with product management and engineering groups to develop new products and features

title: Data & Market Insight Analyst
role-description:
Aberdeen is currently searching for talented individuals with strong problem-solving skills and an intellectual curiosity to join Aberdeen’s growing team as a Data & Market Insight Analyst. This is a unique opportunity that will enable individuals to expand their understanding of the business landscape, hone their market analysis skills, and expand their ability to communicate emerging industry intelligence to customers. The Analyst will help explore multiple types of behavioral monitoring data from large-scale internet search activity data. This individual will learn how to develop user driven research emerging in critical areas of the business world such as: analytics and business intelligence, information technology, supply chain management, financial management and GRC, and, human capital management. The analyst will also be leading our data services activities, such as matching enriching and enhancing of data files. Furthermore, the analyst will be engaging with our customers to present results, findings and recommendations.
  Responsibilities 
Becoming the expert in our intent monitoring solutions and data services for Europe
Set up and fulfilment of client programs including data services and intent monitoring
Generate and analyze intent and technographic behavioral data
Summarize findings for clients, including recommendations for marketing and sales engagement
Present the findings with technology end-users, software vendors and the marketplace.
Being the expert of our data offering – understand the complexity of available data fields and how to best apply for segmentation efforts
Responsible for fulfilment of all European data and data services orders:
Set up of license access in cooperation with the US team
Preparation and fulfillment of data file orders
Supporting sales with data counts and reports
Consult and assist in the integration of licensed data into internal client systems, assist in data related services
Provide internal and client training of our data products
Project management of several initiatives

Qualifications 
3+ years’ experience in a similar role – data analyst
Native English, an additional European language being beneficial
Highly motivated and energetic.
Understanding of data and data analysis.
Excellent writing and verbal communication skills.
Strong critical thinking, problem solving, and analytical skills.
Experience using data management & analysis technologies such as SQL, SAS, Stata, PowerBI, Tableau, etc.
Technically skilled, able to analyze and manipulate data
            DataBase/RDBMS: DB2, MS Access, SQL Server
            Development Languages: SQL, VBA, COBOL
            Data management: Toad for DB2
            Mainframe: Development COBOL/CICS/DB2
Experience with database software/web applications
Experience creating dynamic dashboards/reports to provide valuable, actionable insights.  
Strong interest in emerging technology solutions and an eagerness to learn more
Ability to use online and other secondary research materials quickly and effectively.
Ability to work independently; self-motivated
Desire to be responsible for own success, entrepreneurial spirit is very welcome
Ability to build relationships with C-level decision makers (Database Managers, Insight Managers, Marketing Managers as the key target contact audience) as well as data users
Software experience including; MS Excel, MS Access or equivalent and MS PowerPoint, SFDC or equivalent
   Education:
Masters degree in data science or similar

title: Data Analytics Specialist# 133827
role-description:
We Offer

At Credit Suisse, we’re proud that Internal Audit is seen as a compelling voice inspiring confidence in the ability of the Bank to deliver its strategy. Our Auditors build and maintain direct and lasting relationships with the Bank’s leadership. They are actively consulted for their independent advice and insights to inspire positive change. Reflecting the Bank’s entrepreneurial spirit, our global Internal Audit function is also innovating; we are recognized as leading the industry in new technologies, data analytics, and the latest training techniques, to ensure that both people and platforms are best in class.

About the team We are a global team that encourages diversity of thought. Our offices are located in Zurich, London, Luxembourg, Warsaw, Wroclaw, New York, Raleigh, Hong Kong, Singapore, Tokyo, Pune and Mumbai. Our auditors are part of our practice model which provides exposure to different businesses, products and processes with the flexibility to also focus on areas of interest.

In this role you will
Implement, maintain and monitor data feeds from around the bank into the Internal Audit data repositories.
Lead, plan, perform and handle execution/reporting on audits by owning and executing data analytics based testing.
Have the opportunity to become a trusted advisor and partner to audit teams, building data analytics tests based on walkthroughs with the audit team to understand their requirements.
Translate Audit business requirements into SQL logic and work to obtain the necessary data to implement it.
Establish and maintain relationships within Internal Audit across all locations, as well as other control functions within the bank to build analytics solutions.
Proactively engage Internal Audit team to find opportunities to leverage technology and analytics, in connection with risk assessment and audit execution processes.
Display your good communication, interpersonal skills and your ability to understand requirements from users with varying levels of technical knowledge coupled with effective problem solving, conceptual thinking, quantitative and analytical skills.
Help oversee the use of Data Analytics in the ongoing risk assessment and rolling out audit plans.
Enhance your understanding of the Bank by working alongside auditors on a wide range of different global and local audits across the Bank.
Benefit from significant investments in your career development via our Audit Academy.

Open to discussing flexible/agile working.

You Offer

Requirements
Bachelor or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Finance or another quantitative field.
Strong SQL and proven data analytics skills including mining data, interpreting results, working with statistics, trends, etc.
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.).
Experienced in using data visualization products and technologies (e.g. Tableau).
Experience with ETL technologies such as MS SSIS or any relevant ETL tools.
Understanding of the importance of handling risk and quality on data projects.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
You are an avid learner and a dedicated problem solver with a can-do attitude.
Your strong interpersonal skills, multi-tasking and time management skills enable you to quickly gain trust and deliver effectively towards deadlines.
You are keen to work in an inclusive environment and excel at collaborating in a global team.

Our benefit
Private medical care
Life insurance
Pension plan
Charity days
Training and development
Internal Mobility

Other optional
Language training course
Mentoring
Family – nursery and kindergarten funding, gift vouchers for Christmas
Parking allowance

Employee discounts on various products and services (event tickets, consumer products, etc.)
Relocation package
Employee Referral Program
Flexible work schedule and working from home (home office)

title: Data Analyst – (Planning)
role-description:
We're BookingGo, the ground transport division of Booking.com. We're the ones who empower people to get where they're going. Whether they're taking the wheel or sitting back and leaving it to the driver. Whether they're heading straight from A to B or enjoying the freedom to go wherever their journey takes them.

To do that, we offer car hire to our customers through our Rentalcars.com brand and car hire, taxis and ticketed transfer services through Booking.com. We also have a B2B solution, Rentalcars Connect, providing great ground transportation options to the customers of our partners

With our HQ in Manchester, we're part of the worldwide Booking.com family. At the same time, we're proud of our own unique identity. Speaking 42 languages, our 2,000+ staff come from all over the world, just like our customers. What brings us together is our love of adventure: our own as well as other people's. It's easy to be passionate about a job that enriches so many lives on a daily basis, and our workplace reflects our passion, our diversity, our global focus. Just search "Manchester's coolest office" and see for yourself.

And we're in good company. Together with priceline.com, KAYAK, agoda.com, and OpenTable, we're part of Booking Holdings, the world leader in online travel and related services.

As BookingGo continues its journey to be a fully data driven organisation, we are looking for an exceptional self-led data analyst who wants to join the Taxi Team. This team focuses on offering pre-booked and on-demand taxis, we are on track to sell more than a million taxis this year, with more than 100% year on year growth

This Data Analyst (Planning) role provides the opportunity to be a close business partner of our supply team within Taxi, and will provide opportunities to drive seven-figure improvements in EBITDA by improving our tracking and management of contracts. You’ll sit within our excellent in-house planning team, which is led by an ACA-qualified accountant (ex. BDO) and has full responsibility for our end to end management P&L. You’ll also get involved with day to day performance tracking, and forecasting processes

An ideal candidate would combine strong analytical skills, intellectual curiosity and a collaborative and communicative style. It’s the ideal role for someone with finance skill set, who wants to develop in an “industry role” by working day to day with senior stakeholders.

Core activities: The analyst would focus on…
Supporting our Supply team from a Commercial Finance perspective
Identifying and managing contract rebates - which have a multi million pound impact on our P&L
Working to enforce quality SLAs - driving higher quality of service, and capturing significant value for the business
Ensuring the supply team are appropriately targeted to drive the most value
To do this, you would partner with our core finance team and supply teams
Understanding current performance (secondary responsibility)
Provide information and insight into current trading understanding
Feed in to weekly performance meetings with management team
Constantly highlight opportunities and risks to improve business performance
Planning and forecasting (secondary responsibility)
Support all planning and forecasting and modelling - we have an independent management P&L owned in this team
Reporting (secondary responsibility)
Work with reporting analysts to rationalise and develop management information ensuring analysis is delivered in a concise,accurate and timely manner


Core Skills And Experience That We Are Looking For
Relevant degree in Accountancy, Mathematics, Statistics or Economics / Business
Strong SQL and excel skills for querying and exploring data sets
Experience of business partnering / stakeholder management
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to clearly communicate complex ideas to varied and non-technical stakeholders
Commercial awareness, linking behaviours to business benefit
Ability to prioritise work effectively


Additional Experience That Would Be Beneficial
Relevant accountancy qualifications (CIMA / ACA etc.) – or working towards these
Experience of working in eCommerce, retail and/or travel would be beneficial
Working knowledge of BI tools such as Power BI and Tableau would be a strong plus

title: Data Analyst - Reporting Intelligence
role-description:
Are you passionate about big data? Do you dream of a job that allows you put your analytical skills to the test? We're searching for talented and enthusiastic analyst to join our Reporting Intelligence team.

This team is dedicated to investigate the bidding strategy of our advertisers by identifying and classifying performance patterns, seasonality trends and anomalies. You will be working with our petabytes large dataset.Your work will consist in drawing insightful and actionable conclusions from complex analyses, defining and exploiting new actionable Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that would benefit our partner's bidding strategies.

If you can work in a cross-functional team, contribute through exploratory analyses, A/B test evaluation and consultation on improvements to our systems and algorithms then this is the right job for you.

Apply today, you have the option to start immediately in our Düsseldorf office!

What You'll Do

Get an inside look at data science at trivago:
Work in a cross-functional team with other Analysts, Data Scientists and Data/Software Engineers.
Extract information from various data sources and process and prepare data for strategic analyses as well as regular monitoring of data in order to spot trends, find anomalies and initiate actions based on your findings.
Proactively communicate and share your conclusions as well as explain complex topics tailored to the audience
Investigate and employ new actionable KPIs.
Support, consult and challenge colleagues on data-driven decisions, testing and predictive algorithms.


What You'll Definitely Need
A degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics or another quantitative discipline.
Good knowledge in at least one programming language, preferably SQL, R or Python.
Expertise in statistics, data exploration and data visualization.
Strong communication skills, self-motivation and team working skills.
To speak fluent English (our company language).


What We'd Love You To Have
Knowledge of Hadoop.
Work experience in the travel / hospitality industry specifically, with a focus on data analytic responsibilities.
Experience working with APIs (retrieval and pushing data)
1-3 years data analysis experience.
Experience working with R or Python.


What You Can Expect From Life At Trivago
Growth: We help you grow as trivago grows through support for personal and professional development, constant new challenges, regular peer-feedback, mentorship and world-class training.
Autonomy: Every talent has the ability to make an impact independently by driving topics thanks to our strong entrepreneurial mindset, our horizontal workflow and self-determined working hours.
International environment: Our agile, international culture and environment with talents from 50+ nations encourages mutual trust and creates a safe space to discuss openly and act freely.
Collaborative spaces: Our state-of-the-art campus in Düsseldorf offers interactive spaces where we can easily collaborate, exchange ideas, take a break and workout together.
Relocation: We offer our international talents support with relocation costs, work permit and visa questions, free language classes, flat search and insurance.


Additional Information
trivago N.V. is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users.
To find out more about life at trivago follow us on social media @lifeattrivago.
To learn more about tech at trivago, check out our blog: https://tech.trivago.com/
Want to learn more about trivago's business model to prepare for your interview? Visit https://company.trivago.com/our-product/

title: Alexa Business Analyst
role-description:
Description

You are interested in Amazon Echo? Come work on it. We, Alexa's Applied Modeling & Data Science (AMDS) team in Berlin, are building the speech and language solutions for German and French behind Amazon Echo and other Amazon products and services.

We are seeking a flexible and detail-oriented Business Analyst with a passion for language data. In this role, you will support a range of analytics efforts, monitor NLU model accuracy and help customers to analyze and solve complex problems.

You Will
Handle unique data analysis requests from a range of data customers, including quantitative and qualitative analyses to elevate the customer experience
Continuously evaluate data analysis tools and processes and offer solutions to ensure they are efficient, high-quality and scalable
Present proposals and results in a clear manner backed by data and coupled with actionable conclusions
Generating actionable insights through the development of dashboards and deep dive analyses
Closely collaborate with colleagues from science, engineering and business backgrounds

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field
Native or near-native fluency in German and/or French
Experience with analytics or business analysis
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau or similar BI tools)
Experience with large-scale data mining and reporting tools (e.g., SQL)
Ability to clearly communicate insights (in verbal and written form) to stakeholders and senior management
Strong organizational skills, strong attention to detail and experience balancing multiple tasks and deadlines
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with language, language data, speech recognition and/or natural language processing
Comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative and dynamic environment
