title: Data & Market Insight Analyst
role-description:
Company Overview

Aberdeen is a leading global provider of marketing services to technology vendors. Our solutions include data services, intent and data analytics, research content, digital engagements as well as demand generations services to enable marketing and sales to optimize their pipeline and revenue results.

Aberdeen Europe is headquartered in the UK with further offices in France and Spain. We have an international contact center based in Madrid.

Our US offices are in Waltham and Wilton.

http://www.aberdeen.com

Job Summary

Aberdeen is currently searching for talented individuals with strong problem-solving skills and an intellectual curiosity to join Aberdeen's growing team as a Data & Market Insight Analyst. This is a unique opportunity that will enable individuals to expand their understanding of the business landscape, hone their market analysis skills, and expand their ability to communicate emerging industry intelligence to customers. The Analyst will help explore multiple types of behavioral monitoring data from large-scale internet search activity data. This individual will learn how to develop user driven research emerging in critical areas of the business world such as: analytics and business intelligence, information technology, supply chain management, financial management and GRC, and, human capital management. The analyst will also be leading our data services activities, such as matching enriching and enhancing of data files. Furthermore, the analyst will be engaging with our customers to present results, findings and recommendations.

Responsibilities And Duties
Becoming the expert in our intent monitoring solutions and data services for Europe
Set up and fulfilment of client programs including data services and intent monitoring
Generate and analyze intent and technographic behavioral data
Summarize findings for clients, including recommendations for marketing and sales engagement
Present the findings with technology end-users, software vendors and the marketplace.
Being the expert of our data offering – understand the complexity of available data fields and how to best apply for segmentation efforts
Responsible for fulfilment of all European data and data services orders:
Set up of license access in cooperation with the US team
Preparation and fulfillment of data file orders
Supporting sales with data counts and reports
Consult and assist in the integration of licensed data into internal client systems, assist in data related services
Provide internal and client training of our data products
Project management of several initiatives

Qualifications And Skills
3+ years' experience in a similar role – data analyst
Native English, an additional European language being beneficial
Highly motivated and energetic.
Understanding of data and data analysis.
Excellent writing and verbal communication skills.
Strong critical thinking, problem solving, and analytical skills.
Experience using data management & analysis technologies such as SQL, SAS, Stata, PowerBI, Tableau, etc.
Technically skilled, able to analyze and manipulate data
DataBase/RDBMS: DB2, MS Access, SQL Server
Development Languages: SQL, VBA, COBOL
Data management: Toad for DB2
Mainframe: Development COBOL/CICS/DB2
Experience with database software/web applications
Experience creating dynamic dashboards/reports to provide valuable, actionable insights.
Strong interest in emerging technology solutions and an eagerness to learn more
Ability to use online and other secondary research materials quickly and effectively.
Ability to work independently; self-motivated
Desire to be responsible for own success, entrepreneurial spirit is very welcome
Ability to build relationships with C-level decision makers (Database Managers, Insight Managers, Marketing Managers as the key target contact audience) as well as data users
Software experience including; MS Excel, MS Access or equivalent and MS PowerPoint, SFDC or equivalent

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Salary: £45,000 - £55,000 per annum, depending on experience

Who we are:
Digital Ventures Services Limited (DVS) is a privately owned, global digital business headquartered in central London. Established in 1999, DVS has been an internet pioneer. Today, our core brands are Vivastreet, Digital Directories and Roomgo. Each brand offers a vibrant marketplace for community-based local services.

Digital Directories is a digital platform connecting users with specialist lawyers. We understand that people need access to the very best legal advice at critical times in their lives, but most have trouble finding it and often must rely on recommendations from friends with limited experience. This creates risk and leads to further stress at an already stressful time. Launched originally in France, Digital Directories powers our mon-avocat.fr, legaleperme.it, my-lawyer.be and Qredible UK brands to provide an easy to use and trusted platform that enables people to make informed decisions and get the answers they need from leading lawyers that, in turn, benefit from showcasing their capabilities and reputation by utilising our technology and experience. 

The role:
The Data Analyst role will be responsible for quality, consistent data that enables business and product decisions. Ability to manage time in a fast-paced environment is a must. We innovate early and often and need to be nimble enough to shift gears when necessary. Our company has offices in London, Paris and Milan and maintaining smooth communication between these offices is essential.
 This role is ideal for someone who has worked in BI and Data roles within a Marketing organisation. This is a self-starting role – we have a team of Data experts in other areas of our business and they need to quickly establish a working relationship with those teams to make the most of our setup. This person needs to work across technical, marketing, sales and operational teams, and also provide data sets and reporting which will ultimately go to our paying clients, so excellence in communications is critical, as well as an eye for the best way to demonstrate insights from data in a visual, non-technical manner.
 Key responsibilities:
Work closely with tech team to ensure clean, consistent data. Own all requirements as they relate to data acquisition, storage and usage
Represent the requirements of marketing, sales, operations and translate these into technical requirements for the tech team to deliver
Build data structures to enable self-serve reporting
Work with Sales and Marketing teams to enable their acquisition strategies, highlighting what is available to them
Work with Customer Services and CRM teams to improve the use of data in their conversations with our clients, providing insight which informs their structure and strategy
Work with Product to build out tools, reports and datasets which can be provided to clients
Provide regular insight reporting to the senior team, with data and outcomes/suggestions
 Experience: 
Demonstrable experience working collaboratively with product, tech, marketing & sales team
Capable of using SQL to extract and analyse complex data sets
Experience using Google Analytics for marketing / product optimisation (segments and funnels).
Experience extracting and using Google Analytics data from Google Bigquery.
Creation of reports and dashboards using data visualisation tools such as Google Data Studio, Tableau or Power Bi
Familiarity with programming languages R/Python would be advantageous
Familiarity with qualitative analysis would be advantageous

If this prospect excites you, we'd love to hear from you!

title: Senior Data Analyst (Data Scientist)
role-description:
Senior Data Analyst (Data Scientist)

About Swiss Re

The Swiss Re Group is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. It anticipates and manages risk – from natural catastrophes to climate change, from ageing populations to cybercrime. The aim of the Swiss Re Group is to enable society to thrive and progress, creating new opportunities and solutions for its clients. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, where it was founded in 1863, the Swiss Re Group operates through a network of around 80 offices globally. It is organised into three Business Units, each with a distinct strategy and set of objectives contributing to the Group’s overall mission.

About The Role

As Senior IT Business Management Data Analyst you will be responsible to define, maintain, control and run a lean reporting framework for Swiss Re IT providing all relevant parties with report so they are able to steer and lead their respective functions.

The opportunity
Define, maintain and run a reporting framework for Swiss Re IT and find opportunities for improvement in services, processes and resources.
Support information needs in regards of measurement and reporting of all relevant partners.
Define efficient reporting procedures, methods and systems continually seek to improve the metrics and reports, e.g. in aspects of accuracy, automation etc.
Analyze collected data, relations, trends and translate collected data into actionable information.
Implement, maintain and lead IT consumption measurements and take remedial action with partners based on your analytics.
Present key findings and achievements/ results to IT executives on a regular/need basis and review the results with partners on a periodic basis.
Ensure reports are continually published/ presented in defined agreed time intervals adhering to departmental standards and policies, and cope effectively with the complexity and volume of information needs.
Handle customers feedback of IT and ensure appropriate actioning by the respective service teams.
Propose and define CSI in agreement with partners and seek implementation of service improvements, track progress and reports to management and partners.
As this role is a global role you will be working with various partners around the globe as part of international team mainly based in Bratislava and Zurich and Budapest.


About You

As an expert (5+ years) reporting/data analyst you thrive deep within developing situations with an intense curiosity to make discoveries in the world of big data. You love analyzing information from different varieties, volumes, velocity, veracity to identify rich data sources, connecting them and turning unstructured data into structured data. You are creative by nature and enjoy to communicate in a language understandable to all partners. You have excellent analytical and presentation skills, with an ability to see the big picture and enjoy working within a team. You have a deep understanding and knowledge of quantitative methods (statistics) enjoy working in a multicultural and diverse environment. Proven credibility in building trust and maintaining relationships with partners is expected. You have got strong knowledge in SQL, Excel, leading BI tool (such as Power-BI, Tableau) and good knowledge of Python and JavaScript with excellent command of English.

Minimum base salary for this job from 1700 EUR gross/month/full time. Our offer to you may be higher based on your skills and experience and will include additional rewards and benefits.*
We provide feedback to all candidates via email. If you have not heard back from us, please check your spam folder.

We are required by law to disclose basic wage component (minimum salary) for the advertised positions. We carefully consider your professional competencies, qualifications and experience in our compensation package and/or when offering you other positions. Our compensation philosophy is to pay fairly, also considering market situation and the value employees may bring to Swiss Re.

Keywords

Reference Code: 82541

title: Data Visualisation Analyst
role-description:
Job Title Data Visualisation Analyst
Location Glasgow

As a Dashboard developer you will be working with the Global Compliance Management Reporting Team to develop online Compliance dashboards in Tableau (and/or equivalent visualisation tools) by liaising with SMEs/stakeholders to review big data and data analytics. Dashboards will be used as interactive management information tools for the Compliance Management Team and senior Barclay’s executives. You will gain an understanding of the regulatory and compliance requirements of the banking industry.

What you’ll be doing?
Design, and develop dashboards in Tableau
Provide Tableau user training where necessary on an ad hoc basis
Ability to link and aggregate standalone dashboards to promote greater interactivity through online and interactive MI reports
Review and challenge understanding of Compliance and hierarchical data
Build an understanding of the reporting needs of the function
Gaian awareness of the data structures and tolls available throughout the bank and how they can be leveraged to avoid reinventing
Work with technology platforms; employ controls around data and exception handling;
Liaise with SMEs/stakeholders of all corporate grades in Compliance, Technology and the wider organisation
What We’re Looking For
Possess a very good /advanced understanding of developing dashboards in Tableau with supporting statistical and maths knowledge
Strong written and oral communication skills, able to work in an agile way with business colleagues who are less technically minded
A self-starter with a technology background and developer skill set and mind-set willing to learn
Display professional scepticism, raising and discussing draft observations with management, as necessary
Skills That Will Help You In The Role
Experience with big data projects and data analytics
Actively improves technical knowledge through self-learning and formal training
Experience in Compliance, Audit or other relevant functions;
Knowledge on big data technologies
Where will you be working?

Barclays, Glasgow: Where the best meet to build careers full of scope, variety and reward. Creating the solutions that meet today’s demands, answer tomorrow’s questions, and redefines the future of finance. Visit home.barclays/who-we-are/ for more details.

Our Values

Everything we do is shaped by the five values of Respect, Integrity, Service, Excellence and Stewardship. Our values inform the foundations of our relationships with customers and clients, but they also shape how we measure and reward the performance of our colleagues. Simply put, success is not just about what you achieve, but about how you achieve it.

Our Diversity

We aim to foster a culture where individuals of all backgrounds feel confident in bringing their whole selves to work, feel included and their talents are nurtured, empowering them to contribute fully to our vision and goals.

Our Benefits

Our customers are unique. The same goes for our colleagues. That's why at Barclays we offer a range of benefits, allowing every colleague to choose the best options for their personal circumstances. These include a competitive salary and pension, health care and all the tools, technology and support to help you become the very best you can be. We are proud of our dynamic working options for colleagues. If you have a need for flexibility then please discuss this with us.

UK-Lanarkshire-Glasgow

title: Data Analyst (f/m/d)
role-description:
About Us

Pamono (www.pamono.com) is Europe’s largest marketplace and a magazine specializing in distinctive design objects and the stories behind them. Driven by the belief that a life well lived means surrounding yourself with beauty and soul, we source vintage and contemporary furniture, lighting, accessories, and crafts from around the globe and seamlessly deliver them right to our customer’s door. We see our mission as granting instant access to hard-to-find pieces of the highest quality to the broader public. Based in the heart of Berlin as an international team of 75 people, we aim to revolutionize the online design market.

Your Role
Pamono is currently looking for a skilled and highly motivated Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our team at our beautiful office in the heart of Berlin. You’ll be heading up our Analytics Department, providing valuable data insights and performing descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics.

Your Responsibilities Will Include
Build solutions for third-party data integration into our data warehouse
Maintain existing product and third-party ETL solutions
Leveraging our mature data stack to create value and insights
Performing ad-hoc analyses to support various departments’ data needs
Liaising with other departments to help broaden the scope of analytics at the company
Managing and supporting our analytics team in creating more complex data products, in fields such as recommendations and image classification

Your Profile
You hold a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree, preferably in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a similar field
You have a minimum of 2+ years’ experience in data analytics or a related field
You have experience with ETL development
You have experience with data visualization tools
You have extensive experience with SQL (MySQL, Impala)
You have experience working with various data structures (JSON, CSV, XML, HTML)
You are a proficient English speaker, with good written English skills
You are familiar with at least one of the following programming languages: Python, R, Java, Scala
You have a solid quantitative foundation
Bonus skills:
Knowledge of Apache Spark

What We Offer
An exciting, challenging position with lots of responsibility and space for personal development
Actively shaping an inspiring internet-business
A young and international team, flat hierarchies and no dress code
An exciting work environment
Benefits such as team events, free fruit, drinks, German classes, and more
Dog-friendly office
Interested in the role? Please apply exclusively via our career portal. Don't forget to attach your CV and a motivation letter. We are looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Market and Data Analyst
role-description:
We have an immediate vacancy for a Market Analyst. Working closely with our project managers and with the international team of country analysts, you will be responsible for all aspects of our data quality process. The emphasis is on data completeness, consistency, timeliness and accuracy.

The role requires a combination of Excel skills and business understanding, and will include engagement in the following areas:
Ensure a smooth flow of data between the research team and our client database
Data checks, investigation of data anomalies and development of audit reports
Maintenance and upgrade of existing analytical tools
Development of new tools and processes to improve data quality and integrity
Discussion of modelling assumptions and outputs with individual market analysts, and development of recommendations for the improvement of data quality.
The Ideal Candidate Should Have
A Bachelor or Master?s degree in a business, economics, engineering or science discipline, with a solid foundation in quantitative skills
A minimum of 1-2-year(s) experience in a research/analysis function
Strong numerical skills and the capacity to interpret data
Good working knowledge of Excel and possibly database software.
Basic Programming skills (Macros/VBA) are not essential but would be a bonus
Some experience in forecasting and modelling techniques
The capacity to work both independently and within a team in a highly organised manner with excellent attention to detail
Good communication skills
Fluency in any foreign language preferred but not essential.
We need to see from your application that you are actually interested in exactly this position, so please make sure that your CV/cover letter shows this.

title: Assistant Data Analyst - London
role-description:
Have you always had a passion in finding answers through factual, evidence-based methods? Does presenting truth grounded in numbers and insight give you that instant gratification? We are recruiting for an Assistant Data Analyst to join us and deliver key operational reporting to the business. Numbers, insight and KPIs drive our business. With 100s of metrics delivered to the business on a weekly basis, we need somebody to own the manipulation of that data by extracting it from systems such as Salesforce and turning raw data into our business metrics. This role will give you unique insight into the business as you interact and analyse all different parts of it. We will provide you with a strong commercial foundation, technical training to manipulate data in different environments and most important, the skills to be able to craft narratives to engage people with your insights. The Role: The main duties of the role are to design and develop business KPI dashboards, deliver campaign insights and audience analysis, and most importantly, provide recommendations to influence future planning and decision making of campaigns to a variety of teams across the organisation. The ideal candidate should be analytically curious and be keen to learn different business reporting systems. It goes without saying that this role will require you to be a fan of Microsoft Excel but you will be given training on Salesforce and BI tools such as PowerBI. Being one of the first point of contact for most things related to data, you will also need to be a strong communicator and be able to translate numbers into simpler terms. After your first year, or even sooner, you will be expected to be involved in senior stakeholder reporting that drive business decisions. Additionally, depending on your interests and skills in the field of data, you will be guided to be specialised into a particular area; these include business/marketing analysis, data science/engineering or business intelligence. Campaign Reporting
Responsibility for supporting campaign delivery by producing regular reports and analysis throughout the lifecycle of a campaign.
Proactively make data – driven recommendations and suggestions to project teams to influence outcomes
Analyse quantitative and qualitative customer data to develop effective segmentation strategies Sales Support
Support delegate and sponsorship team around CRM processes and use of data and lead assignment
Produce and deliver regular reports and analysis to support decision making around sales activity on all campaigns What you'll need:
2:1 graduate with a business, economics, statistics, computer science or technology background
Analytical mindset with an eye for detail
You must be a self-starter who is comfortable working autonomously
Right to work in the UK
Experience with relational databases or SQL would be an advantage Why Choose Us?
Hanson Wade is one of the top 100 fastest growing SMEs in the UK and our culture is truly phenomenal
Hanson Wade is proud to be an equal opportunities employer
Our training and career progression opportunities would be hard to beat elsewhere
Our culture consistently remains at the heart of what we do. Employee wellbeing is important to us, for example:
We offer an annual personal learning budget
We offer subsidised yoga in the office, have a running club that regularly enters into team events and a cycle to work scheme
We provide free fresh fruit each week We all get on well and find lots of ways to socialise through:
Monthly social club events
Monthly awards night and drinks
Legendary twice yearly company parties
Team dinners and activities to celebrate success projects £22,000 Base + Bonus

title: Data Analyst - Glasgow
role-description:
Job Description

The full job description is attached.

Responsibilities

As our Data Analyst, you will have a strong background in organising,
managing, enriching and manipulating data, including structured and
text-based information. You will have excellent experience of the relevant
database technologies and programming languages and be highly skilled in
structuring, converting, analysing and exploring data to reveal underlying
patterns and stories. You will have the ability to think rigorously about
the complex issues involved in data collection and manipulation and will
enjoy working with records specialists to support access to the digital
archive.
You will remain calm whilst working under pressure, dealing with a wide
variety of tasks and will have experience in problem solving using data
design. You will see opportunities for improvements and be able to
communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences through
appropriate medium.
This is an opportunity to work with committed and talented developers,
designers, archivists and researchers who share a passion for creating high
quality, user-focused digital services for a range of audiences.
Join us here in beautiful Kew, just 10 minutes’ walk from the Overground
and Underground stations, and you can expect an excellent range of
benefits. They include a pension, the option to work part time or job share
and discounts with local businesses (e.g. beauty salons and bars). We also
offer wellbeing resources (e.g. on-site therapists) and have an on-site
gym, restaurant, shop and staff bar.
To submit your application please click the 'Apply now' button on this
page, where you will be asked to provide CV details and complete a personal
statement. In your personal statement please explain how you meet the
criteria below. You may draw on knowledge, skills, abilities, experience
gained from paid work, domestic responsibilities, education, leisure
interests and voluntary activities. Please note selection for interview
will largely be based on the information you provide in this section so
please make full use of the 1250 word count.

Essential Criteria
Extensive experience of large scale data analysis and manipulation using
different programming techniques (for example, Python, Shell scripting,
XSLT, SQL) for structured and text based data analysis and manipulation.
Excellent knowledge and experience of working with data encoded in
different formats (for example, XML, CSV, JSON, RDF).
Practical experience and knowledge of a range of database technologies
(for example: no-SQL, RDBMS, triple stores / linked data, graph databases).
Awareness of the issues with manipulating complex structured and
unstructured data, with excellent skills in pattern analysis and strong
accuracy and attention to detail.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and organisational skills coupled
with the ability to work to a high degree of accuracy demonstrating a
proactive and solutions focused approach to problems.
Strong communication and relationship building skills, suitable for
working with multidisciplinary stakeholders at all levels; able to lead and
facilitate work to gather user requirements from the business and to
explain technical concepts clearly to non-technical staff.
Highly motivated to work independently and as a project team member.
Ability to prioritise tasks and deliver products to deadlines

Benefits

Benefits

Generous benefits package, including pension, sports and social club
facilities, onsite gym, subsidised staff restaurant and opportunities for
training and development
Things you need to know
Security
Successful candidates must pass a disclosure and barring security
check.Successful candidates must meet the security requirements before they
can be appointed. The level of security needed is security check.
Nationality requirements
Open to UK, Commonwealth and European Economic Area (EEA) and certain non
EEA nationals. Further information on whether you are able to apply is
available here.
Working for the Civil Service
The Civil Service Code sets out the standards of behaviour expected of
civil servants.
We recruit by merit on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined
in the Civil Service Commission's recruitment principles.The Civil Service
embraces diversity and promotes equality of opportunity. There is a
guaranteed interview scheme (GIS) for candidates with disabilities who meet
the minimum selection criteria.Once this job has closed, the job advert
will no longer be available. You may want to save a copy for your records.

title: Sr. Data Analytics & Machine Learning Research Analyst
role-description:
We are looking for a specialist to join our team. We work in projects that are related to Cybersecurity, Machine Learning and automotive embedded systems.
Your work will help improve the security of current and future automotive technologies, including in-vehicle systems protection, secure V2X communications, autonomous driving and privacy.
Your work will involve several Data Analytics & Machine Learning tasks, collaborating in a team of Cybersecurity experts. The main work topics will be applied research and development of Cybersecurity solutions that work with automotive embedded systems, cloud computing, and automotive Data Analysis.
We are looking for someone flexible, curious, willing to learn and to adapt to the team needs in each different project. An affinity with Cybersecurity is a plus.

Your abilities should include experience with most of the following:
·        Big Data projects using Hadoop and Spark.
·        Anomaly detection, few-shot learning, unsupervised learning, semi-supervised learning.
·        Different approaches to work with very imbalanced data.
·        EDA, feature selection, feature enrichment.
·        Privacy issues and how to address them.
·        Machine Learning security problems: adversarial examples, data poisoning, recovering training data, etc. and ways to avoid them.
·        Time-series analysis.
·        Programming in Python and/or R.
·        Knowledge of at least one DL library (Theano, TF, Pytorch, MxNet, etc.)
 What we expect
Required experience / knowledge / skills:
·        Master in Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, Physics, Telecommunications.
·        Strong ethics.
·        Analytical approach to problems.
·        Being able to read and summarize research papers in Machine Learning and apply them.
·        Leadership and a make-do, problem-solving attitude.
·        Original thinking.
·        Presentation skills.
·        Research publications, patents, public projects are a plus.

title: Data Science Analyst - Bucharest
role-description:
Kalypso

Kalypso is a professional services firm dedicated to helping clients discover, create, and make better products with digital. We believe that innovation is the single most important factor for long-term growth and success.

We are passionate about our work and committed to helping clients become more innovative, competitive, and productive. The Kalypso team consists of diverse industry and technical experts with proven experience delivering results. Our people are recognized business, industry, and technical thought leaders with a passion for innovation.

As a provider of professional services, our people are the key to success. We are looking for the absolute best to join our world-class team. We want balanced individuals who are willing to go the extra mile to provide the sustainable results our clients expect. At the same time, we are looking for real, multi-dimensional people – Characters with Character – who complement their expertise and intelligence with personality and integrity.

Data Science Analyst Job Description

Location: Bucharest, Romania (European Innovation Center)

Kalypso is seeking exceptional candidates who are passionate about the exciting world of digital technologies, including the Internet of Things, Big Data, Advanced Analytics, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.

As a Data Science Analyst, you will help our clients apply leading data analysis and artificial intelligence techniques to challenging business problems, all while becoming proficient in the most highly valued technological skillset in the global marketplace.

Our work is fast-paced, demanding, and provides unparalleled exposure to unique opportunities. The learning curve can be quite steep, but our team will help you build confidence and enable you to explore areas that are of interest to you. Our focus is on helping clients extract business value from cutting edge technical capabilities, not just on making the technology work. In this role you will help design, develop, and test solutions for a diverse set of clients in industries such as Manufacturing, High Tech, Life Sciences, Consumer Goods and Retail.

Main Responsibilities

No two days are exactly the same in our dynamic environment, nevertheless, below is a list of responsibilities you will be accountable for:
Create data models supporting Kalypso digital solutions across Manufacturing, High Tech, Life Sciences, Consumer Goods and Retail industries. Example model themes:
Demand/supply forecasting
Risk analysis
Customer behaviour analysis
Timeseries analysis
Asset efficiency modelling
Predictive maintenance
Multi-dimensional correlation
Natural Language Processing / Natural Language Generation
Vision AI / Language AI
Model benchmarking and technology evaluation (tools, vendors, techniques)
Build scalable tools to process large volumes of structured and unstructured data using on prem, cloud, and hybrid technologies – for our pre-configured solutions or on per-project basis
Design and implement machine learning and data management strategies (ingest, process, store)
Interact with internal and external stakeholders to understand their concerns and actively participate in solution design and build. Work with peer Solutions Architects to provide input to solution design, providing Data Science point of view
Be curious and constantly learn something new to stay on top of relevant technologies
Have fun while delivering excellent results to our customers


Requirements
Degree in Computer Science or Information Systems with supplementary experience in Data Science and/or Statistics
2+ years of relevant work experience
Fluency in spoken and written English
Strong academic performance
Superior analytical, technical and problem-solving skills
Effective interpersonal, organizational, and time management skills
Creativity, self-confidence and flexibility
All applicants applying for EU based job openings must be authorized to work in the EU
Work location is Bucharest
Willingness to travel up to 50%


Technical Skills
Proficiency with Machine Learning model development, training, validation and application
Proficiency in mathematical disciplines including linear algebra, calculus, probabilistic models and statistics
Data manipulation techniques, including ETL/ETLV
Experience developing in Java, .NET and SQL languages
Experience with R, Python or Scala scripting techniques
Experience with data visualization platforms like D3.js, Tableau, Kibana, HTML5 and CSS
Competency in Graph/NoSQL database techniques, and RDBS platforms like Oracle and MS SQL Server
Experience using and developing RESTful and SOAP Web Services
General knowledge of software development practices and technical documentation (requirements, functional specifications, test plans, etc.)


Consulting Skills
Versatility, flexibility and proactivity when resolving technical issues and dealing with ambiguity
Understanding of business requirements and the process of translating them into well-engineered and integrated technical solutions; attention to detail
Commitment to quality and on-schedule delivery; proven ability to establish and meet milestones and deadlines
Customer-focused to understand and appropriately respond to customers’ business needs
Demonstrated ability to interface effectively and collaborate with clients, peers and management to help develop solutions and ensure stakeholder buy-in
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment with flexibility and a deep commitment to client service

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
As a Data Analyst at Optiver you will be able to have a big impact on improving our current trading strategies through in-depth analysis of our trade data.

If you have an academic degree, Python, SQL, Excel or similar languages and a passion to prove yourself you could be the Data Analyst we are looking for.

What You'll Do

Optiver is an industry leader across everything we do. We don’t just meet industry standards we aim to set them! With trading teams focusing on a broad range of financial products we are able to provide an unrivaled universe of exciting opportunities for our employees. Through our core function as a market-maker we continuously improve the market by being the source of liquidity for market participants.

The Optiver trading floor is one of the most dynamic, exciting trading floors in Europe. As a Data Analyst you will work directly alongside our trading and research teams gaining valuable insight into how our trading company operates. You will be responsible for managing large amounts of data, producing regular as well as ad-hoc reports and leading a diverse set of projects to improve our trading activities. We will also challenge you to learn new programming languages like Python, Lua and C++.

What You'll Need
An academic degree, preferably in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Econometrics, Finance or equivalent
Advanced knowledge of Python, SQL, Excel or similar languages
Great attention to detail
Analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent communication and teamwork skills
Competitive attitude and eagerness to constantly improve yourself


What You'll Get
The chance to further your career working alongside best-in-class professionals from over 40 different countries.
Our performance based bonus structure is unmatched anywhere in the industry. We combine our profits across desks, teams and offices into a global profit pool fostering a truly collaborative environment to work in.

Alongside this you will get great secondary benefits such as 25 paid vacation days, fully paid first-class commuting expenses, training opportunities, discounts on health insurance, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, Friday afternoon drinks and even weekly in-house chair massages. Being highly international, we are accustomed to guiding expats through their relocation, offering competitive relocation packages and providing visa sponsorship where necessary.

Are you interested in furthering your career on one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe?

Apply directly via the form below for the position of Data Analyst. Please provide us with a CV and letter of motivation in English. Applications without a letter of motivation will not be reviewed. When we think there is a potential match, you will hear from us sooner than you expect. If you have any questions feel free to contact the Recruitment team on +31 (0) 20 708 70 00 or recruitment@optiver.com.

Please note, if you are selected from your application to proceed to the next round for the position of Data Analyst, you will be required to take an online assessment. Additionally, visa requirements apply for non-EU applicants.

Kindly note that we do not require any assistance from third-parties including agencies in the recruitment of this role.

More information on how Optiver Europe processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy.

title: Data Scientist (Data Analytics International Hub)
role-description:

Think Forward! Our purposeis to empower people to stay a step ahead in life and in business. We are anindustry recognized strong brand with positive recognition from customers inmany countries, a strong financial position, Omni-channel distribution strategyand international network. If you want to work at a place where we believe thatyou can make the difference by using machine learning to generate data drivenproducts and solve the most pressing business challenges, please read on.

We are incredibly excited about DataAnalytics and the great potentialfor progress and innovation. We believe that analytics is a key differentiatorin bringing “anytime, anywhere, personalized” services to our customers. We wish to improve our operational processes and create new andinnovative data driven products that go beyond traditional banking, such as theplatform models. Achieving this vision will require us to build andexpand on our analytics effort and organize ourselves around focused valuebuckets with strong coordination capabilities of data, technology, customerjourney, UX, as well as external partnerships.

MSc or PhD with excellent academic results in the field of Mathematics,Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Econometrics or similar.

You will bepart of ING Analytics HUB in Spain. A place where to convert data and analysisinto the best tool to improve the lives of more than 3.9 million customers,helping them grow and achieve a better future.
The INGAnalytics Hub is also an invitation to join our commitment to innovation andtechnology to continue making ING the bank most recommended by its customers(for 10 consecutive years).
This desire toinnovate is also reflected in our way of doing things. We are proud to be oneof the first banks that work with agile methodologies.
However much wedo, we know this is only the beginning. If this is the environment, you thrivein, then apply and join us in changing the future of banking!

title: Data Support Analyst
role-description:
We are growing and need to increase the department Business Assurance. We are looking for our next star, Data Support Analyst in the Internal Audit & Business Assurance function within Finance. 
 There's a lot going on at Tele2, which means there's a lot going on also within the area of revenue assurance. We are building a new in-house team in Sweden as well as increasing the scope from revenue assurance to business assurance. 
 Role Description 
In your role as a Data Support Analyst you will strive towards identifying problems as early as possible to limit revenue and cost leakages and also identify problems with operational processes enabling timely problem solving. Your support work is done by daily data monitoring for early identification of data completeness problems, deviations on RA controls where predefined thresholds are being breached or trends deviating from historical patterns. You will performing root cause investigations to understand reasoning for identified problems using SQL scripting in the investigation work. 
 Your responsibilities 
•   Monitor daily data by reviewing graphs, tables and following up on alarms from assurance tools 
•   Perform root cause investigations based on identified problems 
•   Resolve problems related to missing data, incorrect file loaded into assurance tools 
•   Assign problems to responsible Business Analyst or other system owners involved in the operational processes 
•   Continuously evaluate control effectiveness to improve automation 
  What your background could look like 
•   Strong analytical skills and ability to structure data and information 
•   Fluent in SQL scripting, experience from other types of scripting languages (R, Python) is an advantage 
•   Solid skills in Microsoft Excel (Tables, Pivots, Vlookup) 
•   Fluent in English, both spoken and written 
 Who are you? 
You are keen on details and wanting to deliver results on time. To be successful in this role you need to strive to do things correct the first time, embrace quality thinking! In addition, we are looking for you who are a real team player, willing to share knowledge and experience with colleagues.
 What we will give you 
As an employee at Tele2, you will be working in a creative and flexible environment. You will be a part of a culture where teamwork and inclusion are leading the way forward. Every employee is important for the company’s success and you will always have an impact of your work. 
The position is located in our headquarter in Kista, Stockholm. 
 We want to create an inclusive culture where all forms of diversity are seen. At Tele2 we aim to build an inclusive company in a diverse world and for this position we are happy to see female applicants! 
 Does this sound like a suitable challenge for you? 

You are welcome to submit your application! Selection and interviews are conducted continuously. Please submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Data Analyst (Operations)
role-description:
We’re looking to add a Data Analyst to work alongside our Data Science and Market Research teams to help them deliver insights for our clients about how they can improve their products, or new products that they should consider launching. We are looking for someone who is passionate about turning the raw material of unstructured data into a digestible form to deliver to multiple stakeholders
Data Science, Research and Strategy, and, of course, our top-notch roster of clients. This is a hands-on role that needs strong rational and analytical skills to support data-driven decisions, and the right person will be very comfortable with SQL and Excel, capable with data querying and manipulation and visualisation, and (given it is working with Data Scientists) will have at least basic Python skills (e.g. notebooks) for data exploration and manipulation. Responsibilities Data management and ownership: You'll be processing varied data sources including recoding /transforming data, merging and cleaning, weighting etc. to enable us to deliver exceptional data clarity to our clients. You will need to ‘own’ the data and know it inside-and-out. Cross-functional collaboration: As the primary ‘owner’ of the valuable data we collect, you’ll need to collaborate with multiple teams within Streetbees
Data Science, Research and Strategy, and Community Data visualisation and reporting: You'll be working to structure datasets to facilitate loading into proprietary reporting and visualisation tools, as well as designing the dashboards we deliver to our clients Process improvements: Proactively identifying opportunities to improve efficiencies in these tasks and supporting the implementation of these improvements Requirements Experience and Competencies: You should be comfortable with data querying (relational databases and data lakes using SQL), data interchange (CSV, JSON etc), data analysis (such as Excel and BI tools, maybe even Access), data management and processing using at least simple Python scripts and notebooks (Pandas etc) Strong data, reasoning and analytical skills are essential You will likely have at least 2 years of experience of data management and processing, as well as analysis, in data-driven organisations You will be organised and a keen eye for data quality You will have good communication skills, be comfortable balancing a number of projects at once, and be able to coordinate with multiple stakeholders in several teams The more experience you have with data visualisation the better (but it's not a requirement of the role). Start-up attitude – You’ll be comfortable in a rapidly changing environment, working with limited resources, and delivering high-quality work at the speed which is necessary for successful business growth. You’ll be a self-starter who doesn’t need much guidance, who can think fast on their feet and are ready to pivot when required Benefits At Streetbees, your company benefits will include: A 24-day paid holiday allowance Flexible working hours - we trust people to manage their time and to focus on wider results; so if you need to work from home to finish a project or leave at 5pm on a Tuesday for Choir practice, ensure your manager knows in advance, but feel free to take it. A pension scheme - our new pension scheme means that Streetbees will start paying a percentage of your salary towards your pension. For further details on how this works get in touch with our head of HR for further information. The Streetbees Lifestyle Committee - any employee will have the opportunity to plan and manage a variety of Streetbees funded socials and activities for the team. Socials and day outs can involve anything from rock climbing or bowling to company meals or pub crawls. Wednesday Lunch
We all come together for lunch every Wednesday with a different cuisine each week, paid by the company. Vegetarian and vegan options always provided. Fully Stocked Kitchen
Breakfast is on us every morning and if you need a coffee or a snack at any point throughout the day, please be our guest. Friday Catch-ups
Beers, wine, soft drinks and snacks provided as we celebrate the week's successes and welcome newcomers. Paid volunteering days - one day per quarter with a registered charity of your choice. Audible subscriptions - the company is more than happy to pay for audio-books subscriptions of your choice on Amazon as we encourage wider and continued learning among our team. Free beer in the office Please note we cannot accept applicants from outside the EU due to visa restrictions

title: Data Science Analyst, Corporate Finance
role-description:
Why Deliveroo?

When you first think about Deliveroo, you probably think of getting great food to your house in less than half an hour. Awesome right? But behind the scenes is the real story. This story is one of high growth, huge challenges and an enormous opportunity ahead of us. It began with our founder Will, arriving in London over 5 years ago and finding it almost impossible to order great food, despite the wealth of incredible restaurants in the city. Fast forward 5 years and we operate in 13 countries with over 50,000 riders who deliver orders from 50,000 restaurants in over 200 cities worldwide.

We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you have a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. We are providing people with limitless access to different cuisines and restaurants, turning cooking from a chore to a choice, and giving people the freedom to eat what they want, when they want, where they want it.

We work with riders, restaurants and consumers. We operate one of the most complex three sided marketplaces in the world and we do this in real time. Millions of customers and thousands of restaurants and riders rely on us to match them within milliseconds. The algorithms behind that marketplace are the secret sauce that allow us to deliver our orders in under 30 minutes.

And we're just getting started

The scale of the opportunity ahead of us is immense. The global food market is valued at £7.7 trillion but only 1% of it is currently online. Contrast that with the digital disruption of countless other industries - from banking and travel to retail and communications - it's clear that our journey in the food sector has only just begun.

We are already a multi-billion dollar company that is more than doubling in size every year. Deliveroo came top in the FT's' list of Europe's fastest growing 1000 companies in 2018, and we were the first company ever to win Deloitte's 'UK Top 50' two years in a row. Yet most of the extraordinary value this company will generate lies ahead of us.

About The Department

The Corporate Finance team's mission is to help find and generate capital, help frame capital allocation thinking and, eventually, influence how Deliveroo invests wisely. This includes managing our strategic planning and company budgeting and forecasting processes, capital allocation, board and investor materials, investor relations and future equity fund raising / capital markets interactions.

As a Data Science Analyst in the Corporate Finance team...

You Will
Discover, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets to perform strategic analysis and plan the future of the business
Create new data visualizations to help the organization understand the analytic results
Understand key drivers of the business and provide data driven guidance on key levers
Leverage your commercial experience and knowledge to identify areas of strategic interest and frame approaches to tackle them


You Are
Comfortable with forecasting the future using a wide array of statistical methods and tools
A problem solver with a deeply analytical mindset
Highly commercial with a desire to learn how world class businesses operate and set new standards for excellence
Comfortable operating under uncertainty and tight timelines
A self-starter, equally confident working collaboratively and autonomously


You Will Answer Questions Like
What factors impact the growth of orders?
What does growth of orders look like in the future?
What is the optimum selection and variety of restaurants?
What makes a happy customer?
How does a new competitor's entry into one of our markets affect our growth ambitions?
How can we balance the immediate impact of some marketing channels with long-term brand building activity?
When and how should Deliveroo optimise for growth vs profitability?


You Have
Solid understanding of statistical forecasting methods
Good command of Excel and Powerpoint or equivalents, familiarity with SQL and BI software (ideally Tableau, Looker or similar)
Strong problem solving abilities involving identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing effective solutions
Strong presentation skills and an ability to communicate complex findings to non-technical audiences in a clear, simple way, both written and verbally
Excellent interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to work effectively with business leaders
Strong communication skills both verbal and written


Nice-to-haves
Degree in quantitative field (economics & econometrics, statistics, science)
Experience in strategy consulting, a logistics, e-commerce and/or other customer-obsessed businesses

Life at Deliveroo

We are a small team, with very large impact, seeking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, we're always looking for new ideas and we're very transparent about the decisions we make and why we make them.

There are so many questions we need to answer and plenty more we haven't even encountered. How do data and technology help restaurants to grow as consumer habits change? How can we predict what someone wants to order for dinner long before the idea has even crossed their mind? At Deliveroo these are just some of the tough problems we are solving - and there is no challenge that cannot be yours. No solution is owned by a particular team, which means the scope for growth and personal impact is enormous.

Benefits And Diversity

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. We offer a wide range of competitive benefits in areas including health, family, finance, community, convenience, growth, time away and relocation.

In 2018 we announced our decision to give every employee equity in the company. We did this because we wanted all of our employees, regardless of location, level or role to be owners and because we believe that this is the right thing to do. We believe this helps build a culture where everyone is committed and able to share in the company's success.

We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing start-up's around.

title: Data Analyst - Marketing Intelligence
role-description:
Do you want to join a team of entrepreneurs from over 50 different nationalities? To work in an environment powered by passion where no two days are the same?

At trivago we use the latest innovative technologies to empower our users to find their ideal hotel 100 times a second, across 55 different locales world-wide and in 33 different languages.



Are you passionate about big data? Do you dream of a job that allows you put your analytical skills to the test?


We're searching for talented and enthusiastic analyst to work at the heart of the Marketing Intelligence team on our performance measurement and our attribution model. Working with huge data-sets, you'll draw insightful and actionable conclusions from complex analyses, so teams can optimize their performance.

Do you eat data for breakfast? Then, we want to hear from you!


What you'll do:

Analyze and generate insights into user behavior and marketing campaign performance through data exploration.
Fine tune and improve how we measure marketing performance by evolving our attribution model and diving into how users interact with our product over time and across devices.
End-to-end responsibility for marketing KPIs, from data collection, processing to availability and reporting.
Work in a team of data-hungry analysts, engineers & scientists using state of the art methods and tools.
Strategic analyses as well as regular monitoring of data in order to spot trends, find anomalies and initiate actions based on your findings.
Support and consult colleagues in marketing on data driven decision making and testing.
Setup, calibrate and execute A/B tests with the goal of generating actionable insights for our marketing teams.

What you'll definitely need:

A degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics or another quantitative discipline.
To speak fluent English (our company language).
Proven analytical skills, and experience working in at least one programming language.
A basic knowledge of SQL and a good toolbox of statistical analyses and approaches.

What we'd love you to have:

1-2 years data analysis experience.
Experience working with R or Python.
A basic knowledge of Hadoop.
A basic understanding of the digital marketing ecosystem.

What you can expect from life at trivago:

Growth: We help you grow as trivago grows through support for personal and professional development, constant new challenges, regular peer-feedback, mentorship and world-class training.
Autonomy: Every talent has the ability to make an impact independently by driving topics thanks to our strong entrepreneurial mindset, our horizontal workflow and self-determined working hours.
International environment: Our agile, international culture and environment with talents from 50+ nations encourages mutual trust and creates a safe space to discuss openly and act freely.
Collaborative spaces: Our state-of-the-art campus in Düsseldorf offers interactive spaces where we can easily collaborate, exchange ideas, take a break and workout together.
Relocation: We offer our international talents support with relocation costs, work permit and visa questions, free language classes, flat search and insurance.

Additional information:

trivago N.V. is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users.
To find out more about life at trivago follow us on social media @lifeattrivago.
To learn more about tech at trivago, check out our blog: https://tech.trivago.com/
Want to learn more about trivago's business model to prepare for your interview? Visit https://company.trivago.com/our-product/.

Das Machen Sie Möglich

Sie verwandeln Daten und Zahlen zu aussagekräftigen Informationen in Berichten, Dashboards oder detaillierten Analysen und präsentieren Ihre Ergebnisse in verschiedenen Fachbereichen im Konzern (bspw. Kundenmanagement)

In crossfunktionalen Teams arbeiten Sie als Business Data / Business Intelligence Analyst gemeinsam mit unseren Data Scientists und Fachentscheidern inhaltlich und methodisch an betriebswirtschaftlichen Fragestellungen
Sie analysieren und optimieren interne Geschäftsprozesse als Bindeglied zwischen Fachbereich und IT
In Ihrer Rolle als Business Data / Business Intelligence Analyst unterstützen Sie den Aufbau von neuen Daten- und Berichtsstrukturen mit ihrem Fachwissen

Das Bringen Sie Mit

Sie haben ein Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Statistik oder einen vergleichbaren Studiengang erfolgreich abgeschlossen
Sie konnten bereits erste Erfahrungen mit einer Datenvisualisierungssoftware (z.B. Business Objects oder Microsoft Power BI) sammeln
Idealerweise verfügen Sie als Business Data / Business Intelligence Analyst über erste Erfahrungen mit Projektmanagement-Software (bspw. Jira, Confluence)
Sie bringen ein grundlegendes Verständnis für relationale Datenbanken und Abfragen (SQL) mit
Erste Programmierkenntnisse (z.B. mit R) wären für Ihre Rolle als Business Data/Business Intelligence Analyst von Vorteil
Zu Ihren Eigenschaften zählen Sie eine hohe Auffassungsgabe sowie gute Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfertigkeiten

Das Erleben Sie Bei Uns

Eine intensive Einarbeitung, insbesondere für Berufsanfänger, ist für uns selbstverständlich

Wohlfühlatmosphäre durch Duz-Kultur und lockerem Dresscode

Kollegiales Miteinander sowie Team- und Firmenevents

Attraktives Mitarbeiterfahrzeugmodell als Rundum-sorglos-Paket inklusive Wartung, Versicherung, Steuern und Tanken

Zuschuss zu einem Mobilfunktarif

Flexible Arbeitszeiten

EINE GRUPPE. ALLE MÖGLICHKEITEN.

Bewerben Sie sich vorzugsweise online oder senden Sie Ihre vollständige Bewerbung mit Angabe der Anzeigenquelle und Ihres Gehaltswunsches an: mobilcom-debitel GmbH o Ein Unternehmen der freenet Group o Volker Pabst o Hollerstraße 126 o 24782 Büdelsdorf

title: Analyst - Consumer Data
role-description:
Apply Now

Qualifications
Master’s degree from reputed institutes, preferably in Economics, Business, Technology, Manufacturing
Experience in an analytical role would be an asset
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, ability to work effectively in a team and proactive attitude
Proficiency in MS Excel, proficiency in programming skill in SQL and at least 1 of the following language R, Python, Scala
Applied practical experience in data mining techniques and modeling of real problem with copious amounts of data (emphasis in machine learning is desired)
Experience with data visualization tolls as Tableau or Power BI
Knowledge of distributed computing or NoSQL technologies is a bonus
Who You'll Work With

You’ll work in Wroclaw, Poland as part of Consumer Operations Benchmarking Initiative (COBI) team.

COBI is a growing global service line in Retail Consumer & Packaged Goods practice. This is a suite of services to improve operational performance by building on unique intra- and cross-company benchmarking and diagnostics, as well as on McKinsey’s long-standing expertise in operations. The team collects and analyses data from multiple clients’ manufacturing and supply chain operations develop and presents reports to senior operations managers and are involved in the service line growth and innovation.
What You'll Do

You will help various client teams to shape critical business decisions for our clients.

In this role you will perform benchmarking analysis and reporting, as well as maintain a database. Additionally, you will enhance COBI digital application and support other initiatives to strengthen and broaden COBI value proposition. You will be involved in client engagements by participating in problem-solving sessions and discussions to explain COBI methodology. The balance of your time (~20%) is expected to be committed to other analytical and data visualization projects across our Consumer world.

You will also have the opportunity to work alongside senior knowledge professionals and experts on larger client projects and internal knowledge initiatives.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
As a Data Analyst, you will be part of a very fast growing Data team and one of the first data analyst in our data team in Amsterdam. You will be working with a variety of stakeholders across the whole organisation. The ideal candidate will be extremely curious, have a strong background in statistics and be obsessed with results.

Responsibilities
Support and advise the business with ad-hoc analytics as well as applying statistical techniques to create insights and discover new business opportunities
Enable and support the business regarding the development and use of data analysis and reporting by: building reporting-grade data sources in our BI environment and translating those data sources into meaningful dashboards and reports for easy business use
Provide business expertise and guidance (consultative partnership) on how to apply leverage data analytics and reporting within business operations
Create and deliver documentation and training on reporting and BI tools for business users to enable self-service on company data


Qualifications
PhD or Masters in mathematics, statistics, computer science, information science, or related technical field
3+ years of work experience in Data Analysis
Experienced in SQL
Experienced in BI tooling like Tableau, Looker, etc
Demonstrated ability to translate business information needs into technical requirements and functional code/reporting
Demonstrated knowledge of standard statistical techniques like significance testing, regression modeling, etc
Familiar with commonly used data technical tools like:
R, Python
Git
Excellent communication, relationship skills and a strong team player.


About TripActions

TripActions is the fastest-growing global business travel platform loved by the world's most innovative companies. We are an end-to-end travel platform making business travel as easy and delightful as possible for road warriors. With 97% traveler satisfaction, learn more about why innovative customers across various industries, including Dropbox, Lyft, Sara Lee Frozen Bakery, Stella & Dot and the ACLU trust TripActions to support their business travel at tripactions.com .

Our Benefits

We realize benefits are important as they support keeping you at your best at all times. Our benefits are here for you if you get sick or hurt, help you save for now and later, encourage you to take time off work and travel, and provide perks specific to being a TripActions employee both in and out of the office.

Equal Opportunity

TripActions is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is integral to TripActions success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, or any other basis protected by law.

If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, you are welcome to email us at [email protected] .

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
role-description:
Like the thought of playing around with data? If you have an idea in mind - you can do it here!

If you want to implement your own data ideas and strategies within a state-of-the art data environment - this might  just be the perfect role for you.

With your background in data engineering or cloud based data warehousing (DWH) and your love for tech & sports, you will get the chance to bring data solutions to life; providing DAZN with valuable insights. As DAZN is a truly data driven environment, the Business Intelligence team is at the heart of every decision made within the business. Meaning, on a frequent basis you will be liaising with senior stakeholders around the world and make suggestions as to our next moves.

To give you an idea what we mean with a state-of-the-art data environment: We operate with a Snowflake Data Warehouse, using Dataiku DSS as an ETL tool to clean, enrich and prepare data to then be surfaced to the business via Tableau and Looker.

How will you stand out to us?
New ideas for DAZN
Expert in SQL and DWL

... the rest we can teach you with your hunger to make an impact.
  Benefits include 25 days’ annual leave (increasing by 3 days after 3 years), private medical insurance, life Assurance, pension contributions up to 5%, access to learning portal, training and development and more.

HERE’S A BREAKDOWN OF WHAT YOU’LL DO (NOT ALL OF IT, JUST THE MOST IMPORTANT STUFF)
Wrangling data using our ETL tool Dataiku DSS (a collaborative data science software platform) and SQL to build stable data sets
Developing Tableau and Looker environments to support the business with their decision making
Automating dashboards and reports
Working with different functions to develop KPIs and integrate them into our work stream and being a focal point for data within DAZN
Support the production of corporate reports that are essential for our executives in executing critical business decisions

DO YOU HAVE THESE ESSENTIALS?
First couple of years' experience working with data - as an analyst, engineer or as a consultant
Strong experience in data transformation/ data wrangling using SQL and ETL tools such Alteryx, DSS or SSIS and cloud based DWHs
Desire to test the status quo and to innovate

NOT ESSENTIAL BUT GREAT IF YOU ALSO HAVE
A strong interest in sports or technology
Enjoy working within an agile and fast paced environment

title: Analytics Data Analyst
role-description:
Investec are looking for an Analytics Analyst to join our Corporate Banking, Asset Finance and Leasing team. We are looking for a candidate who is able to use statistical analyses and business skills to drive value for the business

Have you got experience using R, Excel, SQL on a regular basis?

What You Will Be Doing
Working with ongoing maintenance and development of AFG models including IFRS9
Assist in developing the understanding and capabilities of the wider business team members, and liaise with Investec Group functions when opportunities present themselves
Contribute to the design of best-in-class analytical and contract management systems
Regular presenter at team technical and portfolio review meetings
Work with the team to identify business needs for new models / frameworks / calculators and their design
Acquire a deep understanding of Asset Finance deals from a risk measurement and strategy perspective
Assist with business demand for management information when required

What We Look For
Educated to degree level in mathematics or statistics (or a combination with economics/finance) or relevant working experience.
Understands the tenets of financial services and the main risk metrics used in banking: PD, LGD, etc.
Proficient in organising large datasets and understands how to write and apply SQL
Proficient in use of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and good working knowledge of Excel VBA and Pivot Tables
Logical and organised, with a keen eye for detail
Research shows that some candidates – particularly female candidates – can be reluctant to apply to a role unless they meet all the criteria. We pride ourselves on our entrepreneurial spirit here and welcome you to do the same – if the role excites you, please don't let our person specification hold you back. Get in touch!

title: Business / Data Analyst
role-description:
Our client, a global services company, require the services of a proficient excel user to help turn data into information and create compelling stories and presentations.

The Role

The position requires an analytical thinker who is comfortable working with large data sets and has the ability to translate that data into a story. The position requires an advanced level of skill with Microsoft Excel and a working knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint. The analyst will also be given the opportunity to learn how to create executive-level dynamic dashboards using PRO's BI tool. This role may also be expected to attend presentations and speak to the work that they perform.

Apply critical thinking and advanced Microsoft Excel knowledge to provide analytical support for client requests
Identify trends in large datasets that will enable the client to adjust strategic direction
Create detail-oriented presentations designed to inform client management of quarterly achievements of their contingent labor program
Create data visualizations that enable the reader to quickly reach actionable conclusions
Perform research to identify trends, interpret legislative news, and create market rate recommendations
Work with internal and external customers to deliver on-target, value-added solutions and results to complex and strategic challenges
Identify areas for process improvement, both strategic and tactical
Build relationships with key client personnel
Work independently in detail-oriented environment

The Person

The client is flexible on the background and previous roles that you will of come from but there is a preference for finance / financial analysis / consultancy background.

Essential elements are Excel Proficiency including Vlookups, IF Statements and Pivot Tables - a test will have to be passed before an interview is extended.

IN addition you will have to be comfortable presenting to clients and demonstrate confidence / experience in this area.

You will be required in the London office 2 days a week and have the chance to work remotely for 3 days a week.

Morgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Please note that any references to salary or pay rates in this advertisement and in the salary refinement section are indicative only and should only be used as a guide.
