title: Data Analytics
role-description:
About The Role

Role Title: Data Analytics (Energy)Reporting to: Market Modelling and Analysis ManagerLocation: London/Solihull (can be based out of either location, however travel will be required to both sites)

The Market Fundamentals Analyst is an expert in GB and EU energy markets. The role holder has responsibility for performing model runs to support projects, providing analysis and market intelligence.

The role has two key responsibilities
delivering high quality analysis that can help shape long term market views, Business Development projects, strategic decision making and risk appraisals, based on extensive market knowledge, understanding and modelling outputs.
developing our data architecture and delivering high quality data analytics solutions to the Market Fundamentals team – enabling the team to make robust informed decisions.

As part of a matrix team the role holder will be responsible for delivering in-depth insights, market knowledge, country data, key assumptions around specified countries and topics and sharing this knowledge across the business. The role involves working closely with colleagues within the US Market Fundamental team to ensure a high quality and integrated approach to common issues and themes.

The role holder will be responsible for managing internal and external relationships relevant to the area of expertise.

Key Accountabilities
Provide market modelling and market analysis to Business.
Manage, maintain and continuously improve Market Fundamentals in-house market models (such as PLEXOS), ensuring they are fit for purpose, fully documented, calibrated and verified. Articulate and explain market model inputs/outputs to internal and external stakeholders.
Inspecting, cleansing and transforming data to provide in-depth analysis to support short term balancing and trading as well as longer term strategic decision making.
Updating and expanding a wide range of big datasets, improving our data architecture and structure, capturing data and interpreting data trends.
Implementation of data analytics techniques to improve the data analysis capability within Market Fundamentals. Using these techniques identify and quantify new risks and opportunities to National Grid.
Managing the development of a platform to deliver market analytics and data analysis from the Market Fundamentals team to key stakeholders.
Lead Market Fundamentals on improving ways of handling, storing and using data
Deliver in-depth insights, market knowledge, country data, key assumptions around specified countries and topics and share this knowledge across the business.
Data extraction and analysis to improve methodologies and find new sources of data to enable in-depth analysis across the team as well as sharing best practise.
Collaborate within the Market Fundamentals team to monitor energy markets, carry out peer reviews and widely share market intelligence and analysis of critical changes in the markets.
Mentor, support and develop other Market Fundamentals team members to ensure an enduring analysis/modelling capability is created/maintained within the team.
Establish and grow strong industry networks to enhance understanding of key market drivers and developments. Represent the company at external events and conferences.
About You

You will have a wide breadth of knowledge of GB and EU electricity industry structures and power market fundamentals and recent trends. You will understand related markets (gas, coal, carbon, oil, macro-economics) and their impacts on power markets. Experience in developing and employing market and/or financial models is required. PLEXOS market modelling capability and familiarity with stochastic and linear programming methods would be advantageous. The ideal candidate will have advanced knowledge of excel and experience of data analytics techniques and knowhow in collecting, structuring and interpreting large datasets. You will have great experience in managing relationships with internal & external stakeholders/project partners. Experienced of web scraping and APIs, and developing models in tools such as Python, R, VBA. Coding background and experience with data visualisation (i.e. Power-BI, Tableau) would be advantageous. Ideally you will understand interconnector business models and sources of revenue.

Qualifications & Skills Required
Degree level qualification in a relevant discipline and high level of quantitative and analytical skills, and experience; comfortable with interpreting large datasets and working with complex models and tools.
Strong planning and organisational skills, ability to simultaneously manage and prioritise multiple issues.
Ability to translate model outputs into business insight and articulate impact on investment cases.
Agile and collaborative working style.
Self-motivated, entrepreneurial and responsible individual with the ability to perform well under pressure and peaks in work load.
Excellent communication skills both written and oral.
Excellent inter-personal skills and ability to influence others, work collaboratively and constructively with project partners, external stakeholders and internal teams to achieve consensus and positive outcomes.
About Us

National Grid touches the lives of almost everyone in the UK, with an energy network that stretches across the Atlantic. We’re an international team, and our work underpins the lives of millions of people. Feet forwards, head up, and eyes bright, we’re working hard to create value for people today – and shape the future of energy tomorrow.

In the UK, we don’t generate or sell energy – we join the dots to get energy from A to B. From making a cup of tea in the morning, to keeping the lights on in hospitals, our electricity network puts power in the hands of people. Without it, the world as we know it would grind to a halt.

The world of energy is changing beyond recognition. Working at National Grid, you won’t just be touching the lives of almost everyone in the UK – you’ll be shaping the way we use and consume energy for generations to come.

Our values and principles

At National Grid, through listening to what our customers need, every day we do the right thing and find a better way.

As a National Grid employee, you’ll treat our customers as a priority, taking time to listen and work with them to help give them the best experience we possibly can. You’ll need to be proactive and flexible in your approach and continually look for ways to exceed their expectations – sometimes in unexpected and helpful ways. You’ll provide accessible information when our customers need it and make things simple by using your expertise to guide them. Above all, you’ll follow through on your promises to deliver value, drive efficiency and give them a great customer experience.

We offer inclusion and diversity training for everyone here at National Grid, with a view to building an inclusive working environment and developing all our employees. Training opportunities range from unconscious bias and reverse mentoring to targeted training initiatives which are tailored to support our diverse and innovative work force.

What You'll Get

A competitive salary between £35,000 - £59,000 – dependent on capability.As well as your base salary, you will receive a bonus based on personal and company performance and a competitive contributory pension scheme where we will double match your contribution to a maximum company contribution of 12%. You will also have access to a number of flexible benefits such as a share incentive plan, salary sacrifice car and technology schemes, support via employee assistance lines and matched charity giving to name a few.

More Information

This role is due to close on 18th October 2019. However, we encourage candidates to submit their applications as early as possible and not to wait until the published closing date. National Grid’s recruitment periods can and may vary. We reserve the right to remove this advert or close it to further applications at any point during the recruitment process.

title: BI & Product Data Analyst
role-description:
We’re Sky, Europe’s biggest entertainment brand. Think top-quality shows. Breaking news. Innovative tech. Must-have products. Careers here mean the freedom and support you need to make an impact – pushing boundaries, creating solutions, hitting targets. And as part of our close-knit team, you’ll enjoy plenty of benefits. Plus, experiences you’ll only find at Sky.

This role is an exciting opportunity to join us and work within our Data Technology and Analytics (DTA) Team.

The perks

Sky Q, a generous pension and private health care. Access to over 12,000 LinkedIn Learning courses to support your development. And if that’s not enough, our award-winning Osterley campus boasts six subsidised restaurants, a cinema, gym, and much more.

To find out more about working with us, search #LifeatSky on LinkedIn, Twitter or Instagram.

You Will

As a BI & Product Data Analyst, you will be focusing on delivering Core Reporting, Self-serve and Data Products to the business. You will be involved in the use of data and Insights to drive value for the business. You are responsible for delivering against the project approach.
Suggest and design innovative solutions for data insight utilising tools such as Business Objects, Tableau, SQL and GCP.
Gather, manipulate, analyse and document raw, complex data and share data stories that make sense to business and technical audiences
Partner with data product management teams to provide the most accurate and relevant information to help drive meaningful business decisions and feature definition
Continually design, test, and deploy new reports and self-serve solutions - all with the goal of providing a state-of-the-art reporting environment
Respond to ad-hoc analysis needs while ensuring data accuracy and integrity
Develop and define self-serve products.
Understand and abide by data protection rules
You’ll Have
Stakeholder Management experience and proven track record of having established successful business relationships with.
Excellent commercial skills - understand the use of solutions that are requested by the business and help shape the solution to meet commercial needs.
Data Product Management and Insight Experience - have deep and extensive experience in managing end-to-end Data Products, Self-Serve, Reporting and Insights roadmaps.
Experience working in a dynamic environment in an innovative and creative area. Able to deliver big picture benefits and make careful and swift prioritisation calls.
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written. both verbal and written.
High levels of logical thinking & problem-solving skills. Able to deal with complex problems using innovative and industry leading techniques.
Have a good understanding and experience of the ‘art of the possible’ from a data and analytics perspective
Have a good understanding of the tools and technologies, processes and procedures that bring data ‘to life’
A good understanding of the Media and Broadcasting world.
So, what are you waiting for? Apply now for a chance to forge your own career path and be brilliant as part of a bright, talented team.

Just so you know: if your application is successful, your appointment will be subject to receiving a positive outcome from your criminal record check.

We’re happy to discuss flexible working.

It’s our people that make Sky Europe’s leading entertainment company. That’s why we work hard to be an inclusive employer, so everyone at Sky can be their best.

title: Data Insight Analyst
role-description: Job Description Data Insight Analyst - Digital Market Disrupter Birmingham - £40,000-50,000 Our client are a market disrupter who are changing their market in a big way. We're recruiting a Data Insight Analyst for them that will be at the forefront of BI evangelism, upskilling the business in use of data and how it can help make better informed decisions. This is a new position where you will be working closely with senior stakeholders from around the digital function to build and implement data solutions to provide deeper analysis and valuable insights to unlock opportunities and drive informed business decisions. Day yo day you will use the data to communicate key insights through internal reports, presentations and dashboards. You will be proactive in finding different sources to analyse data, contribute to the design, implementation and delivery of a digital Business Intelligence strategy supporting the product and design functions and design team in general. The successful candidate should have excellent SQL knowledge and be able to work with a range of Microsoft tools. You'll be working in a relaxed modern offices: think sofas, bean bags, standing desks and will be rewarded with a generous benefits package including 25 days holiday, pension scheme, discounted gym membership, Training and Development opportunities, plus many more. title: CIB - Operations Transformation - Data Services Analyst/ Associate - London
role-description:
CIB - Transformation Group – Data Services Analyst/ Associate - London

Department Description

The CIB Operations Transformation Group is a strategic, organization-wide team focused on enhancing controls, accelerating capabilities for the CIB, improving the client experience, and enabling ways to commercialize the firm’s assets. It looks to leverage existing innovative activities to improve efficiency, scalability and operational leverage across CIB Operations by executing a co-ordinated, cross-LOB strategy through implementation pf programs that achieve large scale change. The group is organized under eight pillars:

Digital Tools 2) Client Experience 3) Content & Data Services 4) Core Post-Trade Processing 5) Firmwide Collateral 6) Resilience and Controls 7) Real Estate Strategy and 8) Cross Product Change Services

Team Background

The Data Services team sits within the Content & Data Services pillar of the CIB Operations Transformation Group and drives a portfolio of programs focused on centralizing and streamlining the process of sourcing data required across the CIB. The CIB Strategic Reference Data program, in partnership with the Firm-wide Data Management (FDM), is one such program that is a current focus for the team. The ~$300M, multi-year program is expected to deliver significant operating leverage through high quality reference data about our clients, products/instruments, and other core data sets which can be easily integrated into all front-to-back processes from client onboarding through to risk management. The Data Services team is accountable to work with cross-functional teams based in Corporate, CIB Operations, CIB Technology, and CIB Data Analytics to drive various sub-streams of the program to ensure success. Other high impact initiatives with significant firmwide impact that the team is working on include defining and driving the Wholesale KYC/ Onboarding Data Strategy (in close partnership with the Client Experience pillar within CIB Ops Transformation) and the CIB Taxonomy Optimization initiative (in close partnership with the Resilience and Control pillar)

Key Roles And Responsibilities

We are seeking an analyst/ associate to join this team based in London, to be an active member and valuable contributor across one or more of the initiatives the team is working on. The role provides a great opportunity to interact and partner with cross functional team across the firm, build out a well-rounded set of skills, and frequent exposure to Senior Management (Pinto DR-2), Key activities include:
Cross organizational transformation process re-engineering reviews
Simplification of operating models, and standardizing or consolidating key activities
Strategy development and formulation of business hypotheses
Leveraging emerging technologies to solve complex business problems
Migration and testing planning and co-ordination
Partnering with representatives from across the organization including Business, Finance, Operations and Technology groups, as well as potentially working with external partners

Required Skills And Qualifications
Logical, structured approach to planning, problem solving, and decision-making
Project management and reporting
Prior experience in strategy consulting, financial service, operations or technology environment is highly preferred. Knowledge of operational functions across the Banking, Markets, or Post-trade is a major plus.
Expertise in data analysis and manipulation
Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint is a must; familiarity with additional database and analytical tools (e.g., Alteryx, QlikView, Tableau, etc.) is a plus
Ability to work under pressure and to fixed deadlines
Self-starter with ability to manage own workload and deliverables
Strong influencing skills and able to partner with internal and external stakeholders
Ability to communicate clearly and confidently across multiple aspects of the organization and Senior Management/ stakeholders

About J.P. Morgan’s Corporate & Investment Bank

J.P. Morgan’s Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across banking, markets and investor services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. With $18 trillion of assets under custody and $393 billion in deposits, the Corporate & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world. Further information about J.P. Morgan is available at www.jpmorgan.com.

JPMorgan Chase & Co. offers an exceptional benefits program and a highly competitive compensation package. JPMorgan Chase & Co. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a member of the UK Government’s Disability Confident Scheme.

title: Senior Business & Data Analyst
role-description:
ManoMano ? Nous sommes une startup Française créée en 2013 à l’initiative de Philippe de Chanville et Christian Raisson, puis développée dans 6 pays (France, Belgique, Italie, Espagne, UK et Allemagne).

Après six ans d'existence sur le marché, et une levée de fonds de 110 millions d’euros en avril 2019, nous avons triplé nos effectifs cette année, et nous sommes désormais 400 Manas & Manos, alors pourquoi pas toi ?

Nous souhaitons révolutionner l'expérience du bricolage, en proposant à nos clients des idées, des conseils, des produits et des services innovants à portée de clic !

Nous proposons plus de 4 millions de produits sur notre site et travaillons avec 2000 marchands.

En 2016 nous avons reçu l’IMC Awards Or de la catégorie Site E-commerce ainsi que le Prix digital de l’innovation EBG, sans oublier le programme VIP Google Scale-Up (top 10 Start-Up Françaises). Récemment nommée “la future licorne française” par le magazine Forbes, nous recherchons de futurs talents audacieux et ingénieux pour participer à cette success story !

Rejoindre ManoMano, c’est rejoindre une magnifique scale-up Européenne prometteuse. Nous révolutionnons le monde du DIY et nous innovons sans cesse pour faire face à des challenges passionnants.

Notre ambition est de faire grandir nos équipes professionnellement au sein d’un environnement de travail épanouissant, pour que chacun construise son monde à sa façon à travers nos valeurs que sont : l'ingéniosité, l'audace, la bienveillance ; tout en étant agile, orienté tech & data et animé par une flamme entrepreneuriale.

Tu travailleras avec des personnes bienveillantes, talentueuses et dynamiques, qui cherchent à faire progresser chacun des membres de leur équipe !

Nous n’attendons plus que toi pour continuer cette belle aventure où notre plus grand challenge sera de nous challenger !

Inside the ‘growth & data’ team, the Business & data analytics team is transversal to the company, tackling issues for the different teams ranging from sourcing (recommendations), operations (forecasts), product (web analytics)... Senior data analysts will work hand-by-hand with those teams, not acting as support but bringing actionable recommendations.

If you love managing cross-functional stakeholders, pushing projects forward to deliver measurable and strategically meaningful results, and solving problems from both 30,000 feet as well as deep in the details, this is the role for you.

Your Main Tasks Will Include

Understand, explain & optimize ManoMano’s business performances
Become expert for one or more of the departments (sourcing, operations, product, acquisition & retention…) and act as a subject Matter Expert
Develop & automate analysis to understand the business performances based on web analytics tools , Tableau / Excel / SQL (more details can be given in the interviews)
Pro-actively detect issues and identify their root cause
Identify and size drivers of growth (optimization & pain points resolution), autonomously provide recommendations
Act as the ‘data point of entry’ for the different teams
Identify, define & prioritize needs for data products/ optimizations/ analysis
Monitor & drive the delivery of these data projects (data engineering, data science, data analytics…)
Deep dive ad’hoc business problems/ analytics requests for different teams
Tackle ad’hoc business topics autonomously, managing the ‘analytical loop’ and deriving recommendations to the CODIR
Ensure the best data appropriation & use by teams
Democratize data (trainings, dissemination & usage of tools)
Guarantee that analytical methodologies are correctly applied

This position requires to combine a strong analytical mindset, a business acumen and advanced analytical capabilities (SQL is a must-have, Python nice-to-have).

→ Your job will have a considerable impact on ManoMano’s growth

PROFIL RECHERCHÉ
Business and / or analytics background,
bac + 5 or equivalent
3-4 years experience in an analytical position (Consultant, Analyst…)
A passion for data analysis, data visualization & optimization
A strong analytical & detail-oriented mindset
Full autonomy in problem solving
The ability to synthesize and explain your analyses
A creative mindset to identify solutions & shortcuts
The capacity to design automated tools
Mastering (or willingness to master) SQL
eCommerce experience is a plus as well as coding in Python
What ManoMano offers you
A start-up environment made in France in hyper growth
Autonomy with a wide field of action
Agile & international environment with bright and friendly colleagues
Telework possible one day / week
Friday Labs to learn about diverse and exciting subjects
Sponsorship of MM at Talks & Conferences
A pleasant setting in Paris in more than 3,000 m² (a gym, a terrace, a music room)
Historical games of foosball and ping-pong, video games
Restaurant card, mutual, transportation, 7 weeks vacation / year
PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT
1 phone interview
1 interview with the talent recruiter + the hiring manager
1 interview with the a team member + another team member
Technical Test at home

title: Data Analyst (SQL Python)
role-description:
At Elliptic, we believe cryptocurrency will play a huge role in the future of value transfer, and we care deeply about helping to build this future. In order for cryptocurrency to flourish, it’s important to prevent criminal abuse of the technology. Elliptic is the global leader in detecting, preventing, and pursuing criminal activity in cryptocurrencies. Our clients include the world’s leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies.

Our unique platform gives us an unparalleled understanding of cryptocurrency capital flows, using a combination of network science and machine learning to aggregate and interpret vast quantities of transaction data. We provide anti-money laundering (AML) compliance software and investigative services to the leading participants in the cryptocurrency ecosystem. Customers rely on us to analyse more than $150bn of their transactions every month, and include cryptocurrency businesses, major financial institutions, and federal government agencies.

The company has offices in London, NYC, Singapore & Tokyo. We are backed by SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group.

What's the role?

The quality of our data is at the heart of our business. This Data Analyst role is truly cross functional, supporting our Professional Services, Community and Data teams, through the identification and reporting of crypto and blockchain industry trends and activity, as well as producing accurate and insightful analysis with our internal data to improve our understanding of the business and shape the future of Elliptic.

The Data Analyst’s role is to discover value across all of our internal data assets, as well as integrating various third party data sources. The analyst will need to distil these data sources into easy to read dashboards and reports to be used both internally and for our clients. Ultimately, we are looking for someone who is used to working with unstructured large data sets and turning them into valuable insight, resulting in clear directions and actions rather than just producing charts and dashboards.

What You'll Do
Compile data from disparate systems to develop dashboards and reports for both internal Elliptic users, and Elliptic clients
Collect requirements from stakeholders across the business to improve internal and external reporting
Prioritise and schedule incoming data requests from various areas of the business
Understand the complex relationships of our data and maintain consistency of our reporting across various systems and currencies
Perform data quality reviews and communicate with data owners on any issues and work with them to request and implement change to promote more efficient analysis efforts
Work with the data team to gather data across systems, understanding changes, and troubleshooting errors that may arise
Take the initiative to look for areas to improve reporting and adjust reports as decisions change and priorities shift
Use datasets and queries to generate, maintain, and disseminate both routine and ad hoc reporting


Requirements
4+ years of work experience in a related field
Relevant experience with SQL and Python for data analysis
Good understanding of data management best practices and able to demonstrate an understanding of data process automation, ETL and databases.
Comfortable with quantitative data analysis and basic statistical analysis
Experience using data visualisation tools, such as Tableau, Power BI or Sisense
Excellent working knowledge of spreadsheets and BI tools
Ability to multitask in a fast fast environment while still operating with a high level of attention to detail
Knowledge and understanding of various data feeds and how to access them
Ability to express complex technical and non-technical concepts verbally, graphically, and in writing
Experience with managing large, unstructured datasets


Benefits
Competitive salary
Share options
Private Vitality health insurance & wellness incentive programmes
Work pension scheme
Shiny laptop and multiple monitors
Budget for training materials, events, and conferences
Collaborative, flexible and friendly environment with options for remote working
Quarterly full day offsites
Annual company 3 day offsite
Coffee and beer!
Being part of a business with a purpose, and the opportunity to work with a passionate team of mission-driven people who’ll stretch and challenge you

Elliptic is not a traditional financial services firm. We pride ourselves on having a laid-back and friendly ethos, while still expecting great things from our team. Fascinating work is the norm - working at Elliptic is never boring!
Being a self-starter and a self-directed team player who is well-versed the domains of agile processes and continuous improvement
Being willing to roll up your sleeves sometimes to help the team
Maintain reporting process documentation and train the data team on reporting and analysis functions

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Overview

Join Supersolid’s data analytics team, and take a key role in the continued growth of our live games and the successful launches of new games. With your analysis, our teams (product, marketing, art, engineering etc.) will make better informed decisions. We also continually re-evaluate our analytics stack, aiming to have an industry-leading approach. This is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact on a highly respected and fast-growing mobile games studio.
You will be working especially closely with senior management, data analysts, product managers, and the marketing team. You will help develop regular reports but also help lead deeper explorative analyses to directly shape the future direction of our games. The ability to clearly articulate hypotheses, run complex SQL queries to mine the wealth of data we collect, and present findings and suggestions is also critical to the role. You will be expected to be proactive in contributing data-backed recommendations for our gaming titles.

Responsibilities
Writing and maintaining SQL queries and SQL-driven dashboards
Delivering accurate, insightful and actionable analysis to the rest of the company, including Product Managers and Performance Marketers
Creating self-conducted deep-dive reports, mining available behavioral data to spot barriers to and opportunities for improved performance
Assisting in designing and assessing the results of split testing experiments conducted in our games

Requirements
Strong experience in creating SQL queries
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (R, Python, SPSS or SAS) is highly desired
Experience with designing and setting up dashboards in BI tools is a plus
Advanced MS Excel skills
Some interest in Mobile Games
Apply

If you are interested in joining Supersolid, please email us below!

Please note that you need to be entitled to work in the UK. If you are not sure about your eligibility, please find out more information about working in the UK from GOV.UK.

title: Global Data Analyst
role-description:
Reports to:  Senior Manager, Data Management
Location:   Remote-based in the United Kingdom

*Candidates must attach a cover letter and their CV to be considered for this position* 

Position Description:
The Global Data Analyst candidate will work as part of the Radius Travel Data Management team. This team is responsible for acquiring and preparing high quality global travel and meetings and events data from business and industry partners. This role within the team will be responsible for working with partner agencies, clients, technology partners, and internal stakeholders to capture data collection and reporting requirements, evaluate data and provide accurate and meaningful feedback, design and implement reports using Microsoft Excel, PowerBI, Microstrategy or other Business Intelligence tools, and to work with the IT team to design, implement, and support the technology tools used to acquire, process, evaluate, and report data within the Radius Travel infrastructure. The Global Data Analyst may also be required to provide helpdesk support for data related issues for internal and external clients. A successful Global Data Analyst will gain a deep understanding of travel management company operations and technical concepts.
 Key Responsibilities:
Work with minimal supervision, independently and with teams, in a dynamic environment to provide quality results in a timely manner.
Summarize, analyse, and prepare reports and findings using required tools such as MS Excel, SQL, PowerBI or Microstrategy Desktop.
Participate in data load activities including data cleansing and quality evaluation and improvements.
Perform quality review of own work and the work of others in a verifiable and methodical manner, and create monthly audit reports for all clients’ import and export data.
Design and conduct qualitative and quantitative analyses at the direction of team leads, as well as assist in resolving data quality issues from identification to resolution.
Support data governance activities including the collection and maintenance of metadata, analysis of governance effort outcomes, and taking proactive action to drive improvements within the company for internal and external customers.
Participate in the creation of procedural documentation and process diagrams as they relate to the data load process.
Create and maintain documentation related to new and legacy applications supporting the data load process.
Work with IS/IT team on the creation and/or modification of automated data analysis modules and processes.
Perform data auditing function to track data compliance, issue identification and resolution.
Understand the underlying data flow through the travel process beginning with the Agencies through the Radius databases into the reporting systems for assigned Corporate Accounts.
 Required Skills/Qualifications:  
Bachelor’s or equivalent degree (Computer/Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics or other related degrees)
Must possess professional experience in data warehousing/business intelligence and/or the airline/travel industry
Experience with using advanced queries and complex functions in SQL and Microsoft Excel.
Exceptional attention to detail and ability to proactively identify and improve inefficient processes
Desire to quickly meet clients’ reporting needs and exceed customer service expectations
Knowledge of process management & analysis, and ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize changing work loads in a a fast-paced global environment
Ability to work cross organizationally in resolving data issues and building processes to enhance data quality
Knowledge of efficient data management and reporting practices
Demonstrated expertise manipulating and interpreting large datasets
Excellent team, communication, and time management skills are essential

Preferred Skills/Qualifications:
Knowledge of Travel or Airline data and/or Global Distribution Systems (GDS) is preferred.
Experience with structured programming such as C#, Python, and with common frameworks such as .NET.
Knowledge of and experience with R or other similar data analysis platform.
Bilingual capability preferred.

title: Data Analyst, Marketing - EMEA
role-description:
About Uber

At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.

About The Role

We're looking for a data analyst to join our Marketing Analytics team to provide data expertise as we drive the growth, retention, engagement, and brand affinity of the riders and drivers on the Uber platform. In the role you'll be part of and work closely with a cross-functional team consisting of strategy, design, development, and program managers.

You possess a passion for improving techniques, processes, tracking, analytical insights and technology used by marketing to achieve our bold goals. You will help address the complex challenges of experiment design, marketing effectiveness, contact strategy, return on investment, driver and rider behavior and channel effectiveness using state of the art machine learning models.

As a member of marketing analytics, you will not only be able to work with data, but also help define the way marketing performance is calibrated and what questions should be asked. You'll play a big part in finding opportunity fields to help the marketing function scale as we develop onboarding, engagement and retention strategies. You will also learn and apply advanced analytics skills like experimental design, machine learning, statistical modeling, and more.

What You’ll Do
Mine data and analytics at the customer level to gain a better understanding of their usage behaviors, including impacts of current marketing strategies.
Work closely with the paid and CRM marketing teams, responsible for campaign pre and post analysis, cohorting, experiment design, segmentation, KPI measurement and more. Collaborate on project planning/prioritization meetings, stakeholder meeting, data prioritization meeting, etc.
Choose the proper metrics for tracking and understanding current and future experiments.
Develop dashboards that provide reliable insights and visualization into rider and channel performance relative to KPIs, projections, and historical performance.
Implement and analyze A/B or Multivariate Tests to provide actionable insights to the marketing team on the test data.
Present findings to senior management to drive business and marketing decisions.
Use tools such as Google Sheet, Tableau and many internal tools to work efficiently at scale.

What You’ll Need
BS/MS in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Economics, Statistics, or equivalent experience.
At least 2 years of analytical and database experience. Marketing analytics or consulting experience is a plus.
Excellent programming skills in SQL and Python. R is a plus.
Proficiency with multiple analytical and database tools (e.g Jupyter notebooks, Hive, Presto, Vertica, Tableau)
Excellent data visualization skills. Experience creating dashboard reporting in Tableau or a similar visualization tool a plus.
Speed, resourcefulness and a go-getter attitude. Moving quickly and executing to allow for continual iteration is a core qualification of our team.
Someone who is willing to contribute new ideas and articulate them to a variety of stakeholders and not just execute on existing ones
A commitment to learning - We want someone who seeks to deliver impact, but also invests in themselves and others. We don’t get better by standing still, so you will need to consistently seek to innovate and raise the bar
A love of data - you just go get the data you need and turn it into an insightful story. You know how to convert data into decisions without getting stuck in paralysis by analysis
