title: Data Analyst
role-description:
The Smarkets exchange is a multi-billion pound trading platform with a rapidly growing ecosystem of sophisticated users who apply financial trading techniques to the world of betting. We’re looking for a data analyst to join our marketing team and provide valuable, data-driven insights on the impact of marketing campaigns. We’re big on continuous improvement at Smarkets, and so a large component of your role will be to analyze the results of campaigns and make actionable recommendations for what we can do differently next time.

Whether it's boosting our customer retention and reactivation, creating and optimising our marketing activities for our entrance into the US, or brainstorming how to measure the success of a new idea with your team, you’ll be able to see the impact of your work at Smarkets. Having generated terabytes of data from multiple sources in an interesting and challenging domain, we are now applying this data to more and more challenges, so there is definitely room for you to be involved in more engineering-related activities, such as tooling, so we can sample, combine and extract data from our Redshift and BigQuery databases.
 What you’ll be doing:

Embedded in the marketing team, you’ll be able to help our marketers unlock the insights they need by shaping the questions they’re seeking answers to. Ultimately, the work you do will allow your team to make more informed, data-driven decisions.
 More specifically, you will be:

Cleaning, structuring, analyzing and visualizing data from different sources, making it available and understandable within the company
Drawing insights about our customers from data and using that knowledge to design marketing campaigns
Transforming business questions into DB queries and dashboards
Collaborating with data scientists, engineers and marketers across Smarkets
Defining your role in the context -of self-management (we’ll help you with this)
 About you:

You’re great at taking ambiguous business questions and turning them into solvable problems
You are passionate about data analysis and engineering
You have a great working knowledge of SQL and database technologies in general
You have a good understanding of the maths behind exploratory data analysis
You have programming skills and some experience in data analysis libraries
 Bonus points: 

Good working knowledge of data warehouse systems like Redshift or BigQuery
Knowledge of data science, machine learning or scientific computing
Interest in sports betting or trading
 About Smarkets:

We've built one of the world's largest betting exchanges with significantly better odds than the competition. Our strength is technology and trading with a passion to push the known boundaries of real-time financial technology. With our self-management structure, flexible work environment, and uncapped holiday allowance, Smarkets offers a unique opportunity to be part of a great work culture. Our office in St Katharine’s Docks (Tower Hill) comes complete with a fantastic roof terrace and a team of in-house chefs cooking breakfast and lunch every day. 

We transfer and store the information you submit to help us process your application and to make our hiring process better. We also make use of third-party hiring tools to help us process applications. As we are based in both Europe and the United States, your data may leave the European Economic Area when we process it. Please only submit your application if you are happy for us to use your information in this way.

title: Data Lake and Planning Business Analyst Internship - Global IT Hub Barcelona
role-description:
With some 339,000 employees worldwide and operations in 197 countries, Nestlé is a truly multi-cultural and cross-disciplinary company. Our strong culture, values and principles, all based on respect, unite us worldwide.

As a leader in nutrition, health and wellness, our goal is to improve the lives of people, everywhere and every day. We work to make our products tastier and healthier, taking care of consumers and their families and gaining their trust.

The Global Digital Hub has been recently created in Barcelona with a global spirit, to service the entire company.

In Nestlé we value a real work ethic, integrity and honesty, in line with our corporate values.

A good level of interpersonal relationship that is reflected in personal relationships based on trust and respect.

We appreciate the enthusiasm of the candidates and their initiative to implement projects, and their ability to take risks.

Description Of Internship

Expected activities:
Work closely with Business Analytics team in technologies for big data, Power BI, chatbots and voice skills to conceive, build the data architecture and report mockups to use in the Finance and Control team.
Work closely with Management Accounting team to implement solutions in the area of Financial Planning and Advanced Analytics
Ability to integrate insights with business decision systems to build data driven applications
Work with third party teams to setup cloud solutions in the area of financial planning.
Continuous benchmark solutions in the area of analytics.
Gather requirements to build analytic solutions and interfaces with cloud solutions.
Create end user documentation for the solutions analytical solution built and participate on the end user training.

Desired Profile
Academic Background Computer Science or Information systems and/or Communications
Understanding of and Interest in the world of Corporate Analytics
Experience or interest in, digital finance analytics, big data and data interfaces, planning solution, predictive analytics and machine learning based on big data, chatbots, etc.
Knowledge on Agile and Scrum methodologies
A working understanding of cloud computing and data visualization
Strong understanding of SQL databases and Multi-dimensional databases (OLAP)
Languages: MS SQL server, T-SQL, PL/SQ, .NET, VBA, MDX.
Focus and attention to detail, strong analytical mind with proven problem-solving abilities

What can you expect from this experience?

During practice, you will become a member of a team of professionals working on real and targeted projects. You will have the opportunity to work and practice your knowledge and skills

Terms & Conditions
Salary 960 € per month
Grant canteen
Access to Nestle supermarket (30% to 50% off)
Insurance with Zurich during the traineeship

title: Data Analytics Consultant
role-description:
Joining Capco means joining an organisation that is committed to an inclusive working environment where you’re supported to #BeYourselfAtWork. We celebrate individuality and recognize that diversity and inclusion, in all forms, is critical to success. It’s important to us that we recruit and develop as diverse a range of talent as we can. We believe that everyone brings something different to the table – so we’d love to know what makes you different.

About us:

Capco is a global technology and business consultancy, focused on the financial services sector. We are passionate about helping our clients succeed in an ever-changing industry.

We are:

Experts in banking and payments, capital markets and wealth and asset management
Deep knowledge in financial services offering, including e.g. Finance, Risk and Compliance, Financial Crime, Core Banking etc.
Committed to growing our business and hiring the best talent to help us get there
Focus on maintaining our nimble, agile and entrepreneurial culture

Role responsibilities

As part of our on-going global expansion strategy, Capco is growing its UK Data Practice in our London office. We are currently seeking to recruit a number of management consultants with data analytics expertise to lead and develop teams to support large scale transformation projects for our leading Financial Services clients.

The applicant should:
Have a real passion for data and a commitment to shift the industry towards forward thinking data analytics
Be keen to join the team to develop the UK Data Practice capabilities and the broader Global Data Practice to support industry changing topics such as Predictive Analytics, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
Use business judgment & analytical tools in driving the best results for the business unit. Achieved through a combination of using data, analysis, brainstorming sessions and business judgment in identifying & leading new opportunities and establishing oneself as the Subject matter authority in own field of expertise.
Enhance the existing advance analytics modelling, methodologies and contributing to new idea in methodology and modelling, machine learning algorithms and report visualization
Be supremely personally motivated to work in a team where clients become colleagues

Skills & expertise
Ability to parse, manipulate and review large quantities of complex data
Ability to interpret data and translate complex material into easily understandable conclusions
Financial services industry background in data analytics
Experience of diagnostic and predictive techniques in areas such as modelling, CLTV, risk scoring, financial crime analytics, risk & compliance analytics and customer/marketing analytics e.g. segmentation
Experience using Rapid BI tools such as Qlik & Tableau and data analytics tools such as R or SAS
Programme Execution and Change management – proven ability to shape, design and lead the execution of data changes
Desirable experience as a Management Consultant

Professional experience is important. But it’s paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From Day One, your key skill will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an unfair advantage.

WHY JOIN CAPCO?

You will work on engaging projects with some of the largest banks in the world, on projects that will transform the financial services industry.

We offer:
A work culture focused on innovation and building lasting value for our clients
and employees
Ongoing learning opportunities to help you acquire new skills or deepen
existing expertise
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners
and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

title: Junior Data Analyst
role-description:
Acerca de nosotros:

Equifax potencia el futuro financiero de individuos y organizaciones a nivel mundial combinando datos unicos, confiables, con tecnologia y analitica innovadora. Pasando de ser en sus inicios una empresa de credito al consumidor, Equifax se ha convertido en el proveedor lider de perspectivas y conocimientos que ayudan a sus clientes a tomar decisiones informadas. Somos una empresa de clase mundial que administra, integra y analiza datos de mas de 820 millones de consumidores, mas de 91 millones de empresas y datos de empleados aportados por mas de 7100 empleadores

Objetivo:

Como Analista formaras parte del equipo de carteras de deuda y participaras en procesos de analisis, estrategia, objetivos, medicion de datos y proyectos de consultoria relacionados con optimizacion de riesgo crediticio y recobro.

Funciones:
Realizacion de los aspectos de analisis de las carteras/proyectos
Realizacion de analisis para optimizacion de resultados: Rentabilidad, Optimizacion de costes
Documentacion y optimizacion de los procesos realizados
Interlocucion con el cliente
Colaboracion con los equipos de Agencias, Reporting y Operaciones

Requerimientos:
Licenciatura en estudios con un alto componente cuantitativo (Ingenierias, Estadistica, Matematicas, etc.) y/o empresarial (ADE)
Conocimientos avanzados de MS Excel y conocimiento de paquetes estadisticos o plataformas de Data Mining
Dominio de herramientas de Office (Excel, Access, Powerpoint)
Muy alta capacidad analitica, dado el contenido cuantitativo de los proyectos
Alto nivel de ingles

Se valorara adicionalmente:
Experiencia previa en puestos con responsabilidades similares (tratamiento y manejo de informacion, analisis…)
1-2 años  experiencia en extraccion, tratamiento y cruce de datos
Programacion de consultas SQL
Aspiraciones de desarrollo profesional (curiosidad intelectual, iniciativa…)
Orientacion practica y estructurada a la hora de abordar cuestiones complejas
Vocacion por el trabajo en equipo
Experiencia en departamentos de riesgos y recobro
Conocimientos en extraccion y carga de datos (ETL)

Primary Location:
ESP-Madrid-TDX
sector_final: ['', 'Serviços financeiros', 'Serviços da informação', 'Tecnologia da informação e serviços']

title: Data analyst - Paris
role-description:
Descriptif du poste
Pour soutenir notre croissance forte et structurer l’ensemble de nos
démarches liées à la data, nous recherchons un(e) Data Analyst.

Vous Mènerez Les Missions Suivantes

1- Gestion du projet de création de notre Data Warehouse
Sur la base des besoins en reporting, analyses et identifiés au sein du

Slip Français, Vous Serez En Charge De
Piloter les avancées de l’équipe technique dans la mise en place des flux
de collecte (rédaction des spécifications et recettage notamment)
Contrôler la qualité et la fiabilité de la data collectée
Structurer le modèle de données (optimisation des performances, règles de
nommage, conformité RGPD, etc.)
Gérer l'avancée des analyses et la planification des besoins des équipes
Accompagner les équipes dans la mise en place de leurs analyses et
reporting métiers l'outil de BI

2- Analyses & Modélisations Ad-hoc
Modéliser et analyser les besoins adhoc des différentes équipes (audience
web, comportements d'achat cross-canal, distribution de nos produits, etc.)
Accompagner les différents pôles du Slip Français dans l’optimisation de
leur reporting en fonction de leurs besoins business
En fonction du profil recherché et de l'avancée sur la partie analytique,
construction et mise en place de modèles de machine learning (segmentation
client, prédiction de ventes, ...)
Au cours de ces missions, vous serez accompagné de notre directeur des
opérations qui vous accompagnera sur les aspects business et de notre
directeur technique qui sera en charge des développements nécessaires à
votre progression.
Profil recherché
Vous l’aurez compris, le Slip veut accélérer sur le data, se doter d’une
architecture solide et scalable sur ce domaine et cherche un stagiaire
touche à tout, idéalement aussi à l’aise quand il s’agit de discuter de la
construction d’un nouveau connecteur de données permettant de récupérer les
informations non échantillonnées de Google Analytics que lorsqu’il s’agit
de discuter des différentes méthodes de calcul du taux de rotation de
stocks avec nos équipes logistiques.
Vous êtes étudiant(e) en école d’ingénieur (ou autre formation équivalente
avec un attrait pour les chiffres et les statistiques) ? C'est un bon
début.
Vous aimez le digital ? Bon point.
Vous connaissez le langage SQL ? C'est extra.
Vous connaissez R ou Python ? Un énorme plus
Vous avez une expérience préalable avec des technologies telles que
Tableau, Sisense, Looker ou avez déjà eu l’occasion de travailler avec des
bases de données ? Vous êtes le candidat idéal !
Vous êtes motivé, autonome, rigoureux ? C’est indispensable
Vous avez un bon esprit de synthèse ? C'est formidable.
Vous aimez les chiffres ? Épatant !
Vous aimez relever des défis ? C'est très intéressant.

title: Data Analyst Intern
role-description:
Tasks
Coordinate with consultants to collect and organize data from unstructured and unformatted source files
Execute high quality data cleaning/merging/analysis of web application analytics and logs
Make realistic assumptions of data processing steps or when data is not available
Develop effective and informative reports and visualizations
Translate findings into business terms and actionable guidance
Take an active role in developing the advanced analytics needed to achieve the project’s goals
Engage with key stakeholders at all levels to update them of important findings


Education

Qualifications
Recent graduate or senior currently attaining a Bachelor’s Degree with focus on data science, mathematics, statistics, business intelligence, or related field is required
Advanced degree is preferred; Relevant work or industry experience is preferred
Experience in core data science activities:
General programming languages: Python, Java, Scala, etc.
Data visualization and reporting: Tableau, Power BI, Adobe Analytics, etc.
Data science languages and frameworks: R, SQL, SAS, Matlab, Scikit-Learn, etc.


Skills
Customer service focus
Strong written and oral communication skills
Strong analytical, organizational, and time management skills
Proficient computer skills in data processing applications
Proactivity and ability to work independently
Detailed oriented with a high degree of accuracy
Teamwork - ability to interact with all levels of the organization


At a Glance

Join Porsche Consulting, Inc .

We bring together people from different backgrounds and experiences and motivate them with a great power of conviction. Our aim is always to take our clients and ourselves further than expected. This is the only way to generate customer enthusiasm. We set the course and the example. What makes us unique is not only the Porsche brand, but also the ability to put well thought-out strategies effectively into practice. Our consultants start their careers by working on client projects. They work directly with the client’s employee to develop tailored solutions. In the process, they enjoy a high degree of creative freedom to shape new solutions and put them into practice.

Exclusive look behind the scenes

About Porsche Consulting’s Industrial Goods Practice

Companies that specialize in mechanical engineering and electronics are some of the driving forces in today’s economy. The quality of their highly individualized products and projects, which is based on excellent development work, has given them a top-notch international reputation. Their edge in quality and innovation requires a firm commercial foundation – in a business characterized far more by individual projects than by series production. This in turn produces some specific entrepreneurial tasks.

About Porsche Consulting, Inc .

Porsche Consulting, Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of Porsche AG, guides internal and external clients toward operational excellence through a unique combination of proven strategies and comprehensive implementation. Our mission is to develop enthusiasm for change within our clients to help them realize lasting gains. As a leading consultancy for putting strategies into practice, we have a marked impact on the businesses we work with: measurable results, solutions in place with lasting effect, clients eager to own our approach. As consultants we think strategically and act pragmatically. We focus on people. This is how we generate competitive success.

Visit us at https://www.porsche-consulting.com/us-en/client-services/industry-expertise/industrial-goods/

How to apply?

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Porsche Consulting, Inc. (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), or any other non-immigrant status).

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Porsche Consulting, Inc. or an affiliated Porsche North America business may not be eligible for consideration.

Contact

Apply here: https://career5.successfactors.eu/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=7255&company=porschecar&username

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
JOB TITLE: DATA ANALYST
REPORTS TO: SENIOR CATEGORY & INSIGHTS MANAGER
LOCATION: MORNINGTON CRESCENT, LONDON
    Revlon is looking for a Data Analyst to support the business in the analysis and reporting on the performance of multiple divisions in a uniquely visual and efficient way.
  The Company’s strategic objective is to grow the current business and develop new business across Elizabeth Arden, E-commerce, Professional & Distribution Brands,within the categories and channels they operate in.
  Reporting to the Senior Category & Insights Manager, this is a great opportunity for an enthusiastic, data driven analyst to identify, transform and visualize data, to provide useful insights and help inform decisions within the business, using a wide range of technical tools & platforms.
  The role holder will provide accurate and timely high levels of data analysis and customer insights information presented in a format which enables the business to identify and make business decisions linked to business opportunities.
    KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
  Timely and accurate provision of the required dashboard reporting decks for internal management use i.e PowerBI dashboards, product performance trackers, store performance/profitability monitoring
  Maintenance and support of data delivery systems e.g. Alteryx & PowerBI desktop
  Report weekly on Field Team performance vs target to support the retail operations team with incentives, commissions and reporting
  Support on global reporting requests to ensure that a full understanding of performance can be understood by regional and global counterparts
  Develop in-depth understanding of the UK cosmetic market with the ability to translate this into immediate and longer term recommendations
  Present and articulate findings to strategies & insights to enable the business to make data driven decision, taking into consideration the wider global position and vision for the Business.
  Proactively identify where there are business opportunities across divisions and its customers with particular emphasis on the development of new business for the different Revlon brands.
  Fully understand and appraise the available qualitative and quantitative data sources available to Revlon. Develop proposals for future information based on the business’ current and future requirements as part of continuous improvement mindset
  Optimise use of data source to enhance both short and long term decision making
  Manage and maintain collaborative relationships with existing or new data providers ensuring maximum ROI
  Contribute to and work collaboratively with immediate team and cross functional counterparts, speedily responding to internal and external ad hoc requests for data insights as required.
  Attend relevant industry events designed to enhance category and consumer insights, sharing knowledge to enable colleagues
  Support the Senior Category & Insights Manager with various additional responsibilities
  PERSON SPECIFICATION
  ·         University Degree educated
·         Demonstrate prior knowledge and use of at least one data analysis tool (e.g. Tableau & Alteryx)
·         Intermediate to Advanced Excel knowledge including creation of pivot tables and Macros, use of look up functionalities
·         Exceptional analytical skills with an ability to translate data/information from insight into presentations to enable conversion to action plans
·         Excellent written and oral communication skills, with the ability to communicate insights and recommendations confidently and effectively
·         Adept and skilled at data mining
·         Highly numerate and results oriented
·         Proven ability to think strategically and operate tactically
·         Marketing, trade marketing, key account and retail knowledge a distinct advantage
·         Inquisitive, comfortable challenge in a positive manner as part of seeking new and improved ways of working/utilizing data/information

title: Data Analyst - Voice of the Customer
role-description:
THE ROLE

We are looking for a Data Analyst, reporting to the Head of Customer Success, to be responsible for providing business reporting, strategic and tactical insights as well as key recommendations to measure, track and improve customer and partner experience. You will need to use your data analysis expertise to support various projects and ad-hoc reporting requests and, using technical skills to follow up with Business Intelligence teams on the development of new reports.

What You'll Do
Use statistical methods to analyze data and generate useful business reports
Help develop new KPIs & benchmarking to track and measure Partner and Customer Success
Analyze available data and generate recommendations based on insights to drive commercial success
Develop dashboards to present insights and in visually impactful way
Work with multiple data sets to prepare, cleanse and manipulate data
Develop custom reporting via SQL and other BI tools to provide valuable information to stakeholders and leadership.
Add value to requests from business leaders and build a reporting logic that will produce analytical measures to tell the story of what is happening in the business;
Be responsible for ensuring the accuracy of data and reports to ensure a high quality of standards;
Work with development team to scope out and implement new reports and tools as necessary;
Pull data from databases for own use or business owner use;
Manage data manipulation and provide scheduled reports.

Who You Are
A professional with a degree in Mathematics, Statistics or related field
Skilled at processing and analyzing large amounts of data using Excel and SQL (required)
Experienced in working with data presentation tools such as Tableau or Looker
Able to work independently in a structured manner
A good communicator and able to present complex data clearly
Experienced in analytical tasks in one of the following areas: segmentation models, customer health, and retention & churn prediction (preferentially)
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
A structured individual with a ‘can-do’ attitude.

title: Data Analyst (JVBS)
role-description:
Who We Are

The Joint Venture between Banc Sabadell and Zurich is a business agreement that exists between the two companies since 2008 in regard to the management of the Bancassurance business. This business is managed through 3 companies: BanSabadell Vida, BanSabadell Pensiones and BanSabadell Seguros Generales. The current staff of the Joint Venture is 280 employees.


“We are actually living a cultural and business transformation process and that’s the reason why we need to hire people completely different. We are looking for some unique person, creative and exceptional who might want to be a part of this changes and assume new and completely different challenges”

Our opportunity

Be involved in the analytics process and provide support for all business lines (motor, households, shops, SME’s, life care, accidents, pensions and savings, health…). At the same time you’ll have to provide support and advice the most important areas and business process, including insights into underlying performance and implications for the business. You’ll have the opportunity to work with financial information applied to insurance business.

Your role

Under Supervision, Developing Analytical Models As Tariff Structures In Mass Lines Of Business, And Big Data Support For Strategically Decisions Of New/renewal Business, As Well As Modelling Marketing Events
Development and improvement of predictive modeling tools according to the market best practices like: Reverse engineering from market information, Elasticity models, lapse models, customization models or NPS.
Develop analytical tools and methods such as scenario testing analysis and projections.
Develop tariffs for new business and renewal, and assist in the monitoring of portfolio performance based on big data.
Coordinate, prepare and perform analyses including trend analyses, and analyses of loss and expense reserves, as it relates to business benefits and strategic direction.
Overview for life, non life, health and pensions business. Work with financial information to enrich the databases
Support different areas on strategically decisions.
Drive the design, testing and maintenance of pricing models and Tools.
Develop models according two different scopes, bank and insurance business

Your Skills And Experience

We hope that the person joining the team brings together the following skills and experiences:
Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or Actuarial Sciences.
More than 4 years of experience in big data, analytics, pricing, modeling or similar.
Industry experience: insurance, bank, pharmaceutical, massive retail, on-line market, others.
Account in Analytics Software’s (SAS, R, MS Office environment).
English (Advanced Level).
Interest in analytical tools and into develop new approaches.

Additional Information




The physical workplace will be in our offices in Sant Cugat.

We are already on our way and we are changing the way we do insurance. In order to do so we need people with talent, willing to learn and a lot of passion! Want to Join Us?

“ZURICH, 12 consecutive years being considered as top employer. For those who truly love!”



Zurich Insurance has the policy to be an equal opportunity employer. We aim to attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to criteria such as race/ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

Primary Location

Spain-Catalonia-Barcelona

Schedule

Full-time

Travel

No

Job Posting

10/30/19

Unposting Date

11/29/19

title: CDI Data Analyst Lead H/F
role-description:
Notre objectif : Faire du développement durable un standard !
Nous figurons parmi les leaders des secteurs des boissons et glaces, des produits alimentaires, de soin de la personne et d’entretien de la maison et sommes présents dans 190 pays à travers le monde.
Nous touchons 2 milliards de consommateurs par jour grâce à plus de 400 marques emblématiques telles que Lipton, Ben&Jerry’s, Maille, Axe, Skip…
  Localisation : Rueil-Malmaison (92), au siège d’Unilever France

Durée et Date de début : poste à pourvoir dès que possible

Expert de la gestion et de la data, le digital improvement lead comprend les problématiques de l’entreprise, analyse, exploite et transforme les données issues de sources multiples afin de répondre à nos enjeux de croissance et simplification.

Vos missions :

Compréhension et Sélection de la donnée
Compréhension des problématiques marketing, marché, ventes, finance, logistique.
Analyse des besoins en matière de données des clients internes ou externes.
Identification des données pertinentes déjà existantes ou à récupérer via différents canaux.

Traitement et Analyse des données
Conversion de la data brute en data qualifiée en vue de son exploitation.
Utilisation d'outils algorithmiques afin de parvenir à des modélisations statistiques pour répondre à la problématique.
Utilisation des méthodes avancées de statistique descriptive pour traiter d'importants volumes d'information.

Reporting et Recommandations
Analyse des données et restitution les résultats, de façon qu’ils répondent à la problématique de croissance, d’optimisation de coût ou de simplification.
Réalisation de dashboards en fonction des demandes métier.
Proposition de préconisations sur les opportunités offertes par la data afin d'augmenter les résultats business.
Restitution visuelle des données en vue d'optimiser leur compréhension et la prise d’actions.

Amélioration continue et animation
Optimisation de la gestion des process business pour automatiser des workflows et standardiser des process de vente, marketing, logistique et finance.
Pilotage des projets d’implémentation des outils de reporting BI.
Audits réguliers pour s’assurer de la qualité et de l’intégrité de la donnée, du bon usage des outils et du bon tracking de la donnée.
Veille technologique sur les outils de BI et les solutions de gestion de données (Big data et analytics), les tendances et nouvelles pratiques.
Animation des réunions projets internes et externes et à la planification des activités.
Accompagnement des équipes autour de la data et la business intelligence.

Le profil que nous recherchons :

2 à 4 ans d’expérience data/BI en tant qu’analyste ou consultant idéalement dans le secteur FMCG/Distribution.
Excellente compréhension des enjeux business et data.
Expertise dans le domaine du big data et de la Business Intelligence notamment des systèmes d'exploitation web et mobile, des langages informatiques, des bases de données et outils de web analyse.
Maitrise des outils de reporting BI.
Expertise dans la simplification de process business.
Compétence en gestion de projet, analyse technique et fonctionnelle, et dans d’autres disciplines telles que le Data Modeling et Data mining, l’Intelligence Artificielle, le machine learning.
Bonne capacité à travailler en équipes multifonctionnelles de façon agile et non hiérarchique.
Excellentes capacités de communication et de synthèse pour restituer des analyses complexes en analyses simples et visuelles.
Anglais courant indispensable.

Formation :

Diplôme d’école d’ingénieurs ou formation de haut niveau en statistiques / économétrie
Ou Formation universitaire de niveau Bac+5 (ex : Master en statistiques et marketing ou en statistique et informatique décisionnel).

title: Mobile Game Data Analyst
role-description:
Key Deliverables

Work with the Game Teams providing insight into player behaviour using data collected from users and games to answer key business questions.
Perform hands-on research, data exploration and analysis to identify strategies to improve engagement, retention and monetization.
Focused on deepening our player understanding to devise best-in-class solutions and delivering client-friendly insights to senior stakeholders.
Acting as the liaison between product, game developers and data engineers to ensure our data is precisely specified, understood and consistent.
Develop methodologies to improve the in-game customer experience such as predicting when users are likely to perform certain actions, churn or monetize.
Utilize analytical tools to gather, process and present meaningful insights and supporting evidence.
Use predictive analytics to predict how users will react to changes in the games.
Desire to work across diverse data sources (spanning marketing campaign data, sales performance and in-game user behaviour) to shape our customer understanding and support development for Square Enix West’s Mobile digital future.
Ensure we continue to collect and document appropriate data.
Work hand-in-hand with the Product Lead and Product Manager and dive deep into game behaviour data to identify key opportunities for further game development (engagement, retention, monetization) and enhancement of our communications with players.
Build predictive models including, but not limited to, social behaviour, retention, monetization and anti-social behaviour.
Create customer segments that inform the product teams to make the optimal decisions.
Use external data to build large-scale sentiment analysis models.
Suggest data driven changes to game systems to drive desired player behaviour.
Modelling the impact of game systems and player behaviour on monetization metrics.
Identify opportunities and optimizations through in-depth data analysis.
Define, follow, analyze and improve the business KPIs and provide reporting on an ongoing basis.
Together with technical teams, gather requirements to improve our existing in-game tracking infrastructure.

Key Stakeholders
Product Management, Game Design, Engineering, Analytics.
Reports to
Product Lead / Senior Manager Analytics

Knowledge and Experience
Essential
Significant experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value in a mobile B2C business.
Strong undergraduate degree in a quantitative subject area (such as Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science etc.)
Prior experience in empirical analysis.
Strong grasp of machine learning and data modelling techniques
Wealth of practical experience working with data and are comfortable communicating valuable insights to an array of teams to influence decisions.
Desirable
Postgraduate degree.
Masters in Data Science, Applied Statistics, Behavioural Economics, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering or related field.
Data visualization experience.
Experience with Atlassian products (Jira & Confluence).

Competencies, Skills and Attributes
Essential
Understanding of data collection and processing techniques.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics.
Proven track record of conceptualizing complex business problems and solving them with advanced statistical models and machine learning algorithms, as well as the ability to interpret results with confidence and drive through recommendations.
Solid experience and skills in data analysis, data mining or implementing data science models with SQL, Python, R or similar.
Practical experience in relevant machine learning and data modelling techniques used in supervised problems such as decision trees, Random Forests, gradient boosted machines, linear/logistic regression, deep learning or unsupervised problems such as clustering and dimensionality reduction.
Excellent written and communication skills, experience presenting to business stakeholders.
A passion for turning data into actionable insights.
Solid skills visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau, Looker or Chartio.
Creative and innovative, flexible and non-conformist, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.
Fast learner and highly meticulous, bringing value to any conversation you are involved.
Pragmatic, knowing how to balance short term and long-term deliverables managing expectations as needed.
Team player, establishing effective relationships to work with others for the win.

Other
Real passion and interest in mobile games and data analytics.
You love to tell stories with data and generate meaningful insights.
Ability to work under pressure and to deadlines.


Please note that Square Enix does not accept speculative candidate submissions from recruitment agencies.

title: Data Analyst (Product)
role-description:
This Data Analyst (Product) role provides the opportunity to be a close business partner for one of our product groups responsible for the integration with Booking.com. This product group is made up of 3 teams working on ensuring the customer journey from the core Booking.com site into Taxi purchase and management is as seamless as possible.
  An ideal candidate would combine strong analytical skills, intellectual curiosity and a collaborative and communicative style. Business partnering will be a key factor in this role and ensuring you can effectively link our product and insights teams is key.
  Core activities: The analyst would…
Support & drive session growth using A/B (& multivariate) testing of taxi entry points on the accommodation site
Support & drive customer experience improvements
Suggest, create and implement fundamental improvements to taxi placement
Use a selection of analytics tools to evaluate and optimise entry point performance
Execute quantitative analysis from multiple data sources to develop hypotheses and challenge assumptions that underpin the strategic direction of the team
Ensure repeatable datasets are built where needed (e.g. after one-off analyses that could be used elsewhere)
Work effectively with diverse stakeholders across multiple departments within the business, including developers and architects
Able to defend analytical approach & explain benefits & drawbacks regardless of audience
  Skills and experience that we are looking for
Strong data analytical skills
Strong Google Analytics skills for querying and exploring data sets
SQL experience
Proven experience delivering insight from disparate data sets
Ability to clearly communicate complex ideas to varied and non-technical stakeholders
A flair for developing insightful analysis and solving real business problems using data
Technically capable in at least one data technology (e.g. R, SQL, SAS etc)
Experience of working in eCommerce with high velocity event data would be a plus
Working knowledge of BI tools such as Power BI and Tableau would be a strong plus
Working knowledge of Google BigQuery would be a big plus
Experience with statistical and Machine Learning modelling techniques would be a strong plus

title: Researcher, Writer and Data Analyst
location: El Puerto de Santa María, Andalusia, Spain
role-description:
Key points

This role is based in our ROCCO's offices in El Puerto de Santa Maria in Cadiz, Andalucia, Spain. There's no opportunity for remote working. However following a probation period there could be some partial remote working, once relationships with the team have been established.
An excellent competance in English is required.
Some travel to conferences abroad maybe required.
ROCCO is set-up in the Spanish Social Security system as an employer. The employee should be also. 
Starting date is As soon as possible in 2019

Who we are

ROCCO is a Research and Reporting company. We provide Market Intelligence, Vendor Performance and Market Strategy data analysis reports alongside reporting on industry hot topics, insights and company profiles in various media forms.

ROCCO started in 2012 and since 2013 on average 500 MNOs and 180 Vendors engage with ROCCO’s research work annually. We have found that this network and close knowledge of the Roaming industry makes us have ability to understand strategically what challenges are faced by Mobile Operators and allows us leverage this for marketing purposes.

The Job Role

Researcher, Writer and Data Analyst

Responsibilities

Main tasks of these responsibilities would include, but is not exclusive to the following:
Be responsible for designing surveys and other research studies for ROCCO
Decide for how long and when to run surveys
Identify the right questions and how to ask them using survey monkey or similar tools
Identify the audience who should complete the surveys
Help identify how best to market and promote the surveys online with the help of ROCCO's marketing team
Monitor the results coming in and decide when is the the best time to close the survey
Review the results identifing interesting insights
Write up the findings obtained in the data producing the content for the report, or work with other team members or guest writers to produce the content for the report
Work with the graphics team to present the data in a professional way, considering professional image of ROCCO, its brand guidelines and previous reports it has delivered
Be responsible for ensuring a high quality finished report for sale by ROCCO
Help the marketing and graphic design teams to define the graphics and promotional material for the report
Help publish the report on ROCCO's website, promoting the report for sale through ROCCO's communication channels
Follow up on report sales with ROCCO's international sales team
At all times embrance the amazing world of telecoms and what exciting and interesting topics it can bring

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Company Description

null Job Description

Na czym będzie polegać praca?
Obszar, w którym będziesz pracował, zajmuje się automatyzacją oraz optymalizacją wiadomości i notyfikacji wysyłanych do użytkowników platformy Allegro oraz procesów z tym związanych. Dzięki zaawansowanym technikom analizy danych będziesz wspierać nas w podejmowaniu decyzji dotyczących naszych kluczowych projektów w tym obszarze.
Dlaczego miał(a)byś z nami pracować?
Weźmiesz udział w projektowaniu scenariuszy wiadomości wysyłanych do użytkowników Allegro, uwzględniając wszystkie kanały, którymi komunikujemy się z naszymi użytkownikami (email, push, sms, notyfikacje w serwisie)
Będziesz tworzył wizualizacje przedstawiające działanie obecnych oraz przyszłych kampanii marketingowych/wysyłkowych
Weźmiesz udział w projektowaniu i rozwijaniu systemu Marketing Automation, poprzez analityczne wsparcie decyzji podejmowanych przez zespół tworzący to rozwiązanie
Do pracy wykorzystujemy innowacyjny ekosystem narzędziowy (np. Tableau, Druid, Spark, PySpark, Python, Hive, Google Big Query), do którego będziesz miał dostęp
Pracujemy w środowisku wspierającym eksperymenty oraz testowanie w celu weryfikacji hipotez
Big Data to u nas nie puste hasło, a rzeczywistość (kilka petabajtów danych) - damy Ci pracę na naprawdę dużych zbiorach danych, zarówno na naszej wewnętrznej infrastrukturze Big Data, ale też przy wykorzystaniu narzędzi dostarczanych przez Google
Dołączysz do zespołu ekspertów nastawionych na innowacyjne i efektywne rozwiązania, w którym panuje otwartość na dyskusje i nowe koncepcje

Ze Swojej Strony Oferujemy
Startupową kulturę pracy, a jednocześnie stabilność dojrzałej organizacji
Możliwość nauki na żywym organizmie - systemie informatycznym o wielkiej, ogólnopolskiej skali i wpływ na wiadomości, które ślemy do milionów naszych użytkowników
Nieformalną atmosferę pracy w profesjonalnym zespole
Bogaty pakiet świadczeń pozapłacowych w systemie kafeteryjnym – Ty decydujesz z czego korzystasz

Szukamy Specjalistów, Którzy
Posiadają min. 3-4 lata doświadczeń w obszarze analizy danych
Mają silne umiejętności analityczne i doświadczenie w pracy projektowej
Posiadają doświadczenie w analizie dużych wolumenów danych i potrafią łączyć dane z wielu różnych źródeł
Znają bardzo dobrze SQL
Wiedzą jak dobierać techniki statystyczne i metody wizualizacji danych adekwatne do problemu badawczego
Potrafią słuchać i komunikują się w logiczny i ustrukturyzowany sposób
Znają biegle angielski w mowie i piśmie
Wyślij nam swoje CV i dołącz do Allegro!

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Amazing opportunity to join an award winning FinTech payment institution whose product was voted ‘Best Prepaid Product 2019’ at the prestigious ‘Card & Payments’ Awards.

The Data Analyst will play a crucial role in our new expansion phase over the coming years. We are looking for a confident individual, who enjoys working with data and has good analytical and reporting skills. We want someone who understands logic and can be both: a pro-active, independent, self-starter who is ready to jump in and get things done AND work alongside innovative teams with evolving reporting requirements.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Contribute to the understanding of key patterns in customer life cycles, including acquisition, retention and lifetime value
Understand key metrics of the business, design appropriate reporting and be able to explain complex methodologies and results in a way that allows non-technical stakeholders to make decisions
Draw down reports from mySQL to write syntaxes and export into MS Excel as well as use MS Excel to manipulate data rows entering the 1000s in total, drilling down using VLookUps and Pivot Tables to enable you to present the figures in a recognisable format
Collaborate extensively with stakeholders, management, and software development team members to ensure that your proposed solutions meet business needs, permit valid interpretations, and lead to practical enhancements
Review and evaluate different Business Intelligence tools, choose which ones are most suitable for required reporting necessities and ensure that it is setup correctly
Be able to debug and correct any data/report issues
Document the technical details of your work

REQUIREMENTS
2-3 years of successful experience of working with raw data (data cleaning, data visualization and modelling)
Strong MS Excel skills (Pivot Tables, V Look Ups etc)
Previous solid data analytical experience using SQL and MySQL Workbench
Proven record of strong hands-on skills in sourcing, cleaning, manipulating and analysing large volumes of data
Track record of working with mainstream BI packages such as Tableau, Zoho Analytics, Power BI, etc.
Experience in working autonomously, taking the initiative and responsibility for their own work. Highly self-motivated and able to manage your own time effectively
Ability to collaborate well with colleagues to truly understand business & user goals and come up with informed solutions
Have the confidence and ability to communicate the insight found within reports through effective story-telling
Proactive, independent, self-starter who is ready to jump in and get things done
Willingness to question and learn
Attention to detail

PACKAGE
This is a mid-level role and you will be compensated well to reflect your performance
This role is located in our London office

title: Business/Data Analyst, Associate
role-description:
About this role

Is your passion providing outstanding service to clients while building and fostering positive relationships? Want to use your diverse background to make an impact on the clients we service in a culture that flourishes on quality, innovation, collaboration and accountability? Look no further. At BlackRock, we are seeking an Analyst who is curious, collaborative, analytical and passionate. We recognize that strength comes from diversity and we will embrace your rare skills, inquisitiveness and passion while giving you the opportunity to grow professionally and as an individual.

We know you want to feel valued every single day and be recognized for your contribution. At BlackRock we strive to empower our employees and actively engage your involvement in our success. With over USD $6 trillion of assets we have an exceptional responsibility: our technology and services empower millions of investors to save for retirement, pay for college, buy a home and improve their financial well-being. Come join our team and experience what it feels like to be part of an organization that makes a difference.

BlackRock Data Services is a centralized data group dedicated to ensuring that all information required for the investment management process including positions, security data, pricing, risk, cash, net asset value (NAV), performance and compliance are delivered consistently, accurately and on a timely basis. BDS is focused on delivering quality data at scale to our clients by understanding their needs, the markets, and using technology to create best in class solutions.

You will be responsible for the following:

Provide high quality client service externally and internally. Address inquiries, perform controls, resolve problems and mitigate risks for clients and internal BlackRock partners
Learn the intricacies of the Aladdin® end to end investment platform
Gain broad experience in Equities, Fixed Income, Derivatives and Alternatives across the vast global investment marketplace
Investigate and resolve complex and intricate issues and perform ad hoc analysis of large data sets while meeting tight deadlines
Initiate and drive platform and process innovations to support new business needs, minimize risk, improve quality and navigate changing markets
To ensure success, you will have the following qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree is preferred; experience in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Computer Science, Information Systems or Engineering disciplines additive
Basic knowledge of fixed income, equity and derivative instruments is a plus
A “Student of the Markets” attitude: intellectually curious with a passion for learning about the global financial markets and the investment management business
Excellent verbal and written communication skills combined with agile critical thinking and a problem solving attitude
Lastly, your confirmed ability to operate under tight deadlines and prioritize work, coupled with your sound judgement to appropriately document conclusions will provide continued success. Using your proficiency in Microsoft Office, aptitude for learning new applications, and your willingness to ask questions (while learning independently) will get you noticed. Programming or automation experience with tools like Python, RPA, SQL and Unix is a plus.

About BlackRock

BlackRock’s purpose is to help more and more people experience financial well-being. As a fiduciary to investors and a leading provider of financial technology, our clients turn to us for the solutions they need when planning for their most important goals. As of September 30, 2019, the firm managed approximately $6.96 trillion in assets on behalf of investors worldwide.

For additional information on BlackRock, please visit www.blackrock.com/corporate | Twitter: @blackrock |

Blog: www.blackrockblog.com | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock

BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.

BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

title: Business Data Analyst - Paris
role-description:
About

Heuritech is a fashion technology company that offers brands predictive
analytics on trends, sales and stock.
Using advanced artificial intelligence (AI) to translate real-world images
shared on social media into meaningful insights, The Heuritech market
intelligence platform empowers brands to forecast demand and trends more
accurately, produce more sustainably, and achieve unprecedented competitive
advantage.
Heuritech collaborates with leading brands worldwide, such as Louis
Vuitton, Dior, Adidas, etc.
The team is composed of 40 people, among which a quarter has a PhD in
Artificial Intelligence.
Heuritech is backed by French VCs Elaia and Serena, as well as private
investors. With 4M€ fundraising in 2019, Heuritech’s next objectives are to
open the Beauty industry and international development in New York and
Singapore.
Joining Heuritech is a unique opportunity to participate to the growth and
construction of a leading and international fashion-tech startup.

Job Description

The Business Analyst will help on a daily basis on the different tasks
linked to the ongoing data analysis projects: client reporting, market
studies and various research projects.
Missions

You Will Be In Charge Of
Implementing internal reporting tools to improve client reporting
Turn large data volume into structured databases easily usable for
exploratory analysis
Producing analytical reports on strategic topics related to the fashion
and sports markets to support the development of our offer
Performing weekly and monthly analysis for all clients, and draw
insights from data for all projects: product performances, brand
benchmarks, event reports, consumer segmentations, market trends, etc.
Making recommendations and comments on the reports to be delivered
Writing case studies based on key insights (quantitative and
qualitative) detected in Heuritech’s platforms
Proactively suggest relevant analysis to nurture Communication &
Marketing content (blogs & articles)
Participating in the Heuritech product development process, feeding the
product roadmap with strategic thinking about data and key metrics

About You

Preferred Experience
You are looking for an end of studies 6-month internship
You have excellent Excel and Powerpoint skills
You are fluent in English
You already have worked as an analyst or in a data-driven position
You are not afraid of numbers and like to tell stories about them
You are rigorous, organized, and like to suggest new ideas (we know that
is a lot but we know you are out there ;) )
If you are interested in Fashion, it would be a plus, of course.
Otherwise, you are willing to learn about this exciting market

About Your Future Work Environment
You will have to deal with different teams and different backgrounds
(business and tech)
You will evolve in a fast-growing and dynamic company where every
project is an opportunity to learn and build new things
Recruitment Process
Please share your CV and a few words about your motivation to
marion.tessier@heuritech.com
Additional Information
Contract Type: Internship (6 month(s))
Start Date: 05 January 2020
Location: Paris, France (75011)
Education Level: Master's Degree
Experience: > 6 months

title: CDI Data Analyst (H/F)
role-description:
CDI Data Analyst (H/F)

Poste à pourvoir de suite au siège de Unilever France, à Rueil Malmaison (92)

Contexte

Unilever Food Solutions (ufs.com) est la division d’Unilever France spécialisée dans la vente et le développement des produits destinés aux chefs professionnels. Nous proposons une gamme de produits alimentaires et de boissons enthousiasmants ainsi que des services exceptionnels destinés aux chefs au sein de 22 organisations multinationales et présentes dans 72 pays.

Le monde d’Unilever Food Solutions (UFS) est un environnement dynamique et stimulant avec des professionnels passionnés qui ne ménagent pas leurs efforts pour réaliser leur ambition commune, à savoir « permettre aux chefs d’aimer ce qu’ils font ».

« We Free Chefs To Love What They Do »

Nos clients sont à la fois des restaurants, des hôtels, mais aussi des chefs de brasserie et des responsables de la restauration de collectivités dans les cantines d’entreprises, d’écoles ou d’hôpitaux, ainsi que les grossistes et les points de vente en libre-service qui desservent le secteur des services alimentaires.

Unilever Food Solutions (UFS) a toujours eu recours à des gestionnaires de comptes pour nouer un dialogue avec les chefs des établissements de restauration (restaurants, hôtels, traiteurs, etc.). Ces dernières années, le rôle dévolu aux canaux numériques s’est considérablement accru, en particulier autour de l’utilisation de la bonne combinaison de points de contact hors ligne et en ligne, devenue essentielle à la création du parcours client parfait. Les ventes et le marketing ont pour objectif d’inciter les chefs à utiliser différents points de contact et de leur permettre d’acheter nos produits. Cette approche est possible à la faveur de l’optimisation continue du site internet et de la boutique en ligne UFS.com, des campagnes segmentées et personnalisées, des applis UFS et des visites de vente hors ligne.

Description Générale Du Poste

L’Analyste de données gère les données et les processus adjacents en s’inscrivant dans une perspective de qualité, de disponibilité et de facilité d’utilisation. Enfin, il est responsable de l’élaboration de rapports qui montrent clairement si l’entreprise est sur la bonne voie ou non.

Principales responsabilités
Gérer le processus pour intégrer toutes les données de vente dans l’infrastructure. Être garant de la qualité et de l’intégrité des donnéescomme l’exige UFS
Assurer la maintenance de toute la base de données et gérer les nombreux opérateurs achat à travers le monde entier.
Aider les propriétaires à identifier des objectifs commerciaux clairs(améliorer la portée numérique, renforcer l’engagement, augmenter le nombre de conversions de vente) et définir les ICP qui les concernent.
Fournir et gérer les tableaux de bord/rapports nécessaires pour visualiser la BI pour le reste de l’entreprise.
Traduire les données en veille économique (BI) au sommet et à l’extrémité de l’entonnoir sur la base du modèle grip-grab-grow en dispensant des conseils aux OCT et à la Digital Team. Se concentrer sur l’acquisition de nouvelles entreprises et la reconquête d’opérateurs perdus.
Créer des visuels en réalisant et en utilisant des modèles d’interprétation des chiffres de vente. L’analyse est réalisée sur la base des modèles de données développés à l’échelle mondiale par des spécialistes des données. Assurer la liaison avec les spécialistes des données pouroptimiser les modèles existants.
Veiller à créer un solide réseau avec les équipes mondiales CD Operations et Digital Technology & Data
Intégrer l’infrastructure IT CD dans une infrastructure plus large de données en fonction des besoins de l’entreprise et de la stratégie choisie.
Principales interactions



Responsable et équipe IDC locaux
Tender & TMI Manager, analyste de données local
CD Organisation : Trade, Chains, Field Force Lead
Responsable et équipes de marketing locaux
Équipe mondiale centrale (Données/Technologies digitales & Opérations commerciales)
Équipe Fourniture et développement de services
Profil requis



5 ans d’expériences professionnelles pertinentes dans la gestion d’infrastructures de données
Expériences avec des outils de création & visualisation de rapports comme Power BI, BO/BW, Report Builder
Excellente connaissance d’Excel
Expérience avec les outils SAP et/ou numériques (CRM)
Expérience dans l’interprétation des chiffres (ventes/finance/conversion)
Maîtrise parfaite de la langue anglaise, à la fois pour les communications orales et écrites
Avoir de l’énergie à revendre.
Excellentes aptitudes communicationnelles et capacité à être responsable des données.
Orienté résultats
Fort d’un excellent esprit d’équipe, être capable de travailler de façon pluridisciplinaire (avec les équipes marketing, CD & Technologie des données).

Les « Plus »
Expérience professionnelle au sein d’une entreprise ou organisation multinationale
Expérience B2B
Appétence élevée pour l’alimentation et les cultures alimentaires

Lieu

France-Hauts de Seine-Rueil Malmaison-Rueil Malmaison

title: Data & Analytics Consultant, Amsterdam
role-description:
Leer de organisatie kennen

Een bedrijf dat begrijpt dat de wereld constant aan het veranderen is en dat deze veranderingen ervoor zorgen dat men continu op zoek moet gaan naar nieuwe en juiste oplossingen. Met deze blik kijkt onze klant naar de wereld. Deze organisatie is een toonaangevende consultancy. Niet alleen in Nederland, maar ook in de rest van Europa. Het heeft een netwerk van meer dan 12.000 werknemers en klanten, verspreid over 75 landen. Daarnaast zijn zij gefocust op adviseren op het gebied van SaaS, digitale transformaties en advanced analytics.

Over de functie

Verschillende Taken Zijn

Als Data & Analytics Consultant ben je verantwoordelijk voor verschillende projecten. Herbij ontwerp je en ontwikkel je de beste oplossingen voor de klant. Je helpt klanten van A tot Z vanaf de beschikbare data tot en met het implementere van de uitkomsten van jouw analyses.
Op zoek gaan naar de wensen van de klant
Samen met de klant aan tafel om de juiste business strategie te kiezen
Je zorgt voor begeleiding tijdens het implenteren van de juiste oplossing
Je levert hoge kwaliteit met jouw analitische intzichten
Je zal aan de slag gaan met verschillende Machine Learning technieken

Jouw kwaliteiten
WO opleiding in de richting van Econometrie of Computer Science
Minimaal 2 jaar werkervaring in Analytics
Consultancy ervaring
Bekend met Machine Learning technieken, evenals R of Python

De voordelen
Marktconform salaris
Contract voor onbepaalde tijd
Lease auto
Laptop, telefoon, pensioen en flexibele uren
Een internatinale werkomgeving

Klinkt goed?

Ben jij geïnteresseerd in bovenstaand profiel? Good Company ziet graag jouw sollicitatie tegemoet! Solliciteer via onze website op de vacature van Data & Analytics Consultant.

title: Data Analyst
Data analyst - Paris
role-description:
Descriptif du poste
Le job
Chaque semaine, Skello évolue: le nombre de clients augmente, de nouvelles
fonctionnalités sont lancées et notre équipe s'agrandit.
Pour maintenir cette croissance de manière saine, nous veillons à ce que
chaque décision soit prise sur des bases tangibles: nos datas.
Ainsi, nous recrutons aujourd'hui notre premier Data Analyst ! Un amoureux
des chiffres et des systèmes qui veut aider chaque équipe de Skello à
prendre les meilleures décisions.
Missions
Tu l'auras compris la mission de ce job est hautement stratégique puisque
tu impacteras directement l'orientation que prendra Skello sur le long
terme.
Plus concrètement ta mission sera organisée autour de 3 axes :
Axe outils et datas
Collaborer avec chaque équipe de Skello pour identifier et comprendre leurs
besoins en datas (focus Sales, CSM et Produit)
Sélectionner et mettre en place les meilleurs outils possibles pour obtenir
les données nécessaires
Optimiser et valider régulièrement la qualité des outils que tu auras mis
en place*
Axe analyses et recommandations
Extraire et vérifier que les bonnes informations soient toujours
disponibles
Analyser et interpréter les datas fournies par les outils, dashboards et
trakers
Orienter et soutenir les décisions stratégiques des équipes grâce aux datas
obtenues*
Axe diffusion et éducation
Partager et traduire les datas afin de les rendre intelligibles aux yeux de
tous, même aux phobiques des chiffres !
Insuffler une culture de l'analyse au sein des équipes via des formations
dignes de C'est pas sorcier !
Accompagner et suivre les équipes pour mesurer l'impact des décisions
prises*
Profil recherché
Soft Skills
Analytique et rationnel, tu prends tes décisions de manière logique en te
basant sur des faits avant tout
Amoureux par les chiffres, tu es champion du monde de sudoku depuis tes 8
ans, et franchement ca devient un peu ennuyeux
Pédagogue et bon communicant, tu aimes rendre simple ce qui est complexe,
pour transmettre tes idées
Passionné et déterminé tu apprécies l'idée de construire une équipe autour
de toi et la faire monter en compétences
Stratégique et apte à développer une vision long terme de Skello, tu aimes
accompagner les cofondateurs de Skello pour définir ensemble des stratégies
Hard skills
2 ans d'xp en tant que datas ou business analyst
Compréhension des enjeux des startups
Une bonne maitrise des outils SQL, Excel, Tableau et des langages Python ou
R éventuellement
Une compréhension fine des certains logiciels de BI comme Tableaux ou
équivalent type Looker ou Clickview
Process de recrutement
Un call avec Agathe, notre recrutrice
Un premier entretien avec Emmanuelle, co-fondatrice de Skello et COO
Un second entretien avec Quitterie, co-fondatrice de Skello et CEO

title: Data Analytics Specialist
role-description:
Overview

The Data Analytics Specialist is responsible for enabling data analytics to be performed across the Group Internal Audit function, by (a) providing data analytics know-how and support to the Group Internal Audit Hubs to enable them to perform their own local analytics, and (b) implementing, maintaining and enhancing a centralised data analytics platform for use by all Group Internal Audit staff.

The Data Analytics Specialist contributes to the development of Group Internal Audit in order help achieve its key objectives:
provide to the Group Board Audit Committee and to the CEO independent and objective assurance over internal control effectiveness in any of the Group’s entities and functions;
help improve effectiveness and efficiency of operations,
develop and share knowledge

The Data Analytics Specialist Should Also
create, expand and maintain Group Internal Audit’s knowledge and tools to ensure continuous adaptation to the evolution of LafargeHolcim’s business.
support the development of LafargeHolcim's Audit department through acting as a «Technical Specialist» to enhance audit effectiveness and efficiency.

Responsibilities

Data Analysis

The Data Analytics Specialist
Develops the data analytics framework for Group Internal Audit, covering processes, procedures and standards
Manage and maintain the technological infrastructure and data that support Internal Audit Analytics
Coordinates data analytics knowledge sharing across the Group Internal Audit Hubs and with other key stakeholders in the LafargeHolcim Group
Coordinates with LafargeHolcim’s IT organisation at Group and Regional levels to ensure access to the relevant data and the appropriate tools are in place to perform data analyses
Translates Group Internal Audit requirements into technical specifications, builds queries using data querying tools and tests the query results for appropriateness and completeness for:
The planning, fieldwork and reporting stages of individual Group Internal Audit missions
Wider Group Internal Audit management reporting, such as benchmarking, risk assessment, etc.
Join specific audit missions when ad-hoc advanced data analytics are required
Applies continuous improvement principle to mature data analytics in Group Internal Audit
Knowledge development & sharing

The Data Analytics Specialist Should
Develop and deliver training material to the Group Internal Audit staff on the use of audit and data analytics tools specifically, integrating those tools into standard audit practices.
Support Group Internal Audit staff in enhancing the audit approach and audit guides suggesting IT based audit procedures.
Develop and maintain relationships with other Group Assurance Providers (Line of Defense 2) to promote continuous monitoring analytics program.
Develop and maintain relationship with Group IT and Regional ITSCs to keep up-to-date on any technology and/or business process changes that may occur across the LafargeHolcim Group
Advise on any analytical technology tools or enhancements that would help the department realize efficiencies.
The Data Analytics specialist can also be assigned to projects aimed at improving Group Internal Audit’s performance and internal processes.

Possibly all Group business processes and domains (Finance, Order to Cash, Source to Pay, Product Quality, etc.)

No direct reports

The Data Analytics Specialist reports hierarchically to the Head of IT Audit Hub.
Key interfaces, stakeholders and relationships:
The Data Analytics Specialist develops effective working relationship with the IS/IT community, the Business Process Owners (at Group or Operation levels), the Group Internal Control team, and other assurance providers from the Line of Defense 2.

Education/Qualifications

Master of Science, Bachelor degree

CPA, CIA, CISA, ACL Certified Data Analyst and/or CFE considered as a plus

Good awareness of Internal Audit processes is a plus

Good knowledge of standard business processes is a plus

Knowledge & Skills

Technical expertise with data analysis tools such as ACL and QlikView
Proficient in Databases – Data Architecture, Data Modeling, Data Loads, etc.

Behavioural competencies:

Objectivity, courage, independence, fairness
Communication & interpersonal skills
Analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to evaluate risks in the context of the Group strategic vision
Result orientation

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Description

Amazon Fashion is a fast moving innovative team that is revolutionizing the future of online Fashion retail to become each customer’s most loved fashion destination. We are looking for candidates that are passionate about big data and data warehouse technologies (Redshift, EMR, Spark), visualization (Tableau, Amazon QuickSight) and statistical modelling/ML. This role will design, execute, and iterate on reporting directly visible to Senior Leadership in EU Amazon Fashion. Beyond reporting, the role will lead strategic deep dives and build algorithmic solutions that drive discoveries in search, marketing, and pricing to surprise and delight Fashion customers at every turn.

The ideal candidate has a strong track record and end-to-end ownership of the full stack of data analysis (data engineering, ETL, data modelling, and data visualization), with a high fluency in SQL and Python/R. You should also thrive on independence and be relentless in finding automated solutions and eliminating manual solutions.

Primary Responsibilities
Own Reporting/BI roadmap by working with business leaders on strategically prioritizing numerous requests and long-term adoption of new technologies
Develop performance dashboards with key metrics for review with senior leadership and business teams
Empower non-technical, internal customers to self-sufficiency in analytics and reporting via business intelligence and visualization software (e.g., Tableau, Amazon Quicksight, etc.).
Create data pipelines from a data lake to various reporting, visualization, and modelling tools
Use statistical and Machine Learning techniques for strategic deep dives and generate actions, as well as communicating in front of senior leadership.
For This Position We Expect

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
BS in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related field
Multiple years of relevant work experience in BI, Analytics, or Data Science fields or comparable fields
Proven SQL/Python skills in data transformation, analysis, and optimization
Excellent communication written and verbal communication skills, especially in regards to quantitative topics discussed with non-technical colleagues
Ability to influence multiple stakeholders to align roadmap and priorities
Strong organizational and multitasking skills with ability to balance competing priorities
Further Qualifications Would Be a Plus

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
MS or PhD in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related field
Broad experience in big data technologies (Hadoop, Hive, etc.)
Familiarity with AWS services such as S3, Redshift, EMR, Athena, etc.
History of applying statistical or machine learning models to business problems
Familiarity with fashion world and seasonal online retail
Are you interested? We look forward to receiving your application. Please submit your online application including your CV and covering letter in English.

By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize Amazon to transmit and store your information in the Amazon group of companies' world-wide recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies.
