title: Junior Data Analyst
role-description:
Welcome! We’re Attest: a Consumer Growth Platform. We’re on a mission to bring every business closer to consumers, and empower them with the insights that drive predictable and repeatable growth; enabling them to create and deliver better, more useful services, products and experiences for communities worldwide.

We’re spearheaded by a bunch of awesome individuals, and our guess is that you’re pretty awesome, too. We’re ultra-proud of the inclusive company we’ve built to date. Attest is not just an exciting place to work alongside great people, but a feeling – one of belonging and adventure. We’re delighted that you’ve taken the first step to becoming an Attester by expressing an interest in who we are and what we do.

About The ACE Team

The ACE (Attest Centre of Excellence) team's mission is to ensure that all Attest clients are delighted with the product and are provided with the best possible research expertise while making the most of their subscription. The team is here to guide, encourage, support and advise clients to achieve their desired outcomes and uncover new ways of using consumer research. ACE are committed to enabling clients to be more insightful themselves, but also offering our own lens for new ways of achieving goals; a bespoke extension of our clients' internal teams.

The role

We’re looking for Junior Client Experience Data Analyst to help expand and propagate the most important data metrics throughout the business and our clients. You’ll join a team that is all about improving the lives of our clients, ensuring we make data-based decisions and keep clients at the heart of our business.

In your first six to twelve months, you’ll be involved in client analysis and the most detailed data needs, helping clients get the best out of the research they run with us.

What you’ll be doing

Working within the Attest Centre of Excellence and helping the team with client requests

Collaborating with other Data Analysts to deliver first class analysis & insights to clients

Help pioneer a better way to use data within Attest

Pulling information from various data sources to help optimise how we measure & track client information internally

Work cross-functionally with other teams within Attest to promote a data-driven approach

Who you are

You should be comfortable with extracting, collating and analysing data from various sources. You are looking for a chance to work in a high growth environment with a fantastic, collaborative team and exciting clients.

Enjoy working with data, identifying trends, developing viewpoints and answering key questions based on data-derived insights.

Familiar with a variety of data softwares such as: Google Suite, MS Office, or other data analytics tools

Ambitious to learn and develop in new areas, e.g., SQL, Python, R, etc.

Excited about the prospect of pioneering data visualization & easy understanding - by processing data and creating presentations for clients

Analytical mindset - can distill insights from data and present it in an easy to understand way to wider audiences.

Experience of 1-2 years in a data-focused role would be great, but is not a strict requirement

What you’ll bring to Attest

Strong attention to detail - spotting errors or inconsistencies within data

Ability to empathise with internal and external clients, their demands and situations.

Highly self-motivated, enthusiastic and have a proactive, action-driven client approach.

Demonstrate excellent client service and values being part of a team.

New perspective on how to do data analysis & interpretation

What we’ll offer in return

Our benefits and perks are designed with a focus on the wellbeing, engagement, and growth of our Attesters.

A competitive salary that fairly recognises your experience and potential;

High-quality equipment – whether you prefer a MacBook or a Windows machine, we’ll invest a sizeable amount to provide you with the right tools and set-up to help you do your best work;

25 days paid holiday – we care about our team’s wellbeing, so we make sure you have time to fully switch off, rest, and recharge;

Flexible working hours and working from home – whether you have parental responsibilities, just need some headspace, or have a parcel being delivered, we’ll support you in making your work and personal life a manageable blend;

A generous Growth & Development budget to spend on the resources and tools that will help you grow in your role and achieve your career goals;

10% adventure time to invest in charitable activities, your growth and development, and/or side projects for Attest;

Weekly team lunch – a team who eats together, works hard together, and stays together, right? We order in lunch every week, but also acknowledge those who are less fortunate than ourselves: for every meal we order, our supplier donates a meal in support of the Akshaya Patra Foundation;

Fully-paid sick days – Mental health and physical health are treated equally at Attest. Whether you’ve been knocked out with the flu, are having an operation, or need some time off to manage anxiety, stress or depression, for example, we encourage all our Attesters to rest up and come back when they’re feeling more like themselves;

A values-led working environment that encourages putting people first, honesty, curiosity and leadership.

Is this role not quite the right fit for you? Or, have you not seen a suitable position available on our careers site?...We’re always on the look-out for interesting, bright folk to join our team of Attesters. Connect with us to stay in touch, and we’ll notify you when we have new opportunities.

About Our People And Culture

Attest is a place where you’re encouraged to bring every part of you needed to do your best work; every part of you needed to build strong, meaningful and long-lasting relationships with your fellow Attesters, our clients and partners.

We champion our people in their entirety. With our team of Attesters, we take a human-first approach, optimising for joy and adventure, ingrained in everything we do.

We’re a friendly, collaborative team, and value putting people (our team, clients and consumers) first; honesty, curiosity, empowerment and leadership are core to our team working style. Decisions are made with careful and quick consideration at Attest, to support fast and efficient growth.

About Attest

We believe that great companies put consumers and data at the heart of every decision. These companies create better, more useful products and services, which leads to happier consumers and ever-greater success.

Through our Consumer Growth Platform, everyone can now gain answers to their questions from audiences of over 100 million consumers across 80 markets.

Our clients use Attest to learn more about their target consumers, enter new markets, build new categories, validate decisions, develop better products and services, measure their brand, track competition, all with the goal of driving sustained growth across the business.

Our clients include Heineken, Walgreens Boots, Samsung, Fever-Tree, Discovery, Transferwise, and Nutmeg, among many others.

We’re backed by leading VCs, including New Enterprise Associates (NEA) – the investors behind companies such as Uber, Salesforce, Box, and Tableau; Oxford Capital and Episode 1 (the investors behind LoveFilm, Zoopla, Betfair, Shazam, CarWow and many other greats); plus several high-powered amazing Angel investors.

Diversity statement

Diversity matters, and we celebrate it at Attest! We’re building an inclusive place to work where everyone feels they belong. We see you and you’re welcome here. Attest doesn’t discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic including race, religion or belief, gender or gender reassignment, age, sexual orientation, marital status, or disability.

We want to give everyone the opportunity to showcase their best selves during the interview process and beyond. Do let us know if there are any adjustments you’d like to make to ensure it’s more inclusive – we’re learning too, so we’re more than happy to adapt and accommodate where possible.

title: Data Analyst

role-description:
Buscamos un/a Data Analyst para formar parte de nuestro equipo de CRM.

Beneficios en gimnasios
Mango Talks mensuales sobre transformación digital, moda y la actividad de nuestros equipos.
Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido.
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo.
 You got it?

We like you!

title: Data Analytics Specialist
role-description:
Data Analytics Specialist/Scientist/Manager

Working within the Aircraft Cabin WiFi Team

Job brief

We are looking for a passionate certified Data Analyst to work within our exciting and ever changing Inflight Cabin Solutions team within the UK. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions that will help inform, grow and drive our business.

Data Analyst Job Duties

Data analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. Data analysts will work with our current operational and customer platforms, developing analysis and reporting capabilities for both internal and external stakeholders. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

The successful candidate will work with the Business unit team leads to communicate insights from the findings and assist in visualisation and narrative of these for internal and external consumption.

Responsibilities
Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Requirements
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc.), databases (SQL etc.), programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analysing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)
Knowledge of Sandvine/Prosera would be ideal
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics.

title: Product Analyst / Data Analyst
role-description:
Description

We are a marketplace for doctors & patients and provide practice management software to tens of thousands of doctors.

We serve 40 million patients to make over 1 million appointments with doctors each month. That makes us a market leader in 7 countries.

We believe in humility, radical honesty and results, not excuses.

We believe that if your passions and talents match the job, magic happens. Over 1500 of our team members make magic happen every day.

We also believe that “Any product that needs a manual to work is broken.”

We are looking for a Product Analyst in Barcelona.

The purpose of the Product Analytics team is to embed a true data and experimentation culture at Docplanner to empower smart decision making.

What You Will Do
Understand our users, customers and product. Together with researchers and product managers you will discover trends, relationships and opportunities in data. (Business understanding, Data understanding)
Create infrastructure for tracking, experimentation and analytics. We use Google tools (Analytics, Tag Manager, Optimize), Mixpanel, Airflow, Redshift and more. (Data collection, Data preparation)
Conduct data analysis with your favorite tool set and build awesome dashboards to share data insights within the teams (Data Analysis, BI)
Educate and support your product team in decision making. You will communicate the meaning behind the data to the team members and find ways to answer difficult questions with data (Deployment, Team working)


If You

Requirements
Have experience in digital analytics or data science,
Empathically understand the users,
Love to set KPIs and analyse product performance,
Become obsessed with answering difficult problems,
Are fascinated with data and knowledge,
Know the digital and data toolset (Web tracking tools, SQL, Python or R)


And This Sounds Like You
You want to solve problems, not just manipulate data,
You don’t like repetitive work,
You consider learning and creating knowledge natural,
You want to work with other people like you,

it means we should meet =)

Benefits

Competitive Salary,

Flexible working hours,

Private health insurance,

In-company Spanish & English classes,

GymForLess bonus,

Possibility to attend conferences and workshops of your interest,

International environment,

Free coffee, drinks, fruits and snacks,

State of the art technology (Apple or Windows to choose from at your discretion),

2 minutes away from the beach and next to the biggest mall in Barcelona,

Do video games or Oculus Rift mean something to you? Then our Gamer Room is meant for you!

title: Data Analyst Intern
role-description:
Position Purpose
Why Deliveroo?
When you first think about Deliveroo, you probably think of getting great
food to your house in less than half an hour. Awesome right? But behind the
scenes is the real story. This story is one of high growth, huge challenges
and an enormous opportunity ahead of us. It began with our founder Will,
arriving in London over 5 years ago and finding it almost impossible to
order great food, despite the wealth of incredible restaurants in the city.
Fast forward 5 years and we operate in 13 countries with over 50,000 riders
who deliver orders from 50,000 restaurants in over 200 cities worldwide.
And we’re just getting started
We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you
have a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. We
are already a multi-billion dollar company that is more than doubling in
size every year. Deliveroo came top in the FT’s’ list of Europe’s
fastest-growing 1000 companies in 2018, and we were the first company ever
to win Deloitte’s ‘UK Top 50’ two years in a row. Yet most of the
extraordinary value this company will generate lies ahead of us.
The Role
As a Data Science Analyst, you will be part of the Strategy Team of the
Commercial and Marketing Department. Your mission will consist mainly of
piloting our strategic projects, modelling complex situations to facilitate
decision-making and supporting teams in complex analyzes. We want to
provide the best possible service to our customers wherever we operate and
you will be a key player in that.

Your Responsibilities Include

Data Science Link Point
Deliveroo is a company built on Data Science / Big Data analytics. Numerous
analyses are conducted daily by our local teams as well as our Data Science
teams in London. The role will be to carry out such analyses and create a
link with the analyses made by our global teams.
Use your analytical skills to improve our business model - identifying
areas for improvement and being proactive
Pilot strategic projects - you will have a transversal responsibility and
will have to keep a very business-oriented vision
Identify and understand business opportunities - you will model
opportunities and propose an inventory of risks and costs so that we have
the expected returns
Support the other sales teams - keeping the necessary distance to
understand which are the most significant levers of action

Requirements
Masters degree in an engineering school/business school / or at university
Ideally, experience in consulting and / or projects related to the supply
chain/operations
Specialization in Data Science or complex analysis experiments
Required technical knowledge: SQL (necessary), R, Python, Javascript
Very strong analytical skills - able to handle large amounts of data,
extract relevant information to identify and solve problems
Good communicator - able to express ideas in a clear and concise way,
adapting to the public concerned
Highly organized and with a good sense of priorities - able to set up and
follow action plans and follow the "80/20" rule to make quick and effective
decisions
Open-minded - curious, able to give and defend his point of view, aligned
with the company's strategy
Strategist - able to "think big", share ideas and support the execution
Others: proficiency in English, excellent command of Excel, mastery of
python / SQL / VBA is highly appreciated

Benefits
The rare opportunity to change the world such that everyone around you is
using the product you have helped build. We're moving real assets and
reinventing the logistics of food delivery
Work in a fun, exciting company culture with people who enjoy what they are
doing
Being part of a team instigating the expansion of a global brand
The opportunity to make an impact and grow with the business
Regular off-sites with the team
Office lunches once a month and more than enough free food from Deliveroo
Life at Deliveroo
We are a growing team, with a very large impact, seeking to answer some of
the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, we’re always
looking for new ideas and we’re very transparent about the decisions we
make and why we make them. No solution is owned by a particular team, which
means the scope for growth and personal impact is enormous.
Benefits and Diversity
We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in
and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when
it comes to anyone of the things that make you who you are - your gender,
race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need
is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the
fastest-growing start-ups around.

title: Lead Instructor Data Analytics - Barcelona

Lead Instructor Data Analytics - Barcelona

Job Description

#About the Gig

We’re looking for a Lead Instructor for our Data Analytics Bootcamp witha passion for data and for sharing their knowledgein order to have an IMPACT in the Tech Talent Community. The Lead Instructor is someone who has a deep understanding of data analysis gathered from his/her educational journey and real-world experience. You need to be a strong communicator and very patient -- you will find yourself explaining many abstract and complex concepts in math and technology to the first-time data squads.

The Lead Instructor Will Be Responsible For
Overseeing the whole academic experience of an Ironhack bootcamp (from student selection to graduation).
Teaching at ourBarcelonaCampus- Near to the Beach & Pet Friendly
Managing Teaching Assistants RockStars (TAs)
Creating engaging content for our Data Analytics course that may include lessons, exercises and/or mini-projects
Lead instructor won't be needed to produce the curriculum. The curriculum is pre-made by our Global Education Team
The role includes2 months of non-teaching timeper year to work on in-house data projects or improve the data curriculum.

Requirements

#Is this You?
3-5+ years of experience in Data Analytics, Data Science, and/or Data Engineering, preferably with leadership roles
Solid understanding of and strong technical skills in Python, SQL, and R
Proficiency in building end-to-end data pipeline:
Writing Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) jobs to calculate business metrics
Understanding of APIs and Datawarehousing concepts
Familiarity with contemporary industry software and tools (e.g. Linux, git, AWS, Google Analytics, Jupyter)
A big plus if you have experience with one or more of the following:
Experience in Big Data architecture (e.g. Hadoop, Hive)
Experience in Analytics and business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlikview, MicroStrategy)
Experience in Dataviz (e.g. D3)
Experience in AI and machine learning
Passion for teaching: although we don’t require previous formal teaching experiences, we’re looking for people who will enjoy teaching, mentoring, and giving feedback for students.
Experience managing and keeping a team motivated. Can-do attitude and a good sense of humor.
Great communication skills and an ability to capture people’s attention :)
Fluent inEnglish

#Perks
Be part of an Amazing Team. We embrace a constant learning, can-do attitude and 100% positivism!!
Flexible work environment
Possibility of doing any of our part-time bootcamps
Macbook Pro
500€ annually for education budget
Annual company offsite
Ironbeers every Friday
Fresh Fruit
Ping Pong Tournaments
and much more!
#About Ironhack

Ironhack is an education startup that was founded to disrupt the way we learn about technology. It sucks that we’ve been learning the same way since the Industrial Revolution, so we empower students to find meaningful careers in software development or product design by offering immersive learning experiences to extremely motivated people.

Our higher purpose is to transform the education space by making it customer-centric and outcomes-driven. Students finish our program with a new way of thinking and approaching problems, resulting in new jobs, promotions at their current jobs, or companies they’ve built.

Quick Facts
Founded in 2013 by Wharton and Harvard grads
Operations in Barcelona, Madrid, Miami, Paris, Mexico City, Berlin, Amsterdam, Sao Paulo and Lisbon
100% YoY Growth (help us to keep it going!)
Graduated over 3,300 students
100+ global team members & venture capital backed

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
At Wallapop we are on a quest to help people with collaborative economy, and to make the world more sustainable by extending the life of products. Would you like to join the talented team that is crafting the system that makes this possible?

Wallapop takes pride in having an open culture, where every opinion matters, and everybody can contribute in many different ways. We believe that we don't hire people to fit in a job description. We hire people to find the best way to produce the most valuable work that they can do.

With more than 8 million searches per day, more than 200k uploaded items per day and a catalog of several tens of millions of products, Wallapop is the biggest second-hand marketplace in Spain with more than 10 million unique visitors per month (in other words we have to handle with concurrency challenges)

Wallapop's purpose is to empower people to promote a more conscious and human way of consumption.

Our Company Values Are
We are One Team: Respect, Transparency and Alignment.
We Dream & Deliver: Creative & Innovative, Passion and Risk Taking.
We Aim for Simplicity: User centricity and Focus on Essentials
We Learn & Grow: Curiosity and Empowerment
We are looking for a talented, experienced and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our Analytics team.

The Challenge

As a Data analyst you will be responsible for converting advanced data sets into insights for better decision making. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams of Product Owners, Developers and Designers, to deliver the best possible product solutions for Wallapop from conception to production.

Also, you’ll part of a growing Analytics team (8 people and counting) reporting to the Head of Analytics

The day to day involves
Understand business, marketing and/or product needs and leverage insights for taking decisions as a primary analyst
Be the owner in the KPI definition and A/B testing of new product features
Automate dashboards and reports
Develop ad-hoc statistical analysis and data exploration
We are looking for someone with
3+ years of experience as data analyst, business analyst, product analyst or similar role preferably for a web/mobile company
Strong statistical knowledge and ability to obtain insights from data: A/B testing, cohort analysis, customer LTV, ROI
Excellent SQL skills and Business Intelligence and visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, Qlikview, etc)
Experience programming in Python or some other languages like R
Classified industry knowledge/experience will be a plus
Who you are
Proactive and positive attitude, self-organized and an excellent team player
Communicative and empathic with stakeholders
Agile and innovative with the tenacity to thrive in a constantly changing environment
Excellent problem solving and critical thinking
Quality driven, attention to detail and pragmatic
Are you ready to join wallapop? We are waiting for you!

We offer
Flexible working hours
Half/day Fridays
Specialized training budget (2000€ per year)
English/Spanish lessons
Encouraging, fun and team-focused offsite trips twice a year
Team building activities
Free coffee, and free fresh fruit
Private Health Insurance (Cigna)
Gym discounts
Weekly Yoga and Boxing classes in the office
Other benefits paid from the gross salary (kindergarten check, food check, transport check).
You'll enjoy a 50% longer maternity/paternity leave
Referral Program, charity donation
Relocation package. International team (now 18 nationalities and counting)
All-new, modern and inspirational office space in 22@ District including rooftop
Experience: Mid-level

title: R&D Data Analyst
role-description:
As our R&D Data analyst, you will be joining the operations team and will responsible for the development of the analytics, KPIs that tracks the overall health of the product. You will be using new technologies to solve hard problems in a friendly and encouraging work environment. You will also be encouraged to share your experience and knowledge, sparring with your colleagues to grow together

Your Colleagues

Operations and R&D work as an autonomous team in Falcon with your colleagues present in all our R&D offices (Copenhagen, Budapest, Sofia). They are friendly, self-driven, and highly value critical thinking in their teammates. Apart from the R&D team, you will be building rapport with other key stakeholders in the business, like product managers, compliance teams, and CX.

What You’ll Do

You will be closely working with the operations specialists and BI, to build the relevant metrics needed to track the overall functioning of the product. You will eventually grow into responsibilities that will involve you looking into BI and improve the overall automation needed to improve product efficiency.

How You Will Do It
Partner with R&D teams, BI and leadership to develop a framework which will enable an increased ability to use data for informed decision making in R&D (and beyond)
Establish KPIs and metrics to track, measure and develop insights into: Process Flow Metrics - Velocity, Throughput, Efficiency Metrics, Maintenance costs/effort
Release tracking: use platform data to understand the effectiveness and value delivered by each product release
Track Customer Health & Product Health by understanding Adoption, Activation & Retention for each of our product modules and features
Build on top of the established BI ecosystem to develop and maintain operational reporting and dashboards for R&D, for example: R&D Financial dashboards, Development process metrics and lead indicators, Customer Health metrics, Release tracking and value delivered
Ensure a steady flow of product feedback and insights to help inform the priorities of R&D

What You Have
Extensive experience writing analytics queries in SQL
Experience with LookML highly desirable
Proficiency with Python, R, or other programming language desirable
Experience creating data visualisations for business users
An understanding of process metrics and indicators in a SaaS product
The ability to translate technical concepts into tangible business results
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proactive and naturally curious

NOTE: We are not expecting you to be an expert on all accounts but have sufficient knowledge to get hands-on with the above tech-stack.

Extra Points For
Experience working in a highly agile organization, involving several teams
An understanding of the agile software development lifecycle
Strong stakeholder management, across all levels of the organisation
Strong analytical mindset coupled with commercial understanding

What We Offer
You will join a multinational, open, and informal work environment.
Work at a central location in Copenhagen (the home of the best craft beer and bicycle lanes in Europe, also the most liveable city on the planet!)
Get a high level of responsibility, work with the newest technologies, and have room for experimentation
Work-life balance, flexible work hours and work from home options
Opportunities for L&D through sponsored conferences, e-learning and books
Choose your own gear (Laptop and phone + subscription)
Pension and health insurance
Healthy lunch and drinks daily
Healthy, and not so healthy, snacks. We take our candy seriously!
Friday bars and other social events

About Falcon.io

Falcon.io provides a unified SaaS platform for social media listening, engaging, publishing and managing customer data. We enable our clients to explore the full potential of digital marketing by managing multiple customer touch points from one platform. Our platform has already achieved great international traction in the market, with its technology endorsed by partnerships with Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

Founded as Falcon Social in Copenhagen in 2010, we offices in 6 different locations with 3 main offices (Copenhagen, Budapest & Sofia) dedicated to the R&D development. We’re a highly diverse team, and we’re always looking for passionate and curious people who want to be part of a fast-paced, high-energy environment.

For further queries and information please reach out to: jobs@falcon.io

title: DATA ANALYST/ MARKETING ANALYST/ BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST
role-description:
Full-time in Vienna at the earliest possible date

Start your career with Philip Morris International, the world's leading tobacco company! Since the foundation of Philip Morris Austria GmbH in 2012, the Austrian market has been developed even more intensively, with the clear aim of further expanding its market leadership. Become part of this success story and join our Data Team at the HQ in Vienna.

WE OFFER YOU
• A unique opportunity to join Philip Morris – and be part of the biggest transformation in the history of our company – to „Design a Smoke-Free Future“
• The opportunity to develop in a world-leading, international company.
• An inspiring working environment, flat hierarchies and an open-minded, team-oriented company culture.
• An all-in employment relationship with flexible working hours, various benefits, team events, various insurances, and much more.
• A basic salary of min. € 40,000/year gross, with willingness to negotiate overpayments in line with the market, depending on experience and qualifications.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
• You keep track of our data in the commercial area and function as an advisory interface between our teams.
• You analyze internal data and processes, initiate checks for irregular data and deviations, create reports and identify optimization potential.
• You organize coordination meetings and initiate relevant next steps.
• You support product launches in coordination with our management team.
• You are our Business Intelligence Key User and are familiar with relevant IT tools.

YOUR PROFILE
• You have successfully graduated in business informatics, IT or an equivalent field.
• You have more than 5 years of professional experience in a comparable position.
• Ideally, you have knowledge in project-based working and you are an expert in consulting teams and executives.
• You are familiar with databases and have experience with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau or similar).
• You preferably have knowledge of Python, R or comparable.
• You are communicative and open minded with analytical skills and an affinity for numbers.
• You are fluent in spoken and written English.

JOIN A GLOBAL MARKET LEADER
PMI is the world's leading international tobacco company, with six of the world's top 15 international brands and products sold in more than 180 markets. In addition to the manufacture and sale of cigarettes, including the number one global cigarette brand, and other tobacco products, PMI is engaged in the development and commercialization of Reduced-Risk Products ("RRPs"). RRPs is the term we use to refer to products that present, are likely to present, or have the potential to present less risk of harm to smokers who switch to these products versus continued smoking. We have a range of RRPs in various stages of development, scientific assessment and commercialization. Because our RRPs do not burn tobacco, they produce far lower quantities of harmful and potentially harmful compounds than found in cigarette smoke. For more information, see www.pmi.com and www.pmiscience.com.

title: Data Analyst - Advanced Analytics
role-description:
Apply Now

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in quantitative field (mathematics, quantitative methods, computer science, engineering, finance etc.); Advanced degree is a plus
Hands-on experience in reporting, data analytics, data engineering or business intelligence
At least one of the below skills
Strong data management skills with focus on database design, data quality management and data analysis of small to medium datasets, including hands-on experience with SQL and ETL software.
Good business modelling and programming skills using Excel, VBA.
Experience with building interactive visualization and BI platforms (R Shiny, Tableau/Qlikview/Power BI etc.)
Programming experience in R or Python will be a plus.Understanding of business environment and ability to translate business problems to analytical frameworks and technical end-products
Entrepreneurial mindset proactively thinking about potential improvements to how things are done
Ability to work collaboratively and self-driven in a diverse team environment, under tight deadlines and changing priorities
Good communication skills with the ability to communicate analytical and technical content
Business level fluency in both written and spoken English
Willingness to travel abroad
Who You'll Work With

You will be a part of McKinsey Analytics Wroclaw hub and a member of our global analytics community. As data analyst, you will interact and collaborate with McKinsey consultants, data scientists and data engineers.

In McKinsey Analytics we shape the future of what data-driven organizations look like, creating new lines of thinking within a diverse range of clients and situations. We help clients harness data to solve their toughest challenges and pride ourselves on fostering an atmosphere of ongoing learning and development for those seeking to constantly enhance their capabilities and knowledge.
What You'll Do

As a skilled storyteller with a passion for data, you will analyze and evaluate data to create concepts, prototypes and iterate on ideas effectively balancing quality and time factors.

Leveraging your visualization and data analysis skills, you will create the foundations for sound client recommendations. In doing this, you will manage the data cleaning pipeline, apply analytic methodologies and data visualization techniques, generate insights and communicate them back to the team. Your end-products will include business models, scenario planners, reporting dashboards or data visualizations. You may be expected to travel to other McKinsey offices.

Working on projects and exchanging experiences with your colleagues means you will face new intellectual challenges, while continuously building your methodological knowledge and skills. Growing in the role will also create opportunities to coach junior colleagues and contribute to team strategy on knowledge and capability development.

We are recruiting both junior and senior profiles, so the role will be calibrated during the recruiting process based on candidate’s experience.

engagement, creation of complete member profiles, accurate identification of the

title: Senior Data Analyst - London, UK
role-description:
Quizlet’s mission is to help students (and their teachers) practice and master whatever they are learning. Every month more than 50 million active learners from 130 countries practice and master more than 300 million study sets on every conceivable topic and subject. We are developing new learning experiences by modeling how students learn and drawing upon knowledge acquisition, retention, and pedagogy in cognitive science. We are always seeking to help students master any subject by optimizing study efficiency and engagement.

We're looking for a quantitative Senior Data Analyst to drive inquiry and informed decisions in our international markets. Someone who is passionate about analytics and wants to help shape the future of our international playbook at Quizlet. Our team is scrappy, focused on results and self-starters who drive the understanding, growth, and success of the product. We serve in a pivotal role, identifying as well as driving inquiry on behalf of leaders at the company.

Quizlet is located in San Francisco, CA and Denver CO. and our London team is our first outside the United States.

The Role
Working directly with Quizlet’s Country Manager to partner in strategy and growth in new or existing markets.
Important role to help define the growth strategy of Quizlet's first international office.
Explore, understand, and own the entire international user lifecycle, including acquisition, retention, and Lifetime value.
Measure the success of paid marketing and email campaigns, as well as other product growth initiatives, with various tools such as A/B testing.
Foster a strong data culture as the first data hire in the new London office.
Drive maturity and excellence in the way we measure the success of our business.

Required Qualifications
Advanced SQL skills, including highly developed QA skills and ability to write the most efficient, optimized code.
Experience coding in Python including modeling and forecasting techniques.
Experienced, practical knowledge of running A/B tests.
Strong communicator: effectively synthesize, visualize, and communicate your ideas to others.
Deep understanding of the analytics toolkit, including funnels, cohort analyses, long-term trends, user segmentation, regression models, and more.
5+ years of experience in analytics.
Degree in Math, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative fields.

Preferred Qualifications
Experience with BigQuery, Airflow, and Periscope
2+ years running analytics at a consumer internet company

We hope you are excited about everything you read so far. We highly encourage you to apply for this position, even if you feel you do not meet all the requirements. Quizlet is always looking for amazing folks that believe in our mission and can contribute to our team in various ways - not merely candidates that fit a certain mold.

Quizlet's Team Culture

We are here to make education better and more accessible. We strive to improve the lives of students and teachers at every stage and in every setting. We have a bias for action, take initiative, and hustle to deliver results. We make informed decisions whenever possible but are unafraid to take calculated risks on great ideas to promote learning. We embrace challenges and see effort as the path to mastery. We’re constantly seeking opportunities to learn and we embrace curiosity. Quality matters at Quizlet, and we hold the bar high on everything we do. We sweat the details and take personal accountability and pride in anything that carries the Quizlet name. We speak up, jump in and work with each other to fix problems, and never say "that's not my job." We treat each other with honesty and respect, encourage vigorous debate, and seek critical feedback. We value diversity, humility, transparency, and collaboration as the best paths to our success — as individuals, as a team, and as a company.

Quizlet’s success as an online learning community depends on a strong commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion. We are actively working to build a team that is representative of the diverse communities we serve, and an open, inclusive work environment where all employees can thrive. As an equal opportunity employer and a tech company committed to societal change, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ+ community, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Come join us!

title: Financial Data Analyst - Paris
role-description: Chez Back Market , nous avons à cœur de promouvoir un nouveau mode de consommation favorisant l’économie circulaire tout en luttant contre le gâchis électronique et l’obsolescence programmée.1ere marketplace européenne (et bientôt mondiale !!!) dédiée exclusivement à la vente de produits électroniques reconditionnés, nous connectons professionnels certifiés (usines de reconditionnement, distributeurs, etc..) donnant une seconde vie à vos équipements et clients à la recherche de qualité, d’accessibilité et d’un type de consommation plus écologique.Ce que l'on recherche au sein de Back Market? Une bonne dose d'humour, respect et bienveillance, un amour pour les lapins, un peu de zèle et une réelle expertise dans ton domaine ! Pour la bonne personne, c’est l’occasion de participer à la construction d’une marketplace de premier plan, directement dans l'équipe au cœur de l’innovation : le Bureau Of Technology. Tu veux en savoir plus sur l'organisation des équipes techniques et les features teams. : Un peu de lecture. Travaillant au sein de l’équipe BI, tu participeras à la croissance et à la rentabilité de Back Market grâce à une exploitation innovante et intelligente de notre data.Basé dans notre bureau Parisien ou Bordelais, tu travailleras particulièrement avec l'équipe Finance de Back Market afin de mettre à disposition des dashboards et analyses leur permettant de prendre les meilleures décisions. Tu seras donc au coeur du réacteur ! Reportant à notre Head of BI, tes missions incluront : * Utiliser la donnée (financière et autre) pour aider au pilotage de l’activité et améliorer les process existants avec notamment :-La modélisation de nos échecs de paiement pour réduire leur coûts associés et ainsi augmenter le CA de backmarket-la création de modèle pour détecter les marchands & les clients à risque-La création de reporting (financiers, comptable, …) * Automatiser la production et restitution des dashboards / KPIs * Accompagner les autres départements de Backmarket, sur leurs besoins et leurs problématiques de finance opérationnelle (tu aideras sur la bonne gestion des paiements, tu accompagneras les lancements de produits côte Finance, tu créeras des deposits sur des balances virtuelles et tu mapperas les nouveaux flux…) * Aider à la mise en place de nouveaux process, de KPI et d'alertes pour intégrer les nouveaux services aux clients (ex : services d'assurances) et aux marchands (ex : sous-traitance de services logistiques) dans nos suivis financiersCe que nous recherchons * Tu as au moins 3 ans d’expérience sur un poste et un secteur similaires * Tu as une formation Bac +5, Ecole d’ingénieur ou de commerce * Tu as une vraie appétence au secteur de la finance * Tu fais preuve d'une grande rigueur * Tu es quelqu'un de transparent, qui communique aisément sur tes avancées et tes difficultés * Tu as un esprit d’entrepreneur, tu es ouvert d’esprit et tu as envie de te dépasser * English is a no brainer for you :) * SQL et Tableau n'ont aucun secret pour toi, snowflake, looker, alteryx, python, airflow, dataiku, ELK seraient un plus * Tu as à cœur de rendre nos clients heureux * Tu aimes faire des choses concrètes et mettre les mains dans le cambouis * Tu sais prioriser, prendre soin des détails et la pression ne te fait pas peur * Tu as soif d’apprendre et tu veux t’immerger dans une startup en très forte croissance * Tu es un fantastique coéquipier qui aime travailler en équipe, apprendre des autres et partager ses connaissanceProcess de recrutement :- 1er entretien téléphonique avec Stéphane, notre chargé de recrutement- Test technique - Entretien avec Marie, notre head of BI- Entretien avec Pauline, notre Head of finances- Entretien avec Quentin, notre CTO et Thibaud, notre CEO Sauve la planète.. Rejoins Back Market !

title: Data Analyst - London
role-description:
Position Purpose

About The Team

Data sits at the heart of Revolut and plays a uniquely crucial role in what
we do. With data we build intelligent real-time systems to personalise our
product, tackle financial crime, automate reporting, track team
performances and enhance customer experiences.
Fundamentally, data underpins all operations at Revolut and being part of
the team gives you the chance to have a major impact across the company –
apply today to join our world class data department.
What we need
We are looking for smart and ambitious people who would help us understand
our data better. We are creating a centralised team of business analysts
who will be working with all teams across the company. This is a unique
opportunity to learn about all aspects of our business. Your main weapons
will be SQL, dashboards, and a thorough understanding of our business. You
will also be acting as a bridge between product owners and engineers.
What you will be doing
Understand our business and its processes through our data
Apply this understanding and knowledge of our data to help product teams
Come up with key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Create and maintain new aggregated views and tables to simplify data
querying
Maintain and create new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promote data literacy across the company, organise and hold workshops
What you will need
Strong SQL skills, experience with analytical databases is a plus
Datadriven storytelling and visualisation
Attention to detail
Empathy and compassion
Experience coding in Python is a plus
A Little About Us
We believe that there are better ways for people to control their money.
Easier, fairer ways.
Revolut started in 2015 with fee-free card transactions abroad. We’ve since
added current accounts, business accounts, savings, insurance, and even
cryptocurrency trading.
We reached 4 million customers in February 2019 and we’re adding another
million every quarter.
And we’re only just getting started.
Come and help Revolut build the world’s first truly global bank.
What we are looking for
From employee 1 to employee 1000, you will be slotting into a global team
that shares a number of traits.
You can work autonomously and take ownership. We thrive with the space and
responsibility to solve problems.
You operate best without lots of bureaucracy. We don’t hide behind fancy
job titles or clunky processes ‘because that’s how things are done’.
You approach work in a logical way. We are not afraid to make mistakes but
we use data and logic to backup decisions and improve understanding.
And you share our mission to improve people’s relationship with their
money.
The benefits
Competitive salary
Biannual equity bonuses
All the latest tech you need
Skip the commute and work from home once a week
Roll with a free Revolut Metal subscription
Pension plan
Private health insurance
Don’t panic about cooking: get free dinners with Deliveroo
Start the day properly with fresh fruit and cereals
Stay refreshed: get juice, tea, coffee and soft drinks on tap
Rest up with 29 days’ holiday per year

title: Data Analyst - F/H
role-description:
Votre rôle et votre mission

Votre futur environnement de travail
Au sein de notre filère Conseil, vous intégrerez notre équipe Intégration, Innovation, Industrie en Cybersécurité. Vous serez encadré
e par des Consultant
e
s expérimenté
e
s et suivi
e par votre tuteur
riche tout au long de votre stage. Vous interviendrez auprès de nos clients multi-secteurs d'activités sur des sujets de sécurité fonctionnelle des SI au sein de projets complexes à forts enjeux.

Les missions du stage
Vous interviendrez au sein d'un projet phare de l'Innovation, consistant au développement expérimental d'un système de détection de cyberattaques inconnues au sein du SOC. Le système à ce jour repose sur une approche par apprentissage non-supervisé, à base de features extraits des logs proxy. Des systèmes complémentaires à base de supervisé sont envisagés en vue d'opérationnalisation.

Votre mission consistera à assister le développement du système, depuis la conception de features en passant par sa mise en oeuvre jusqu'à sa mesure et à son analyse de performances. Vous pourrez être amené(e) à présenter et communiquer sur le projet.

En dehors du projet, vous serez amené
e à participer aux différents travaux et initiatives de l'équipe.
Technos utilisées
Développement : python, ScikitLearn, C,
Machine learning (supervisé et non supervisé) :
BI et Data Mining tools
Mathématiques (statistiques et probabilités notamment)

Les apports du stage
Déployer une méthodologie de Data Science et Machine Learning appliquée à la Cyber
Découvrir l'ensemble des activités liées à la cybersécurité grâce à notre vision 360
Bénéficier d'une formation technique chaque semaine, où vous pourrez alors interagir avec notre réseau d'experts
Profiter du soleil toulousain !
Rejoindre une entreprise engagée : les Soirées Cyber, Women in Cyber, le Hack, le FIC!
Démarrer votre carrière chez l'un des leaders européens de la Cybersécurité

Votre profil

En dernière année d'école d'Ingénieurs ou de Master Informatique, vous êtes intéressé
e par la diversité des expertises Cybersécurité et souhaité y développer vos compétences de Data Science.
Vous êtes curieux
se, autonome et avez l'esprit d'équipe. Vous êtes également capable de vulgarisation avec des connaissances en Machine Learning.
Un bon niveau d'anglais est préférable.

A compétences égales, tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.

A propos de nous

Sopra Steria, l'un des leaders européens du conseil, des services numériques et de l'édition de logiciels, aide ses clients à mener leur transformation digitale et à obtenir des bénéfices concrets et durables. Il apporte une réponse globale aux enjeux de compétitivité des grandes entreprises et organisations, combinant une connaissance approfondie des secteurs d'activité et des technologies innovantes à une approche résolument collaborative. Sopra Steria place l'humain au centre de son action et s'engage auprès de ses clients à tirer le meilleur parti du digital pour construire un avenir positif. Fort de 45 000 collaborateurs dans 25 pays, le Groupe a réalisé un chiffre d'affaires de 4,1 milliards d'euros en 2018.
The world is how we shape it. A l'heure où les cyber-menaces sont de plus en plus nombreuses et complexes, les entreprises doivent les anticiper et se protéger. La division « Cybersécurité » compte 250 experts à Paris et Toulouse. Elle accompagne ses clients grands comptes pour apporter des solutions sur de prévention, de détection et de réaction. Intégrez nos équipes de passionnés en Cybersécurité pour aborder de nouveaux challenges !

title: Data Analyst Business Intelligence (m/f/d) - Munich, Germany
role-description:
The Westwing mission is to inspire and make every home a beautiful home. We are on a quest to bring the wonders of eCommerce for home & living to our more than 900,000 customers in 11 countries. In only 8 years on the market, we have grown to more than 254 million Euros in annual revenue. More importantly, the opportunity ahead of us is massive.

The Westwing team is the secret to our success. Our more than 1,100 team members balance creativity and style with innovative technology and strong business fundamentals. We are proud to be working with inspiring colleagues who are smart, fun, ambitious, and looking for the challenge to transform an industry and take it into the future.

Do you think this could be you? To pursue our ambitious growth strategy, we are looking for a Business Intelligence Data Analyst (m/f/d). In this position, you will use your excellent analytical skills to provide actionable insights supporting our Management team and Business Departments to make data-driven decisions.

Your Responsibilities Will Be
Provide analytical expertise and actionable insights to support our Management team and Business Departments to make data-driven decisions
Establish and constantly improve reporting tools for business stakeholders, in order to support data-driven decision
Conduct ad-hoc analyses and present the results with passion and brevity to stakeholders, both visually and verbally
Develop and advance analytical models

You Come With
A passion for identifying and solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches and for translating your insights into data-driven and actionable recommendations
Ability to balance a fast-paced working environment with the need for precision. Yet, being able to apply a high degree of pragmatism to solve data challenges and get fast results if needed
Excellent skills in SQL, Excel and Tableau (or any equivalent visualization software). Additional programming skills (e.g. R, Python) or basic experience with setting-up ETL processes and working with Google Analytics data are a plus
At least two years of practical experience in the area of Business Intelligence / Data Analysis / Data Science
Excellent communication and presentation skills including fluent business English

We Offer

A highly talented, dynamic, and international team
Entrepreneurial experience in a leading eCommerce company
An attractive compensation package

title: Data Analytics Internship
role-description:
G-Research is a leading quantitative research and technology company. By using the latest scientific techniques, we produce world-beating predictive research and build advanced technology to analyse the world's data.

The role

This is a great opportunity gain experience in the growing field of data analytics while making a real contribution to the quality of decision making in a market-leading company.

Data is at the heart of our business. The ability to use the information available to us to drive management decisions is a core driver of competitive advantage for the firm, making our data analytics team a key function in the firm.

Our team operates a world-class business information platform using Tableau, Alteryx and other tools to create a set of dynamic and highly available reports used across the firm from individual teams to senior management.

In This Role You Will
Use your analytical skills and business acumen to source, analyse and visualise a wide range of data
Meet with stakeholders to scope requirements
Use a range of analytical and statistical techniques to answer questions using data
Present findings and recommendations based on your analysis
Who are we looking for?

We Are Looking For a Strong Undergraduate Or Masters Student In a Numerical Subject In Their Penultimate Year Of Study At a Top Tier Institution Who
Is enthusiastic about data visualisation and can demonstrate interest in data/statistical analysis
Has excellent problem-solving ability
Has good communication skills and is able to work effectively as part of a team
Has a self-starting attitude and willingness to learn
Although exposure to specific applications or technical languages is not required, experience with Python, Matlab, Excel, R, Excel, Tableau, Alteryx or similar languages/applications would be a positive.

Why should you apply?
Highly competitive compensation
Informal dress code and excellent work/life balance
Comprehensive healthcare and life assurance
25 days holiday pro-rata
Cycle-to-work scheme
Subsidised gym membership
Monthly company events
Central London office close to 5 stations and 6 tube lines
Additional Information

This internship is available for 3 or 6 months, ending in September 2020. We are exclusively looking for those in their penultimate year of University with a view of converting strong performers into full time employees in 2021.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
WHO WE ARE

Here at Bellabeat we are dedicated to helping women achieve well-being through beautiful designed products based on technology. We’ve positioned ourselves as a growing force within the women’s wellness category with ambitious goals in the following years. As a highly motivated team of young people, we’re looking for like-minded individuals who want to make a valuable difference and understand the importance of both physical and mental health.
With a pet-friendly office environment it’s hard to pass a full day without a smile on your face. There’s also free coffee, snacks and fun office get-togethers. ●  Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data

SKILLS AND QUALITIES REQUIRED

Experience in data mining

Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills

WORK ATMOSPHERE and PEAKS

Beautiful new office in the center of the city, Fun work events, Flexible working hours, Pet-friendly office space
Multinational team of young professionals
A lot of room for creativity and new ideas
Working with teams around the globe and (occasional) opportunity to travel

title: Data Insights Analyst
role-description:
Back to search

Data Insights Analyst
Solihull, West Midlands, United Kingdom

Data Insights Analyst

Up to £50,000 per annum (dependent on experience) plus a range of benefits including 25 days annual leave, life assurance, an online benefits platform with a wide variety of discounts, and more…

Purplebricks is a unique hybrid estate agency. Having successfully disrupted the market with a strong focus and utilisation of technology and data, we are now the UK’s largest estate agent, selling more homes than anyone else in the market

We’re proud to be an official partner of Team GB and will be showing our support for the nation’s Olympic athletes in the run up to 2020. Our mission is simple: to be the best and most loved place for customers to buy, sell, and let their homes. We will achieve this through our amazing people – our #TeamPB – and by living our Purple Promises, which bring us together and ensure we live and breathe the same beliefs and values.

What does ‘Digital’ at Purplebricks look like?

Our ever-growing Digital team is made up from Design, Engineering, Infrastructure and Product experts. Our beanbags, sofas, mini fridges and standing desks create a relaxed environment in our Shirley headquarters – supporting our culture of trying new things, failing fast, and being open about our successes and struggles. You’ll be joining a team with a clearly defined product strategy led by a solid and experienced leadership team at the helm.

What will your day to day look like?

Intelligent use of data is central to our strategy at Purplebricks. As Data Insights Analyst you will be at the forefront of BI evangelism, upskilling the business in use of data and how it can help make better informed decisions. You should be highly skilled in manipulating and analysing data sets from a variety of sources and proficient at highlighting key metrics and presenting insight and recommendations in a confident, concise and easy to digest manner

You'll build and implement data solutions to provide deeper analysis and valuable insights to unlock opportunities and drive informed business decisions. You will use the data to communicate key insights through internal reports, presentations and dashboards. You will ensure the use of data is compliant to GDPR standards (and local legislation) and that best practices are applied. You will contribute to the design, implementation and delivery of a digital Business Intelligence strategy supporting the product and design functions and the wider Digital team.

What do we look for in a Data Insights Analyst?

Required
Excellent presentation, oral and written communication skills with the ability to explain complex analysis results and processes to non-technical audiences in a clear and positive manner
Strong analytical and quantitative skills
Ability to manage multiple projects at once, showing task prioritisation and ownership
Attention to detail and ability to work with and combine multiple data sources to answer key business questions
Knowledge of database structures and relational databases
Experience working with complex datasets from a variety of sources
Strong skills in data cleansing, reformatting and wrangling
Strong SQL skills
Strong visualisation skills
Desirable
GA360 and Optimise 360 preferable
If this sounds like you, please apply by clicking the link below.

We look forward to hearing from you!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, ex-service personnel status, or disability status.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
ClarusONE Sourcing Services, LLP, provides strategic generic pharmaceutical services for both Walmart Stores, Inc. and McKesson Corporation.

This is a natural next step for the companies, which have more than two decades of history working together to improve the quality and lower the cost of pharmaceutical care to patients.

This new partnership will leverage McKesson’s demonstrated strength and expertise in global pharmaceutical sourcing in conjunction with Walmart’s strength and commitment to delivering leading health and wellness services to their customers.

As part of this arrangement, McKesson and Walmart have established this organisation in London to provide strategic sourcing services for both companies.

Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: London, United Kingdom

Job Purpose

The Data Analyst will support, manage and deliver reporting, analytics and insight that enable a wide range of strategic business decision processes. They will support all areas of the business in driving business growth, reducing waste and supporting automation though the use of appropriate data.

This role will work in collaboration with both internal and external stakeholders to provide data expertise and support the ongoing demand for new or enhanced data sets.

Responsibilities
Leverage visualisation tools and technology resources to plan, evaluate and execute strategic initiatives; design, build and support data solutions and dashboards conducive for business insights, reporting and analytics
Lead the development of dashboards and reports that compile, analyse, and report on data using multiple technologies (SQL, Tableau, etc); gather requirements and modelling criteria leveraging agile methodology
Apply various analytical techniques (i.e. mathematical models and/or statistical techniques) to support business growth
Leverage analytics and dashboards to create effective supplier-facing and internal communication materials
Assist in the development of team, departmental, and organisation metrics to analyse business performance and identify areas of opportunity
Be an advocate and champion of the ClarusONE data and information assets
Use supporting data to address key questions and concerns; partner with internal clients to identify and measure opportunities for relationship with Clarus
Support the development of metrics needed to accurately manage performance
Analyse opportunities for Clarus to expand product sales, services, and sourcing strategies while examining market channels and exploring innovative business opportunities
Manage the compilation, analysis, and reporting of data to forecast trends, apply various analytical techniques (i.e. mathematical models and/or statistical techniques) to support supplier and cost optimisation.
Analyse purchasing trends and generic launch conversions to provide clear internal guidance with product conversion strategies
Evaluate business performance and analyse impact to market share ensure Clarus ability to exceed targets
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, partners and internal clients
Manage delivery and support objectives of the ClarusONE
Leverage strong analytical capabilities, problem solving skills to make recommendations based on data
Demonstrate the ability to quickly identify solutions to complex problem
Present ideas and recommendation to various level in the organisation
Collaborate with all team members to problem solve and create solution
(The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties.)

Requirements

Education
Bachelor Degree level or above

Minimum Skills/Experience
Strong level and experience in data query language/tools (e.g. SQL, Alteryx). Direct experience of Alteryx would be preferable.
Experience with visualisation tools such as Tableau, Qliview, SAS, Business Objects & Power BI. Direct experience of Tableau would be preferable.
Experience with database technologies and concepts (Snowflake, Oracle, Teradata, SAP HANA, DB2, PostGres, SQL Server)
Expertise of data design and analysing data requirements

Additional Knowledge/Skills
Strong experience of Excel with skills in V-lookups, pivot tables, reporting and macro programming
Experience with data performance optimisation
Experience of Life Sciences/Pharmaceutical business

title: Data Scientist - Stress-Testing Data Analytics
role-description:
BNP Paribas is a leading European bank with an international reach. It has a presence in 73 countries, with more than 192,000 employees – including more than 146,000 in Europe and over 4,000 in Portugal alone.

BNP Paribas is present in Portugal since 1985, having been one of the first foreign banks to operate in the country. Today, BNP Paribas has several entities operating directly in this territory, offering a wide range of integrated financial solutions to support its clients and their businesses.

Worldwide, the Group has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. The Group helps all its clients (individuals, community associations, entrepreneurs, SMEs, corporate and institutional clients) to realise their projects through solutions spanning financing, investment, savings and protection insurance.

Department Overview

The team named STFS, for Stress Testing and Financial Synthesis, coordinates the strengthening of BNP Paribas’ Stress-Testing (S/T) and planning capabilities so as to better serve Business Lines, Legal Entities and Group needs and meet supervisory requirement on these matters, and in a cost-efficient manner.

To that effect, STFS aims at building a flexible, industrialized, central utility accessible by BNP Paribas’ Business Lines and Entities (B/E) for their local needs and their contribution to Group exercises. STFS offers an integrated S/T service to B/Es to support them in capitalizing on the shared framework for their local needs.

Within the STFS platform, Stress-Testing Data Analytics (STDA) is the STFS data model owner for the S/T platform, and provides STFS with the data necessary for modelling activities and S/T exercises.
STDA develops Datamarts for Stress Testing on the RISK & Finance shared Big Data platform.
In addition to data crushing and data analysis, STDA works jointly with IT Group on the automation of data ingestion, code processing, and data visualization processes. The team is the entry point of IT Group concerning data navigation and statistical exploration (DATAIKU) as well as data visualization (TABLEAU).
STDA serves other STFS teams with statistical analyses based on historical data.
STDA is in charge of the monitoring of the data quality.

Role And Responsibilities

The STDA team in Lisbon is dedicated to credit and works in a one-team manner with the STDA team based in Paris.

The team is looking for a data analyst, also the primary focus will be on the development, maintenance and testing of STDA datamarts in a Big Data environment.

Appetite for the credit data functional content and understanding of stress tests modelling team requirements are a must.

This Includes The Following Processes

The objective is to set up Datamarts for STFS to be able to stress capital and cost of risk on the credit risk perimeter of the bank.
Data ingestion, Data quality, Data preparation with DATAIKU DSS (Data Science Studio)
Data visualization with TABLEAU
Specific contributions to regulatory and internal stress testing exercises
PROFILE

To be successful in this role, the candidate should meet the following requirements:
Junior (0-3 years experiences - willingness to consider recent graduates) with strong desire to learn
Strong academic background, with a Master degree
Skills: significant experience in data exploration and data preparation. Good knowledge of SQL. Experience with PYTHON programming language is a plus.
Knowledge of Risk Management principles is a plus.
Languages: fluent in English
Strong interest in data management and functional content of the data
Ability to work with tight deadlines and multidisciplinary teams
In addition, the candidate should have the following essential behavioral skills:
Autonomy & Adaptability
Strong curiosity
Result oriented
This role will expose the candidate to a wide range of professionals within the bank. Therefore, communication skills, both written and verbal, play an essential part in the day-to-day role
The candidate should be available for periodic training abroad (short term in Paris).

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

role-description:
MaaS Global is the world’s first true Mobility-as-a-Service (MaaS) operator with its award-winning Whim app, which provides users all city transport services in one app. With over 4 million trips made since its launch in December 2017, Whim is the first all-inclusive MaaS solution commercially available on the market. Whim allows users to journey where and when they want with public transport, taxis, rental cars, and many other options, all under a single monthly subscription. Whim has revolutionized users’ travel habits, in favor of circular modes. We are doing something revolutionary and we are seeking people that want to be part of this.
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Helsinki to become a member of our analytics team. The main goal of our analytics team is to support the development of the Whim application and live operations by providing insights through data analysis. In this role, you will provide an analytical perspective to the various projects taking place at MaaS Global. To succeed, you should be a self-driven, creative individual who has good business and technical skills as well as customer-centric mindset. You should also be passionate about increasing the level of customer insight in the company, and driving forward data-based decision making.

Support various teams in their decision making by providing a data-based, analytical perspective.
Work closely together with the product team and provide them with insights and ideas for further development and innovations.
Support day-to-day operations by answering different ad-hoc questions from other teams based on data.
Create reports on key insights for internal and external parties.
Proactively follow key performance measures.
Help automating internal and external reporting.
Understand and model user behavior.

title: Data Insights Analyst

Job Description
The focus of the role is working directly with the business to deliver actionable and timely customer, marketing and commercially relevant insights from analytics of internal and external data. The implications of the insight help to drive a data-driven business strategy and impact day-to-day trading performance and longer term strategic planning.

You will use your expert analytical capability aligned with business knowledge to provide the best analytics solutions to achieve business objectives. You will have a proven track record of delivering actionable insights which create business impact and have knowledge of best practise customer data analysis techniques.

You will also be passionate about data visualisation and storytelling to share the data back with the business; you will be skilled in condensing large volumes of data into simple, actionable and commercially valuable insights for the business.
  You will also work closely with the business and build relationships with key stakeholders across a diverse range of business units, partnering with key areas of the business to drive their data driven insight agenda and supporting them hitting their short and long term plans. You will develop analytical work plans and scope projects to interrogate relevant data and information to help solve key business challenges and find opportunities. You will enjoy using your consultative skills and deep analysis expertise to develop and deliver significant customer insights and concepts, defining implications and providing relevant recommendations to business leaders.

Purpose of the position

This role will be involved in the development and maintenance of our Single View of the Customer (SVC) database. The role will be critical to ensure BSI has the best possible and most accurate data to help drive key business analytics and strategic decisions.

This position comes with a 10% Bonus

Key Responsibilities & Accountabilities
Supporting the maintenance, update and development of our SQL Single View of the Customer (SCV) database to accommodate constantly changing business needs. This includes combining all customer and prospect transactions, at contact, site and company level
Integrating third party data sources with BSI’s own
Develop, maintain, update and improve SSAS cubes including data mining capabilities.
Collaborate on engagement with all countries / streams / sectors / business functions to provide functional self-serve data sources that will enable them to gain insight and make data driven decisions by allowing them interrogate their data and gain answers to business / strategic questions
Integrate data and reporting capabilities with frontline systems (e.g. Salesforce, marketing automation, SAP)
Work closely with the Business Intelligence team, to leverage best data available to generate insights and to deliver results from modelling / analytics via the most appropriate channels to enable the business to access and use the data effectively whilst ensuring that results can be tracked and monitored
Collaborate with the Data team, advising the rest of the team and relevant stakeholders across BSI on best data to use to inform different business decisions and purposes, providing the data as appropriate and suggesting new data uses based on data analysis and findings.
Manage user setup / access rights to reporting tools and data feeds, ensuring that they comply with data governance polices
Input into documentation of data processing definitions
Collaborate on preparation and maintenance of system data dictionary’s
Create and maintain complex SQL queries to extract data efficiently from relational databases. Optimizing existing queries for improved performance
Identify critical data not currently available for extraction and offer potential solutions
Do you believe the world deserves excellence?

As the leading global business standards company BSI helps 84,000 clients worldwide to improve their businesses. From business continuity to recycling waste, from medical devices to the exploration of space, we help businesses embed the habits of excellence so that they perform better, manage their risks more effectively and achieve sustainable growth and in doing so we touch the lives of many across the globe.

What We Offer

We offer a highly competitive starting salary with 27 days annual leave with the opportunity to increase this to 30 days, company-paid private medical insurance, an excellent company-contributed pension scheme, and a wide range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your life-style. Plus, as we’re situated just above Gunnersbury Tube station it makes for a really easy commute, or you can use the free on-site parking if you’d prefer to drive.

Review our full standard benefits HERE

We carefully consider agile ways of working that allow for the best impact for our employees and clients. If the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated below, we are happy to discuss further.

About You

Proven technical expertise regarding database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques and s trong data and business analytical skills, including a thorough understanding of business needs and how to translate them into requirements for best practices and incorporate them into technical solutions.

You will also need to be able to appreciate the wider flow of data and data lifecycle, and how your own role relates to other roles and to the overall business and have s trong problem solving skills

In Addition You'll Be
Good communicator at all levels
