role-description:
Cape Analytics uses AI and geospatial imagery to provide instant property intelligence for buildings across the United States. Cape Analytics enables insurers and other property stakeholders to access valuable property attributes at time of underwriting—with the accuracy and detail that traditionally required an on-site inspection, but with the speed and coverage of property record pre-fill. Founded in 2014, Cape Analytics is backed by leading venture firms and innovative insurers, and comprised of computer vision and risk analysis experts.

Position Summary

At the heart of our highly scalable, state-of-the-art machine learning models lies large amounts of human-annotated data (ground truth) used for training and testing our models. Accurate data is crucial for our models to perform well. Scalability is another important aspect, which is why we outsource most of the ground truth generation to our contractors. We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst who will own and manage the ground truth generation pipeline end-to-end. S/he will be the contact person for everything ground truth related, from training our contractors on new taxonomies to quantifying the data accuracy and developing new methods to improve it. Strong communication skills, scientific approach, strong foundation in statistics, data analysis and data management will be critical to success. S/he must be at ease working in an agile environment with full ownership and little supervision. This person should embody a passion for continuous improvement, automation and data quality.

What You'll Do
Take mental ownership of our ground truth pipeline and help us extend its functionality to support the development of innovative new products. Coordinate with multiple teams at Cape to meet short-term and long-term objectives.
Design and implement methods to quantify and improve ground truth data accuracy in collaboration with the data scientists.
Design and experiment new ways for more accurate and efficient ground truth generation.
Participate in creating and updating taxonomies for machine learning models. Create documentation for taxonomies and train the ground truth contractors.
Evaluate ground truth contractors and provide them feedback to keep high quality standards.
Leverage the feedback from the contractors to improve the taxonomy definitions, and collaborate with the engineering team to improve the tools for data collection and management.
Triage and report bugs throughout our data pipeline.
Take ownership of communicating changes to the appropriate end-users.
Maintain comprehensive documentation of data, definitions, tables, and schemas across multiple systems.
Build and support visualization and exploration capabilities around our data sets.
Contribute to constantly improving data quality/quality assurance best practices.
Skills/Requirements:
BS (MS is preferred) in Statistics, Analytics, Computer Science or related STEM fields.
Excellent critical thinking, troubleshooting and analytical problem-solving abilities.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must be able to create clear documentations, communicate with off-shore contractors and with multiple teams at Cape.
Solid foundation in Statistics and Data Analysis.
Coding Skills: Python, SQL.

We Believe

Talent is critical, but best when tempered with humility
Self-motivation leads to the best outcomes
Open, direct communication is a sign of respect
Teamwork drives success
Having fun together is an important part of the job

***Cape Analytics is an E-verify participant.***

title: Data Analyst (M/F)
role-description:
Company Description

Ubisoft's teams are driven by their desire to enrich the lives of players by original and memorable entertainment experiences. They give life to amazing worlds, real playgrounds where the imagination can express itself freely, giving birth to surprising moments of fun and adventure that also help you as a player to discover yourself and learn.

Ubisoft Bordeaux

Created in September 2017, Ubisoft Bordeaux is the newest of the French Ubisoft studios, working on iconic brands such as Just Dance, Ghost Recon, Beyond Good & Evil and the Raving Rabbids.

About 15 Ubisoft experts from all over the globe, created the core of the studio. With their experience, energy and passion, we are able to grow into a world class development team.

Announced as AAA studio, Ubisoft Bordeaux is growing rapidly and already counts more than 200 employees, from more than 16 different nationalities.

With the ocean less than an hour away, the vineyards at the gates of Bordeaux, and located in one of the most beautiful regions of France, Ubisoft Bordeaux is the ideal place to reconcile a demanding and creative work environment on leading Ubisoft brands along with an exceptional lifestyle.

If you like working in a stimulating, international and friendly environment, come join us and become a pioneer of this new studio!

Job Description
You manage and manipulate SQL data sets, including: defining variables, performing calculations and summarizations, and creating solutions to address business requirements;
You provide hands-on R development, data processing automation, and statistical models deployment;
You build both large systematic reports and one-off small pieces of analysis from multiple data sources;
You proactively develop new analyses and insights, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention and monetization;
You identify, document and design data to be tracked;
Debugging and problem solving issues to ensure delivery of accurate metrics.
Qualifications
Very good communicator: you will be in permanent interactions with the production teams (English required)
Technical background : Good command of the SQL language ; Knowledge in programming and databases, you create queries and scripts in order to render the player data intelligibly to teams (R, Tableau, Python, SPSS ...)

Additional Information

We are looking for innovative and original minds that are challenging, and who want to build the future of the video game industry.

Integrating The Ubisoft French Studios Also Means
Join passionate and highly technical teams, all driven by the desire to design and develop innovative games and stand out for their quality
Collaborate with teams recognized for their experience on renowned franchises
Develop expertise by participating in in-house sharing events (talks, conferences, trade shows) and benefiting from tailor-made training programs
Evolve in a leading French videogame company represented in 30 different countries, with opportunities for international development.
Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status.

All information will be treated as confidential in accordance with the Employment Equity Act.

title: Senior Data Analyst (Dplay)
role-description:
Discovery House - Chiswick Park Building 2 566 Chiswick High Road, London W4 5YB, GB

General Summary

Dplay is as a Direct to Consumer video entertainment service targeted to families. The service will consist of long form and short form video built around multiple content streams, with an appealing and easy to use interface accessed across multiple platforms (e.g. televisions, mobile devices, PCs).

We are responsible for the launch and day to day operation of Dplay across multiple regions, specifically focused on customer acquisition and retention, marketing, partnerships and synergy, content programming, research and analytics, and we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our growing team.

As Senior Data Analyst will provide the deep understanding of customer & usage behaviour needed to drive strategies on customer retention and tenure. They will blend content and product insights with customer acquisition data and through the combination of statistical rigor, data analysis, generate the fast-paced execution of actionable business recommendations.

Key Responsibilities:

Deep-Dive Analysis: Analyse commercial & user behavioural data to identify patterns, uncover opportunities, and create common understanding of how to maximise customer life time
Partnership: Partner closely with regional business stakeholders to identify and unlock opportunities, and with other data teams to improve analytical capabilities around data modelling, testing, data visualization, and data architecture
Forecasting, and Opportunity Sizing: Both to set goals and help evaluate potential opportunities, this analyst will be tasked with forecasting and opportunity sizing. This will help business stakeholders evaluate trade-offs approaches, and create targets for driving business performance.
Goaling and KPIs:  Work “full-stack” to define techniques and benchmarks to measure the business benefit from business strategies.
Experimentation: Develop test plans, define success metrics, and ensure accurate results methodologically, technically, and statistically.
Planning: Establishment and on-going development of analytical roadmaps to support primary stakeholder.
Business Performance Reporting, Visualization, and Regression Management: Be the primary partner for cross-functional stakeholders to understand growth performance. When a metric is ahead or behind expectations, dig in to drive meaningful, actionable insights that helps business performance improve or double-down on success.

Key Requirements

Extensive experience using SQL; Python/R and other statistical programming language experience preferred
Have a demonstrated history of translating complex data sets into clear and actionable narratives and communicate opportunities and challenges to stakeholders.
Have a background in data visualization and dashboard development
A strong understanding of statistics concepts (e.g., propensity modelling, hypothesis testing, regression analysis)
Ability to think strategically, analyse and interpret market and consumer information
Strong communication skills, as well as written and verbal presentation skills
Experience in communicating data insights to large matrix organizations
Experience of working collaboratively across international organisations
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field including Marketing, Economics, Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, Physics, Chemistry or Social Science. Graduate degree preferred

title: Internal Audit, Data Analytics, Analyst/ Associate, London
role-description:
INTERNAL AUDIT

In Internal Audit, we ensure that Goldman Sachs maintains effective controls by assessing the reliability of financial reports, monitoring the firm’s compliance with laws and regulations, and advising management on developing smart control solutions. Our group has unique insight on the financial industry and its products and operations. We’re looking for detail-oriented team players who have an interest in financial markets and want to gain insight into the firm’s operations and control processes.

Responsibilities And Qualifications

YOUR IMPACT

Are you passionate about using data to challenge the norm? We’re looking for a strong data analytics professional to join our Embedded Data Analytics team where they will work closely with the audit teams to apply analytical techniques to data and develop insight into the firm’s control environment.

OUR IMPACT

In Internal Audit,we ensure that Goldman Sachs maintains effective controls by assessing the reliability of financial reports, monitoring the firm’s compliance with laws and regulations, and advising management on developing smart control solutions. Our group has unique insight on the financial industry and its products and operations. We’re looking for detail-oriented team players who have an interest in financial markets and want to gain insight into the firm’s operations and control processes.

The Embedded Data Analytics team leverages their programming and advanced analytics skillset to work closely with auditors and develop data-centric analysis and testing strategies that derive insight and help the audit team to better understand the firm’s businesses.

How You Will Fulfill Your Potential
Assist auditors through hands-on analysis of firm data and providing insights from it.
Help the audit team understand the tools, approaches and infrastructure available to them
Extract data from the firm’s data stores, profile to identify key features, patterns and outliers, and performing scenario based testing.
Assess the quality of data extracted to understand potential limitations or issues
Develop visualization analytics and reporting to present scenarios from the data; both at a high level to highlight potential risks and at the detailed level to enable root cause analyses
Work with the audit teams to build strategic self-service data products that enable auditors to more efficiently and effectively work with firm data and identify potential risk

Basic Qualifications

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR
Minimum 4 years of experience working in the Data Analytics field with preference for experience in Financial Services
Hands-on experience with SQL programming, preferably in Sybase and MS SQL
Experience with analytical/statistical programming such as Python, R, or SAS
Excellent communication skills (written and oral). Ability to communicate what is relevant and important in a clear and concise manner
Drive and Motivation. Ability to handle multiple tasks, takes initiative to improve their own performance

Preferred Qualifications
Understanding of the basics of Finance is preferred
Knowledge of basic statistics (Time Series Analysis, Correlation, Regression) and its application to data
Experience with any visualization tool (Spotfire, Qlikview or Tableau) will be an added advantage
Experience with scripting or formal programming languages such as Javascript, Python or Java
Creativity/Innovation. Ability to create new ways to improve current processes and develop solutions that are grounded in reality and have practical value
A financial industry certification (CFA, FRM, PRM etc.) would be useful but not required

About Goldman Sachs

The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.

title: Data and Insight Analyst

Coventry, England
October 4, 2019 Apply Data and Insight Analyst
Coventry CV2 2TX

Permanent Position

Excellent basic salary, bonus and private healthcare

The life changer. The industry shaper. The healthcare pioneer. Join McKesson, a leading global healthcare company, and you can be all these things and more. Based at our UK Head Office in Coventry, as part of one of the teams shaping our services and improving lives, you’ll have the opportunity to drive your career forward and become more than you ever imagined.

About The Opportunity

In this newly created role, you will be at the forefront of discovery, uncovering new insights and adding commercial value. This will be a highly visible role engaging with all parts of our £5bil t/o UK business.

By analysing and interrogating detailed and complex data you will used a hypothesis-based methodology to test established assumptions and create new ways of thinking to improve commercial outcomes.

You will be confident in proactively communicating and presenting findings to stakeholders, creating and sharing dashboards and visualisations using Power BI and / or Tableau, helping to drive better decisions.

About You

To be considered for this role it is essential you have a strong analytical mindset combined with solid experience in Power BI or Tableau plus Alteryx or SQL

You will have proven senior stakeholder management experience and be confident to both challenge and influence where necessary.

A Commercial mindset is essential as is an adaptable and pro-active approach with excellent problem-solving skills

Desirable but not essential experience would include a working knowledge of R or Python , experience within an agile framework using JIRA and/or Google cloud experience

In return for your hard work, we offer training opportunities and development plans, wide-ranging benefits, flexible holidays and a brilliant work-life balance. We’ll also ensure that you feel empowered to support colleagues and make a real difference in people’s lives.

About McKesson

We’re McKesson – a Fortune Global 500 healthcare company that strives to break boundaries, challenge the status quo and support the changing healthcare industry. Bringing together six companies and 24,000 McKesson colleagues across pharmacy, pharmaceutical distribution and homecare services, we’re committed to offering the best advice and healthcare to our patients, customers and colleagues. As part of our UK Head Office you’ll be able to use your passion, ambition and drive to build solutions and have experiences that transform lives for the better – starting with your own.

Closing date: 3rd October 2019

title: Reporting & Data Analyst
role-description:
In het kort

Ben jij die gedreven talentvolle professional en wil je je bezig houden met finance en jezelf op professioneel en persoonlijk vlak ontwikkelen? Wij zoeken een enthousiaste collega voor de afdeling Statistical & ALM Risk reporting. Je gaat in teamverband werken aan concernrapportages en big data aanleveringen waarin onder meer de balans, p&l, liquiditeitsmanagement, betalingsverkeer, kredietverlening, effectenverkeer centraal staan. Op een van deze onderwerpen ga je meewerken. Onze rapportages en big databestanden ondersteunen de externe toezichthouders (DNB/ECB/SRB/CBS) bij het maken van monetaire beleidsbeslissingen en het uitvoeren van toezicht op de financiële sector. Je gaat je verdiepen en verbanden leggen (slim analyseren) met andere rapportages, waardoor je naast de verdieping ook een helikopterview ontwikkelt. Goede samenwerking met (internationale) stakeholders is van groot belang voor het neerzetten van een goed resultaat. In multidisciplinaire teams, met een Agile aanpak, verbeteren wij continue onze processen, data en rapportages.Ga jij met ons het avontuur rond big data en advanced analytics aan? Zet je het fundament voor een mooie carrière? Wij staan open voor jouw nieuwe ideeën. Vertel ons jouw verhaal. Wij zijn benieuwd! Kom jij ons team versterken?

Je werk

Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen, verzorgen en verspreiden van kwalitatief hoogwaardige en complexe rapportages omtrent statistieken en specifieke portefeuille's voor zowel binnen als buiten de bank en je streeft naar continue verbetering van data kwaliteit. Je bent eigenaar van de gerapporteerde informatie en je bent in staat om vereiste analyses uit te voeren die rapportages naar een hoger plan brengen. Daarnaast bewaak je dagelijks de kwaliteit van het reporting proces door de juiste balans te vinden tussen tijdigheid en nauwkeurigheid van de informatie.

Je werkomgeving

De afdeling Statistical & ALM Risk Reporting is binnen Finance verantwoordelijk voor enterprise reporting op het gebied van regulatory reporting. De wereld rond de afdeling Reporting is uitdagend en volop in beweging. Als gevolg van nieuw te implementeren regelgeving ontwikkelen we nieuwe rapportages en gaan we steeds meer big data bestanden leveren aan de toezichthouders.Naast goed contact met onze belangrijkste afnemers hebben wij veel contact met verschillende interne klanten zoals Risk, Asset & Liability Management en de verschillende business-lines. Tevens is er veelvuldig contact met onze stakeholders in binnen- en buitenland. Voor ons regulatory reporting team zijn we op zoek naar versterking.

Je profiel

Je bent een ondernemende professional met een pro-actieve houding en je bent gericht op samenwerking, om samen met collega's nog betere resultaten neer te zetten. Je bent stressbestendig en werkt nauwkeurig en geordend. Je bent proces georiënteerd en je neemt actief deel aan een preventief en curatief risicobeheer.

Check je profiel:

0 - 7 jaar ervaring
Master opleiding met een financiële richting
Ervaring met MS Excel / Access, kennis van Business Intelligence Tools(bvb SAS) heeft voorkeur
Aantoonbaar kwantitatief inzicht en analytisch vermogen
Samenwerkingsgericht in het algemeen
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden
Goede beheersing van Nederlands en Engels is vereist


We bieden

Een professionele omgeving waar je met veel risk en finance disciplines in aanraking komt. We zijn prestatiegericht, maar de onderlinge sfeer blijft altijd informeel en de werkdruk gezond. Met zo veel kennis en ervaring van collega's ontwikkel je niet alleen je expertise, maar leer je ook hoe je die slim toepast in een grote organisatie. Daarnaast ga je meewerken aan vernieuwingen die ons vak interessant maken en relevant houden.ABN AMRO hecht veel waarde aan persoonlijke ontwikkeling en bied je daarom veel opleidings- en doorgroeimogelijkheden. Daarnaast krijg je een marktconform salaris en een aantrekkelijk pakket van employee benefits. Hiermee bepaal je grotendeels je eigen voorwaarden.Bij ABN AMRO zetten we onze kennis, kunde en ons netwerk in voor klanten. Zodat zij op basis van verantwoorde beslissingen hun doelen kunnen bereiken. In Nederland en daar buiten. Hierbij staat klantbelang altijd voorop. We willen dat klanten onze producten begrijpen en verkopen soms 'nee' als het risico van een product voor een klant te groot is. Klantbelang is ook: helder communiceren en slimme oplossingen bedenken die echt het verschil maken. Dat is ons doel.Wij bieden je de vrijheid om het beste uit jezelf te halen, flexibel te werken en veel ruimte om te groeienWij helpen je om fit & vitaal te blijvenEen aanvullend benefit budget van 11%, waarmee je flexibel arbeidsvoorwaarden kunt kopenEen persoonlijk ontwikkelbudget van € 1.000 per jaarEen OV-jaarabonnement of vervoersbudget, afhankelijk van de functieEen goede pensioenregeling

Interesse?

Ben je geïnteresseerd? Wees je ervan bewust dat beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal een must is en reageer dan nu op deze vacature. Neem voor meer informatie contact op met Ankur Lal, ankur.lal@nl.abnamro.com . We maken graag kennis met je.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Smule Bulgaria EOOD is a subsidiary of Smule Inc. – a leading US-based company, founded in 2008 and specialized in developing innovative mobile-based software solutions. Ten years on, Smule Inc. employs more than 200 people and is a vibrant, global community of music lovers.

Smule is on a mission to bring the world together through music. Music is much more than listening… it's about creating, sharing, discovering, participating, and connecting with people. With 50 million monthly active users creating over 20 million songs every day, Smule is connecting people all over the world through the joy of making music and transforming the music landscape from one of passive listening to collaborative creative expression and active engagement.

If you see the world in numbers but have the soul of a musician, then come join us as the Business & Data Analyst for Smule! Here, you will have the opportunity to dig deep into all the ways we reach out into the world and spread our app for fun, for the community, and for music. Come solve significant business problems using the power of data, statistics, and analytics.

Responsibilities:

Proactively communicate and collaborate with business stakeholders to deliver actionable insights and recommendations
Be responsible for analysis, technology, and process rigor
Proactively design and implement new ways of data collection
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously – both marketing and technical
Design and analyze experiments and A/B tests
Create and automate analyses that drive the business through observing metrics, tracking history or mining data

Requirements:

Strong experience in business and data analytics, ideally in social/mobile startups
Strong in SQL and advanced analytic tools incl. data modeling tools
Translate real business problems into analytical data and actionable insights
Strong in communication, storytelling, and data analysis with experience in product, growth, or marketing analytics at consumer internet-related companies
Solid knowledge with Statistics (quantitative degrees), a solid understanding of a/b testing and its application
Communicating difficult concepts to org-wide stakeholders
Fun, positive attitude. A team player

Would be a plus:

Experience with Vertica, Tableau, MySQL, Hive
Programming skills with R, Python, Pig, Panda or similar
Experience with any web/ app tracking tools – e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Mixpanel and etc.
Degrees in fields like Statistics, Physics, Chemistry, Maths, etc.
Experience in data modeling – customer segmentation, churn prediction, lifetime value prediction and etc. is a strong plus.


What we can offer you
♪ Advanced and Latest Technologies
♪ Growth and Learning Personalized Program
♪ IT conferences, Training courses and Professional Qualification and Certification Programs 

# Additional Medical Insurance 
# Multisport cards
# Discount program
# Stock Options Plan
# Attractive “Refer a talent” bonus

♫ 22 vacation days 
♫ Home office possibilities

title: Junior Data Analyst
role-description:
Join an international games developer building out a new team in Bristol.
Work with some globally known brands.
Modern technology, flat structure and amazing benefits.

I’m working with an impressive media and tech company with a focus on mobile gaming who are in the process of relocating their digital acquisition team from the US to Bristol. These guys operate on a global scale, producing some world class mobile games.

What You’ll Be Doing

This role will allow you to learn the ropes of this company’s digital acquisition strategy and assist with growing their user base across an exciting portfolio of games. You will join a team of specialists and it will allow you to dive into both the marketing and data sides of the business.
You’ll be looking into the data generated by their marketing activities with the goal of finding trends and insights that can be conveyed to the rest of the team to deliver value to their strategies. You will also get stuck in helping to run advertising campaigns end to end via Facebook & Google.
This is a broad role that will let you get stuck in with a wide range of tools and technologies.

What Experience You’ll Need To Apply

A degree from a technical or numerical field (e.g. Maths, Science, Computer Science or Business).
Some statistical programming experience with R or Python
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills (think pivot tables, VBA & macros)
Previous experience using Data Visualisation software like; Tableau, Power BI or QlikView
Be able to query SQL databases
Be able to show your problem solving and analytical skills.
You should be able to work well both in a team or on your own
Passion for mobile games would also be beneficial.

What You’ll Get In Return For Your Experience

There’s a competitive salary on offer here, entirely dependent on experience but in the region of £25K - £30K. Not only will you be a part of a brand-new team in modern offices, you’ll also be entitled to a performance related monthly bonus scheme, unlimited holiday and a Christmas shut down, a generous mobile phone contribution, share options and more.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Job Description

Data Analyst, Reward

We’re hiring!

McLagan are currently recruiting a Data Analyst, Reward to join our team in London. This role will be responsible for the development and execution of consulting projects and annual compensation studies. This role will work with various segments of the financial services industry, including Investment Banking, Corporate Banking, Capital Markets, Retail Banking and associated Infrastructure areas.

About McLagan

McLagan is a management consulting firm that focuses exclusively on the financial services industry. We help our clients make better business decisions by applying market pay and performance information.

Our belief is that accurate market data is a requirement for aligning resources with opportunities. Market data identifies business opportunities and market opportunities for talent and products.

Our goal is to provide a complete and accurate set of data coupled with insights to help management interpret market trends and apply them to improve business results.

Aon is an equal opportunities employer. Aon's recruitment and selection policy ensures the best possible skill mix of colleagues and the highest quality candidates are appointed using objective job-related criteria.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst some of your key responsibilities will involve:

Data collection and in depth analysis of client compensation (salary and bonus) levels.

Market research and competitor analysis.

Assisting on projects that develop and implement client reward strategies that link to business strategy.

Create and support the technical, statistical and graphical content of consulting projects and compensation studies.

The implementation and interpretation of compensation surveys.

Project and process management.

Responsible for working in accordance with the Aon UK Limited Risk Management Framework, and compliance with the Aon UK Limited policies, including participation in the management of risks (including completion of mandatory training) that may adversely affect the business, interests or reputation of any Group Company.

About You

You skills and qualifications will ideally include:

Degree qualified in a numerate discipline.

Proven and accurate analytical skills.

Experience with data analysis and a range of modelling techniques.

Strong presentation skills, both verbal and written.

Advanced Excel skills is a prerequisite.

Experience of carrying out data analysis and the use of modelling techniques.

Excellent interpersonal skills.

Ability to work effectively in a team.

Willingness to progress into a client facing role in the medium term.

Our Colleague Experience

Every day, our colleagues make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. Together, we share this one purpose: to empower economic and human possibility around the world. This unifying goal is at the heart of our identity, and it lives in everything we do. To learn more about our colleague experience, visit Aon Colleague Experience.

We offer you

A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization. Aon is an equal opportunities employer. Aon's recruitment and selection policy ensures the best possible skill mix of colleagues and the highest quality candidates are appointed using objective job-related criteria.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
As a Data Analyst, you will help drive measurement, strategy, and tactical decision-making within GetYourGuide. You will solve problems that could range from improving marketing efficiency, forecasting the economics of our business, or analyzing the success of our new product features.

About GetYourGuide

With 600+ employees from 68 nationalities, GetYourGuide is on a mission to turn trips into amazing experiences, using our product and technology to change the way travelers find and book things to do and explore their destination. We connect these travelers to our vast catalog of amazing experiences through our online marketplace.

Team Mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

Responsibilities
Develop quantitative analysis to drive product, marketing, or business decisions
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports
Serve as a liaison between the product teams and the data engineering team


Requirements
2-3 years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals


Nice To Have
Familiarity with statistical packages (e.g. R, Python)
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


We Offer
Work on a product that helps create memorable travel experiences
Smart, engaged co-workers
Speak English in the office with people from over 68 nationalities
Virtual stock options - be part of our success story
Monthly Hackathons and weekly tech talks
Annual external training budget - be constantly learning
Well stocked kitchen and our famous pizza & beer Friday’s
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation Assistance

Curious?

Do you have the skills for the job, enthusiasm about our vision and fit our culture? We are looking forward to hearing from you! For any further questions regarding this position contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

In the meantime, you can check our blog to see what happens behind the scenes at GetYourGuide and check out our Tech Radar for an insight into the stack we’re using to change the way the world travels.

title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
role-description:
BNP Paribas is a leading European bank with an international reach. It has a presence in 72 countries, with more than 202,000 Employees – including more than 154,000 in Europe and over 5,000 in Portugal alone.

BNP Paribas is present in Portugal since 1985, having been one of the first foreign banks to operate in the country. Today, BNP Paribas has several entities operating directly in this territory, offering a wide range of integrated financial solutions to support its clients and their businesses.

Worldwide, the Group has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. The Group helps all its clients (individuals, community associations, entrepreneurs, SMEs, corporate and institutional clients) to realize their projects through solutions spanning financing, investment, savings and protection insurance.

BNP Paribas Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB) is a leading European investment bank with global leadership in many of our businesses. We are part of the BNP Paribas Group, a financial institution with solid foundations and a proven ability to adapt to change. BNP Paribas CIB, with nearly 28,000 employees in over 50 countries, can offer you an exciting and truly global start to your career, a career where you, your ideas and your development matter.

The Global Markets Client Analytics (GCA) team is responsible for providing data, insights and analysis to Global Markets front office on client activity.The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner.The team in Lisbon is comprised of 6 members. The consumers of this data and analysis are over 1000 global Front Office users including Sales, Trading, Research and Senior Management.We are a global team, with presence in Europe, America, and Asia.

Responsibilities
Production of interactive dashboards primarily using Tableau as a tool
Understand data handling, modelling and reporting techniques along with a strong understanding of the business
Leverage large volumes of data from internal sources
Help global markets to achieve digital transformations

Team work and collaborative mind-set.

title: Associate Data Analyst
role-description:
HM Land Registry has an exciting opportunity for an Associate Data Analyst to join the team based in Plymouth. You will join us on either a Flexible working, Job share or Part-time basis and you will receive a highly competitive salary of £25,247 per annum.

It is an exciting time for HM Land Registry (HMLR) as we continue to embark on a major transformation programme. HMLR's ambition is to become the world’s leading land registry for speed, simplicity and an open approach to data.

We are now looking for an Associate Data Analyst to join our Digital, Data and Technology team to help us to achieve this.

Responsibilities Of Our Associate Data Analyst Include

As an Associate Data Analyst you will primarily be working as part of the Local Land Charges (LLC) quality assurance team. You will be responsible for supporting the migration and transformation of Local Authority Local Land Charges (LLC) data into the HM Land Registry LLC register. To do this, you will evaluate the accuracy, completeness and conformance of the supplied data at a variety of predesignated check points. You will assimilate output from the quality tests and feed findings into the wider quality assurance team, identifying trends and provide evidence to support recommendations and decisions across the program.

What we’re looking for in our Associate Data Analyst:
Ability to analyse a variety of textual and spatial datasets against defined standards.
Able to interpret quality standards and quality assurance outputs to identify where automated validation routines can be introduced and/or enhanced.
Experience of delivering data quality analysis based on defined requirements and developing automated QA routines in FME, VBA, python or similar.

title: Intelligence & Data Analyst Development Programme
role-description:
In a complex world, the impact you make will become clear.

In MI5 our Intelligence and Data Analysts explore and understand data; making sense of the story it’s telling, to support our investigations. By spotting patterns and solving problems, you’ll make connections which protect the UK’s people and places, keeping our country safe.

Our programme

The development programme teaches you the skills and techniques you’ll need to play a key role in investigations. Starting alongside other new analysts, you’ll complete four months of bespoke training, learning about our unique techniques, data and approaches to solving problems. This foundation, delivered by a team of supportive and experienced analysts, is built upon as you join your first team and quickly begin having a tangible impact on investigations. You’ll have a development partner guiding you through your first placement with us, developing your ability and confidence.

As you progress through the programme, you'll be able to take on postings in a range of different areas including investigations, agent handling, surveillance, and strategic analysis. In all of these areas you will be using your analysis skills to support the team by answering questions, identifying new information, and providing assurance.

Your place

Working alongside Intelligence Officers, who lead investigations, you’ll help them understand the story being told by data. By unpicking large data sets, spotting patterns and exploring new methods you’ll be able to see things others would miss. The intelligence you’ll unearth will help us in our vital work to protect the UK.

The work you do will guide decision making and have real impact at all levels of seniority. But don’t worry, you won’t do this alone, but as part of a supportive and hardworking team. After the first two years you’ll have a variety of options open to you in your career as an analyst, which could include specialising in one of the numerous different areas of analysis, or exploring opportunities in training, mentoring and managing new analysts.

Your story

Our analysts come from all walks of life, and have different levels of experience when starting our programme. What unifies them is their curiosity to explore and solve problems. Patience and commitment are traits you’ll need as you work through data to understand the bigger picture and communicate what you’ve found to your team.

You don’t need to have worked with big data, be an experienced analyst or have a degree to join our programme. We look for potential, for passion and for people who can put their mind to tricky tasks when priorities are changing.

How We Work

Although our work, at times, can be challenging, the way we work isn’t. Our offices are open, friendly and relaxed. We come together to share ideas and collaborate. This develops our ability to do more. Your training and development is important to us, as is ensuring you have a healthy work-life balance, social life and do meaningful work. We have options for flexi-time, where you work hours to suit you, and part-time working as just a couple of the different options.

MI5 is an Equal Opportunities employer, committed to reflecting the society we protect. Our recruitment process is fair, transparent and based on merit. We particularly welcome applications from women, Black, Asian and minority ethnic candidates.

The recruitment and vetting process can take around nine months to complete. If you are in the final year of your studies we advise you to apply now. During the recruitment process our recruitment team will give you further information about when you would be able to join.

How To Apply

You should read the Applying section for further information on the eligibility criteria and recruitment process for this role, and satisfy yourself that you meet the criteria outlined:

Eligibility Criteria
Equality and Diversity
Recruitment Process

Please note, you should only launch your application from within the UK. If you are based overseas, you should wait until you visit the UK to launch an application. Applying from outside the UK will impact on our ability to progress your application.

The Recruitment Process
Pre-screening questions, initial application and eligibility questions.
Full application form – This will ask for details of your education and employment history. There will also be competency questions and an opportunity to describe your data analysis experience.
Telephone interview – This is a competency based interview, which will test your motivation and skills for the role.
Assessment centre – This will consist of a competency interview, two role plays, and a written assessment.
Final selection interview – This will be a competency interview based on your performance throughout the recruitment process.
Vetting – This involves completing detailed questionnaires, a security interview, and providing character references.
Key Dates

Initial application closing date: 11th November 2019 at 23:00

Full application closing date: 18th November 2019 at 23:00

Telephone Interviews start: Mid-November 2019

Assessment Centres start: Early January 2020
Eligibility Criteria

To apply you will need a 2:2 degree or equivalent (or be expecting a degree by summer 2020). Alternatively, you’ll have relevant work experience. You’ll also need to prove you can interrogate large data sets, evaluate the reliability of your findings and communicate them clearly. You might have done this while at university, or picked it up during your time working in a similar career. Whatever your background, you’ll need to show your potential with evidence of analysing complex and varied sets of data and be comfortable working at a computer for long periods at a time.

To be eligible to apply, you must meet our residency criteria. You must be a born or naturalised British citizen and one of your parents must be a British citizen or have substantial ties to the UK.

Candidates must normally have been resident in the UK for nine out of the last ten years. This is particularly important if you were born outside the UK. You will nonetheless be considered if you have, for example, served overseas with HM Forces or in some other official capacity as a representative of Her Majesty's Government, studied abroad, or lived overseas with your parents.

Due to vetting requirements you will need to be 17 years and 6 months old, or above, at the time of application. If successful, you will not be offered a start date prior to your 18th birthday.

Discretion is vital. You should not discuss your application, other than with your partner or a close family member providing they are British.

title: BI & Data Analytics Projekt-Manager
role-description:
A vacancy for a BI & Data Analytics Projekt Manager (d/f/m) has arisen within Airbus Helicopters in Donauwörth. The successful applicant will join “BI & Analytics”.
IM business applications are key elements in the overall IM performance of Airbus Helicopters and an essential pillar for Airbus Helicopters transformation activities.
As part of our growing efforts to design, build and support data-centric solutions, we are looking for a new BI & Analytics project manager to strengthen our BI & Data Analytics division (ERP & BI domain).
- You will be responsible for the complete implementation of BI and data analysis projects.
- Within the framework of the general architectural designs and roadmaps and in compliance with the IM processes, you will organise the delivery of projects within the existing framework of the organisation:
             - Methodology: Waterfall, Scrum, Safe
              - Project organisation (internal / external staffing, steering committees, etc.)
              - Decisionmaking regasrding in-house / external development
              - Costs, planning, RACI, risk management etc.
              - Change Management
- You will lead the following project activities:
              - Refine business requirements, supported by architects and business project managers
              - Development/Scrum Team Coaching
              - Test organization and control
              - Project progress reporting: cost tracking, technical progress,
                Status and overview of tasks, risks, metrics (OTQ, OTC, OTD, etc.)
              - Organization of application support after the project phase: Documentation,
                Knowledge transfer to the maintenance teams
- You will contribute to the following activities:
            - Definition of the application architecture (interfaces, data collection, data modeling strategies, Selection of front-end tools, etc.)
            - Technical architecture definition (data volume, network, server, operating system, etc.).
            - BI Team Task Administration & Work Management
            - Development of business strategies of the specialist departments with regard to BI, Advanced Analytics and Big Data in cooperation with architects and the teams in the specialist departments
            - Strategy of external commissioning
- Technical strategy (obsolescence, choice of tools, observation of current technological developments)
            - Maintenance of running applications (ticket management, troubleshooting, user support, Change Requests)
This position may include some business trips to Toulouse, Marignane or any other Airbus Helicopters office in the world.
We are looking for candidates with the following skills and experience:
- Completed studies in the STEM field or comparable
- Several years of professional experience in the field of BI / Data Project Management
- Experience in the implementation of projects in the Agile Scrum methodology (in particular as Scrum Master) and in the management of subcontractors
- SAFE experience an advantage
- Good knowledge of general BI and data system architecture (data acquisition, staging, data warehousing, multidimensional modeling, etc.)
- Knowledge and interest about Big Data, Advanced Analytics and Data Science Tools (e.g. R, Python, distributed calculation)
- Experience in SAP BW, ideally BW 7.4 platform with HANA database required
- Technical skills (desired):
              - Experience in the SAP BO BI Suite (4.1, 4.2): SAP Web Intelligence, Lumira, Analysis for Office,
                TIBCO Spotfire (7.13), SAP Analytics Cloud
              - ETL Tools: SAP BO Data Services 4.2
              - SAP Fiori: content management (tiles etc.), data access (Odata), application development (SAP UI5)
              - SAP HANA Platforms: SAP HANA XS Server, Web IDE, Smart Data Access, etc.
              - Database design, SQL, NoSQL
              - Big Data / Data Science: Spark / Python (PySpark), Machine Learning
              - Frontend: JS / HTML / CSS
- Knowledge of English: business fluent, knowledge of German: advanced
Please apply for this vacancy at our careers site (www.jobs.airbus-group.com) with your CV attached.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Rated People is the UK’s #1 online marketplace connecting homeowners with quality local tradespeople. We work with: 60,000 tradespeople from 30 trades, and have over 1,000,000 jobs by homeowners looking to care for their homes.

Our goal is to make home improvements enjoyable for both homeowners and tradespeople.

We are disrupting a £50 billion a year sector by providing homeowners a free and easy to use app and website to source tradespeople, and offering tradespeople a highly effective channel to build their business and reputation.

We’re passionate about delivering the best possible experience for our customers and believe working with us should be easy. One of the teams that makes this happen is our Data team.

THE ROLE

Data is the nucleus of Rated People’s operation and is the key to the fundamental business decisions we make daily. To drive the company forward, we’re looking for a talented analyst to join our expanding data analytics team. You’ll be asking questions and driving insight across the entire organisation, solving problems that range from customer acquisition and conversion on both sides of our marketplace to measuring our performance advertising efficiency. If you have a passion for understanding complex questions and problem solving from start to finish, then this is the right position for you.

Analytics is a centralized, cross functional team that regularly collaborates with all areas of the business, including sales, customer operations, finance, marketing and our executive team to drive decision-making at Rated People. The team provides real time data dashboard support, leads ambitious data science projects and develops key strategic frameworks and predictive models to help us provide our customers with the best experience from Rated People.

ABOUT YOU

We like inquisitive, innovative, data driven, practical and committed people. Along with these traits, you will also have 3+ years commercial experience delivering complex insights in a data analytics role. Communicating simple insights from distributed complex data sets to senior technical and non-technical stakeholders. 

As someone who wants to deliver a quality experience, with real value to our customers, you are keen on the frequent delivery of high-quality/integrity insights to all areas of the business. We’re looking for someone who will push for best practice and continuous improvement at all times. You will be eager to keep up with new technologies and continually updating your technical knowledge and skills.

You can demonstrate all or most of the following core competencies:

3+ Years in a data analysis role
Outstanding oral and written communication skills; extremely attentive to detail
Experience gathering detailed user requirements from stakeholders
Advanced SQL query capabilities
Consolidating reports from diverse data sources
Experience of creating data visualisation dashboards (Tableau, Quicksight, Superset etc)
Experience of ETL tools to warehouse data (Eg. Talend/AWS Glue/SSIS)
Strong Excel skills
Taking a proactive approach to mining insights in a data driven team

It would be great if you have prior knowledge of:

Machine learning
Agile methodologies
AWS infrastructure
Docker
Python

You’re a self-starter who is excited to learn and improve your skillset in the ever-evolving field of data exploration.

WHAT WE OFFER
Our bright, open plan office has spectacular views over central London and offers an environment perfect for creativity, fun and sharing ideas. We offer a competitive salary and a generous range of benefits:

25 days’ holiday
Bike scheme
Life assurance
Childcare vouchers
Travel loans
Direct pension contributions
Fresh fruit, coffee and tea and food cupboard
A variety of perks and special offers from Perkbox

title: Senior Data Analyst - Freelance - Amsterdam
role-description:
Orange Quarter are working with an Amsterdam-based Digital Hub for a global business – one of the most competitive digital enterprises within smart cities, transport and innovation – managing a platform with 1.8 million units in 32 countries. With a customer-driven approach to their business and platform, everything they do and build is guided by the power of data. They’re now looking for a Sr. Data Analyst on a freelance basis, preferably one who can start ASAP at their Innovation Centre.

What You’ll Be Doing

– Working with the head of Marketing and a team of 4 to define and extend next generation marketing architecture.
– Prototype, productionize and integrate data and automation capabilities – focussing on lead generation and retention specifically.
– Balancing the art of data storytelling, analytics translation and hardcore technical skills.

Skills?

Must Haves

– You know how to manipulate and draw insights using SQL, Excel
– You know how to communicate your results with data visualisations tools like Tableau…
– You know how to make processes quick and effective – automation and optimisation are key.

Handy To Have

– Salesforce, Google Analytics, Sitecore – the Marketing team are currently using these tools, so it’s useful to have a grip on them.

You Are

– An Expat or a Dutchie, the environment is as inclusive and diverse as they come so everyone is welcome.

– Flexible and love working in a fast-paced, agile way.

– Autonomous – with a curious and go-getting spirit!

Fine Print

– Location – Amsterdam (Riekerpolder en Sloten, to be precise)

– Initial 3 months.

– Rate negotiable.

Line of Service
Assurance

Job Description & Summary


Job Position: XBRL Senior Client Account Associate


Overview of Business & Role:


The explosion of digital data in recent years has fundamentally changed the way businesses operate. Organisation of every type have the opportunity to optimise their processes and improve critical decision making by harnessing the power of data and data analytics and our Data Analytics & Assurance (DA&A) team are there to help our clients successfully realise this opportunity.
 
We work on a variety of engagements with our clients in all industries addressing various aspects of data including extraction, transformation, quality assessment & enhancement, governance, visualisation and data analytics to unlock meaningful insights for management.

The advertised position is within our iXBRL Transformation sub-team and involves working closely with management to deliver iXBRL Financial Statement Conversion services to a wide range of clients to meet their Revenue and HMRC tax filing requirements.

To support you in this role PwC will sponsor your pursuit of an accounting qualification (ACCA or ACA) and provide full technical and data training.

Successful applicants will have strong analytical and problem solving skills, a passion for learning, a strong interest in accounting, data and the digital world and a desire to provide high quality services to help our clients meet the challenges they face.


Responsibilities:
Liaising with clients to agree scope of engagements, scheduling work and managing client engagements end to end within agreed timeframes
Assessing the quality and reliability of client data and advising them on remediation actions
Research and advise clients on technical queries and changes in reporting requirements as instructed by the relevant authority (Revenue or HMRC)
Oversee the work of junior team members to ensure quality is maintained and timelines are achieved
Work as an effective team member during an engagement by communicating relevant issues, and requesting feedback

Education/ Professional Qualifications:
Qualified IATI Accounting Technician, or part qualified ACCA Accountant (or equivalent from a recognised international accounting institution)
A recognised university degree or equivalent in accounting, finance or a related field.

Experience:
1-2 years of experience in a finance role would be an advantage;
Demonstrable track record of effective client and stakeholder communication and management
Experience of planning and effecting working practices with large scale operations
Supporting projects to deliver results for clients within agreed deadlines and budgets
Experience of managing client and internal stakeholder expectations
Supporting the delivery of formal and informal reports and presentations

Personal Qualities:
Strong interpersonal skills and able to deal with people across all levels of an organisation
A genuine interest in providing high quality service to clients
Excellent planning and organising skills.
Excellent analytical, problem solving & organizational skills
Ability to handle multiple assignments simultaneously
Demonstrated ability to work to deadlines

title: Business Intelligence & Data Analyst (m|w|d)
role-description:
Ihre Aufgaben
Thementreiber werden. Sie haben den Biss und Ehrgeiz, Kompetenz in einem BI Thema aufzubauen und dieses thematisch sowie organisatorisch als Person zu besetzen.
Teamarbeit ist Ihr Ding: Gemeinsam mit Ihren Kollegen erarbeiten Sie neue Kennzahlen sowie Auswertungen und entwickeln die BI Lösung, auf Basis aktueller und zukünftiger Verfahren und Technologien, weiter.
In Ihrer Rolle erarbeiten Sie Fach- und IT-Konzepte im Business lntelligence-Umfeld.
Sie haben Spaß daran, in agilen und klassisch gesteuerten Projekten, Bl Lösungen umzusetzen. Ihr Profil
Ihr Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung, haben Sie erfolgreich abgeschlossen. Idealerweise haben Sie Ihr Können im BI/DWH-Umfeld in den letzten Jahren unter Beweis gestellt.
Sie sind immer am Puls der Zeit und kennen sich in der BI Entwicklung, idealerweise mit SAP BI / HANA, aus. Ebenso sind Sie aber offen für neue Themen und Technologien.
Sie weisen zudem solide Kenntnisse und Kompetenzen/Erfahrungen in den Themenbereichen Anforderungs-, Projekt- und Testmanagement auf.
Analytisches Denken, eine proaktive und selbständige Arbeitsweise sowie eine hohe Serviceorientierung und sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch runden Ihr Profil ab.
Themen wie Artificial Intelligence, Big Data Technologien oder Data Science finden Sie spannend und wollen sich hier weiterentwickeln. Was wir bieten
Einen modernen Arbeitsplatz und ein spannendes Aufgabengebiet in einer zukunftssicheren Branche
Interkulturelle Zusammenarbeit und kurze Kommunikationswege - auch über Ländergrenzen hinweg
Eine offene Unternehmenskultur und Vertrauensarbeitszeit für ein freies und selbstbestimmtes Zeitmanagement
Gezielte Mitarbeiterförderung: Fachliche Weiterbildung und Entwicklung der persönlichen Fähigkeiten in unserer hauseigenen Academy
Vielfältige Corporate Benefits in Bezug auf Gesundheit, Sport und Mitarbeiterevents Kontaktieren Sie uns Wenn Sie sich in der beschriebenen Position wiedererkennen, lassen Sie uns bitte Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (Anschreiben, Lebenslauf, Zeugnisse) online zukommen. Bitte geben Sie Ihre Gehaltsvorstellung sowie Ihren frühesten Eintrittstermin an.

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Job Description

Job Description - Data Analyst (BRU202SR)

Data Analyst - (BRU202SR)

Description

Division

Audit mission is to provide independent assurance and insight, globally and locally, on Governance, Risk Management and Internal Controls, in order to support the Board and senior management in reaching their objectives.

We add value to the Company by promoting a control culture and by providing advices to management. We report to senior management, Management Committee and Audit Committees.

We are a team of about 50 persons, based in London, Paris and Brussels and our activities cover the entire Euroclear group.

Role

The key role of Data Analyst in Audit is to use data through various advanced analytics techniques to derive value and insights to support Audit division activities.

Your Objective

You work with data to generate insights and create value as part of Internal Audit’s assurance work
Contribute to deliver the Audit Plan on time, within budget and quality standards
Manage relationships and establish proactive interactions with auditors, business managers, data suppliers, IT specialists and other data analysts in the company
Continuous improvement: propose ideas or contribute to initiatives to further improve the functioning and productivity of the Audit division through the use of Data Analytics and Process Automation techniques.

In Order To Reach These Objectives, You Will
Conduct Business Data Analysis and Manipulate internal/external data in order to produce quality and actionable outputs in a timely manner
Make use of data analytics, data visualization, scripting and automation techniques
Make use of our Data Analytics technologies such as Hadoop echosystem (HDFS, Impala, Apache Hue), SQL Server, Microsoft PowerBI, MS Excel+VBA, MS Access+VBA, Powershell scripting, Python scripting, Knime (or equivalent)

We offer an excellent opportunity to practice and develop your talents in a highly professional and motivated team, dealing with multi-domains and getting involved in some of the most strategic files for the company.

We Offer a Continuous Professional Development Through
A comprehensive and transversal view on Euroclear and its business
Appropriate training per year related to the Audit Data Analytics function
Support to acquire external qualifications and professional certifications
Opportunity to acquire detailed knowledge of other division/departments within Euroclear
Opportunity to help improve the processes and control culture of the company
Focus on individual coaching by your people manager

Qualifications

Technical skills
You hold a University degree in a field where data are pivotal (Scientific domain, statistics, mathematics, computer science, laboratory, quantitative field, …)
You already have 3 years of professional experience as a data analyst using same technologies
You have experience with relational databases, Hadoop echosystem, SQL queries, Apache Hue, data exchange formats, high-level machine learning,
You understand the basics of data importation and data validation
You are very analytical and possess proven problem-solving ability, by quickly understanding and analysing different domains
You are able to analyse and understand business flows in order to create value with data
Experience with the following technologies is a plus: Hadoop echosystem (HDFS, Impala, Apache Hue), SQL Server, Microsoft PowerBI, MS Excel+VBA, MS Access+VBA, Powershell scripting, Python scripting, Knime (or equivalent)

Soft Skills
You have good networking skills since you will work in close collaboration with auditors, data suppliers and business users
You stay abreast of new tools and technologies to practice up-to-date data analytic
You are able to learn quickly, adjust to changes and think outside the box
You have excellent time management and organizational skills with attention to details
You are able to build relationships in a consultative style in order to understand the business of the data
You can influence and constructively challenge
You are self-confident and motivated, able to work independently and as a team member
You possess excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
The position is Brussels based and for a full time schedule. You are flexible, when travelling is required to other locations of the company.

This role is part of the Advisory career orientation.

Explore or develop your soft skills? More on Pulse+ Euroclear Development Centre

Euroclear recruits people from all walks of life. Our 3,500 employees represent 89 nationalities, of which over 50% are women. We are deeply convinced that diversity of talents, backgrounds and opinions is a key to success, by fostering engagement, energy and innovation. We are committed to promoting diversity within the organisation, as well as an inclusive environment where everyone can be themselves, feels valued and respected, regardless of their background.

Primary Location
: Brussels Office

Area of Interest
: Audit

title: Data Analyst

Data AnalystPromptly - Trofa

Jobdescription

PROMPTLYis an eHealth startup company that aims to revolutionize healthcare by making health outcomes available to everyone. Within one year, we aim to be conducting several pilot-studies in hospitals and healthcare systems in different geographies and by 2020 we will be reaching 1M patients in at least 4 different countries.

We are currently seeking aDataAnalystwho wants to help us build a product that patients and clinical teams love, and that will be at the core of making excellent outcomes care a reality in Portugal and worldwide.

Duties & Responsibilities

You have to be a self-paced developer. We do not micromanage here. You will be on a fast learning environment and we expect that you learn and teach as much as you can.You will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data to provide patients with smart insights about their diseases.

Build high quality live dashboards and reports
Analyze trends and proactively provide meaningful analysis
Perform quality assurance on generated reports to ensuring accuracy and consistency
Develop and maintain ETL scripts and queries to gather data from different sources

Experience with Business Intelligence, data analysis and data visualization (Tableau, others)

Great communication skills
Data-oriented personality

What We Offer

Be one of the firsts on a fast-growing team

title: Data Analyst - Contract
role-description:
Description

Bird’s eye view of your role –

Yodlee’s Data Products team is driving innovations within the Financial Services Sector using Big Data. We have a high-caliber, focused and mission-driven culture within our teams. The models we build and the analysis that we derive from financial data matters in crucial cutting-edge business decisions made daily across global financial services firms and provides insight into real world problems.

In this role, you will gain a deep understanding of income and expense transactions, financial classifications, and long-term financial management within the UK market. You will participate in customer and partner calls to review requirements and client needs. You will quickly gain an understanding of how local income and expense calculations, and financial management best practices can be leveraged to deliver financial wellness tools to the UK market.

This role will allow you to partner with Yodlee analytics teams to review and enhance data categorization for key income and expense transactions. You will develop a specification for both rules based and machine learning-driven enhancements to categorization by defining transaction types. You will also interact closely with the Financial Wellness Product team to provide requirements to localize the financial management tools for the UK market. You will perform regular and ongoing analysis of consumer transactions to identify methods for improved categorization, testing and certifying enhancements, and validating performance metrics. You will also work with the Financial Wellness Product team to adapt their products for the UK market. This requires you to develop a deep understanding of the UK financial management space in order to develop an ongoing UK roadmap with the rest of the Financial Wellness Product team.

You will have –
Bachelor’s Degree
2 – 4 years of experience in software-oriented Product Management, preferably in Financial Services
Experience in financial modeling
Knowledge of Financial Services transactions

You Will Definitely Possess These Technical Skills –
Experience/interest in analyzing data
High attention to detail, especially in regards to data cleansing

Preferred Skills –
Product Management Certifications, particularly Pragmatic Marketing
Financial analysis skills

What Will You Bring –

You will be a thinker, a doer, and someone that likes to solve problems by analyzing data. You possess superb written and oral communication skills. You have analytical skills with a background in financial analysis. You will carefully seek to understand underlying business needs, both at a market level as well as at an individual client/prospect level. You are adaptable and can work successfully in a technical environment as a non-technical leader. You are inquisitive and highly detail-oriented. You are focused on execution and are able to make definitive decisions with limited data in uncertain environments.

What Are Your Performance Objectives –
Provide regular and deep analysis of transactions and propose new rules and feedback into machine learning
Analyze transactions and associated enrichment output for accuracy. Tag and label transaction data with accurate and appropriate attributes including, but not limited to, category of transaction, geo, etc.
Define and assess data product performance, identify gaps and incorrect outputs, tag correct values and improve expected performance
Contribute to the Yodlee transaction data enrichment and financial wellness roadmaps
Develop analytics requirements and rules based on the analysis
Ensure analysis output is incorporated into product after review with Data Science and Product Teams
Apply your knowledge and expertise of local and country-wide companies, merchants, types of businesses and nature of transactions towards analysis of the country/region
Bring your local/country/region expertise to highlight financial services nuances, prevalent financial behavior, popular technology choices, etc.
Provide a specific data-oriented approach to developing list of top merchants and companies, details on financial attitude, data sources for identifying long tail of merchants and businesses, etc.
Document your analysis and findings for knowledge base
What’s in it for you? –
Work with transactional data in a dynamic and rapidly growing space both within Fintech as well as Financial Wellness
Gain knowledge that can be applied towards various industries as the use of aggregated transactional data continues to spread and gain increasing popularity
Partner with cutting edge startups and traditional financial institutions
Open culture and technology agnostic which helps you be on top of the big data technology stack

title: Data Analyst - Twycross
role-description:
ROLE PURPOSE Our BI team is expanding! We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our busy crew. Are you passionate about data and what it can bring to the business? Do you enjoy solving complex challenges? Are you excited about working in a dynamic, agile environment? This is an opportunity to join a high-performing team, with a wide and diverse org reach, contributing directly to the business' growth and success. Our mission is to support every team and individual in the studio with tools and insights to make smarter decisions and optimise day-to-day work processes. Intelligent business supported by intelligent resource - that's our goal, please reach out if you'd like to take part! KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Identify impactful business use cases for advanced statistics, science and ML. Tailor, design and liaise with Data Scientist to deliver solutions.
Within the BI team, contribute to continuous improvement of analytic best practices and framework. REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
3+ years of proven experience providing analytic support, ideally within the gaming industry or in an internet or technology environment.
High level of numeracy with quantitative/statistical analytic skills.
Proficiency with SQL and big data transformations.
Experience with visualising data in reports, dashboards and decks.
Strong attention to detail, natural curiosity with ability to problem-solve creatively.
Exceptionally strong communication skills (both written and verbal), strong collaboration skills and the ability to work effectively with a diversity of business users of different technical abilities.
Self-starter who can effectively manage time and workload.
An independent learner who can identify knowledge gaps and opportunities for improvements and reach out for resource.

title: Junior Data Analyst
role-description:
Acerca de nosotros:

Equifax potencia el futuro financiero de individuos y organizaciones a nivel mundial combinando datos unicos, confiables, con tecnologia y analitica innovadora. Pasando de ser en sus inicios una empresa de credito al consumidor, Equifax se ha convertido en el proveedor lider de perspectivas y conocimientos que ayudan a sus clientes a tomar decisiones informadas. Somos una empresa de clase mundial que administra, integra y analiza datos de mas de 820 millones de consumidores, mas de 91 millones de empresas y datos de empleados aportados por mas de 7100 empleadores
Objetivo:
Como Analista formaras parte del equipo de carteras de deuda y participaras en procesos de analisis, estrategia, objetivos, medicion de datos y proyectos de consultoria relacionados con optimizacion de riesgo crediticio y recobro.
Funciones:

title: Data Analyst
role-description:
Company Description

Nexthink is a global leader in Digital Employee Experience. Our product allows enterprises to create highly productive digital workplaces for their employees by delivering optimal end-user experience. Through a unique combination of real-time analytics, automation and employee feedback across all endpoints, Nexthink helps IT teams meet the needs of the modern digital workplace.

Headquartered in Switzerland, Nexthink also has offices in France, UK, Germany, Spain, UAE, Australia and the US. Our growing team of Nexthinkers is proud to be making the digital work lives of seven million employees across 1,000 customers more productive.

At Nexthink, we believe actions are stronger than words when it comes to diversity, inclusivity, and equity in the workplace. Nexthinkers are multinational and multilingual, and come from all walks of life. We are committed to hiring a genuine representative workforce that can help us create solutions and foster innovation for the modern digital employee experience. Join us today!

Job Description

To support Nexthink Manage Services, we are looking for a Data Analyst who can provide remote Analytics activities to Nexthink strategic accounts in order to provide ongoing value to Nexthink customers on different areas of operations.

The focus of the role is to work with set of Service Delivery Managers to provide analysis for customer’s dataset and provide recommendations. The role is expected to work collaboratively with SDMs, Professional Services & Customer Success teams.

The Main Responsibilities Of The Role Are As Follows
Being able to analyze, baseline and benchmark customer’s data-set to drive insights for ongoing operations
Lead data projects end-to-end, including business requirements gathering, data requirements definition, technical specifications and follow-up;
Run complex analyses to deliver business insights to the different teams – automate reporting for scalability reasons whenever it is relevant;
Being able to find and highlight false positives or one off events
Ensuring that results and milestones are documented consistently and regularly shared with internal and external stakeholders
Being able to speak with experience IT stakeholders and explain data analysis, insights and assumptions
Analyze customer needs, goals, strategic plans and constraints
Being able to prioritize and work on different projects at the same time
Being able to suggest remediations and automation opportunities
Work against a set of Service Levels (SLs)
Stay current on product development/releases to a level required for the above activities;
This position requires 10% travel to headquarter for training purposes.
Seniority Level: Mid-Senior Level
Function: Information Technology
Qualifications
BA/BS preferred in computer science, computer engineering
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in technical consulting, analytics & automation
Ability to perform data analysis and drive to actionable insights and automation
Deep experience in either workplace management, network management, productivity and collaboration management
Experience over transformation projects (e.g. Win10, O365)
Extensive technical knowledge on end user computing
Good knowledge of IT operations in challenging environments
Ability to quickly learn new technologies in an unsupervised environment
Excellent communication, customer facing and teamwork skills
Exceptional analytical skills; outstanding communication and social awareness
Enthusiasm for working in an international, collaborative and fast-paced environment and learning new technologies
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Windows and Linux clients and its applications
Outstanding Excel skills. Great command of business intelligence software and data visualization tools such of R , Mathlab and Python as well as strong data visualization skills and experience with relevant data visualization tools would be a significant asset;
Practical knowledge of SQL, XML, windows PowerShell. Practical experiences in data integration
Relevant software industry experience in any of the following: IT systems, enterprise or infrastructure management, application development and management, security, and/or analytics
Fluency in English, with excellent written, digital and verbal communication skills; knowledge of other languages would be an asset
Additional Information
This is an exceptional opportunity to join a fast-growing, successful and innovative company. Nexthink allows you to thrive in a unique work environment where the emphasis is on excellence, innovation, openness and collaboration.
SpainServicesNexthink
