title: Data Scientist KYC
role-description:
ING is looking for a Data Scientist KYC (Know Your Customer) passionate about delivering data-products

Think Forward! Our purpose is to empower people to stay a step ahead in life and in business. We are an industry recognized strong brand with positive recognition from customers in many countries, strong financial position, omni-channel distribution strategy and international network. If you want to work at a place where we believe that you can live by the Agile manifesto without jeopardizing the necessary continuity, compliance and QA measures, where we are committed to deliver stable and secure services to end users, and where we have a 'no nonsense' getting-things done mentality, please read on!

"a day in the life of a data scientist"
There are no “typical” days for a data scientist in WBAA. On any given day I wear many hats. I might start my day reviewing a merge request, ahead of our Scrum meeting. Following which I will rush off to a meeting with a business expert to discuss a recent analysis I prepared, that might even involve walking them through the python notebook I prepared with a subsample of data. In the afternoon, I’ll sit with colleagues to discuss cutting-edge machine learning methodologies, that might involve helping each other through some difficult math on a white board. Perhaps the only thing “typical” or “standard” in my day is making sure to take out after lunch for a quick game of ping pong with the team.

As a Data Scientist KYC you are passionate about your field of work: Data Science. You look to not only develop predictive algorithms, but also to actually deliver them as a working product to end-users and incorporate their feedback in the product. You know how to apply machine learning algorithms, but more importantly, you know how they work under the hood.
You want to work with key developments in the Data Science area. Experimenting with new algorithms and technology.

Our ambition is to “Catch the bad guys!”, those trying to launder money using ING and the banking system. We want ING to become the most trustworthy bank in the world! For this we are building a real-time anti-money-laundering product. We are bringing together domain expertise, top-notch user-experience, massive amounts of data (internal and external), cutting edge data science, robust software engineering and strong product management. Your team will work together with an existing team in Amsterdam, with as much agility as possible, on the continuous cycle of discovery and delivery and will own key features of the product. Where needed we will partner with ING colleagues, academia, vendors, start-ups and other banks to get the job done.

What department?
The Wholesale Banking Advanced Analytics team is a team of 100 people (and growing rapidly) that has the mission to make Wholesale Banking in ING data driven. We do this by combining Big Data technology with Data Science to deliver high value solutions and products for our organization. We work in a fun and creative environment and we’re dedicated to bringing out the best in both each other and our projects. We have offices in Amsterdam, Katowice, Warsaw, London and Romania.

Job description
Your passion is to work with the latest and greatest technologies in the field of Data Science. You will participate in maintaining the data analytics capability. Besides this, you will build and improve predictive models using statistical and machine learning techniques. You will work in one of the finest engineering teams of the world, to implement the algorithms and visualisations you’ve helped to build as prototypes. You will design, analyse and interpret business hypothesis and explore datasets through using available tools and recommend ideas to business when data/results is available through good visualizations / predictive algorithms. Last but not least, you assist users to understand the data science principles and when needed provide an explanation for the model behaviour and possible correcting actions.

Our Stack
Within the Wholesale banking Advanced Analytics team we mainly use the following technologies and frameworks:
Python with packages:
Numpy
Pandas
Sklearn
Keras
Lightgbm
Spark (Pyspark, Spark ML)
Airflow

Do you recognize yourself in this profile:
MSc or PhD with excellent academic results in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics or other exact disciplines
Knowledgeable in statistics, calculus and applied math
Knowledgeable about machine learning techniques and willingness to keep the knowledge up-to-date. You have an in-depth understanding of algorithms like Random Forests, Neural Networks, MCMC and reinforcement learning.
You have experience with unsupervised learning with a strong focus on anomaly detection and time serie prediction
As we hire for potential and a very strong fit with the team, rather than experience, we consider 2+ years of work experience a strong plus, but this can be substituted with excellent capabilities.
Strong programming skills in Python, Experience in delivering (near) production grade code.
Familiour with engineering tools like Docker or strong willingness to learn and use it. Furthermore, you like working with tools like Spark and Hadoop, though extensive experience with this is not necessary at the start.
Experience in working in an agile/scrum way is a plus, but at least you should have a strong willingness to do so.
You have excellent oral and written communication skills at technical and business level.
Fluent in written and spoken English.
  Moreover
You have a learning attitude. Not only to master new algorithms and technologies, but also on the interpersonal level. You realize that the value of your work is quality x acceptance and want to become better at both. You are proven to be able to give, ask and incorporate feedback.
You have experience in building data products. From inception to production. With your full-stack capabilities, you can build a prototype, but also improve an issue within the existing models in production. You love coding.
You feel at home in a high-performing team and you make the other team members feel at home as well. You have the independence to speak up when needed.
You have exceptional problem-solving capabilities. You understand that understanding the problem is at least 90% of the solution. You have displayed creativity and tenacity in cracking the problem and finding a solution to it.
Active (or impressive) Github and/or Kaggle profile

What do we offer?
Working at ING means working in a dynamic and international setting. Individual development of our employees is very important and that is why ING offers excellent courses and programs. You will become a member of the Wholesale Banking Advanced Analytics team, a prestigious, no-nonsense and high-output data-science team. Diva behaviour is not tolerated, neither is underperformance. We only hire people with exceptional talents and capabilities! You will work on the most innovative projects within ING. In addition we offer:
Fun!
A competitive salary
Working with highly skilled people
Working in an area which is of great importance to the strategy of ING
A relaxed and fun team
An International atmosphere
A full time position (40 hour week)
Great training and education opportunities
  Are you keen to know more or apply?
For further inquiries, please contact Stanley Waccary (Business Manager Wholesale Banking Advanced Analytics), Stanley.Waccary@ing.com.

We are looking forward to getting to know you

title: Data Scientist - Lisbon
Data Scientist - EMEA Advanced Analytics
role-description:
Apply Now

Qualifications
Experience and knowledge of modeling techniques in statistics, econometrics, and/or optimization
Experience in mathematical software, databases, programming languages, and comfortable working with large data sets (R/SAS/Python/SQL or others)
University degree with focus on quantitative methods/ econometrics/ statistics/ mathematics or related degree programs
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, including the ability to independently disaggregate issues, identify root causes and recommend solutions
Prior experience in a multi-national environment (as an asset)
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and with people at all levels in an organization
Skills to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English
Who You'll Work With

You’ll work with our EMEA Advanced Analytics group in Wroclaw, co-located with our Knowledge Center colleagues. As a member of this team, you’ll work with McKinsey clients and consulting teams to carry out complex data analysis and modeling, creating a foundation for sound recommendations for client studies and internal projects.
What You'll Do

Leveraging your expertise in analysis and methodology, you’ll take part in projects with our clients and consultants by creating complex mathematical and economic models.

You will develop prototypes in R, SAS, Python, SQL, Excel, conduct statistical analyses. You’ll often be responsible for the entire analytical process — from task definition to the implementation and interpretation of results to the delivery to the client.

You’ll collaborate with McKinsey consultants and with clients, discussing the results constructively in continuous search of the best possible solution. You will gain insights into many industries, methodologies, and management topics on an ongoing basis.

You'll contribute to knowledge development through special projects, both with client teams and on a stand-alone basis.

title: Junior Data Scientist
role-description:
VISIÓN GENERAL

 Endesa Energía, está buscando un Científico del Dato experto en el Análisis de Datos y en la aplicación de modelos analíticos para la resolución de problemas de negocio.

¿Te gustaría involucrarse en nuestro equipo? Tendrás la oportunidad de gestionar y analizar grandes volúmenes de datos, así como desarrollar tus capacidades para plantear e implementar modelos analíticos en la primera comercializadora de electricidad a nivel nacional.
En Endesa ponemos al cliente en el centro de nuestra estrategia basada en mejorar la eficiencia y la experiencia del cliente. Nuestro equipo data scientist aplica técnicas de Advanced Analytics innovadoras que permiten conocer mejor a nuestro cliente, ofrecerle productos y servicios personalizados e incrementar su satisfacción.

 ¿Estás formado en esta área de conocimiento? ¿te atrae el sector energético?  ¿te apetece ayudarnos en esta tarea? ¡Puede que quieras unirte a nosotros!

Qué harás
Como científico de datos, trabajarás junto a profesionales del sector desarrollando e implementando modelos de advanced analytics con un alto impacto económico en el negocio. En particular tus responsabilidades incluirán:
Acceder, unificar, validar y transformar grandes volúmenes de datos, tanto de clientes como de mercado, garantizando la calidad para su uso posterior.
Analizar e interpretar los datos, de forma metódica, siendo capaz de extraer conclusiones concretas que aporten valor al negocio.
Buscar, identificar, analizar y seleccionar variables a incluir en los modelos.
Definir y diseñar los modelos analíticos para la resolución de problemas de negocio, explorando diferentes técnicas.
Implementar los modelos analíticos utilizando lenguajes de programación orientados a datos (típicamente Python, R, Matlab).
Establecer los criterios para la operación y mantenimiento de los modelos.
Operar y mantener los modelos implementados, identificando oportunidades de mejora continua.
Generar los resultados, reportarlos e interpretarlos desde el punto vista tanto técnico como de negocio.


Quien eres: 
Tienes un grado en Matemáticas, Física o Ingeniería y Master en Data Scientist o Ingeniería del dato. Con conocimiento probado de:
Lenguaje de programación de BBDD estructuradas: Consultas complejas en SQL.
Explotación BBDD estructuradas: Creación de objetos, extracción y carga de datos masivo (Redshift, MySql)
Se valorará conocimientos en entornos Big Data (HADOOP, Cloudera). En particular conocimientos sobre Map Reduce, HIVE, Impala.
Conocimiento avanzado de R y/o Matlab.
Conocimiento avanzado de modelos analíticos: Regresión logística, series temporales, clustering, redes neuronales, Random Forest, XGBoost, Deep-learning, etc
Conocimiento de librerías de Python y su ecosistema (Jupyter, Numpy, Pandas, ScikitLearn, SciPy, Matplotlib, Pyplot, etc..).
Se valorará conocimiento de Keras y TensorFlow
Conocimiento de herramientas de visualización: QlickView, Cognos, Spotfire, PowerBi.
Buen conocimiento del sector energético.
Lo que buscamos en ti:
Actitud para trabajar en equipo, capacidad de resolución de problemas, fuerte motivación.
Actitud proactiva para proponer nuevas iniciativas, así como áreas de mejora.
Inquietud por la formación técnica, buscando oportunidades de aprendizaje que permitan la actualización constante de tu conocimiento.
Entendimiento de negocio e interpretación como un problema analítico basado en datos, identificando las preguntas concretas a realizar para su implementación.
Capacidades de comunicación y habilidades para reportar resultados con un lenguaje adaptado a negocio.
Actitud colaborativa e iniciativa para fomentar el intercambio de conocimiento técnico entre los distintos miembros del equipo.

title: Data Scientist - Stress-Testing Data Analytics
role-description:
BNP Paribas is a leading European bank with an international reach. It has a presence in 73 countries, with more than 192,000 employees – including more than 146,000 in Europe and over 4,000 in Portugal alone.

BNP Paribas is present in Portugal since 1985, having been one of the first foreign banks to operate in the country. Today, BNP Paribas has several entities operating directly in this territory, offering a wide range of integrated financial solutions to support its clients and their businesses.

Worldwide, the Group has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. The Group helps all its clients (individuals, community associations, entrepreneurs, SMEs, corporate and institutional clients) to realise their projects through solutions spanning financing, investment, savings and protection insurance.

Department Overview

The team named STFS, for Stress Testing and Financial Synthesis, coordinates the strengthening of BNP Paribas’ Stress-Testing (S/T) and planning capabilities so as to better serve Business Lines, Legal Entities and Group needs and meet supervisory requirement on these matters, and in a cost-efficient manner.

To that effect, STFS aims at building a flexible, industrialized, central utility accessible by BNP Paribas’ Business Lines and Entities (B/E) for their local needs and their contribution to Group exercises. STFS offers an integrated S/T service to B/Es to support them in capitalizing on the shared framework for their local needs.

Within the STFS platform, Stress-Testing Data Analytics (STDA) is the STFS data model owner for the S/T platform, and provides STFS with the data necessary for modelling activities and S/T exercises.
STDA develops Datamarts for Stress Testing on the RISK & Finance shared Big Data platform.
In addition to data crushing and data analysis, STDA works jointly with IT Group on the automation of data ingestion, code processing, and data visualization processes. The team is the entry point of IT Group concerning data navigation and statistical exploration (DATAIKU) as well as data visualization (TABLEAU).
STDA serves other STFS teams with statistical analyses based on historical data.
STDA is in charge of the monitoring of the data quality.

Role And Responsibilities

The STDA team in Lisbon is dedicated to credit and works in a one-team manner with the STDA team based in Paris.

The team is looking for a data analyst, also the primary focus will be on the development, maintenance and testing of STDA datamarts in a Big Data environment.

Appetite for the credit data functional content and understanding of stress tests modelling team requirements are a must.

This Includes The Following Processes

The objective is to set up Datamarts for STFS to be able to stress capital and cost of risk on the credit risk perimeter of the bank.
Data ingestion, Data quality, Data preparation with DATAIKU DSS (Data Science Studio)
Data visualization with TABLEAU
Specific contributions to regulatory and internal stress testing exercises
PROFILE

To be successful in this role, the candidate should meet the following requirements:
Junior (0-3 years experiences - willingness to consider recent graduates) with strong desire to learn
Strong academic background, with a Master degree
Skills: significant experience in data exploration and data preparation. Good knowledge of SQL. Experience with PYTHON programming language is a plus.
Knowledge of Risk Management principles is a plus.
Languages: fluent in English
Strong interest in data management and functional content of the data
Ability to work with tight deadlines and multidisciplinary teams
In addition, the candidate should have the following essential behavioral skills:
Autonomy & Adaptability
Strong curiosity
Result oriented
This role will expose the candidate to a wide range of professionals within the bank. Therefore, communication skills, both written and verbal, play an essential part in the day-to-day role
The candidate should be available for periodic training abroad (short term in Paris).

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.

In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Primary Location

PT-11-Lisbon

Job Type

Standard / Permanent

Job

RISKS

Education Level

Master Degree or equivalent (> 4 years)

Experience Level

Beginner

Schedule

Full-time

Behavioural Competencies

Creativity & Innovation / Problem solving

Transversal Competencies

title: Junior Data Scientist - London
role-description: We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our collaborative team within the Data Science area. What this role will entail... You will be working alongside experienced Data Scientists, analysing complex viewer data, and building descriptive and predictive models. This will give you an opportunity to gain exposure to all aspects of ITV business and develop hands-on experience in machine learning and data science. You will work with the latest technology stack (AWS and GCP), and we will support you in becoming an expert in it. You will find yourself in a place where on-going learning is highly encouraged, and your contribution and good work ethic will not be left unnoticed. We offer competitive remuneration and benefits package. Some Key Responsibilities: Essential: 1st or 2.1 degree (BSc or MSc) in Computer Science, Machine Learning or Data Science Strong Python 3.x skills, and proficient in at least one other low-level programming language Proficient in principles of database design and SQL (any flavour) Highly numerate, with a strong sense of curiosity and a strong interest in statistics, mathematics and programming Ability to work independently Good communication skills Desirable: Familiarity with pandas, numpy and scikit-learn Familiarity with the principles of Machine Learning and Data Science Prior work experience in the data science or machine learning field The ideal candidate: Interest and background in Data Science Python programming skills

title: Data Scientist – UK, Market Analytics
role-description:
We seek an outstanding Data Scientist to join our Markets Research team in London. This individual will be responsible for partnering with local business operations teams to drive strategic decision-making across the globe. You will study user behaviour, market dynamics, and content strategies, providing data and insights that will influence strategic direction. Above all, you will be at the nexus of data science and business at one of the most innovative companies in the world.

In addition to possessing strong technical background of his/her own, the ideal candidate will be a natural communicator who is able to explain complex statistical frameworks to non-technical stakeholders all over the world. Accompanying this broad set of responsibilities is exposure to many departments, as well as senior management, at Spotify.

What You’ll Do
Productise day-to-day analytics and insights support for Spotify’s Markets Operations team.
Develop a robust body of knowledge around each of Spotify’s key markets to proactively address business questions and drive strategy.
Work closely with cross-functional teams of analysts, product owners, marketers, designers, and others across the company who are responsible for driving results in local markets.
Support Markets leadership with research on key business initiatives and challenges.


Who You Are
Degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or another quantitative field.
3-5 years of experience, preferably at at least one company with a matrix organisational structure.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Extensive experience manipulating and analysing complex data with SQL, Python and/or R. Knowledge of Google BigQuery and Java/Scala is a plus.
Familiarity with big data processing frameworks like Hadoop or Spark is a plus.
Ability to converse in two or more languages is a plus.
Comfort operating independently in a fast-paced work environment.


We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users and our creators. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of changing the way the world listens to music

Psst! If this job is your perfect match and you want some inside tips before you apply, read this blog post

title: Data Scientist 2 (R1103875)
role-description:
Job Description

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

Intégré Au Sein Des Équipes Advanced Analytics Innovation & Data Science, Le Candidat Devra Être Force De Proposition, Et Sera En Charge Des Missions Suivantes
Développement de nouvelles innovations
Expertise en Data Mining, Wrangling, Big Data, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, dans une optique d’optimisation et d’industrialisation de solutions innovantes
Gestion de projet (Ciblage, Webscraping, développement de programmes…) afin de répondre à différents projets internes & externes
Automatisation de process, Data Visualization, afin de porter de nouvelles offres
Vérification des données et de leur qualité en adéquation avec les projets traités
Codage sous Python, R et SAS

Join Us

title: Data Scientist - Recommendations
role-description:
The Role

Farfetch is building the next-generation intelligent platform for online luxury fashion, powered by large-scale data and state of the art Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Computer Vision algorithms. You will join a talented team of Data Scientists, Engineers and Product designers to help build and optimize, through research and experimentation, our data-driven products.

What You Will Do
Design and develop state of the art algorithms in the area of Recommender systems;
Conduct practical research with a scientific mindset, and a focus on delivery;
Build large scale data pipelines;
Work closely with the engineering team to integrate ML algorithms into the platform;
Engage with business stakeholders, product managers and designers to help deliver a shared vision of a luxury fashion recommender system

Who You Are
MSc or PhD in a quantitative discipline: Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Physics or related areas.
Minimum of 2 years experience in a Data Science related role, or equivalent academic research background.
Hands-on and experienced with Recommender Systems. Practical contact with large-scale recommender systems in production is a plus.
Knowledgeable of online testing methodologies (AB Testing, Multi-armed bandits). Experience designing and analysing online experiments is highly valued.
Fluent in Python and common numerical and ML packages (NumPy, SciPy, Scikit-Learn, Pandas, Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch, PySpark). R candidates are also encouraged to apply; Experience developing production software is a bonus.
Experienced in dealing with large amounts of data and building data pipelines; Knowledge of big data technologies is a plus (Spark, Hive; GCP).
Highly fluent in English, both written and spoken.

title: Data Scientist Consultant
role-description:
About Accenture

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions – underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network – Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 425,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

This is an opportunity to join ACCENTURE DIGITAL as a Data Scientist Consultant within the APPLIED INTELLIGENCE practice.

Applied Intelligence is intelligent technology and human ingenuity applied at the core of business across every function and process – to address our clients' most complex challenges.
We combine Artificial Intelligence with deep industry and analytics expertise to help our clients embrace intelligent technologies confidently and responsibly.
By joining Accenture, you will work in diverse projects aimed at solving complex analytical needs from customers spanning across several industries, providing expert guidance into all areas of data science.

Qualifications
Academic background in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Statistics or equivalent quantitative fields
3+ years of professional experience in corporate environment
Skills for customer facing with business stakeholders with focus on putting analytics into the heart of the business
Experience in the data science domains with the capacity of translating business issues into analytic problems
Proficiency in applying complex techniques in solving specific business needs, including
Development of analytical approaches and methodologies, mathematical modelling and algorithm prototyping
Design of solutions based in statistical and advanced analytics techniques in areas such as prediction, forecasting, clustering and optimization
Evaluation & monitoring of results and correspondent presentation to business units, explaining technical concepts to non-technical and business people
Consulting on data science strategies to tackle new and growth business opportunities
Organizational, communication and interpersonal skills
Consultative mindset with focus on customer problem solving customer
Structured approach and execution to large and high-visibility projects
Ability to collaborate and delegate with others and to communicate clearly
Curiosity, creativity, passion for continuous learning and keen on new challenges
Proficiency on SAS, R, Python, Matlab, SSPS; others platform and languages aera valued as well as experience in AI/ML/DL

You know machine learning and you are interested in programmatic real-time auction bidding. You are looking forward to crunch 'real' big data (we are talking about petabytes, and worldwide) in order to detect patterns and make accurate predictions. You are excited about writing great code, solve challenging problems in order to help processing billions of bid requests every day at millisecond latency?

If yes, then you might be the next amazing person to join our technology team at Adello. We are reshaping the advertising industry as we know it today and we invite you to make a contribution in our mission. Join our friendly, multicultural team of professionals to learn, develop new skills and work with innovative technologies.

Our culture is one of constant learning and challenging. We value attitude over skill - we believe that skills can be learned but personal attitude is intrinsic.

Constantly bring new ideas and inspiration

Ability to work independently and self-directed in a team of equals
Fun to be around is a must!

EU work permit required


Benefits
no powerpoint and buzzword bingo
as little process as necessary, as much freedom as possible
committed yet very flexible startup work culture (i.e. if you have a family or hobbies, we can make it work for both sides)
learn and master the ML and AI skills for your professional future

role-description:
Data Scientist - OEIRAS (m/f)
International Bank based in Greater Lisbon
Data Scientist with Python proficiency

Our client is an international bank based in Greater Lisbon - Oeiras.

Develop, revise and automate scoring using machine learning techniques for our different business lines (e.g. automotive financing scorecard; automotive financing)

title: Data Scientist - Pricing, Data & Analytics, Group Digital
role-description:
WHO YOU ARE
We are looking for a number of data scientists to join a group working on pricing across Ikea. We focus on developing cutting edge tooling in all areas of pricing, to ensure the best experience for our customers, as well as our co-workers. To do that, we are looking to building a diverse team consisting of talented data scientists,

We would love to talk with you, if you:
- love getting to understand business problems through data,
- have a strong background in a highly mathematical subject,
- have experience developing mathematical solutions to real-life business problems,
- enjoy being creative through code – Python is our main language, but deep experience with other stats and data processing languages is great,
- have experience working with pricing, ideally in a retail company,
- are a great communicator with technical stakeholders, business stakeholders and data science peers,
- want to keep learning!

The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day to day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it’s important for us that you share our values! You can read more regarding our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING DAY TO DAY
IKEA is taking huge steps to become a data-driven company in all aspects. Pricing is a key focus area in this transition. It is a highly strategic part of the business with a high potential value, where we are looking to revamp our existing tools, and as well as address new areas. This includes pricing of furniture, food and services across all parts of the product life cycle.

We want you to help us build ML software to answer questions like:
- How should we price our range to ensure our furniture is accessible for the many people no matter where they?
- How do we increase demand of outgoing items to make space for news?
- Delivery is complex – how do we set prices to ensure best customer experience?
- Can we use intelligent pricing to drive sustainability and circular economy?
- What can we learn about fashion and trends to inform price-setting on new items?

You will work in a cross-disciplinary agile team that designs, implements and deploys models that help to solve these kinds of problems. It will be a mix of mathematical modeling, training machine learning models and writing code – as well as talking with product owners and business stakeholders.

OUR TEAM WITHIN IKEA
IKEA has long been a global leader in home furnishing. We are proud of our vision to improve the everyday life of the many people. But our industry is quickly changing and we need to adapt to stay competitive.

As part of IKEA’s journey to strengthen our digital capabilities, we are building a Data & Analytics function with a new Data Science team. This team is working on problems across the company, from customer modeling to pricing to forecasting. We see so many opportunities for what we can accomplish and have an ambition to become a world class team. At the same time, we believe that our work is not just about building models, but also about learning and having fun together.

We can offer you:
- Work on some very interesting problems in pricing, and you are encouraged to spot opportunities to collaborate with data science colleagues in other specialist teams.
- Opportunities to have global impact with your work.
- Flexible and modern tools: We deploy on Google Cloud Platform and we use a lot of open source tools across the board.
- Hardware of your choice.
- A team of great colleagues to learn with and from.
- Continuous learning (we aim to spend 20% of our working time on learning).
- Flexible and friendly working environment.
- Relocation support: we are based in southern Sweden.

QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!
Does this sound like your next challenge? IKEA offers an exciting and empowering work environment in a global workplace. And as the world’s leader at life at home, you have exceptional opportunities to grow and develop together with us. If you have questions regarding the recruitment system please reach out to Veronika Grollova at veronika.grollova@ikea.com.

Please apply with application in English. Please not that we can´t process any applications through email. Thank you.

title: Data Scientist (CDI)
role-description:
Profil recherché :

Inventif, autonome, astucieux et créatif, vous êtes passionné par la data science, Python, SQL et la bidouille. Vous n’avez pas peur de vous attaquer, en équipe, à l’analyse automatisée de millions de conversations, de communautés Twitter et de commentaires Facebook. Vous êtes imaginatif et vous voulez résoudre des problèmes encore nouveaux sur le secteur digital et participer à notre R&D. Inventer des algorithmes innovants, sur des problèmes concrets et tangibles, seront votre quotidien. Rejoindre le pôle Data de Reputation Squad, c’est la promesse d’un job jamais ennuyeux, avec des prospectives inédites pour ce corps de métier. Vous traiterez des sujets variés allant des enjeux sociétaux, corporate à des questions géopolitiques.

Transversal aux autres pôles de l’agence, vous serez par ailleurs en amont de chaque projet data. En plus des analyses et du développement, vous disposerez d’une deuxième casquette en gestion de projet : recueil de besoins, évaluation des possibilités techniques, estimation du temps et des ressources à déployer.

Vous avez d’excellentes qualités relationnelles, et vous savez écrire (nous produisons notamment des articles data-driven pour des médias internationaux majeurs).

Notre coeur de métier : le digital. Nous avons besoin de quelqu’un qui puisse comprendre et exécuter des problématiques data globales sur ces thématiques (bonne connaissance des réseaux sociaux, crawl, machine learning, analyse sémantique, SQL).

Skills :
Compétences en Python
Savoir mettre en place et gérer des BDD MySQL
Connaissances des librairies suivantes est un plus : pandas, NLTK, scikit-learn, Keras ou Tensorflow
Base en Analyse Sémantique Computationnelle est un plus : tf-idf, word2vec, LDA, tokenization, postag…
Esprit critique, capacités d’analyses et de synthèse
Anglais courant

title: Product Analyst - Lisbon
role-description:
Come help us make sense of the wealth of data we collect every day from our mobile and web apps to read conclusions that directly affect the business and optimize the learning journey of hundreds of thousands of our users. At ELSA we are building the best AI-powered English speaking assistant with over 5M app downloads.

About Us

ELSA (English Language Speech Assistant) Corp. is a fast growing Silicon Valley-based startup in the edTech area with engineering offices in Portugal, India and Vietnam. In business since 2015, the company has received many prizes and recognitions for its state-of-the-art language assessment AI and has recently closed a funding round (round A) with Google Gradient Ventures as one of the key investors.
Our vision is to enable everyone to speak foreign languages with full confidence, reaching better life and career opportunities. Our flagship product, ELSA speak, is a personal mobile coach who improves our users' English pronunciation using our own state-of-the-art speech recognition technology.
The Role
At ELSA we know how important it is to know our customers in order to serve them best. For this reason we adapt many aspects of the apps and the speech processing algorithms based on what we learn from our users over time. We would like to extend out data science team with a business analyst to lead the analysis of user behavior and manage the AB testing process for new features.

As Part Of Your Role You Will

Organize and analyze anonymized data from our users to find patterns and explain their behavior.

Propose changes in the app or our backend infrastructure to improve decision making and optimize the company’s OKRs. This requires deep understanding of our product, and collaboration with product, design, marketing and growth teams to conduct in-depth analyses that guide strategic decisions.

Build data products and visualization dashboards around the information we have from users

Present actionable insights to both technical and non-technical team members

Design and run experiments that optimize existing features

We are looking to fill this position in Portugal (Lisbon preferred)

Requirements

4+ years of experience as a product/data analyst

Strong experience using SQL queries on Redshift (or other similar Data Warehouse) and Python/Pandas for data search and cleanup

Strong experience using visualization tools like tableau/klipfolio/redash/google data studio and working experience using Amplitude or Mixpanel;

Relevant experience in working with user data at consumer startup in order to draw relevant insights

Experience designing, running and extracting insights from AB tests

Strong business sense in order to connect the dots between data and product

Able to work with non-engineer people (meaning PM and executives) to present their insights

Some experience managing data at scale, optimally on a company setting

Good communication skills in English

Knowledge of the common metrics used in business for BI

What we offer
Competitive salary according to seniority

Stock options

Flexible working hours

Private health insurance

Ample room to grow professionally

Friendly and flexible work environment, no office politics

Healthy food, teas, coffee and snacks in the office

Experience a full diversity of cultures and languages both locally and remotely across ELSA’s 4 offices

Yearly company retreat

Experience the true startup spirit of a fast growing and well funded Silicon Valley edTech startup

Opportunity to work on a mission that can transform the lives of 1.5 Billion language learners around the World

Application
Send your CV to

title: Analyst (R1101678)
role-description:
Job Description

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

We are looking for an analyst to join our local commercial effectiveness solutions team, based in Lisbon.

Working at IQVIA Portugal you’ll have the opportunity to work with the major pharmaceutical companies and other healthcare stakeholders in Portugal.

Your Role

You’ll be part of a local consulting team, working in projects dedicated to:
Analyze secondary data and desk market research to identify key findings and trends
Perform quantitative or qualitative analysis to support client deliverables and business decisions as they relate to IQVIA data
Assist in data preparation, deliver components of the project with senior support and assist in ensuring quality of the final deliverable
Assist in creation of presentations for clients and attend, support and present at client meetings with senior support
Be able to quickly learn and work with sales and promotional data, market and epidemiology assessment, pipeline analysis and market research with senior support
Your Background
New graduates or candidates with 1-3 years experience, with a background related to health, economics or statistics
Knowledge in MS Excel, MS Access, and MS PowerPoint
Knowledge in any of the following (preferential): SAS, R Programming, or Excel VBA
Knowledge and interest in pharmaceutical and healthcare market & trends
Demonstrate analytical, interpretative and problem-solving skills, working with large and multiple data sets to process data in the required format for the analysis
Well-developed written and verbal communication skills
Adaptability and an ability to learn quickly and apply new knowledge
Fluent English and Spanish (preferential)
We need please to receive all the candidatures in English

Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.

Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

title: Data Content Manager
Data Analyst (M/F)
Product Data Analyst
role-description:
The Pipedrive product is used by hundreds of thousands of salespeople all over the world. Their interactions with the product and our support team generate large amounts of data every day. More data means better potential insights, but it also means an increasingly difficult task of reaching these insights.
You’re the kind of person that can easily get excited by huge data sets. You’re happy chasing the proverbial needle in the haystack, drawing conclusions and generating insights where others would be scared away by the challenge.  

What you’ll do:
Analyze internal, public and 3rd party data to come back with conclusions and insights presented in a human-readable format.
Make sure all necessary data is gathered in the correct way, identify currently missing pieces and facilitate adding them into the mix.
Work closely with people in Product Management, UX, Design and Engineering helping them set and track their KPIs and in general, get the most out of their data.
Publish your learnings in the organization and evangelize data-driven decision making.


Who you are:
You have 3+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis, preferably for a SaaS company.
You have experience utilizing tools like Tableau, Amplitude, R, Excel, etc. for analysing user behaviour
You are fluent in SQL and have development experience in at least one scripting language (PHP, Python, Javascript, etc.).
You demonstrate intellectual curiosity, logical thinking, and the ability to solve complex problems that may not always be well-defined.
You have the ability to condense analysis into actionable insights to inform business decisions and influence performance.

What we offer:
A world-class working environment full of the usual nice perks, and some more.
A structured and transparent working environment with clear product roadmaps.
Monthly flexible benefits package, e.g paid gym access, public transportation, etc.
Yearly training & conferences allowance.
A competitive base pay.

title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
role-description:
BNP Paribas is a leading European bank with an international reach. It has a presence in 72 countries, with more than 202,000 Employees – including more than 154,000 in Europe and over 5,000 in Portugal alone.

BNP Paribas is present in Portugal since 1985, having been one of the first foreign banks to operate in the country. Today, BNP Paribas has several entities operating directly in this territory, offering a wide range of integrated financial solutions to support its clients and their businesses.

Worldwide, the Group has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. The Group helps all its clients (individuals, community associations, entrepreneurs, SMEs, corporate and institutional clients) to realize their projects through solutions spanning financing, investment, savings and protection insurance.

BNP Paribas Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB) is a leading European investment bank with global leadership in many of our businesses. We are part of the BNP Paribas Group, a financial institution with solid foundations and a proven ability to adapt to change. BNP Paribas CIB, with nearly 28,000 employees in over 50 countries, can offer you an exciting and truly global start to your career, a career where you, your ideas and your development matter.

The Global Markets Client Analytics (GCA) team is responsible for providing data, insights and analysis to Global Markets front office on client activity.The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner.The team in Lisbon is comprised of 6 members. The consumers of this data and analysis are over 1000 global Front Office users including Sales, Trading, Research and Senior Management.We are a global team, with presence in Europe, America, and Asia.

Responsibilities
Production of interactive dashboards primarily using Tableau as a tool
Understand data handling, modelling and reporting techniques along with a strong understanding of the business
Leverage large volumes of data from internal sources
Help global markets to achieve digital transformations
Proof of concept data projects with innovative methods or tools
Relationship with other departments – IT, Management, Sales and Trading teams
PROFILE
Bachelor or Master in Computer Science, Engineering, Maths, Business Management, Economics or Information Management
Interest in Data Science
Knowledge of visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI)
Experience with programming languages (Python is a plus)
Knowledge of SQL.
Understanding of code versioning tools such as Git is a plus.
Strong communication and presentation skills both verbal and written.
Effective problem solver and consensus builder.
Team work and collaborative mind-set.
Fluency in English is mandatory
BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.

In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

title: Data Analyst - Lisbon
role-description:
Daltix is a fast-growing, successful data-driven start-up from Belgium with offices in Boom, Ghent and Lisbon. We bring real-time insights to the world of retail. How are we doing that? We have developed a set of tools to gather, process and analyze retail data at massive scale and bring it all together in a state of the art data platform we offer to our clients. So far, we have had great success in doing so. That’s why today Daltix serves customers such as Makro, Lidl, Dreamland, Jumbo, Greenyard, Unilever and many others.

Sign me up! No wait... What will I be doing?
We are looking for a kickass Data Analyst who is excited to become a true Data Master based in Lisbon. This role will give you the opportunity to have a direct, positive impact on our business as well as our customers.

What Your Typical Day Will Look Like

You will be working on projects that deliver immediate value to our customers. These will involve extracting, transforming & analyzing data to produce actionable insights and reports for our customers who are major retailers and suppliers across Europe.
(Data) Quality will be an important focus when doing these projects.
In addition to working with Daltix’s data lake you will also be cleaning, analyzing and extracting datasets from external sources as well as visualizing data using Tableau/Excel.
Technologies you’ll find yourself using daily include:Python, pandas & jupyter notebooks.Snowflake Data Warehouse, S3.BI tools such as Metabase & Tableau.Schedulers such as Apache Airflow.

Main requirements

Minimum Qualifications

Why you're the one we are dying to meet:

You have at least 2 years of professional experience with data analysis using SQL and Python (with pandas)
R experience is also relevant but professional experience with Python (and pandas) is mandatory.
You have a great eye for detail and are able to produce accurate, timely reports that meet (or exceed) the needs of our customers.
You are highly proficient in both spoken and written English.
You are curious to learn and you learn fast.
You can work in a team.
You are proactive in your problem-solving.
Your business mind is just as strong as your technical mind. You will be working at the boundary between the technical team and the customer and will need to be able to effortlessly bridge between the two.
You thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment and can adapt to changes in priorities based on dynamic customer needs.

Nice to have

Preferred Qualifications

A background in engineering (as you will be working on some simple ETL, data pipelines and automating some tasks).
Previous experience with big data technologies (such as Hadoop, Spark, Airflow).
Great coding skills in Python (with pandas, numpy, …) and deep knowledge of SQL.
Experience with BI tools such as Tableau are a big plus.

Perks

If you still need more convincing…

We are a young, entrepreneurial and fast-growing company; you will have the unique opportunity to shape our future and have a positive impact on our clients’ business
You will be offered a competitive wage in a talented, international team of top-notch experts
Flexible work arrangements with a lot of autonomy in what you do and where you do it - we trust you to know your schedule and work when you feel most productive
You will be able to participate in relevant training to stay at the top of your field.
Health Insurance coverage

Fresh fruit, snacks, tea and coffee on the house
Occasional drinks and team events
A modern office in the heart of Lisbon, the sunshine capital of Europe

title: Data Content Analyst
Business Intelligence Developer
role-description:
Your opportunity....

As a Business Intelligence Developer, it is your mission to work closely with teams and consolidate data from multiple sources in an efficient data warehouse and design enterprise-level solutions, reports and insights.

Also, we need people with great team spirit, dynamism, and new ideas to develop our business proactively, waking up every day with the same motivation and bring a positive attitude to the company.

at OLX

OLX is among the largest classifieds and ecommerce sites worldwide. OLX is designed to enable people to connect through buying and selling goods and services quickly, easily and for free. Our contribution to a better world is bringing people together for win-win exchanges. Sellers win - as they can make some money from used items. Buyers win - as they can trade up better items for lower prices. Communities win - as we connect people and are creating a lively trading between the members. Earth wins as we help to extend the lifetime of items. OLX wins and most of all, you win. Being part of something special. In an open culture that encourages own initiatives, growth and entrepreneurial spirit. Sharing the same values.

At OLX we have a clear ambition – to create a richer world. We empower people to make the difference and we’re always looking for great people to help us do just that.

What responsibilities will you get when working with us?

Run relevant reports to consolidate data for the business to analyze and provide insights
Extract, transform, load data and create indicators to provide analysis
Work closely with the business analysts in each one of the businesses, being the sparring partner and the go-to-person in the team for analyses and insights
Locate relevant market data, analyze and generate actionable insights that contribute to company strategy
Turn data into insights, capable of independently translating issues into specific analysis and capable of translating the resulting data back into a solution


What will you need to be successful in this role?

Degree/Master in Econometric, Statistics, Computer Science/Management or similar
2-3 years professional experience in an analytical role, such as business analyst or data scientist
Experience in an internet company is a plus
Expertise in reporting engine building, business intelligence tools and open platforms
Data mining & data analysis knowledge is a plus
Technical expertise working with relational databases and SQL
Excel high level skills
Excellent English communication skills both oral and written
Good level of critical and logical thinking, creativity and business focus
Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment and to meet changing deadlines and priorities on multiple simultaneous projects
Strong analytical capabilities
High attention to detail and the eagerness to own projects from start to finish
Good team player, however also able to work independently
Used to work in international environment


What can you expect from us and what do we offer?

Unique opportunity to become a part of an international group and one of the major Internet Brands, not only in Portugal but in the world, contributing to the global OLX Group success, based in Lisbon;
Work in a meritocratic and entrepreneurial environment where your work will have a real impact on the company’s success;
Conferences, training and support for your career development;
Enticing compensation, benefits and perks



Why OLX?

The OLX Group is a network of leading classifieds platforms in 45 markets, including brands like OLX, Avito, Letgo, Dubizzle, Storia, Stradia, among others.

The OLX Group connects local people to buy, sell or exchange used goods and services by making it fast and easy for anyone to post a listing through their mobile phone or on the web. Hundreds of millions of people in local markets around the world generate more than 1.9billion monthly visits, 37 billion monthly page views and 54 million listings every month on the OLX Group's online marketplaces.

Our continuously growing audience on OLX, Standvirtual and Imovirtual is the foundation for the value we deliver to professionals and consumers. To maximize the value we create we need to continuously improve the service experience we deliver to our customers.

Inspired and interested in the job? Apply!

role-description:
BNP Paribas is a leading European bank with an international reach. It has a presence in 72 countries, with more than 202,000 Employees – including more than 154,000 in Europe and over 5,000 in Portugal alone.

BNP Paribas is present in Portugal since 1985, having been one of the first foreign banks to operate in the country. Today, BNP Paribas has several entities operating directly in this territory, offering a wide range of integrated financial solutions to support its clients and their businesses.

Worldwide, the Group has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. The Group helps all its clients (individuals, community associations, entrepreneurs, SMEs, corporate and institutional clients) to realize their projects through solutions spanning financing, investment, savings and protection insurance.

BNP Paribas Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB) is a leading European investment bank with global leadership in many of our businesses. BNP Paribas CIB, with nearly 28,000 employees in over 50 countries, can offer you an exciting and truly global start to your career, a career where you, your ideas and your development matter.

The consumers of this data and analysis are over 1000 global Front Office users including Sales, Trading, Research and Senior Management.We are a global team, with presence in Europe, America, and Asia.

Team work and collaborative mind-set.

title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer (m/f)
Quantitative Data Analyst (Backtesting)
role-description:
BNP Paribas is a leading European bank with an international reach. It has a presence in 73 countries, with more than 192,000 employees – including more than 146,000 in Europe and over 4,000 in Portugal alone.

BNP Paribas is present in Portugal since 1985, having been one of the first foreign banks to operate in the country. Today, BNP Paribas has several entities operating directly in this territory, offering a wide range of integrated financial solutions to support its clients and their businesses.

Worldwide, the Group has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. The Group helps all its clients (individuals, community associations, entrepreneurs, SMEs, corporate and institutional clients) to realise their projects through solutions spanning financing, investment, savings and protection insurance.

Department Overview

Credit Analytics & Ratings (CAR) is responsible for the elaboration and the maintenance of the credit risk analytics and methodologies at Group level. The team sits within Enterprise Risk Architecture (ERA), which is part of the Risk Function of the group.

The Risk Function Is a Cross-functional And Independent Function Of The BNP Paribas Group, Which Covers All Businesses And Territories And Operates In The Following Areas

Credit risk – Corporate & Retail
Market and counterparty risk
Refinancing and liquidity risk
Insurance contract underwriting risk

With risk experts spread over five continents, the Risk Function's mission is to:

advise the General Management on the definition of risk policies
ensure risk management and contribute with "his second look" to monitor that the risks taken by the Bank are in line with its policies
postpone and alert the bank's management of the Bank's risk status.

The ERA team is one of three cross-functional teams in the Risks function.

By virtue of its position and function, it covers all areas and methodologies (Retail & Corporate, Credit, Counterparty, Market and Liquidity Risk, backtestings, stress tests, reportings).

Within ERA, CAR is composed of credit and quantitative analysts who work in close cooperation with the various credit risk streams and with the businesses in order to leverage on the existing expertise within the Group.

CAR’s mission is to develop and continually improve the group's risk modelling & measurement, analysis and back-testing capabilities on credit risk.

Its first priority is to provide tools for the Bank’s credit risk management that comply with regulations.

CAR Is Organized In Three Teams
one is dedicated to credit risk models design on Group Model
one to their transversal and regular performance assessment on Group and Retail Models
and the last one to the model portfolio management.

Within the CAR department, the candidate will join the model performance team.

This team tracks the performance and robustness of internal rating models on the Basel credit risk parameters (PD, LGD, EAD / CCF).

The team carries out many other studies and participates in various transverse projects.

Due to growing demands from European regulator/supervisor, the model performance team is carrying out studies that are becoming increasingly important.

ROLE AND RESPONSABILITIES

Realization of the model performance (on EAD, PD and LGD parameters) and participation in the setting up of new studies:
Database preparation
Model performance production
Report preparation
Level 1 control
Methodology improvement
- Control and data collection on the GRR for backtesting non retail perimeter production of LGD and EAD/CCF
Collection of information
Data quality control
Monitoring
There will be a lot of interactions with different stakeholders and good communication skills and knowledge credit analysis will be appreciated
Improvement of the existing tools and processes:
Ensure the continuous improvement of existing programs and processes for carrying out various studies
Strong focus on documentation.

CONTRIBUTIONS FROM THE MISSION

Acquire a broad vision of the existing rating system within the group, both in the Corporate & Institutional Banking scope and in the Corporate and retail scope of the network banks.
Development of knowledge and skills in credit risk data management and in the interpretation of risk measures

PROFILE
Undergraduate or Master degree in economics, finance, statistics, mathematics, data science
Minimum 2 years of experience in a similar area in the financial sector
Mastery of the SAS tool / Knowledge in R/Python would be appreciated
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Power Point and Word
Good writing and communication skills (English)
Good knowledge of Basel 3 prudential regulation for credit institutions will be appreciated

role-description:
Descrição da Empresa

Fundada em 1995, a NOESIS é uma consultora Portuguesa que fornece serviços e soluções vocacionados para apoiar os seus Clientes a aumentar a competitividade, facilitar a gestão, reduzir os custos e otimizar processos. Fruto da aposta estratégica da empresa, a NOESIS é líder no mercado português de Quality Management, para o fornecimento independente de serviços de testes de software, de acordo com um estudo da IDC.

Atualmente a NOESIS conta com mais de 500 colaboradores distribuídos pelas suas diversas localizações: Lisboa, Porto, Coimbra, Bruxelas, São Paulo, Dublin e Roterdão assegurando a adequada resposta aos desafios dos clientes, em Portugal e nos mercados internacionais.

Em 2016, registou um volume de faturação de 28.7 Milhões de Euros estando a sua oferta estruturada nas seguintes Unidades de Negócio – Quality Management; Business Intelligence; Infrastructure Solutions; Agile Solutions; Enterprise Solutions; Enterprise Resource Planning e Professional Services. Estes serviços são desenvolvidos nos setores em que a empresa atua, nomeadamente Telecomunicações, Sector Financeiro, Retalho, Administração Pública, Saúde, Serviços e a Indústria.
Para responder aos desafios de uma economia cada vez mais exigente e competitiva, a NOESIS aposta na valorização contínua da sua equipa e na contratação dos melhores talentos para os seus projetos. A dedicação das equipas, conjugada com a audácia que nos faz procurar as melhores soluções para os nossos Clientes, constitui a fundação que permite afirmar a NOESIS como uma referência no sector das Tecnologias de Informação.
Detalhe da Função

Noesis Is Looking For Professionals With The Following Profile

EducationMaster’s degree from university with a specialization in engineering, mathematics, statistics or data science.
Experience:5+ years of BI development experience on complex multi-dimensional problems;Experience creating analytics products that incorporate complex business rules;Experience creating business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations;Strong communication skills and comfortable interacting with senior stakeholders.
Technical Skills:Strong knowledge of SQL databases and ETL methods;Knowledge of advanced data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI);Programming skills (e.g. Python, R, Java, Go, Javascript);Synthesis skills: ability to explain the results of a model and the different elements impacting it.
Soft Skills:Excellent communication and interpersonal skills;Flexibility: ability to work in a changing environment;Project management skills.
Languages:Fluency in English, both written and oral;French is a plus

If you meet these requirements and are interested in joining an audacious and innovative company, please send us a copy of your CV, including the job reference SE_006_REC_10_19_2102.

title: Data Scientist (m/f)
Real World Data - Epidemiologist (R1106408)
role-description:
Job Description

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

Epidemiologist / Real-World Data Scientist

Join the Centre of Excellence for Retrospective Studies to help us deliver high‑quality scientific research to our clients in the global pharmaceutical and healthcare industries.

Our goal is to contribute to the body of scientific evidence that allows medical practitioners to treat patients in the most effective way, and health systems to include as many patients as possible. We use data, collected for clinical (and other) purposes to answer research questions such as "which treatment works best in the real world, beyond the clinical trial setting?" Our fast paced and supportive environment attracts individuals who care deeply about the quality, timeliness and subsequent impact of their work; who thrive when exposed to the scale and variety of scientific challenges we face.

Primary Responsibilities
Contribute to the design, execution and reporting of real-world database (RWD) studies
Contribute to the writing of study protocols, statistical analysis plans and study reports
Provide scientific and methodological expertise to teams and clients on various aspects of study design to address research questions
Develop abstracts, manuscripts and/or presentations to conferences for projects
Contribute to business development activities and proposal writing
Contribute to improving operational efficiencies of workflows, including writing of internal guidance documents (e.g., SOPs and quality management documents)

Requirements
MPH, MSc, PhD or an equivalent degree in epidemiology, public health or a related discipline
Experience designing and executing prospective or retrospective database studies
Commitment to working collaboratively and effectively with people of other disciplines
Excellent time management skills, contributing to multiple projects with competing timelines
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Fluency in English (spoken and written)

Preferred Qualities
Exposure to working with large real-world healthcare databases
Excellent communication skills
Prior experience working in a consultancy, CRO or healthcare services
Publications in peer reviewed journals and/or abstracts in scientific conferences

Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. title: Data Scientist
role-description:
As a Data Scientist at FreeBalance you will support our product, R&D leadership teams with insights gained from analyzing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. Must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. Must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. Must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

Main Responsibilities
Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
Mine and analyse data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development and business strategies.
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
Use predictive modelling to increase and optimize customer experiences.
Coordinate with different functional teams and R&D to implement models and monitor outcomes.
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyse model performance and data accuracy.

Qualifications
Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field.
5-7 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models.
Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development.
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
Experience working with and creating data architectures.
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
Coding knowledge and experience with several languages: C, C++, Java (Mandatory), JavaScript, etc.
Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc.
Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, SLQ, etc.
Experience using web services.
Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
Experience analyzing data from 3rd party providers.
Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, MySQL, etc.
Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. FreeBalance is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce to increase the representation of the designated groups based on each country’s legislation. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective labour law throughout all stages of the recruitment process.

title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
role-description:
The Data Science team at OLX Group is responsible for building algorithmic solutions to facilitate transactions between buyers and sellers. We are developing personalisation technologies and optimisation strategies that have a direct impact on OLX’s users as well as the company's bottom line.

You will be encouraged to research state-of-the-art machine learning, in the areas of user segmentation, image metadata extraction (including multi-label classification and tagging with deep learning), semi-supervised learning, and more. Applying these methods to core OLX product platforms deployed in the cloud that are affecting the user experience for millions of visitors per month, rolling your solutions to production, analysing results offline and online, and measuring site impact.

Data Engineers wishing to make the transition to a more Data Science role are welcome to apply as well.

Your Ramp-up Challenges
As an online classifieds platform, understanding if and when a transaction has happened in our platform is important. Making predictive models that calculate the probability of an item being sold at a given point in time and using them as part of an overall customer value management (CVM) strategy.
Another important area we are aiming to further extend is identification of the effect of the different types of Value Added Services (VAS) that we offer to our customers. This is particularly important in order to recommend the correct package for our professional sellers and to ensure we price fairly.


The Day To Day
Driving projects globally from the data side
Working on optimizing the models according to the requirements of the specific use case and collaborating with other team members to bring in production and scale machine learning solutions.
Measure the impact of your models against company goals.
Collaborate across the Data Science community to find technical solutions to complex business problems.
Work in an agile environment to deliver high quality software against aggressive schedules.


Experience That Could Contribute To Success In This Role
A highly driven, results-oriented, creative problem solver with a hands-on approach to delivering business impact quickly.
Excited by the chance to directly impact the daily experience and happiness of millions of people around the world by matching supply and demand.
A good understanding of machine learning techniques and demonstrable experience applying them to solve problems using machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, scipy, etc.
A strong engineering background working with good knowledge of at least one programming language (Python, Java, etc) as well as engineering standard methodologies.
Experience writing SQL queries and handling large amounts of data.
Experience bringing models in production.
Fluent in English with excellent written and oral communication skills.


Nice To Have
Industry experience creating and productionizing machine learning algorithms at scale (e.g., production use of AWS Athena, AWS Sagemaker, AWS Spectrum, AWS Kinesis) or the GCP equivalent.
Experience setting monitoring (e.g. Grafana) and alert notifications (e.g. New Relic), etc.
Experience building large-scale batch and real-time data pipelines with open source data processing frameworks like Spark or Storm.
Experience with Tensorflow or MXNET
Experience with platforms for programmatically authoring, scheduling and monitoring workflows (e.g. Apache Airflow).


What We Offer
Competitive compensation and benefits
Contributing to the global OLX Group
A passionate and diverse team of data scientists spanning several tech hubs across the globe.
The opportunity to learn from each other and become better every day
Competitive salary and great benefits
Company Mobile phone, laptop of your choice: Laptop MacBook Pro, Windows or Linux, Notebook, PC, any tool you might need
Terrific office location - Duque de Saldanha Square


About Us
OLX is the world’s leading classifieds platform in high-growth markets. It’s available in more than 35 countries and in over 50 languages. The platform makes it so easy to connect people to buy, sell or exchange used goods and services.
OLX Group is a global product and tech company with 17 brands, +40 countries, +6000 people and one mindset.
Our mission is to make it super easy for people to buy and sell almost anything, boosting local economies.
We are proud to be different, and we work differently too. We combine the spirit and agility of a start-up with the maturity that comes from being part of a 100 year-old company.
We are curious, ambitious and allergic to corporate interference. We improvise, experiment and push each other further, embracing uncertainty and inspiring change.
If you are as excited as us about this position and our company, we hope you join us. Want to learn more about us? Take a look at the other parts of our website. And remember, we are an equal opportunities employer committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
