title: Product Data Analyst
role-description:
The Pipedrive product is used by hundreds of thousands of salespeople all over the world. Their interactions with the product and our support team generate large amounts of data every day. More data means better potential insights, but it also means an increasingly difficult task of reaching these insights.
You’re the kind of person that can easily get excited by huge data sets. You’re happy chasing the proverbial needle in the haystack, drawing conclusions and generating insights where others would be scared away by the challenge.  

What you’ll do:
Analyze internal, public and 3rd party data to come back with conclusions and insights presented in a human-readable format.
Make sure all necessary data is gathered in the correct way, identify currently missing pieces and facilitate adding them into the mix.
Work closely with people in Product Management, UX, Design and Engineering helping them set and track their KPIs and in general, get the most out of their data.
Publish your learnings in the organization and evangelize data-driven decision making.


Who you are:
You have 3+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis, preferably for a SaaS company.
You have experience utilizing tools like Tableau, Amplitude, R, Excel, etc. for analysing user behaviour
You are fluent in SQL and have development experience in at least one scripting language (PHP, Python, Javascript, etc.).
You demonstrate intellectual curiosity, logical thinking, and the ability to solve complex problems that may not always be well-defined.
You have the ability to condense analysis into actionable insights to inform business decisions and influence performance.

What we offer:
A world-class working environment full of the usual nice perks, and some more.
A structured and transparent working environment with clear product roadmaps.
Monthly flexible benefits package, e.g paid gym access, public transportation, etc.
Yearly training & conferences allowance.
A competitive base pay.

title: Data Scientist Consultant

About Accenture

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions – underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network – Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 425,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

This is an opportunity to join ACCENTURE DIGITAL as a Data Scientist Consultant within the APPLIED INTELLIGENCE practice.

Applied Intelligence is intelligent technology and human ingenuity applied at the core of business across every function and process – to address our clients' most complex challenges.
We combine Artificial Intelligence with deep industry and analytics expertise to help our clients embrace intelligent technologies confidently and responsibly.
By joining Accenture, you will work in diverse projects aimed at solving complex analytical needs from customers spanning across several industries, providing expert guidance into all areas of data science.

Qualifications
Academic background in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Statistics or equivalent quantitative fields
3+ years of professional experience in corporate environment
Skills for customer facing with business stakeholders with focus on putting analytics into the heart of the business

Proficiency in applying complex techniques in solving specific business needs, including
Development of analytical approaches and methodologies, mathematical modelling and algorithm prototyping
Design of solutions based in statistical and advanced analytics techniques in areas such as prediction, forecasting, clustering and optimization
Evaluation & monitoring of results and correspondent presentation to business units, explaining technical concepts to non-technical and business people

Organizational, communication and interpersonal skills
Consultative mindset with focus on customer problem solving customer
Structured approach and execution to large and high-visibility projects
Ability to collaborate and delegate with others and to communicate clearly
Curiosity, creativity, passion for continuous learning and keen on new challenges
Proficiency on SAS, R, Python, Matlab, SSPS; others platform and languages aera valued as well as experience in AI/ML/DL

title: Data Analyst M/W/D (Data Scientist).
role-description:
Stellenangebotsbeschreibung

At Daltix (Full-time), in Lisbon, Portugal
Expires at: 2020-01-08
Daltix is a fast-growing, successful data-driven start-up from Belgium with offices in Boom, Ghent and Lisbon. We bring real-time insights to the world of retail. How are we doing that- We have developed a set of tools to gather, process and analyze retail data at massive scale and bring it all together in a state of the art data platform we offer to our clients. So far, we have had great success in doing so. That's why today Daltix serves customers such as Makro, Lidl, Dreamland, Jumbo, Greenyard, Unilever and many others.
Sign me up! No wait... What will I be doing-
We are looking for a kickass Data Analyst who is excited to become a true Data Master based in Lisbon. This role will give you the opportunity to have a direct, positive impact on our business as well as our customers.

What Your Typical Day Will Look Like
You will be working on projects that deliver immediate value to our customers. These will involve extracting, transforming & analyzing data to produce actionable insights and reports for our customers who are major retailers and suppliers across Europe.
(Data) Quality will be an important focus when doing these projects.
In addition to working with Daltix's data lake you will also be cleaning, analyzing and extracting datasets from external sources as well as visualizing data using Tableau/Excel.
Technologies you'll find yourself using daily include:
Python, pandas & jupyter notebooks.
Snowflake Data Warehouse, S3.
BI tools such as Metabase & Tableau.
Schedulers such as Apache Airflow.
Main requirements

Minimum Qualifications

Why you're the one we are dying to meet:
You have at least 1 year (ideally 2-3 years) of professional experience with data analysis using SQL and Python (with pandas)
R experience is also relevant but you should be able to use Python (with pandas) in the end.
You are highly proficient in both spoken and written English.
Your business mind is just as strong as your technical mind. You will be working at the boundary between the technical team and the customer and will need to be able to effortlessly bridge between the two.
Nice to have

Preferred Qualifications
Previous experience with big data technologies (such as Hadoop, Spark, Airflow).
Great coding skills in Python (with pandas, numpy, …) and deep knowledge of SQL.
Experience with BI tools such as Tableau are a big plus.
You have a great eye for detail and are able to produce accurate, timely reports that meet (or exceed) the needs of our customers.
You are curious to learn and you learn fast.
You can work in a team.
You are proactive in your problem-solving.
You thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment and can adapt to changes in priorities based on dynamic customer needs.
Perks
If you still need more convincing…
We are a young, entrepreneurial and fast-growing company; you will have the unique opportunity to shape our future and have a positive impact on our clients' business
You will be offered a competitive wage in a talented, international team of top-notch experts
Flexible work arrangements with a lot of autonomy in what you do and where you do it - we trust you to know your schedule and work when you feel most productive
You will be able to participate in relevant training to stay at the top of your field.
Health Insurance coverage
Fresh fruit, snacks, tea and coffee on the house
Occasional drinks and team events
A modern office in the heart of Lisbon, the sunshine capital of Europe

title: Data Scientist (multiple levels)
role-description:
Data Scientist (multiple levels)

Job Description

We're looking for a Data Scientist to join the AI Vertical.

A vertical is in charge of defining methodologies and best practices within a domain, to increase Engineering knowledge. On a more day-to-day basis, the Data Scientist will be part of a Feature Team, which is a group composed of one or more members of each Engineering Vertical.

You will own strategic code. You will analyse data, find where efficiency is and take action to help drivers achieve it. Your aptitude for data modeling through datasets and AI algorithms such as K-Means, Neural Networks and data regressions will be generating content, in real-time, and get feedback immediately. At FuelSave, you will be accountable for your own percentage of spared liters and you will see your direct impact in the environment!

FuelSave (FS) is a real-time data science company that performs analysis for driving optimization. FS provides a mobile app that fits the truck driver's cockpit and performs everyday training on the job. With FS technology, trucking companies can reduce fuel consumption and CO2 emissions by up to 20%, thus increasing efficiency and reducing hazardous gas emissions.

Requirements

THE ROLE

You Will Be
sharing ideas and proposing features to the VP Product
a pioneer using vehicle data to create tangible products
creating a healthy impact in environment
applying ML, AI and statistics to real problems
understanding how our truck drivers experience our products.
given a lot of opportunities to develop yourself

You Must Have

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
a Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Artificial Intelligence or Mathematics.
naturally self-driven, proactive, systematic, well organised and rigorous about details.
Good math and statistical skills and an ability to apply those skills towards generating logical, accurate and meaningful models from data.
experience using scripting languages (Python, R) applied to statistics and/or Machine Learning.
demonstrated experience in ML techniques: clustering, classification, etc.
first touch with data ETL
experience in Unit Testing.
1-4 years of experience in data modelling

Bonus
Skills in coding for distributed frameworks (Spark, Hadoop)

OUR OFFER

Role: Data Scientist

Location:Evora /Lisbon

Contract: Unspecified duration unlimited

Start date:ASAP
